Find out more...
Prosperity
Halloween
Distant Places
Enable this Additional Content (DLC) for a game round to be able to use all related content during the game.

After many years on the toxic surface of Earth, the survivors are now ready to reclaim the planet in order to strive for Prosperity at last! The Prosperity add-on provides many new construction materials, Buildings and challenges. At long last you're able to upgrade and improve your settlement further to usher in a new era for your Settlers.

A collection of 14 brand-new Decorations that perfectly suit the setting, which you can use to adorn your settlement. Under no circumstances should your Settlers - including you - miss out on worshipping the Great Old One, otherwise...

Now that your Settlers have created a new and heathy civilization, they are still curious about what lies ahead of them.

Pioneers that they are, they want to look for other survivors and get to know new, exciting places beyond the borders of the settlement. They want to find and explore the distant places they have heard about in stories.
DLC
Complete the scenario successfully to be able to unlock the content for "Prosperity".
The scenario must be successfully completed before the additional content in "Prosperity" can be unlocked.

Quick Access to Building Modes
When selecting a Building with configurable mode, an additional view showing all Buildings of the same type is displayed in the world to enable their mode to be seen and changed.
Planning Mode

In the Planning Mode the construction of newly placed Buildings is immediately paused to prevent Builders from transporting Resources to the respective construction sites. This mode is helpful for better planning by placing construction commissions at an early stage, but the pause makes it possible for the construction itself to be carried out later on.
Footprint
No Achievements during further gameplay
No Achievements can be unlocked during further gameplay. Start a game round in Survival Mode to unlock a wide range of Achievements.

No Trophies can be unlocked during continued gameplay. Start a game round in Survival Mode to unlock a wide range of Trophies.

Wood is a basic construction material. It can also be processed into Coal in a Charcoal Kiln.
Scrap is not only a basic construction material for Buildings. It can also be used to manufacture Tools or for processing into special Resources.
Metal can be recovered from Scrap. A Recycler or a Refinery is needed to do this. Metal is a more robust material that is mainly used for improved Tools or special Buildings.
Plastic can be recovered from Scrap. A Recycler or a Refinery is needed to do this. It is a key material to hold back radiation.
Electronics can be recovered from Scrap. A Recycler or a Refinery is needed to do this. Electronics are mainly used for the power supply.

Cloth can be recovered from Scrap. A Recycler or a Refinery is needed to do this. Alternatively, Cloth can be produced from Hemp. This takes place at the Hemp Weaving Mill. Cloth is used by a Tailor to make Protective Clothing.

Water is the key to survival. It is obtained from Lakes via a Jetty, from the ground via a Well, or from rain via a Rainwater Collector. A Cistern or a Water Tower is necessary to distribute the Water.
Providing a wide variety of Foods together with Herbs keeps your Settlers healthy and lowers the risk of a disease outbreak.
Berries are picked by Gatherers and can be found in forests.
Mushrooms are harvested by Gatherers and can be found in forests.
Roots are dug up by Gatherers and can be found in forests.

Wild Boar Meat can be produced by hunting undomesticated Wild Boars or by slaughtering Wild Boars kept on Pastures.
  
Animals can generally be captured by a Hunter or acquired from certain Traders at the Trading Post.
Roe Deer Venison can be produced by hunting wild Roe Deer or by slaughtering Roe Deer kept on Pastures.
Herbs are gathered by Gatherers and can be found in forests.
Beer is produced in the Pub and serves to brighten up Settlers' moods.
An important Tool in order to complete work Tasks in the surrounding environment.
A more advanced Tool with a higher durability in order to perform work Tasks everywhere around the settlement.
Coal is made from Wood using a Charcoal Kiln. It can be used in a Water Tower to purify Water to remove Radiation.
Neck Scarves protect Settlers against low-level Radiation.
Activated Carbon Masks protect Settlers against medium-level Radiation.
Radiation Suits protect Settlers against high-level Radiation.
Beans can be harvested on Fields.
Cabbage can be picked from Fields.
Corn can be harvested from Fields.
Bell Peppers can be harvested from Fields.
Potatoes can be harvested from Fields.
Giant Pumpkins can be harvested from Fields.
Pumpkin can be harvested from Fields.
Wheat can be harvested from Fields.
Apples can be harvested from Orchards.
Cherries can be harvested from Orchards.
Peaches can be harvested from Orchards.
Pears can be harvested from Orchards.
Pecans can be harvested from Orchards.
Plums can be harvested from Orchards.
Walnuts can be harvested from Orchards.
Fish can be caught in Fishing Huts.

Hemp can be harvested on Fields, but it is not a source of Food. Hemp is processed into Cloth at a Hemp Weaving Mill or crafted into Joints in a Pub. They can be consumed by Settlers to boost their Confidence.
Joints can be produced at a Pub and consumed by Settlers to boost their Confidence.
Medicine can be produced at Medical Facilities.
Expedition Rations are Food and Water packages with which Expeditions can be equipped in order to repeatedly explore Ruins before the Expedition has to return.
Hard Liquor is produced from various kinds of Fruit at a Pub.
Decontamination Kits are produced in a Decontamination Station. They are used to cleanse food from contamination in food and storage buildings.
Iodine can be recovered in Mines and processed into Iodine Tablets at Medical Facilities.
Iodine Tablets can be consumed by Settlers to free their bodies from Radiation.
Hearty Meals can be produced from conventional Food in a Kitchen. Settlers need less of a variety of sources of Food for a healthy diet when they additionally eat a Hearty Meal.
Tomatoes can be harvested from Fields.
Carrots can be harvested from Fields.
Zucchini can be harvested from Fields.
Mustard Seeds can be harvested from Fields.
Lupine can be harvested from Fields.
Sugar Beets can be harvested from Fields.
Goat Meat can be produced by hunting wild Goats or by slaughtering Goats kept on Pastures.
Hare Meat can be produced by hunting wild Hares or by slaughtering Hares kept on Pastures.
Buffalo Meat can be produced by hunting wild Buffalos or by slaughtering Buffalos kept on Pastures.
Chicken Meat can be produced by hunting wild Chickens or by slaughtering Chickens kept on Pastures.
Milk can be obtained from Buffalos or Goats kept in pens.
Eggs can be obtained from Chickens kept in pens.

Wild Boars can be kept on Pastures and reproduce there. They can be slaughtered to obtain Meat.
  
Animals can generally be captured by a Hunter or acquired from certain Traders at the Trading Post.

Roe Deer and Deer can be kept on Pastures and reproduce there. They can be slaughtered to obtain Meat.
  
Animals can generally be captured by a Hunter or acquired from certain Traders at the Trading Post.

Goats can be kept on Pastures and reproduce there. They can be slaughtered to obtain Meat. In addition they produce Milk in captivity as livestock.
  
Animals can generally be captured by a Hunter or acquired from certain Traders at the Trading Post.

Hares can be kept on Pastures and reproduce there. They can be slaughtered to obtain Meat.
  
Animals can generally be captured by a Hunter or acquired from certain Traders at the Trading Post.

Buffalos can be kept on Pastures and reproduce there. They can be slaughtered to obtain Meat. In addition they produce Milk in captivity as livestock.
  
Animals can generally be captured by a Hunter or acquired from certain Traders at the Trading Post.

Chickens can be kept on Pastures and reproduce there. They can be slaughtered to obtain Meat. If they are kept in captivity as livestock they produce Eggs as well.
  
Animals can generally be captured by a Hunter or acquired from certain Traders at the Trading Post.
Black Salsify can be harvested from Fields.
Cake can be produced from conventional Food in a Kitchen. Settlers who consume Cake boost their Confidence by eating it.
Stew can be produced from conventional Food in a Kitchen. Settlers who eat Stew improve their Health in the process.
Sulfur is used to produce gunpowder for ammunition.
Metal bullets are a possibility to defend against looters. Metal bullets are lethal.
Rubber bullets are a non-lethal possibility to defend against looters.
The luxury item Coffee can be made from Coffee Beans and Water in Pubs and increases the Confidence of your Settlers when consumed.
Coffee Beans can be harvested from Fields. They are needed to produce the luxury item Coffee.
The luxury item Soap can be produced from Milk and Healing Herbs at Medical Facilities. When used it increases the Confidence and Health of your Settlers.
Strengthened Metal can be made from Metal in a Material Factory. It is needed in the construction of some kinds of sturdy Buildings.
Cement can be mined in a Mine and is needed to produce Concrete.
Glass can be produced at a Material Factory. It is needed in the construction of some kinds of complex Buildings.
Sand can be mined at a Sand Mine. Sand can either be processed further into Glass or used to produce Concrete.
Concrete can be produced at a Concrete Factory. It is needed in the construction of some kinds of stable buildings.
Wheat is cultivated on Fields, but it is not a source of Food. Wheat serves as the base product for the luxury item Beer.
Milk can be obtained from Buffalos or Goats kept in pens. It serves as the base product for the luyury item Soap.
Hemp can be cultivated on Fields, but it is not a source of Food. Hemp can be crafted into the luxury item Joints in a Pub or processed into Cloth at a Hemp Weaving Mill.
The luxury item Joints are produced in a Pub and consumed by Settlers to strengthen their Confidence.
The luxury item Beer is produced in a Pub and boosts Settlers’ Confidence.
The luxury item Cake can be produced from conventional Food in a Kitchen. Settlers who consume Cake increase their Confidence as a result.
The luxury item Stew can be produced from conventional Food in a Kitchen. If Settlers eat Stew they improve their Health as a result.
Coconuts can be harvested from plantations.
Bananas can be harvested from plantations.
Pineapples can be harvested from fields.
Physalis fruits can be harvested from fields.
Sunflower seeds can be harvested from fields.
Watermelon seeds can be harvested from fields.

A Cabin provides Settlers with living space where they can give birth to offspring.
A Sturdy House provides Settlers with living space where they can give birth to offspring. The Sturdy House provides living space for more Settlers and is more resistant than the normal Cabin.
A Shelter provides many Settlers with living space where they do not give birth to offspring. Depending on the configuration setting, all Settlers or only old and infertile Settlers move in.

An Upgraded Shelter provides many Settlers with living space where they do not give birth to offspring. Depending on the configuration setting, all Settlers or only old and infertile Settlers move in. The Upgraded Shelter provides more space for Settlers and, when connected to a Power Grid, boosts the Confidence of its Inhabitants.
A Dirt Road enables Settlers to make fast progress. Although paths made of dirt and gravel do not require any construction material, they must be developed by a Builder.

A Paved Road enables Settlers to make considerably faster progress in comparison to a Dirt Road. Although paths made of dirt and gravel do not require any construction material, they must be developed by a Builder.
A paved road that enables Settlers to travel faster and makes protection against toxic rain possible.
A Temporary Storeroom provides additional space for Resources. This Building cannot be used to house Water.
A Warehouse provides additional space for Resources. This Building cannot be used to house Water.
An Upgraded Warehouse provides additional space for Resources.This Building cannot be used to house Water.
A place to store raw materials like Wood, Scrap or Metal.

A Market is supplied exclusively by Logisticians and serves as a transit hub for shipments of Resources. The Storage Capacity for the Resources can be precisely specified to make them available to neighboring Production sites or to meet Settlers' needs. Settlers can visit the Market to boost their Confidence.
The Expedition Station is the starting point for Scouting Missions and Expeditions, in the course of which Resources and special Items are collected at locations on the map.

The bodies of deceased Settlers find their final resting place at the Cemetery. If the dead remain unburied, their relatives lose a substantial amount of Confidence. Occupied graves are free to use again after a certain amount of time. Tools and Clothing that belonged to the deceased are made available to the community again.

As the heart of the settlement, the Bus can store Resources and Water. It provides more capacity with each upgrade. As soon as the Bus has been hitched in place, Settlers can meet there and increase their Confidence.
The Town Center is the heart of the settlement. It can store a large quantity of Resources and Water. In addition, it's a place where Settlers can meet to increase their Confidence.
Medicine or Iodine Tablets are produced at a Medical Facility and administered to Settlers to prevent outbreaks of Diseases. In addition, Settlers who are sick come here for treatment.
A School brings up Children to become Educated Adults. This enables them to practice their later Professions more effectively.

Teachers educate Children to a certain extent in all subjects at a School. A focus can be placed on individual subjects to fully educate Children and speed up the educational training in that subject.
A Gatherer's Cabin gathers Mushrooms and Berries in forested areas.
Within its configured working area, a Hunting Lodge either gathers Meat from hunted Wildlife or captures Wildlife to be kept on a Pasture.
A Fishing Hut supplies Food by catching Fish. Too small a distance between Fishing Huts might possibly reduce their efficiency.
An Orchard supplies Food like Fruits and Nuts from trees. In addition, trees can be cut down to obtain Wood. Although creating the Orchard does not require any Resources, the trees need time to grow.
A Covered Orchard provides Food like fruits and nuts from trees and can be covered to avoid toxic rain.
Among others, a Cultivated Field supplies Food from farming Crops. Although creating the Field does not require any Resources, the Crops need time to grow.
A Covered Field provides Food from farming Crops and can be covered to avoid toxic rain.

Parallel to each other a Refinery produces Metal, Cloth, Plastic and, when researched, Electronics from Scrap. The Production lines can be individually disabled. The Refinery works faster and more efficiently than individual Recyclers.
A Scrapyard collects Scrap from Ruins or Scrap Catchers in a predefined zone.
A Pub produces Beer, Liquor or Joints that can be consumed by Settlers to boost their Confidence.
A Tailor’s Shop manufactures either Neck Scarves, Activated Carbon Masks or Radiation Suits to protect against Radiation.
An Upgraded Tailor's Shop manufactures either Neck Scarves, Activated Carbon Masks or Radiation Suits to protect against Radiation. It employs more Tailors and works more efficiently as well.
A Workshop produces either Scrap Tools or Metal Tools to perform work of all kinds more efficiently.
An Upgraded Workshop produces either Scrap Tools or Metal Tools to perform work of all kinds more efficiently. It employs more Technicians and works more efficiently as well.
An Herbal Hut gathers Herbs in forests which can be used to improve the Settlers' Health.
A Forester's Lodge can either cut trees down, plant them or combine both activities within a predefined zone. The mode can be configured.
A Charcoal Kiln produces Coal from Wood.
A Rainwater Collector collects Water from rain without requiring a workforce. It can be covered to avoid collecting toxic rain. It requires a Cistern or a Water Tower to store the collected Water.
A Water Tower collects and stores Water. It can also use Coal to filter Radiation out of the Water. This Building requires a Jetty, a Well or a Rainwater Collector in order to function.
A Solar Collector generates large quantities of energy in the daytime and supplies the Buildings hooked up to the Power Grid with Electricity.
A Power Line connects Buildings to a Power Grid.
A Battery stores energy during the daytime and returns it to the Power Grid at night.
A Campfire serves as a meeting place for Settlers and boosts their confidence.
A wooden Jetty enables Settlers to collect Water. Requires a Cistern or a Water Tower to store the collected Water. Can only be built at lakesides.
A Stock of Resources that can be picked up and transfered to a storage building by Settlers.
A Well produces Water slowly but uncontaminated by Radiation, and regardless of Droughts. Short distances between Wells reduce their efficiency. Can be upgraded to an Electric Water Pump.
A Recycler produces either Metal, Cloth, Plastic or Electronics from Scrap.

An Irrigation Plant increases the soil moisture within its range of influence. This process requires Water. The contamination level of the Water used also influences the amount of Radiation in the soil.
The Weather Station regulates at which rain contamination level Cultivated Fields and Rainwater Collectors are covered. It additionally provides a rain contamination forecast for coming Seasons.
A Cistern collects and stores Water. It requires a wooden Jetty, a Well or a Rainwater Collector to function.

A Scrap Catcher catches Scrap that slowly whirls around. This occurs particularly effectively during Sandstorms. The Scrap Catcher must be located within the working area of a Scrapyard in order to cart away the caught Scrap.
A Hemp Weaving Mill produces Cloth from Hemp.
A Wind Turbine generates Electricity on a lasting basis, thus supplying Buildings connected to the Power Grid. Small distances between them reduce the efficiency.
The Research Station enables the researching of various new Technologies and Resources. As long as no Research is being performed, all assigned Researchers generate Knowledge.
A Decontamination Post produces Decontamination Kits and supplies them to the appropriate Buildings. They are used there to free stored Resources from contamination due to Radiation.

A Mine optionally extracts the raw materials Iodine, Coal or Sulfur. The mining of the respective Resource must be researched beforehand. The Mine must be built on a mountainside. Small distances between them reduce the efficiency.
A Kitchen processes unprocessed Food into either hearty meals, Cake or Stew. A larger number of Settlers can be efficiently provided for as a result.
A decorative object that increases the settlement's attractiveness in the vicinity of the object.
A decorative object that increases the Attractiveness of the settlement in its surrounding area. What's more, your Settlers can increase their Contentedness near this Building.
At the Forum, Decrees can be imposed that influence the Settlers' behavior. In addition, a selection of the Settlers' Tasks can be viewed and taken on.
Traders arrive at the Trading Post regularly to barter the different goods they offer.
An Upgraded School fully educates Children in all subjects. The educational training also occurs distinctly faster than at a normal School.

Animals can be kept on a Pasture in order to slaughter them for Food or obtain other Resources via passive product Yield. Different types of Animals can be captured by a Hunter and acquired via Barter Trade Deal or Expeditions.
A Food Station is continuously stocked with Food and can consequently shorten the routes to Food intake.
An Electric Water Pump pumps Water out of the ground without the use of manpower. It requires the connection to a functioning Power Grid.
A Water Point is continuously refilled with Water and can shorten the walking distances for your Settlers who want something to drink.
An Ammunition Factory produces either Metal or Rubber bullets that can be used to defend against Raiders.
Militias are stationed at a Watchtower to equip the Towers with Ammunition and defend the settlement against Raiders. Small distances between them reduce the efficiency.
The Siren Tower reduces the Morale of Raiders located within its range. Requires Electricity to function.
Barricades prevent Raiders from rapidly advancing into the settlement. If Barricades are located within the radius of a Raider Force, the speed of the Force's movement is slowed down.

All Seeds that grow on Fields can be cultivated in a Greenhouse. In a Greenhouse the planted Seed is automatically sown, grows faster and cannot be contaminated with Radiation. A Greenhouse must be constantly supplied with Water in order to function.
An Aquafarm breeds Fish. Unlike a Fishing Hut, it is also able to work during a Drought. In addition, the Fish is not influenced by Radiation.
A Concrete Factory needs Sand, Water, Cement and Coal to produce Concrete.  This Concrete is needed in the construction of some kinds of sturdy Buildings.
An Endzone is a subterranean bunker complex that was built a long time ago as a safe refuge to protect human beings against the nuclear catastrophe.

An Upgraded Water Tower collects and stores Water. It can be supplied with Coal by Water Carriers to filter Radiation out of the Water. A Water Tower can automatically fill its reservoir with Water via Pumping Stations. This Building can be alternately supplied with Water via a wooden Jetty, a Well or a Rainwater Collector by utilizing a Workforce.
A Sand Mine extracts Sand from Lakes. It must be built near Water to function. Sand is needed in the production of Concrete and Glass.

A Pumping Station conveys Water from Lakes. Though it doesn’t require any Workforce, it must be supplied with Electricity in order to function. Pumping Stations require Upgraded Water Towers to be able to make their Water available at the settlement.
A Material Factory makes Glass and Strenghtened Metal. Glass and Strenghtened Metal are needed in the construction of some kinds of complex Buildings.
The Town Hall is the highest upgrade level for the Town Center. It is a central place for Settlers to make Demands regarding life at the settlement.

A Comfortable House in which Settlers can live and produce offspring. In addition, it increases the Contentedness of its Inhabitants by providing itself with Electricity from wind energy. Due to its sturdy construction this Building can stand up better against Sandstorms.

A Comfortable Shelter houses a large number of Settlers, however it is not suitable for producing offspring. In addition, it increases the Contentedness of its Inhabitants by providing itself with Electricity from wind energy. Due to its sturdy construction this Building can stand up better against Sandstorms.
An Upgraded Pub produces consumer goods such as Beer, Hard Liquor or Joints, which increase Settlers' Confidence. It functions more effectively than a normal Pub.

A radiant landmark that stands for Prosperity and progress. This Building goes through several construction phases before it is completed. When upgrading has ended, this increases the Attractiveness of the location for the entire settlement.

The Factory Unit consumes different Resources such as Concrete, Reinforced Metal or Glass in order to increase the efficiency of the neighboring Production Buildings Tailor's Shop, Workshop, Ammunition Factory, Medical Facility and Decontamination Post.

Medicine, Iodine Tablets or the luxury item Soap are produced at a Medical Facility and administered to Settlers to prevent outbreaks of Diseases. In addition, Settlers who are sick come here for treatment.
A Pub produces Hard Liquor along with the luxury items Beer, Coffee and Joints. These goods boost Settlers' Confidence and fulfill Demands they might make.

A Mine optionally extracts the raw materials Iodine, Coal, Cement or Sulfur. The mining of the respective Resource must be researched beforehand. The Mine must be built on a mountainside. Small distances between them might reduce the efficiency.

A Kitchen processes Food into either hearty meals or the luxury items Cake and Stew. A larger number of Settlers can be provided for more efficiently as a result and possible Demands from the population fulfilled.
The Balloon Station can be used to send expeditions to farawary places. Also, with each completed expedition, it gives you the opportunity to take advantage of special trade offers.
A building that can be erected to commemorate the successful completion of an expedition in the North.
A building that can be erected to commemorate the successful completion of an expedition in the West.
A building that can be erected to commemorate the successful completion of an expedition in the South.
A building that can be erected to commemorate the successful completion of an expedition in the East.

Unassigned Settlers assign themselves Tasks on their own. They transport Resources to Depots and Warehouses, and automatically take over the Professions of Settlers who have died. They also free construction sites from Radiation, Scrap or Trees.

Builders take care of construction contracts for Roads and Buildings. They also transport necessary Resources to construction sites. The prioritization of the Task zones Buildings, Roads and Repairs can be configured at the Town Center.
Explorers are part of a previously arranged Expedition and work on its preparation, too. Only assignable at Expedition Stations.
Scouts produce Expedition Rations at Expedition Stations. They scout out Ruins when instructed to do so. They transport all necessary Resources to the Expedition Station.
Logisticians transport Resources to the respective Depot or Warehouse as needed.

When assigned, ensures that sick Settlers receive healthcare at their Medical Facility. Processes either Healing Herbs into Medicine or Iodine into Iodine Tablets. The mode can be configured at the Medical Facility. They transport the necessary Resources for their work to the work location.
When assigned, Teachers ensure that Children are educated at the School.
Gatherers pick Berries and Mushrooms within the working area of their Gatherer's Cabin.
In the configured working area Hunters accumulate either Meat from hunted Wildlife or capture Wildlife to be kept on Pastures. The mode can be configured at the Hunting Lodge.
Fishermen accumulate Fish from Lakes out of their Fishing Hut.
Farmers plant Seeds on Fields or in Orchards. They harvest the Crop when instructed to or as soon as the Crop is ripe for harvesting.

Refiners produce Metal, Plastic, Cloth or, when researched, Electronics out of Scrap. They transport the necessary Scrap to the work location. They can only be assigned once per Recycler, but they can be assigned repeatedly at the Refinery.
Scrap Collectors collect Scrap lying around or empty Scrap Catchers within the working area of their Scrapyard.
Pubkeepers produce Hard Liquor, Beer or Joints at the Pub. They transport the Resources necessary for their work to the work location.
Tailors produce configured Protective Clothing at the Tailor's Shop or process Hemp into Cloth at the Hemp Weaving Mill. They transport the Resources necessary for their work to the work location.
Technicians produce Tools at the Workshop or Ammunition at the Ammunition Factory. They transport the Resources necessary for their work to the work location.
Herb Gatherers gather Herbs within the working area of their Herbal Hut.
Foresters either cut down Trees, plant them, or combine both activities. The mode can be configured at the Forester Lodge.
Charcoal Burners process Wood into Coal at the Charcoal Kiln. They transport Wood to the work location.
Water Carriers collect Water from Water-producing Buildings. They also transport Coal to the Water Tower when Filtration has been enabled.
Children help their Families to transport Food and Water to their home.
Students learn at a School. When they have finished their educational training they are Educated Adults and work more effectively.
Adults can become active in Professions or help to transport Resources and carry out simple Tasks.
Morticians take care of burying dead bodies, provided that empty graves exist. They also make intact Radiation Suits and Tools that belonged to the deceased available to the general public again.
Wellkeepers operate their Wells and produce radioactively uncontaminated Water there. They can only be assigned once per Well.
Irrigators collect Water from Water reservoirs or Water-producing Buildings. They use the collected Water to refill their Irrigation Plant. They can only be assigned once per Irrigation Plant.
Researchers generate Knowledge Points over time or forge ahead with ongoing Research projects. They transport necessary Resources to the Research Station for the respective Research project.
Decontaminators produce Decontamination Kits at Decontamination Posts and distribute them to other Buildings. They transport the Resources necessary for their work to the work location.
Miners mine Resources at their Mine. Depending on the Research status, Coal, Iodine or Sulfur can be obtained.
Cooks produce meals in the Kitchen. They transport Water and Food to the Kitchen as needed.
Herders provide Animals on the Pasture with Water, collect Animal-based products and slaughter Animals for Meat. They bring captured Wildlife to the Pasture when instructed to do so.
Militia man their Watchtower in the event of an attack and fight against Raiders from there. They transport Ammunition to their Watchtower.
Engineers work at a Factory Unit or produce Concrete at a Concrete Factory. They transport the Resources needed for their work to the workplace.
Depending on the Research status, Miners extract Coal, Iodine, Cement or Sulfur at a Mine. If they work at a Sand Mine, they produce Sand there.
Pubkeepers produce Hard Liquor, Beer, Coffee or Joints in the Pub. They transport the Resources needed for their work to the workplace.

Refiners produce Metal, Plastic, Cloth or Electronics at a Recycler or a Refinery. They make Glass or Strengthened Metal at a Material Factory. They transport the necessary Resources to the workplace. They can only be assigned once per Recycler, but they can be assigned more than once at the Refinery and the Material Factory.
Fishermen gather Fish from Lakes out of a Fishing Hut. At an Aquafarm they provide for the Fish and process them into Food.

Farmer plant Seeds on Fields, in Orchards or in Greenhouses. At the latter they also provide the Greenhouses with Water when necessary. They bring in the Harvest when instructed to or as soon as the Crop is ripe.

Population Growth
Population Growth is a snapshot that indicates whether the Population will tend to grow, decline or remain constant over a longer period of time.
Growing Population

The Population is going to grow in the long term because fertile Settlers mainly live in Houses and are going to start Families.

Make sure that the basic supplies are sufficient or restrict Population Growth by housing Settlers at Shelters. In an emergency, Reproduction can be prohibited for several Seasons via Decree.
Constant Population

The Population is hardly going to change in the long term.

This can be due to a balanced distribution of living space between Houses and Shelters. Pay extra attention to the distribution of fertile and infertile Settlers.
Declining Population
The Population is going to decline in the long term because either not enough Houses are available to your Settlers to start a Family or a large part of your Population is infertile.

Our Scouts discovered an interesting-looking building at one of the abandoned sites. It wasn't in good condition. That's why we ought to take the right Tools with us. Maybe some basic construction material might come in handy, too, just in case we have to find another way in.

It's a pretty run-down building - the roof has partially caved in. On the other hand, the sign in front looks like the one we had on the doors to the medical ward in the Endzone. Could be worth taking a look!
Gain Access
We should try to find a way to get in. Maybe we'll find some material.
Get going!
Door
We simply use the Tools we brought along to get through the door.
We forced the door open. Maybe we'll find something inside.
We didn't find anything. But we could try again in a few days.
Roof
Let's try to climb in through the roof!
We climbed in through a hole in the roof and no one was hurt! Maybe we can find something inside.
Damn it, chief! One of us burst through the roof and busted a leg! But we did manage to open the door from the inside. Maybe we can find something.
Search Through Everything!
We found a way in. It's time to search through everything!
Start searching!
Library
Let's take a look in the library!
We found some interesting books! Maybe we can learn something about Medicine from them.
Unfortunately, we didn't find anything useful. <<dynamicmessage>>
Maybe we might find something if we come back with someone who's smarter.
Operating Table
Let's take a look at the operating table!
We found several types of medications and some electronic devices! That could really help in the event of an epidemic.
Unfortunately, we didn't find anything useful. <<dynamicmessage>>
Maybe we might find something if we come back with someone who has a good grasp of this subject.
Search the Surrounding Area
Maybe we'll find something if we search the surrounding area...
Search!
Backyard
Let's take a look in the backyard
We found some Scrap we can use.
We didn't find anything, but we could try again some other time!
More Doors
Maybe we'll find more doors inside the House.
We found the entrance to the basement. The door was hidden behind vines.
We didn't find any other entrance, but we can try again some other time.
Front Yard
Maybe we'll find something in the front yard...
We found some Metal!
We didn't find anything, but we could try again some other time!
Search The Basement
Maybe we can find something down there.
Get moving!
Go down
Let's take a look down there. Looks like the basement is contaminated.
Everything went smoothly! We found some Seeds down there!
Some of us have been contaminated with Radiation. But we did find some Seeds down there!

It’s a nuclear power plant! Those things devastated the world. Our elders warned us to stay clear of them, but it's a sure thing there are still valuable Resources waiting inside. At the very least we'll need Tools and protective gear to get in.

Looks almost peaceful, if it weren't for the caved-in roof. That must've been one big bang! The remnants have still got to be emitting tons of Radiation. Just listen to that Geiger counter! <<dynamicmessage>>
Are you sure that we should be spending any time here? All of us ought to be wearing Radiation Suits if we don't want to catch the "sickness".
Reactor Core
We can try to climb up the giant door to break in. <<dynamicmessage>> There's a rusty ladder up to the roof, too. From there we could try getting into the dome through the hole.
Although it's going to be hard to open it with our bare hands.
Find a way into the reactor core!
Giant Door
Try to force the door open!
The door couldn't do a thing to stop the crowbar. Now the Geiger counter's going bananas. Are you really sure about this?
This door may be old, but it still won't budge an inch. <<dynamicmessage>> Maybe we can find another way into the reactor core...
If we only had the right Tools with us...
Rusty Ladder
We could climb up that rusty ladder! <<dynamicmessage>>
But you know what, chief? We're not what you'd call nimble!

The ladder broke apart as the last of us was climbing up it. But we made it. Now we can climb down to the core. You're sure about this, right? The Radiation level must still be incredibly high! We can see chunks of graphite all over the place...
The ladder broke apart while climbing up! Luckily, no one was seriously injured. Just a few bruises and a dislocated shoulder. What's worse: We won't get in this way.
Inside The Core
It's worth the risk!
There's an empty pool, some old tubes and machinery, and a room full of displays and control panels. But the needle on the Geiger counter keeps spiking like wild...
Control Room
This looks like a control room. It ought to be full of electronic equipment. <<dynamicmessage>>
Without protection it's a tough call!
This almost looks like the central control room we had back in the Endzone. In any case, we can definitely put all this old technology to good use!
The air had a metallic taste to it, and all of us are already feeling queasy. We grabbed a few loose electronic parts on the way out. We didn't want to leave absolutely empty-handed...
Heat Exchanger
That machine with all those tubes must be a heat exchanger. We can use the Metal it's made of. <<dynamicmessage>>
Without protection it's a tough call!
It took some effort, but in the end we were able to take the whole machine apart. Lots of valuable Metal!
I think this whole place is still highly contaminated, chief. We had to leave quickly, but the first symptoms are already evident.
Airlock
This airlock should get us into the generator room. The Geiger counter's going off like crazy. <<dynamicmessage>>
Thanks for remembering to pack those suits for us, chief!
Without protection it's a tough call!

We've passed the airlock now. This must have been the generator room before the roof got blown away. All the machinery was destroyed. There's not much left except for wreckage that has to be salvaged. But there are other doors here, too...
That was a bad idea, chief. Some of us are already showing symptoms of the sickness, and we got out of there in a hurry when the Geiger counter started clicking like crazy.
Main Facility
Seems to be all locked-in. There are a couple of roller doors and a side entrance that we could get in through. Our Scout suggested climbing up onto the roof and getting in from there.
Try the main facility!
Side Entrance
We can try getting in from there! But this symbol is kind of alarming... <<dynamicmessage>>
Without protection it's a tough call!

Beyond the long corridor we entered the room where the generator must have stood before the roof was torn off. All the machinery was destroyed. There's not much left except for wreckage that has to be salvaged. But there are other doors here, too...
Listen to that Geiger counter, chief! Some of us are getting really scared, and we're not going to leave anyone behind here. <<dynamicmessage>>
We ought to come back with better equipment.
Roller Doors
There's supposed to be a storage depot behind those doors. <<dynamicmessage>>
The only drawback is that we don't have any suitable Tools. We'll give it a try, anyway!

It was pretty easy to force the old doors open. Now we're standing in some kind of storage depot - there's all sorts of old machinery and an old truck standing around, and a long corridor leads further inside. Oh, and there's a row of doors at the other end of the hall.

These doors are heavier than they look! We managed to hoist them just far enough so that the skinniest one of us could squeeze through and take a couple of small things from inside. We'd be better off finding a different entrance...
Generator Room
What kind of doors are there?
Okay, the floor collapsed in the middle and there's a row of really sturdy doors on the side of the room.
Collapsed Floor
A collapsed floor that leads to a kind of decontamination room. We could rope some towels together to get down there! <<dynamicmessage>>
If we only had some! But we could still risk it by climbing down.

That was close! The last of us nearly fell on top of the group, but at the last moment he latched onto something. <<dynamicmessage>> There are lots of dusty Radiation Suits lying around here! They should prove to come in handy...
Good thing we had a rope.

Damn it, chief, the last of us slipped and fell on top of the whole group. Hit us really hard. We'd be better off heading back... <<dynamicmessage>> This room is full of Radiation Suits, but we were only able to take a few of them with us...
Next time, please don't send us down there without a rope.
Sturdy Doors
We should be able to get into the rest of the facility through these doors!
It worked! Those old doors sure didn't want to give up without a fight, but in the end they let themselves be opened, chief!
Storage Depot
Look around!
Now we're standing in some kind of Storage Depot. There's all sorts of old machinery and an old truck standing around. Oh, and a row of doors at the other end.
Sturdy Doors
That door might lead further inside... <<dynamicmessage>>
But we need to be careful since we're not very well protected...

This must have been the generator room before the whole roof was torn off. All the machinery has been destroyed. There's not much left to salvage except for wreckage. But there are other doors here, too...
I'm sorry, chief, but we can't go in there. It's a long, dark corridor and the sound of the Geiger counter is like a warning on a continuous loop. <<dynamicmessage>>
If there's no other choice, we could come back properly equipped.
Storage Room
That sounds promising! <<dynamicmessage>>
But it could become tough to get in without the right Tools.
Yes! No door can stop us! We're in a much smaller storage room, but guess what we found in a couple of lockers: Radiation Suits and masks! They really ought to come in handy.
We can't do a thing, chief. This door won't budge a bit. <<dynamicmessage>>
If we only had the right Tools along...
Machinery
We can definitely use the parts. <<dynamicmessage>>
And we've brought along an expert!
<<dynamicmessage>> I'd say we've stripped this thing down completely. That's going to prove to be useful back in camp!
Good thing we have someone with us who knows their way around this machinery!
Okay, I think we pretty much took along everything we can carry. All that's left are a few big parts that are just too heavy. <<dynamicmessage>>
We simply don't know how we can dismantle them.
Old Truck
Talk about an aging beauty! Time to crank up those old engines!
<<dynamicmessage>> But our Technician did manage to strip the engine down into valuable parts!
Pardon the wisecrack. That thing is never going to run again.
Pardon the wisecrack. That thing is in good shape, but not good enough by far. We've stripped the truck for parts instead.
Turbine Building
It must be a turbine. Except that it's ten times bigger than the one we used to generate power in the Endzone. Just imagine the output alone!
This should be less dangerous.
The Turbine
We can try to strip that thing down into individual parts!
Phew, that was a lot of work. We managed to break the thing up, and all the parts are in amazingly good shape!
There's no way we'll be able to take the turbine apart. That thing is heavy and much too large. We'll take some of the other stuff lying around here and head back.
Barrels, Barrels, Barrels
Maybe there's something useful in those barrels.
Some of them seem to contain Water, but the Geiger counter is going crazy! We'd be best off just staying away from those barrels. But we can take the empty ones along with us.
We accidentally tipped one over and now Water has spilled out all over the place. We took off when the Geiger counter started clicking, but some of us suddenly don't feel well at all.
Roof
We could climb up onto the roof and get in from there! <<dynamicmessage>>

Climbing up was easy. Climbing down from the hole in the roof was a different story, but we made it. Now we're standing in the generator room. All the machinery has been destroyed. There's not much left to salvage except for wreckage. But there are other doors here, too...

Climbing up was easy. But while climbing down a platform crashed with one of us on it. Although we've made it to the generator room, we've got a broken leg on our hands now, too! There are doors here. We'd be better off trying to get out of here again, chief!
But we're not in the best shape...

Follow Arthur Sawchyn's instructions and obtain important clues and useful information about survival in the merciless world of Endzone - A World Apart.
Play either an interrelated tutorial that teaches you all the important aspects of the game or become familiar with certain parts of the game in brief segments.

In Survival Mode you can configure your game according to your own needs. There are no predefined conditions to win. Create a huge settlement or fight against a challenging environment. Anything's possible as long as you survive!
Choose from a variety of challenging scenarios that specify different goals.

When you play using all the Research utensils, you can freely explore the Research Tree without having to find Research utensils on Expeditions.
Indicates how severely the Sandstorm damages Buildings. The higher the value, the more the Building is damaged when hit by a Sandstorm.
All save games of this session will be collected under the name of your settlement.
The number of settlers available at the start of the game. Fewer settlers increase the difficulty.
Defines the kinds of Tools with which the first Settlers are equipped and which are in stock at the Town Center at the beginning. Poorer-quality Tools increase the difficulty enormously.
The Protective Clothing with which the first settlers are equipped and which is in stock in the town center at the beginning. Worse Protective Clothing increases the difficulty.
The distance to water defines how far away the first natural source of water should be to the Town Center. A higher distance increases the difficulty.
You can use this to set whether all available Seeds are already supposed to be available when the game begins.
This can be used to set how fast Tools or Protective Clothing wears out. The higher the wear & tear, the faster you have to have these objects produced again.
Here you can set how high your Settlers' Consumption is when they use up Food, Water or other consumables such as Beer or Medicine. The higher the Consumption, the more has to be produced.
You can use this setting to regulate how many Resources are being stored in your Town Center at the beginning of a game. Game entry can become easier as a result.
This setting describes how many Animals and herds are located on the map. The higher the figure, the more Animals are going to roam the map.

This option specifies how much open area – without Scrap and trees – is located around your Town Center. Attention: This leads to your Settlers possibly having long routes to travel in order to reach the next trees or Ruins.

Setting the interval for rain. At "Never" it never rains and Lakes dry up, but only during a Drought. At "Always" it rains each Season, except during Droughts. "Random" mixes phases with and without rain into the course of the weather.
The maximum contamination stage that rain can take on. Higher stages increase the difficulty. Possible values are: "None", "Low-level", "Medium-level", "High-level"

Setting the interval for Droughts. At "No Droughts" there aren't any droughts over the whole course of the game. At "Random Droughts" a Drought occurs every now and then in the course of the weather. At "Constant Droughts" the weather consists of constant Drought phases, meaning that there is no rain, either.
When it's activated, the Drought Director controls the random incidence of Droughts and tries to prevent unfair situations from happening.
The interval for Sandstorms. At "Never" there is not one Sandstorm in the whole game. At "Random" Sandstorms randomly occur during a Drought. At "Every Drought" a Sandstorm occurs in each Drought.
The number of mountains on the map can influence your Settlers' routes. Fewer mountains also indirectly signify: shorter routes.
The number of Lakes on the map defines the number of points where your Settlers can collect Water. But many Lakes can also mean that less area for construction is available.
The number of Forest areas defines how many Trees are located on the map at the start. Fewer Trees equally signifies less directly recoverable Wood Resources.
The number of Ruins on the map defines how much Scrap is available at the start. Less Scrap means that your Settlers have to travel longer routes.
A random sequence of numbers with which the map is generated. You can copy this code from the Savegame overview and share it with your friends too when, for example, you want to play on the same map.
The size of the map. Attention: Large maps can prolong the saving process itself and lead to weak performance on older systems.
The incidence of Diseases. At "Off" no Diseases can ravage your settlement.
Sidemissions can be exciting events or auxiliary Tasks that change the gaming experience.

Discontented Settlers work or perform Research slower and reproduce more slowly, too. In the event of a high level of Discontentment they move more slowly around the settlement. If too many Settlers are discontented, the chance of crimes and rebellions increases. In the event of a high level of general Discontentment it can occur that individual groups of Settlers leave the settlement.
Even-tempered Settlers work or perform Research without limitations. They reproduce at a normal speed.

Contented Settlers work or perform Research faster and reproduce faster, too. The higher the level of Contentedness at birth, the older Settlers will get. In the event of extreme Contentedness they also move faster around the settlement.

Children help their Families to transport Food and Water to their home. They can be educated in a School as long as they are children to make them grow up to educated Adults.

Young Adults are Settlers that recently became Adults and are potential new workforce that can be distributed to different Professions. If they are provided with a suitable place to start a family they try to find a partner to grow the population of the settlement.

If Settlers have been fully educated at a School, as Adults they receive a Badge for the Profession in which they were active the longest. In addition, Adults are still fertile and help to have the population of the settlement keep growing.
Old Adults are no longer fertile and can't help to grow the population of the settlement anymore. They are likely to be rewarded with a Badge for a specific Profession.
Very Old Adults will die any time soon. If there are free Settlers available in case of their Death they can be replaced in their current Profession.

Survival Guide
Reproduction
Age of Settlers
Adults
Families
Children
Fertility
Birth Control

Your Settlers get older until they eventually die of old age.
That's why an eye should always be kept on how old Settlers are to prevent a settlement from dying out.

All Children become Adults as of a certain age. As Adults they can be instructed to carry out a <link="2"><style="DefaultLink">Task</style></link> or to pursue a <link="3"><style="DefaultLink">Profession</style></link>.
If Settlers live in a Cabin or a Sturdy House they can start a Family. A Family consists of one male and one female Adult. Over the course of time these two Settlers are going to reproduce.

Children are born when a Family has enough space in its Cabin or Sturdy House. Children cannot practice <link="3"><style="DefaultLink">Professions</style></link> or carry out <link="2"><style="DefaultLink">Tasks</style></link>. They are educated in the <link="17"><style="DefaultLink">School</style></link>, provided that one is available.

A Cabin can be built to give Settlers a home. Settlers constitute a Family when they live in one Cabin and have sufficient space there. When sufficient space is available in a Cabin they have up to 3 Children at one time. 
Settlers with a roof over their heads are <link="8"><style="DefaultLink">more confident</style></link>, too. Some Buildings in the vicinity of a Cabin can influence the <link="8"><style="DefaultLink">Contentedness</style></link> of the Inhabitants positively or negatively.

The Sturdy House functions like a normal Cabin but it can accommodate up to 4 Adults and 6 Children. The Sturdy House can also stand up better against Sandstorms. Settlers only move in as a Family. When sufficient space is available in a Sturdy House they have up to 6 Children at one time. To be able to build a Sturdy House the appropriate <link="19"><style="DefaultLink">Research</style></link> has to be performed first. Some Buildings in the vicinity of a Sturdy House can influence the <link="8"><style="DefaultLink">Contentedness</style></link> of the Inhabitants positively or negatively.

A Shelter provides space for up to 25 Settlers. While living in a Shelter Settlers will not start any Families and they will not reproduce. The Shelter can be upgraded to provide space for more Settlers. A Shelter cannot be connected to a Power Grid. Some Buildings in the vicinity of a Shelter can influence the Contentedness of the Inhabitants. Both positively and negatively. You ought to pay attention to the kind of surroundings your Settlers live in.
Settlers who grow too old become infertile. They can also lose their ability to reproduce when they are highly <link="10"><style="DefaultLink">contaminated</style></link> with Radiation.

An Upgraded Shelter provides space for up to 50 Settlers. While living in an Upgraded Shelter Settlers will not start any Families and they will not reproduce. An Upgraded Shelter can be connected to a Power Grid. To be able to build an Upgraded Shelter the corresponding <link="19"><style="DefaultLink">Research</style></link> must be performed first. Some Buildings in the vicinity of an Upgraded Shelter can influence the Contentedness of the Inhabitants positively or negatively.
Birth Control keeps your Settlers from having Children during the next 3 Seasons. This prevents the Economy from being burdened too severely due to a high number of Children.
Comfortable House

The Comfortable House functions like a Sturdy House and can equally accommodate up to 4 Adults and 6 Children. The Comfortable House is also able to stand up better against Sandstorms. Settlers only move in as a Family. If enough space is available in a Comfortable House, the Family has up to 6 Children all at once. A Comfortable House supplies itself with <link="13"><style="DefaultLink">Electricity</style></link> and does not have to be connected to a Power Grid. To be able to build a Comfortable House the appropriate <link="19"><style="DefaultLink">Research</style></link> must be performed first. Some Buildings in the vicinity of a Comfortable House can influence the <link="8"><style="DefaultLink">Contentedness</style></link> of its Inhabitants positively or negatively.
Comfortable Shelter

A Comfortable Shelter provides space for up to 100 settlers. While living in a Comfortable Shelter Settlers will not start a Family or reproduce. A Comfortable Shelter provides itself with <link="13"><style="DefaultLink">Electricity</style></link> and does not need to be connected to a Power Grid first. To be able to build a Comfortable Shelter the appropriate <link="19"><style="DefaultLink">Research</style></link> must be performed first. Some Buildings in the vicinity of a Comfortable Shelter can positively or negatively influence the Contentedness of its Inhabitants.
