Sitting Areas can be placed to increase the Attractiveness of an area.
Canopies can be placed to greatly increase the Attractiveness of an area.

A Greenhouse! We saw pictures of them in the Endzone. Just picture all the Plants and Fruits that must have grown here... sadly, there's not much left of them. The only things lying around here are rusty Metal and Scrap. We could send an Expedition to excavate the ground. Maybe they'll find something.
Well, just like our Scout reported: Metal and rubble. Should we be on the lookout for anything specific, or just grab the Scrap and get out of here in a hurry?
Greenhouse
It doesn't look like much, but we'll keep our eyes open.
Search for Seeds and Plants.
Remnants
If anything from the time before the incident survived, then we ought to find it underground. But it's been a long time... We'll have to be really thorough. <<dynamicmessage>>
Next time maybe we'll have to bring along an agriculture expert.
The Surroundings
We'll take a look around. Maybe we'll find something in one of the dusty corners. <<dynamicmessage>>
If you had only packed a few of the right Tools for us...
There are Herbs growing here that we can use for Medicine!
I don't know what you expected here, chief, but the only things here are grass, filth and dirt. Just like everywhere else. <<dynamicmessage>>
Next time we ought to bring Tools along!
Chief, we found a new type of Seed for our Fields! <<dynamicmessage>>
Our agriculture expert just discovered it. That's precisely why it's so important to hire the right people!
We've torn apart whole piles of rubble and still haven't found anything remarkable yet. We'll just take some of this Scrap with us... <<dynamicmessage>>
Next time we ought to bring someone along who knows more than a thing or two about Plants.

Judging by that big green cross and the helipad, this must have been a hospital where they treated their sick and wounded. Unlike them, we won't have the luxury to get painkillers for a broken ankle anytime soon, right? Wait, can painkillers stay intact for a whole century? Hmm. If this place wasn't already looted, this thing could be a gold mine...

Looks like the Scout was right, chief! One part of the Building has partially collapsed, but even from a distance you can see that this structure is nearly untouched! On the other hand, some fresh footprints lead to the main entrance, and we also discovered a few splatters of blood...
Main Entrance

The footprints lead directly toward the main entrance. Unfortunately, we can't look through the windows because they're all coated with layers of dirt. We could try to open the main door or break in through one of the windows. <<dynamicmessage>>
Investigate it!
Opening the door shouldn't be too hard since we brought along some Tools.
We should've brought along some Tools for that door, just in case it was locked.
Break Window
Smashing these windows shouldn't be hard, chief! We just need to make sure no one gets hurt. <<dynamicmessage>>
Good thing we have a veteran with us.
I told ya we'd get in with ease! <<dynamicmessage>> Really looks like some loner set up camp here. The spot where he built his fire is still warm!
Our veteran smashed in the window with one rock at a safe distance! Smart cookie.
Ahhhh, bad news. One of us got cut really badly. We’ll make a bandage out of some rags lying around here. I just hope there won't be an infection. I think it would be wise to head back...
Pry Door Open
This door is sturdier than it looks… I'd say it was blocked from the inside with a big chunk of Wood. Presumably by the person who got here before us. <<dynamicmessage>>
Lucky for us you packed up an axe, chief!
An axe would've done the job... But we've still got our hands...
That door is a done deal! Really looks like some loner set up camp here. The spot where he built his fire is still warm! We're inside now. From here we can reach the main corridor!
This door won't let itself be opened so easily. This person really made sure that no one gets in without an effort. At least not here... We might need to find another way...
Main Corridor
We made it to the main corridor. It's pretty dark in here, but we discovered signs that designate different departments and wards we can take a look at.
Keep going!
Storage Department
We can head to the Storage Department to see if we can find any Medicine left. <<dynamicmessage>> I bet we'll find Protective Clothing, too!
While reading our guide we learned that some medication never expires...
If we hadn't skipped school, maybe we'd know if some of this stuff is still usable...
Yeah, some of those painkillers stay good forever! Good thing our Survival Guide told us about that. We also found some respirator masks.

Well, we found a huge pile of Medicine, but it was way past the expiration date for it. I don't think it's safe to use that stuff. On the bright side, we just found some Activated Carbon Masks inside some lockers.
Management
On the way to the executive suite. This must be where all those doctors took their breaks. We’ll probably find some books to read here.<<dynamicmessage>>
Our veteran tells us we ought to be thorough. It's a sure bet those privileged doctors hid their best stuff in their offices.
I'm not sure if that's our best option, but most likely it’ll just be books. Nothing else.

Our veteran had us search every corner, but it was really worth it! We found some old whiskey! What a haul! We found a stock of well-preserved painkillers and lots of interesting books, too. Even got our hands on some novels!
Just as predicted, there were all sorts of books left over. We even got our hands on some novels! We've already taken a look at a few of them. We'll have enough time to read some on our way back!
Trauma Center
The footprints lead in this direction... <<dynamicmessage>>
Our doc tells us that, judging by the strange movement pattern, it looks like this person limps.

Looks like this guy headed to the Trauma Center to get some bandages. He was also bleeding severely and probably used some rags to stop the bleeding, but apparently that didn't help much. <<dynamicmessage>> We'll head further inside.
The doc says we ought to hurry, his wounds seem to be really bad.
A Wounded Survivor
We found him! That guy must've got hit pretty bad. His heartbeat is weak and he's unconscious. <<dynamicmessage>>
Keep going!
The doc says a wild boar did a real job on him.
Patch Him Up.
We'll need some serious skill to get that guy shipshape again. <<dynamicmessage>>
Luckily we have our doc on our crew.
At least we brought some Medicine along.

He's back in the land of the living! He'll hook up with our group. <<dynamicmessage>> The poor guy told us he used to be a Scout in a different Endzone and took off after a reconnaissance mission. That was 15 years ago. Can you believe it? Said he couldn't stand the dark hellhole anymore. He still had some Rations left and shared them with us.
Doc truly performed a miracle in there!

The poor guy ran out of luck! We tried our best, but he had an infection and lost too much blood. We brought him to the morgue so that at least the wild animals don't get to him. He had some Rations in his backpack. Some of them are soaked in blood now, we took the rest with us.
Operating Table
We can lay him down on a nearby operating table. There should be some alcohol on hand to sterilize his wounds and patch him up! But we need to hurry! <<dynamicmessage>>

He's back in the land of the living! He'll hook up with our group. <<dynamicmessage>> The poor guy told us he used to be a Scout in a different Endzone and took off after a reconnaissance mission. That was 15 years ago. Can you believe it? Said he couldn't stand the dark hellhole anymore. He still had some Rations left and shared them with us.
Collapsed Side

A whole section of the building seems to have broken off and collapsed. Did an earthquake cause this? Either way, this could be an easy access to the first floor. From there we can get to all the different levels via the adjacent stairwell.
Take a look at that!
Climb Inside!
The floor is higher than we thought. Maybe it's not so easy to get up there, after all. <<dynamicmessage>>
Good thing you packed rough-and-ready Tools for us. We'll have a better grip on that old concrete while climbing up.
Good thing you packed some Cloth for us. This way we can fashion ourselves a rope!
Good thing you packed some Cloth and a pick for us. This way we can build ourselves a grappling hook!
Some Cloth or a Tool really could've helped us here...
We just reached the first floor, chief. <<dynamicmessage>>
Getting here was a breeze! Finally working with real pros, at last!
Some of us nearly hit the ground. This old concrete has really turned into pudding.
Damn it, chief, this concrete is much too brittle. One of us fell just before we reached the first floor. It's really hard to get a grip. Good thing it was only the first floor, so no major injuries.
The First Floor
We made it to the first floor. If we use the adjacent stairwell we'll have no trouble reaching all the floors of this Building. Just like we predicted.
Keep going!
To The Ground Floor

We could go down to the ground level, chief. I just don't know why you wanted us to climb up to the first floor then, but what do I know. The stairs are also partially collapsed. Getting down will be easy but getting back up this way won't be possible.
If you say so. Guys, the chief wants us to go back down! Yeah, I know...
Check This Floor
There's a large bookshelf and a bunch of different cabinets here on this floor. Plenty of stuff to comb through. <<dynamicmessage>>
This must be the administrative wing. I bet they have some kind of strongroom with a safe.
Having someone with more imagination might have helped to find the truly interesting stuff.

On the first try, chief! We found a hidden door that leads to a small storage compartment. There were lots of Radiation Suits and some well-preserved Medicine! Good thing some of us enjoy reading adventure stories...
Well, what a waste of time. We found a few books to read. But still, far more interesting than our Survival Guide... It bores you to tears! We'll bring them back to Camp!
Head For The 2nd Floor
The sign next to the stairs tells us that this floor is intended for patients' rooms. There's supposed to be plenty of Scrap and Metal here. <<dynamicmessage>>
Our Technician just had the bright idea to stop by the janitor's room and grab some Tools so that we can dismantle things faster!
A Technician could've helped out with the dismantling, but we'll manage anyways.
Yeah. We took those beds apart in nothing flat! We also found a few good Tools and a stack of cables! <<dynamicmessage>>
Good thing we had a Technician on the team. Saved a lot of time!
Taking those beds apart took longer than we thought. But still, a lot of Metal emerged in the process.

This must be one of the Greenhouses that people used for farming. Man, life must have been much more carefree back then. The Greenhouse itself is in bad shape, but there's a variety of Plants growing here that we haven't seen anywhere else.
We've arrived at the Greenhouse, chief. I don't know what that Scout told ya... to us, it just looks like any other Ruin scattered around in the wilderness. Not very promising...
Abandoned Greenhouse
Take a look around!
Some Plants are growing where the Planting Area must have been when this was still a lush green oasis. There's also an old ventilation shaft that we could dismantle. <<dynamicmessage>>
A Farmer or a Gatherer could've really helped us out here!
Planting Area
Some sort of Corn grows here. <<dynamicmessage>>
Sadly, we don't know much about Plants at all.
Good thing we brought along an expert!
The Plants growing here only vaguely resemble the Corn we know<<dynamicmessage>>! We could gather them and try to cultivate them.
. The exposure to Radiation must have altered their phenotype
These Plants are of no use to us... <<dynamicmessage>>. We'll just collect some Scrap instead.
Maybe these Plants used to have Seeds way back when, but the exposure to Radiation must have rendered them sterile. Which makes me wonder how they reproduce...
Ventilation Shaft
We could remove the cover of this old shaft. Not much to expect here, chief! But you never know. <<dynamicmessage>>
Wait, our expert tells us it would make a good refuge for some edible Mushrooms. All right, I get it...
Maybe a Gatherer would know better...
Yeah, we found what looks like some sort of Mushroom. We'll scrape them off carefully! <<dynamicmessage>>
I was told it deals with some kind of moss with fungi. Our Gatherer is sure it's edible. He already took a bite.
Well, it's an empty old shaft... We'll take it apart so that at least we end up with some Metal out of this venture.

The remnants of an old Greenhouse. People used to grow Fruits and Vegetables there before the incident. There are quite a few of them around. Hmm. Looks like some of our ancestors cared about Mother Nature, after all. You can send some Explorers to take a closer look. Maybe they'll dig up something useful.

We're here, chief. There's not much to look at. Shattered glass here and there, rubble, and an old Metal frame. Was that Scout pulling our leg, sending us here all because of this junk heap?! Then let's get to work.
Greenhouse Ruin
Come on! Get in there!
Let's see... all sorts of smashed pots, planters and buckets. This thing seems to have had a ventilation system, too. Which is now rusty and falling apart. So, how should I put it?... Scrap.
Accessories
We'll try to take along some of this stuff. Don't want to see that it was all for nothing. <<dynamicmessage>>
At least we have a genuine craftsman with us.
If we had brought along a good foreman, everything would've been simpler.
All right, not anything remarkable, but we still managed to get some Scrap and Metal out of this place.
Well, there's not much left we can still put to use, but it's still better than nothing. <<dynamicmessage>>
I mean, this all looks like garbage to us. Maybe we ought to bring somebody along who's in a better position to distinguish garbage from recyclable.
Ventilation System
It deals with some sort of dilapidated ventilation system. Looks like some parts of it could still be put to good use. <<dynamicmessage>>

No, no way! While taking the ventilation apart we noticed that this thing had a false bottom! And guess what was inside, chief? Vacuum-sealed and just waiting for us to find? A plastic container full of hemp that someone must've stashed here! Let's consider this a gift from the past and get ready for a laid-back evening in the Pub! Hate to say it, but good thing that Scout led us here.
Some Metal and a few old Plastic parts… I'd say that's all there is, chief. Like I said, that Scout is a jerk!
The remnants of an old Greenhouse. There are still some Plants growing inside. Maybe we'll get lucky with this one!
Okay, we're here. The Scout didn't tell us a thing, but there's a sweet smell lingering in the air here. It gets even stronger the closer you get to the Greenhouse.
Demolished Greenhouse

The smell seems to come from a bunch of Plants growing in the middle of the Ruin. They have long thin leaves; spiked, almost jagged-looking. I'd say they were once cultivated here and somehow managed to survive the fallout.
Where does it come from?
The Plants
Wait a second. This must be Marijuana! The sweet smell, the leaves... it all fits! We can harvest these babies! <<dynamicmessage>>
It's a sure thing a Farmer would have some comments to offer...
Lucky for us, we have a Farmer on the team.
Greenhouse Frame
We could leave the Plants where they are for now and try to salvage part of the Metal the Greenhouse is made of. <<dynamicmessage>>
We should've brought along some Tools for us. Would've been a lot more efficient.
Good thing we brought along our tools!
If we're careful we can take the blossoming little Plants with us and try to cultivate them back at the Camp! <<dynamicmessage>>
Can you believe these dimwits, chief? They nearly would've destroyed these precious little creatures by ripping them out of the ground.

If we only knew how we'd be able to cultivate this godsend... maybe next time we ought to bring along one of the experienced Farmers. But who cares, anyway? Get ready to fly high as a kite in the bus once we get back, chief!
Alrighty, looks good. This is almost more usable Scrap and Metal than we can carry!
Good, we got some Scrap out of this thing. Although the frame itself is too sturdy. <<dynamicmessage>>
We'd need some tools to take it apart.

Our Scout said that our ancestors used this Ruin to debug stories. Maybe we should do that, too. (If you see this story and you're not a developer, please report this by pressing F1 using our STOMT tool)

Privacy Policy for the Game “Endzone” I. General Information

1. Body Responsible; Company Data Protection Officer In the following we explain to you which personal data are collected and processed by us when our services or offers are used. We are: ASSEMBLE Entertainment GmbH  Ostring 3 (Hinterhaus) 65205 Wiesbaden, Germany  Telephone: +49 611 13 57 82 30 E-MAIL: info@assemble-entertainment.com Personal data are individual details regarding personal or factual circumstances pertaining to a specific or identifiable natural person.

2. Legal Basis We collect and process personal data based on the legal grounds stated in the following: \u2022 Consent pursuant to Article 6 para. 1 (a) of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Consent is any voluntary expression of intent given in an informed and unequivocal manner in the form of a statement or other unambiguous confirmatory act which indicates that the data subject consents to the processing of his/her personal data. \u2022 Necessity to fulfill the contract or carry out preparatory actions pursuant to Article 6 para. 1 (b) of the GDPR. This means that the data are required so that we are able to fulfill the contractual obligations to you or we need the data to prepare a contract closure with you. \u2022 Processing to fulfill legal obligations pursuant to Article 6 para. 1 (c) of the GDPR. This means that a processing of the data is stipulated, e.g. due to a law or other regulations. \u2022 Processing toward the safeguarding of legitimate interests pursuant to Article 6 para. 1 (f) of the GDPR. This means that processing is necessary to safeguard legitimate interests on our part or those of third parties insofar as the interests or fundamental rights and freedoms on your part which require the protection of personal data do not predominate.

3. Rights of the Data Subject You are entitled to the following rights with regard to the processing of data by us in the scope pursuant to the respectively listed articles of the General Data Protection Regulation: \u2022 Right of access to the data pursuant to Art. 15 of the GDPR \u2022 Right to rectification pursuant to Art. 16 of the GDPR \u2022 Right to erasure ("Right to be forgotten") pursuant to Art. 17 of the GDPR \u2022 Right to restriction of processing pursuant to Art. 18 of the GDPR \u2022 Right to data portability pursuant to Art. 20 of the GDPR \u2022 Right to object pursuant to Art. 21 of the GDPR Without prejudice to any other administrative or judicial remedy, you have the right to complain to a supervisory authority, in particular in the member state of your place of residence, employment or the place of the alleged infringement, if you believe that the processing of the personal data affecting you violates the GDPR.

4. Data Deletion and Retention Period The personal data of the data subject shall be deleted or blocked as soon as the purpose of storage ceases to apply. Above and beyond this, storage may occur when this has been envisaged by the European or national legislator in directives, legislation or other regulations pertaining to EU law which the processor is governed by. A blocking or deletion of the data also occurs when a retention period prescribed by the standards stated expires unless a necessity for further storage of the data for conclusion of a contract or fulfillment of a contract exists.
II. Specific Data Processing
1. Data Collection Using Stomt

a) Scope of Data Processing The game provides the possibility to make contact with us via Stomt in the event of problems, errors or wishes for improvement. Stomt is a service of the firm Stomt GmbH based in Germany. By making contact a query is posted on a public Community Board hosted and operated by Stomt GmbH. Among other options, registered users can reply there as well. However, the message can also be composed in such a way that it is posted anonymously. An email address and a user name can but do not have to be made available. The same applies for a screenshot of the respective game scene in which the problem arises. If you use this service, Stomt processes the posted data on its own behalf and under its own responsibility on the basis of its privacy policy at https://www.stomt.com/privacy. Besides this data, which we have no influence upon, we receive technical data intended to help us in solving any technical issues. Insofar as an email address is indicated, we receive the following data together with said email address and the user name indicated: \u2022 Screen Resolution \u2022 Version of the game \u2022 Information whether the gamer is in an ongoing game or in the main menu \u2022 Details about the existing hardware and operation system, including drivers \u2022 Time elapsed, in seconds, since the game was started \u2022 Replay – data that contains the game moves made until now \u2022 Logfile of the game with possible error warnings, including the following data: \u2022 IP adress of the local network (not the Internet IP) \u2022 Computer name \u2022 Unity version \u2022 A text file containing all information about the game map created by the gamer and all starting options selected This data is stored at Stomt and made availble to us and/or software developers commissioned by us. The software developer commissioned by us shall reply to customer queries via email or on the Stomt platform. In the event of a reply via email, the entire follow-up email correspondence shall be saved.

b) Legal Basis The legal basis for the processing of the data by us is Art. 6 para. 1 (b), (f) of the GDPR. The basis for the processing by Stomt on its own behalf for those data published by Stomt is the Usage Agreement between you and Stomt. The data are collected directly by Stomt, however the transmission of data to Stomt occurs only when you actively send a “Stomt” message. Data that are not published are processed by Stomt on our behalf pursuant to Art. 28 para 3 of the GDPR. The legitimate interest within the meaning of Art. 6 para 1 (f) of the GDPR therefore lies in the functionality of our game and the customer service for customers with whom we maintain no direct contractual relationship. The developer of software commissioned by us processes support queries on our behalf pursuant to Art. 28 para. 3 of the GDPR, and solely within the European Union. In addition, the legitimate interest for email storage here is that we want to monitor the customer service provided by our developer in terms of its quality.

c) Purpose of data processing The purpose of data processing is to render support services toward customers along with the continuous improvement of our game and correction of errors within said game.

d) Retention Period To the extent that no direct support for a customer is supposed to be performed, the email address and user name shall be deleted without undue delay. The remaining data shall be subsequently used anonymously. To the extent that support services are being rendered, the data are saved for the duration of the customer dialog and subsequently for the term of any warranty. If no case involving warranty exists, the data are retained for 6 (six) months in the event that the customer has further questions.

e) Objection and Removal Option The acquisition of data is urgently necessary for the rendering of support services. Although the customer can object to a use of his/her data at any time via email to support@assembleteam.com, in such case a rendering of support services is no longer possible. Insofar as the services take place within the framework of statutory warranty legislation, an objection is not possible.
Privacy Policy for our Feedback Reporter

Here's a Building with a weird sign on the front facade. It's not exactly in the best shape. The boys should bring along Tools and a Doctor. Aside from that, some strange flyers are lying around in the neighborhood houses: "Moonshine for the end of the world". Was that some kind of party? There's a bottle in the center with the inscription "XXX" printed on it. Oh, well, sorry for taking up your time, chief...

It's a pretty run-down building - the roof has partially collapsed. Although, the sign in front looks like the one we had on the doors in the medical ward back in the Endzone. Could be worth taking a look inside. <<dynamicmessage>>
I'm not sure why the Pubkeeper had to come along. I think it'd be better to have a freshly tapped Beer waiting on us when we return...
The Way To Get In
I bet there could still be Medicine and other useful stuff lying around here! The door looks solid. We could also try getting in through the roof... <<dynamicmessage>>
Clear yourselves a path to get in there!
Good thing we've got some sturdy Tools with us!
We can try to jimmy the door open, but it might be hard without good Tools...
Looks accessible, although I wonder if that roof can still hold the weight with one of us on it....
Front Door
We can try it through the front door. <<dynamicmessage>>
We should've brought some tools along, just in case.
Good thing you packed up some Tools for us!
Okay, we've jimmied the door and are standing in what looks like a waiting area. Lots and lots of stools.
There's no way we're getting in  there <<dynamicmessage>>!
without the right Tools
Roof
We ought to be able to get in by climbing onto the roof <<dynamicmessage>>.
, although it'd definitely be easier for someone younger
, for once it's an exciting challenge
We simply jumped through a hole in the roof. Doesn't get any easier than that, chief! Now we're standing in some kind of waiting area. Lots and lots of stools.
Damn it, chief, one of us broke broke a leg! But at least we're inside now! We're standing in some kind of waiting area. Lots and lots of stools.
Inside The Doctor's Office

There are two rooms here and a stairway down to the basement, except that the stairs are blocked by the rubble from the collapsed roof. One room must be where the patients were treated, the other just seems to be full of files. <<dynamicmessage>>
Take a look around!
Good thing we brought along someone who can make head or tail out of all these files!

Too bad we don't have anyone with us who has a grip on this medical stuff and can make head or tail out of all of it. Although, we could just look and see if we can find a manual with a catchy title...
Treatment Room
No doubt there's useful things like bandages and stuff like that here! For sure! <<dynamicmessage>>
Good thing we brought along the doc! Now we know what the pills and syringes lying around here are good for!
Although, we're pretty much in the dark as to what this stuff here is. We should've brought along our doc.
Guess nothing's been looted here yet since the incident! Here's a Medicine cabinet filled with all sorts of pills, bandages and syringes. Everything still looks intact. We'll take it all with us!

Guess nothing's been looted here yet since the incident! Here's a Medicine cabinet filled with all sorts of pills, bandages and syringes. We're not familiar with the stuff... but we packed up a few things, anyway. <<dynamicmessage>>
We should've brought along the doc.
Records Room
Let's go through all those files and books! There's a whole bunch of stuff lying around here. <<dynamicmessage>>
Someone who can read better would've been helpful.
But luckily we can read quite well.

They're just old files - barely readable anymore and full of useless information about the little aches and pains people used to have. If the only problem we had was a stiff neck... what a life... But at least we found a wide-ranging medical book. Looks promising! Helpful! <<dynamicmessage>>
Good thing we have our very own mister smarty pants with us. Wouldn't have spotted it otherwise between all these files!

They were all just old files - barely readable anymore and full of irrelevant information that didn't get us anywhere. <<dynamicmessage>> In the end, merely one book with the promising title "A Quack Doctor's Guide for Dummies"! Think that'll get us somewhere, chief?
We should've brought along someone who's educated!
The Surroundings
Maybe we'll find something out here! <<dynamicmessage>>
Our veteran told us that lots of these old Houses often have a basement where you can get in from outside.
But I'm not sure what you're hoping to find here, chief. And we're not exactly the most experienced crew...
Look around!
Backyard
Roger, we'll take a look at the backyard. <<dynamicmessage>>
We should've brought along a veteran. To us, this area looks... pretty uninteresting...
Ah, our veteran already went ahead. Looks like we already spotted something...
Look what we found! <<dynamicmessage>> Looks like a hatch to the basement. Everything's all overgrown here and hidden behind thick vines, but we can squeeze through...
Our veteran is a walking secret door detector!
Well, it's an empty backyard, chief. We did find some Scrap, but that's about it. <<dynamicmessage>>
If we come back with one of our veterans, maybe we'll be luckier here...
Front Yard
We can take along a bit of the Scrap lying around. Not particularly interesting, but better than nothing.
Not exactly our biggest find, but as the old saying goes: "A little Scrap a day and the suit’s on the way". Not funny? Okay...
Oh, we got a little distracted. What were we supposed to do? Right, gather up some Scrap...
The Basement
Looks as if the good doctor got a kick out of making moonshine on the sly! It's a full-scale distillery down here: pots, bottles, ... Whatever’s needed seems to be here!
Then hurry up and get down there!
Distillery
Let's take a closer look at this baby! It's in good shape. We could tidy this thing up and brew our own Hard Liquor! But it could be dangerous. <<dynamicmessage>>
Damn, we don't have our Pubkeeper with us... That thing would be running again in no time. We'll try it anyway.
You should've seen the look on our Pubkeeper's face. That was good instinct to take him along, chief!
Sweet, it's up and running! It'll take some time till the alcohol's ready, but good things are worth waiting for, right? <<dynamicmessage>>
Not to mention that we don't want to go blind from cheap hooch.

Okay! That went just like in a textbook! Hmmm, smells pretty awful, but ... whatever, I'll take a slug. *Coughs* What the blazes is this crap? Guys, don't drink this stuff! Everything's gotten all blurry. Shoot, chief, that wasn't a good idea...
Shelves

The shelves are full of bottles - there's still liquid in some of them! Ah, the bottle with the "XXX" the Scout was talking about... they brewed strong stuff down here while the world was going down the drain. Nice! <<dynamicmessage>>
We just don't know which ones are still properly sealed, hmmm. We should've brought along that Pubkeeper.
Our best friend, the Pubkeeper, has already hurried to the shelves to sort the bottles!
Now that's a stroke of luck! Most of these bottles were empty or all gunked up, but a few of them were still properly sealed! The finest moonshine - get ready to party hearty!

No idea what we had in mind by taking a slug from those old bottles. That was a pretty bad idea... the headaches we got are murder! At any rate, there's nothing we should take along. The moment we feel better we'll just take some Scrap and split!

In-game feedback
General Information

Hey chief, one of the Scouts here. I went to the coordinates you suggested and came across an old Storage Depot. Pretty run-down, walls are missing, rust everywhere - a downright Ruin. Looks like there's an old shipping container inside. If you're thinking of sending an Expedition here, it might just be worth it.
We're at the location now. Like that Scout said - a dilapidated Storage Depot. At least we should be able to get a little Scrap out of this place. But who knows? Maybe we'll get lucky today.
Storage Depot
So, there's the old shipping container the Scout mentioned. Locked up <<dynamicmessage>>
but that shouldn't be any problem since we brought along some Tools.
and we didn't bring any Tools. But it's old and rusty, so maybe we can just force it open.
Take a look around!
Shipping Container
Let's open this thing up! <<dynamicmessage>>
Off
On

Yeah, our forefathers and their overconfidence. They built these plants without thinking about the risk or any long-term impacts. When it all spiraled out of control, these power plants brought death to millions of human beings. Almost two centuries later and the whole sector is still radioactively contaminated. If you really want to send people in there you ought to equip them well. Otherwise you'll risk that these things will be notching up more people's lives soon.
This place gives us the creeps - it's eerily quiet except for the clicking of our Geiger counter. <<dynamicmessage>>
We really shouldn't be here, chief. Like our Scout said: it's too dangerous without protection.
At least we're properly equipped.
Reactor Core

We managed to climb up a giant door and get in from there! Now we're standing in a control room, with the actual core beneath us. It's embedded in a pool of Water and, judging from the Geiger counter, still emitting Radiation like crazy...
Find a way in!
Control Room
We can take as much of the equipment in here as we can carry!
A real treasure trove, chief! This should provide more than enough electronic parts for a while...
We've dismantled a few of these devices, but our heads are starting to spin. I think the sickness is getting to us - time to head out of here, chief!
Core
Could be dangerous, but maybe we'll find something useful down there.

We were pulling some of the tubes and machinery out of the pool when one of us slipped and fell in the water! Even though we did manage to pull him out quickly, we'd still better watch if he displays any signs of the sickness. <<dynamicmessage>>
Good thing we're all wearing Radiation Suits.

We were pulling some of the tubes and machinery out of the pool when one of us slipped and fell in the water! We managed to pull him out quickly but he lost consciousness. We're worried sick, it must've been a pretty heavy dose of Radiation! This one's on you, chief- why would you send us here without the right equipment?
Main Facility
Seems to be all locked up. There are a couple of roller doors we could try to force open <<dynamicmessage>>, but we could also try getting in through that collapsed roof our Scout told us about.
with the Tools we brought along
, though that could be difficult without any Tools
Go ahead
Roof
Getting to the roof should be easy, there are ladders leading up
Alright, we've climbed up to the roof and reached the upper floor through the collapsed part.
Roller Doors
We should be able to pry them open. <<dynamicmessage>>
We didn't take all these Tools along for nothing, after all.
It was easy enough to force those old doors. There's all sorts of old machinery and an old truck in here. We'll start sorting through it and take what we can put to use back home with us.
These doors are heavier and sturdier than they look! <<dynamicmessage>>
No way we'll get them open without some Tools.
Upper Floor
There are a lot of desks and a locked room at the end of the corridor. Unfortunately there seems to be no way down from here - the stairway is buried under slabs of concrete from that collapsed roof.
Look around
Desks
Bet we can find some useful stuff if we look around! Besides some office supplies there are even some old computers here. <<dynamicmessage>>
Maybe our Technician can dismantle some of them!
A Technician could help us dismantle some of them!
Well, it's a lot of useless rubble - old pens, books, coffee cups and squeaky desk chairs. But we can salvage some of it for Plastic and Metal! <<dynamicmessage>>
Our Technician even managed to grab the last Electronics from the computers that was still working.
We even managed to grab some Electronics from the computers without a Technician.
Well, it's a lot of useless rubble - old pens, books, coffee cups and squeaky desk chairs. But we can salvage some of it for Plastic and Metal! <<dynamicmessage>>
A Technician could've gotten something else out of these old computers.
Locked Room
Locked means valuable, right?

Ha! We knew this would be worthwhile, chief! They've stored a couple of Radiation Suits and Activated Carbon Masks in this room. They'll come in handy when we have to deal with areas contaminated with Radiation!
It's no use, chief. The door is made of solid metal and won't budge an inch. <<dynamicmessage>>
Maybe we ought to come back with some Tools, but we shouldn't spend too much time here.
I guess we could keep going at it for hours, but we really shouldn't spend too much time here, not with the Radiation and whatever else...
Turbine Building
Looks like they used this Building to house the turbine! We can try to dismantle it. It ought to bring some valuable metal! <<dynamicmessage>>
Good thing we brought along some Tools and someone who knows about this technical stuff. Otherwise this would be one pointless venture...
But without the right Tools or a technical Expert we won't be able to take this thing apart.
It's a good thing we have someone with technical expertise along. Too bad we're missing the right Tools. But we can try, anyway.
It's a good thing we have the right Tools. Too bad we don't have someone with technical Knowledge along. But we can try, anyway.
Let's take it apart!
Turbine
We'll try our best to take this thing apart.
Phew, that was a lot of work. We managed to dismantle it and still keep all the pieces in good condition!
No way we'll manage to take this thing apart - it's simply too big and too heavy. But we can still come back <<dynamicmessage>> and try again.
with better equipment
with someone who knows about that technical stuff
with better equipment and someone who knows about that technical stuff
Way to go, chief! It'll be smooth sailing from here!
What a pain. Next time we'll get it right!
We really stepped on the gas to crank that number up. But now you've got to keep an eye out that our kids and us stay healthy, okay?
Nope, chief. You know that "increasing a population" is more work than cranking up a number, right?
*humming* How much wood could a woodchuck chuck. If a woodchuck could chuck wood? As much wood as a woodchuck could chuck, If a woodchuck could chuck wood.
Gee, chief, we really don't need that much Wood. Was that some kind of contest?
If there's one thing we love, it's rummaging through endless mounds of garbage. Nothing beats it!
We do love these mounds of garbage, but that turned out to be a bit too much.

Good thing we brought along the right Tools.
Looks sturdy. Could be hard to get in with our bare hands...

Open sesame! <<dynamicmessage>> The container is filled with crates full of "authentic folk costumes". At least that's what's written on the label. From the look of them the stuff was probably produced on the other side of the planet and then shipped here to be sold for a song.
Easy as pie when you bring along the right Tools. Can't tell you how much I've come to love my trusty crowbar, chief!
It's old and rusty, but we're still having a hard time forcing this container open, chief!
We should come back with better Tools.
Junk
We'll strip whatever's still any good for Scrap.
Well, let's see. Some old crates made of Metal, some wooden palettes, a few pieces of Plastic, some junk. All in all, it's not much, but at least we won't leave this place empty-handed.

This must be an old gas station. If we hadn't settled already this might have brought our bus some more miles. I can't imagine there's still much left to find here, but it might still be worth it to send an Expedition to take a closer look. At least there ought to be some salvageable stuff  in it.

We're here, chief. Well, that Scout pretty much summed it up already - not much left here. The station is in pretty bad shape - the structures look like they're made of rust instead of Metal. But we'll look around anyway.
Gas station
Well, the gas pumps are either gone or busted, but there's a garage we could check out. The convenience shop, too. Our best bets, I guess.
So, anything remarkable?
Garage
Most likely we'll find some old Tools inside along with some sheets of Metal. Judging by the size of the garage, they also did some repairs here back then. <<dynamicmessage>>
That roller door looks really sturdy. A crowbar would've helped.
Good thing we brought along a crowbar!

The door's open. Looks like an old military truck. They must have been in a real hurry, everything's scattered around. The truck's pretty much stripped and a bunch of Tools are lying around. A welcome discovery!
Damn. We won't be getting in <<dynamicmessage>>, chief. Guess we could come back better equipped!
without some real Tools
Shop
We'll check out that shop! But to be honest, most of the stuff is probably way past any expiration date or has simply become unusable after all these years. <<dynamicmessage>>
A Scrap Collector would've helped finding the stuff that's still usable.
Good thing we brought along a Scrap Collector to sort out the stuff that's still usable.

We found a skeleton in the midst of a pile of old whiskey and beer bottles, surrounded by empty food cans next to some sooty walls. The poor guy must've spent his last days drunk as a skunk, waiting for the inevitable. Guess only a few made it to the Endzone. We'll take what's left in here and let him rest in peace.

We found a skeleton in the midst of a pile of old whiskey and beer bottles, surrounded by empty food cans next to some sooty walls. The poor guy must've spent his last days drunk as a skunk, waiting for the inevitable. Guess only a few made it to the Endzone. We'll take what's left in here and let him rest in peace. <<dynamicmessage>>
It's horrifying to search with this skeleton watching, plus there is not much of use left.
It's horrifying to search with this skeleton watching, we'll take some stuff and leave.

Chief - I think I came across the entrance to another Endzone. The Elders mentioned there were other Endzones nearby, but apparently we lost contact with them long ago when communication systems broke down after the incident. The main gate still seems to be sealed shut, so if you want to send an Expedition, make sure they bring along the right Tools and folks who know about all this technical stuff!

We're here, chief. This looks almost exactly like the Endzone we left behind to start anew. Can you still remember the tingling of sunlight on your face when we first opened that airlock and stepped outside? For a moment there everything seemed so bright and promising...
Anyway, a thought just crossed my mind - maybe there are other survivors down there, people like us! Let's hurry up and get that main gate open so we can find out!
Entering the Endzone

Well, I'd say we have two options: We can try to open the airlock just enough so that we can squeeze through. Or we can try fiddling around with the panel box that controls the airlock. <<dynamicmessage>>
Without a Technician or some Metal Tools, both options will be tough.
Opening up the main gate should be easy using our Metal Tools.
Good thing we brought along a Technician.
What are our options?
Main Gate
Let's give that big main gate a shot! We probably won't be able to open it all the way.
Phew! It took some work, but we managed to pry it open so that we can get through now!
Phew! Sorry, chief, but there's no way we're going to force our way in like this. This giant thing was built to last!
Panel Box
A panel box. <<dynamicmessage>>
Probably our best option!
Absolutely pointless - we have no idea what to do with that box.

Ha! We need more of these technician guys, chief! After fiddling around with the box for a while, there was a bang - apparently we short-circuited the thing! The main door opened up just enough so that we might squeeze through.
Ouch! I got an electric shock while fiddling around with this thing. Absolutely no idea what I'm supposed to do with all this tangled-up cable. We could come back and bring a Technician along!
First Sublevel

Well, we had to climb down the elevator shaft. Looks like the elevator is broken, though that's probably not the only thing not working down here. Lights are flickering, dirt everywhere, and stale air. What a letdown. Can't imagine anyone still lives here.
Apart from that, it looks similar to our Endzone with a different floor layout. The hydroponics station should be on this level. Second sublevel ought to be a living area and medical ward, third sublevel machinery and storage. Looks like all the other floors caved in. Damn it!
Don't give up hope!
Farther Down
Not sure if we really want to find out what awaits us on the second sublevel, but let's see...
I think there are footprints on the stairs going down, chief. Though it's hard to tell in this dim light. Might be from when people were still living here.
Hydroponics
Judging by that stench it must be in bad shape, but let's take a look. <<dynamicmessage>>
We should've brought along people with more knowledge about Plants and such.
Our Gatherer tells us we shouldn't give up hope. The stench doesn't mean it's a lost cause!

Oh my god, it smells awful in here. The Water in the tanks is slimey and filled with algae, and the few Plants that are left are rotting away. No wonder, since only a few of the grow lights are still working, and the water pumps seem dead. <<dynamicmessage>>

On closer inspection, one of our experts noticed that these algae might be edible, and there are some Mushrooms growing on a pile of compost. Almost looks like someone was still tending to this place; living on shrooms and green jelly. Can you imagine, chief?

Oh my god, it smells awful in here. The Water in the tanks is slimey and filled with algae, and the few Plants that are left are rotting away. No wonder, since only a few of the grow lights are still working, and the water pumps seem to have broken down. Let's get out of here.
Second Sublevel
Hm, the door down to the third sublevel seems locked. <<dynamicmessage>> We could also check out the medical ward or head down the corridor to the living area.
How does it look like on the second sublevel?
We can try breaking it down without tools, doesn't look too sturdy.
Shouldn't pose any problem to force it open with our trusty Metal Tools. I'm talking crowbar, chief.
Third Sublevel
Let's check what's left on this floor. There should still be some heavy machinery around. <<dynamicmessage>>
Good thing we have some handy tools!
With Metal Tools this would've been easier.

Oh my god *retching sound* - a blast of disgustingly foul air hit us when we broke the door down. As we went down further it became harder and harder to breathe. We held our breath and went on, only to find decaying corpses in the machine room. They stored their dead down there. What a tragedy...
I guess we'd need some proper Tools to break this door down, chief. Won't get anywhere like this.
Medical Ward
Hopefully there are some medical supplies left. <<dynamicmessage>>
We brought our doc along. Should be easy to tell which supplies are still usable.
If we'd brought our doc along it'd be easier to tell good from bad.

I just had the strangest déjà vu - felt like I've been in this exact same place before. Probably because it's so similar to our old Endzone... Guess they already used up most of their supplies, but we scraped together some remnants and Cloth. <<dynamicmessage>>
Our doc even identified some old compounds and liquids that we thought were garbage...

I just had the strangest déjà vu - felt like I've been in this exact same place before. Probably because it's so similar to our old Endzone... Guess they already used up most of their supplies, but we scraped together some remnants and Cloth.
Living Quarters
No way! I think I just heard faint voices from those living quarters!

You won't believe this, chief- we found survivors! Their diet was based on Mushrooms and algae, but their supplies were running low. Listen for yourself, I'll get their leader on the radio: *female voice* Hello, can you hear me? My name is Charlotte. What a relief your people found us! Everything went south when our systems started shutting down a couple of months ago - the ventilation, the electricity, our hydroponics culture system... We got ready to leave the Endzone, but the main gate wouldn't budge and we didn't have any able-bodied Technicians left. *sobbing* It didn't take long before people were starving and gave up hope altogether... you guys are true saviors! The real thing!
Charlotte

It's me, chief, one of your Scouts. Came across a House with a strange symbol on it - two snakes intertwined on a stick with wings. Think I saw that once in one of the medical manuals we had back in the Endzone. The House is run-down, but there might still be some medical supplies left in there that we could really use back at Camp!

We arrived at the location, chief. The House must've been an old medical practice. I can imagine that people before us already scoured this place, but we'll check anyway. At least it'll be easy to get inside - the door's not locked.
Doctor's Office
So, how does it look inside?
We're standing in the doorway now - there's a stairway to the upper floor, and these must've been a waiting room and treatment room down here.
Upper Floor
We could take a look at the upper floor. <<dynamicmessage>>
Should've brought along a good Scrap Collector.
Good thing we brought along a good Scrap Collector!

That doc must've lived right over his office. Everything's pretty much in ruins up here. Someone else must've already been here before us. Nothing left but rubble - Ahhh, wait a sec! A few old dirty sheets, at least <<dynamicmessage>>!
, spotted by one of our hard-core Scrap Collectors
That doc must've lived right over his office. Everything's pretty much in ruins up here. Someone else must've already been here before us. Nothing left but rubble and dirt. <<dynamicmessage>>
You'd have to be a hard-core Scrap Collector to find anything in this mess, chief.
Ground Floor
Let's take a look around those rooms. <<dynamicmessage>>
We should've brought along our doc.
Good thing we brought along our doc.
It would've helped to have someone who's educated sort through this stuff.
Good thing we have mister smarty pants with us!

I'd say someone must've already combed through all the desks and cabinets in here. There's just some old patient files left - we can probably learn something from them! And we'll strip some of the furniture for Scrap. Otherwise that's pretty much it on this floor. But we did find a stairway down to the basement in the back!

I'd say someone must've already combed through all the desks and cabinets in here. There's just some old patient files left <<dynamicmessage>>. And we'll strip some of the furniture for Scrap. Otherwise that's pretty much it on this floor. But we did find a stairway down to the basement in the back!
- really boring stuff, except for doctors or smarty pants
Basement
What's down there?
There's a Metal door at the end of the stairs. We'll try to force it open <<dynamicmessage>>
but it'll be hard without any of the right Tools.
Metal Door
We'll try our best to bust that thing open!

Oh my god. Well, the door's open now - but it wasn't locked to hide valuables. There are hospital beds lined up all along the walls here, with a skeleton on each and every one of them. Just lying there, hands folded - looks almost peaceful. In the back of the room there's a skeleton sitting at a desk, a grimy white doctor's coat still on its shoulders and its fingers wrapped around a syringe. Guess they must've chosen death over the fate that awaited them after the incident. We ...could scavenge the bodies, chief, but we won't feel too good about it.
Damn, that door won't budge. Whoever installed and barred this thing must have wanted to make sure no one would ever open it again... <<dynamicmessage>>
D'ya think maybe we ought to come back with the right Tools, chief?

Hey, chief, I followed a few overgrown railroad tracks and found a platform and some old trains. It looks like they keep going underground, too, even though the area has partially caved in. Tell the Expedition they'd better bring along lamps and shovels. Oh yeah, and Masks, too. There's an awful stench in the air here that creeps right up your nose.

We've arrived at the abandoned train station, chief. Wasn't so easy to find. The Scout said we ought to follow the overgrown tracks, but they were covered up by grass so high that they were hard to spot.
The Train Station
Take a look around!

There's nothing interesting lying around here except for a few recyclable signs and benches. But the Scout was right: It smells weird! The smell comes from the stairs going underground. It's a putrid, sweet-smelling stench. <<dynamicmessage>>
Good thing we've equipped ourselves with Masks. Otherwise it'd be unbearable.
To be honest, I'm not so sure if we should go down there without Masks. The smell is really revolting!
The Platform

There's an old schedule hanging here with a map, chief. Can you picture how things used to run back then? Just get on board and ride around. Wherever you want. Oh well, we shouldn't rack our brains over it. Let's get to work and collect as much Scrap as possible! <<dynamicmessage>>
Luckily we have someone along who knows what we can make use of out of all this stuff at home.
That looks good! <<dynamicmessage>> I don't think there's anything else here that's useful.
It's always a pleasure to work with pros!
I think we've pretty much taken everything along that's useful. <<dynamicmessage>>
Only a dyed-in-the-wool Scrap gnome knows what we could do with the stuff lying around here.
The Stairs

We've dug our way down successfully. Except for the nauseating smell, things look totally bizarre down here! The walls and ceiling are covered with a thick layer of mushrooms. That's where the stench comes from. The mushrooms really are everywhere, you can even see the spores flying around in the air! <<dynamicmessage>>
Good thing we're not inhaling that stuff directly!
Hopefully this crap won't make us sick!

A human skeleton is leaning against a wall here. It looks totally psycho, chief! It's completely overgrown with mushrooms, almost as if the mushrooms grew out of it. The guy apparently scribbled something on a pad, too: “What a trip!” He probably wolfed down the 'shrooms to get really high and ended up taking an overdose. We'll take his stuff along with us. And a few of these mushrooms. It's a sure thing they're just fine once they've been properly cooked.

A human skeleton is leaning against a wall here. It looks totally psycho, chief! The guy left behind a note, too: “What a trip!” The bones are so overgrown with mushrooms that they're even growing right out of him! Almost as if they were alive, they're moving and changing colors! Whoa, I feel strange, everything's going round and round. Could it be those damned spores? We'd better get out of here before we end up like that poor guy.

Here's one of your Scouts, chief! Remember those overgrown tracks I was supposed to inspect for you? Looks like they lead to an old train station, not too far away from our settlement. Pack up a few Tools for the Expedition Team to take along. They'll give them a better chance to take apart the remnants. Otherwise there's not much to see here, although it seemed to me as if I'd heard voices coming from the caved-in stairs. Was just my imagination, for sure. It can get pretty darn spooky out here.

Yeah, exactly like the Scout said, there's not much to see here. Did people stand on this weird platform way back when to make it easier to get on the trains? If you could simply get on board and ride away nowadays! Oh well, dream on. We'd be better off getting started with taking things apart, right, chief?
The Train Station
Take a look around first!
Like the Scout said, not much to… Guys, quiet down for a sec! I heard something coming from those stairs!
The Platform
Merely some signs and a few benches… in other words, nothing notable. We'll take everything along that seems useful to us! <<dynamicmessage>>
Should be a piece of cake, thanks to our Tools!
Burrowing around here with bare hands costs a lot of effort!
I think we've taken all the recyclable things with us. At least there was a little Metal, too! <<dynamicmessage>>
With the Tools we had that was no problem either, chief! Otherwise we would've had to leave a few good things where they were!
Well, we were able to dismantle a little bit, better than nothing, but we had to leave all the heavy stuff made of iron where it was. <<dynamicmessage>>
A few Tools might have helped us along.
The Stairs

It sounds like stomping, but now everything's all quiet again. We've cleared away the debris here. Looks like another train station, only it's underground, with lots of empty tunnels and dark passageways - Wait a second, I think I heard something again! Should we go take a look? <<dynamicmessage>>
At least we have experienced veterans along, chief!
Those kinds of Expeditions to dark and deserted places would be better off left to experienced Explorers. But it's your call, chief!

We followed several small footprints into the tunnels<<dynamicmessage>>. There were a few kids scared out of their wits down there! Apparently they were attacked by some stray dogs and their mother defended them. Sad to say, they got separated in the process and have been hiding down here for several days now. They were too frightened to leave their hiding place. We weren't able to find their mother. No idea if something's happened to her. Our Scouts should keep on looking around, but for the time being we'll keep the kids with us!
, without our well-trained eyes we never would've discovered it

Now, some footprints can be seen down here that lead in the direction of the tunnels. We don't have the slightest idea how old they are <<dynamicmessage>>. It's terrifyingly quiet down here. We've called out and the only reply we got was just our own echo. I know that ghosts don't exist, but this place is spooky! Remember our days in the Endzone, when people thought muffled screams could be heard in the Generator Room? Maybe something's lying in wait for us down here. We should get out of here pronto!
, an old veteran would've been able to give us better information

I'm there, chief. The only thing this could deal with is an abandoned military base - fences all around it, barracks, watchtowers and rusty tanks. It might've even made a halfway decent base for us! At any rate, there ought to be a fair share to salvage here. Don't forget to equip the Expedition with Tools and Experts!

Okay, we've arrived at the base. When you take a look around here, what comes to mind is one of the sayings from that old thick tome. How did it go? The preacher from the Endzone always read it out loud to the Children... Right: "Turn swords into plowshares"! With that in mind: Where should we start, chief?
West Side
Take a look around!

There are two barracks here that we can search. Who knows, maybe there's still loads of equipment left behind inside them! Other than that, a few vehicle wrecks and a container are still standing around.  <<dynamicmessage>>
With the Tools we've packed it shouldn't be any problem to strip down the wrecks and open the container!
I'm not sure if we'll get the container open without Tools. And taking the wrecks apart won't be easy, either!
Barracks

The doors stood wide open, chief. Inside it looks as if everyone took off head over heels: the cots are lying every which way, the lockers are open, and Clothing and other stuff are scattered all over the floor. After the catastrophe it's likely that everything plunged into absolute chaos here in no time at all. But maybe we'll still find a few useful things... <<dynamicmessage>>
Luckily we have someone along who knows a thing or two about recycling Scrap. At least then we'll know what's worth taking with us!
But to be really honest, chief - I'd say it all looks like useless junk. If we had someone along who knew the ins and outs of recycling Scrap, then maybe we could sort out the most useful things...

It's all wrapped up, chief! <<dynamicmessage>> Besides finding some Cloth remnants that are still in good shape we took the old cots apart, too. We can put the Metal to good use! A book was hidden in one of the beds: listen to this title! "Deserting Made Easy - With Illustrations and Tips from Experts!"
Thanks to our Expert we've probably rounded up everything that's still recyclable somehow!
Wasn't much there, chief. When everybody headed for the hills they probably took the most valuable things with them. <<dynamicmessage>>
But, as already mentioned: Nearly all of it looks like junk to us. We should've brought someone along who can tell the difference between useless and usable!
Wrecks
No good pickings here, chief - but we'll take a look at those rust buckets! At least we can take along any usable parts. <<dynamicmessage>>
With the right Tools stripping down turns into child's play!
With no suitable Tools stripping down is definitely not going to be easy!

That's wild, even an old tank is standing around here! Hard to imagine that these things were built for the sole purpose of shooting down other human beings... we really have other things to worry about, don't we, chief? In any case: We took everything out of the vehicles that's still usable and wasn't completely rusted out...

That's wild, even an old tank is standing around here! Hard to imagine that these things were built for the sole purpose of shooting down other human beings... we really have other things to worry about, don't we, chief? In any case: Without Tools we sadly weren't able to remove the most usable parts...
Container
According to the symbol on the container there might be protective gear inside. Maybe meant for the soldiers after the catastrophe occurred? The container is sealed, <<dynamicmessage>>
but with our Tools we'll get it open for sure!
and I'm not sure if we'll get it open without Tools!

There you go, the container's open! <<dynamicmessage>> There are crates inside - but apparently all of them already opened and empty. No, wait a second - here's a crate that's still sealed... and there are Masks and Radiation Suits inside! Perfect!
See, it always pays off to set off on Expeditions well prepared!

What a drag - although we did get the container open using brute force, now we've got a dislocated shoulder to deal with! That's what happens when you're on the road, poorly prepared, and then have to hurl yourself against some doors with all your weight! At any rate: There are crates inside - but apparently all of them already opened and empty. No, wait a second - here's a crate that's still sealed... and there are Masks and Radiation Suits inside! Then at least it paid off...
East Side
What does it look like here?

My guess is that there are no good pickings here, chief. Besides the remnants from a few tents, a landing platform and a watchtower, an old hangar is about the most interesting of what's left. <<dynamicmessage>>
Maybe someone with some experience in scouting can spot even more!
If we had someone with some experience in scouting along, it'd probably be considerably easier to comb through this right down to the last corner!
Watchtower
I can't imagine that we'll find anything up there, but the view from up top is worth it for sure. <<dynamicmessage>>
This is clearly a case for our veteran, chief!

It's an amazing view from up here, chief! You can even spot our Expedition Station in the distance! And what's more, we've found something here: Someone hid a small box between two floorboards - probably one of the soldiers who were stationed here. <<dynamicmessage>> And guess what's inside the tiny box? A few Joints wrapped up nice and tidy in airtight foil! Would they still be any good?
Our veteran naturally recognized it right away!

It's an amazing view from up here, chief! You can even spot our settlement's Expedition Station in the distance! Otherwise there's nothing up here - but what the heck, it was worth it anyway! <<dynamicmessage>>
Next time we'll take along one of our veteran Scouts. They might have spotted even more from up here!
Helipad

Hm, this must be a landing platform for those helicopters. I saw them once in a video from the era way back when! Hard to imagine simply climbing aboard a thing like that and then soaring across the skies... On the other hand, sadly there are no good pickings here, chief. All that's left over here are a few crates, but we can pry them open. <<dynamicmessage>>
Of course, that shouldn't pose any problem using our crowbar.
A crowbar would come in handy now - but maybe we can make do without one!
Yup, no problem. Primarily it seems to be some kinds of springs, bolts and stuff like that. Maybe they used to be used to repair those helicopters?

Phew! We're not going to get this crate open with our bare fingers, chief - our fingernails will break off before that happens! If we had a crowbar or something like that it surely wouldn't be any problem...
Hangar

The door was able to be pried open with no further ado, chief! There are shelves full of Metal parts and a half-dismantled helicopter in here. It's a safe bet it won't fly anymore, but what we could do is to strip it down even further! <<dynamicmessage>>
Good thing we packed Tools to take with us...
We would've done better to pack Tools for this, but we'll give it a try without them and see...
It was more complicated than imagined, but in return we were even able to remove a few electronic components without damaging them! <<dynamicmessage>> Hopefully they still work, too...
That would've gone nowhere without suitable Tools!

It was more complicated than expected, chief. We took apart that helicopter as far as we got. Unfortunately we had to use brute force and in the process a few electronic components were broken. With suitable Tools it probably wouldn't have happened, but what's the use....
Tents

These tents are all long since rotten and rusted with nothing left to salvage anymore, except for two of them. There are a few crates and cabinets still standing in those two other tents, the cabinets with small bottles and pillboxes inside. The tents were probably once used as a sickbay. <<dynamicmessage>>
Our doc thinks some of the stuff might still be usable!
On the other hand, my guess would be that the stuff is well beyond its expiration date - but hey, I'm not a doctor!

<<dynamicmessage>> This ought to improve our supplies of Medicine and bandages a bit, chief! It's really not easy to get your hands on that stuff - and without it, even a small injury can quickly turn into a real problem!
Doc realized right away that some of the Medication can't ever really expire!

I don't know, chief. We could take a chance and bring back some sort of pills with us, but who's supposed to serve as guinea pigs afterwards? No, that makes no sense at all. Next time we'd better take one of our docs along with us!

The Building apparently deals with a store, chief. The lettering "My home is my castle" is emblazoned on a sign out front, which had probably been the slogan at the time when things revolved around having your own home. The luxury of decorating our Endzone with all kinds of chic furniture and other objects was naturally something we didn't have. But maybe we'll find sufficient Materials here to turn our settlement into a little castle of our own, too...

OK, we're there. Really looks quite promising! The front entrance seems to have been barricaded - but there's a good chance that meanwhile the Wood is rotten. There's a ladder on the roof, too. We could probably get in from there. But the whole thing doesn't look all too stable anymore! One part of the Building has already caved in... that would probably be the simplest route.
Front entrance
Try it from the front!

The entrance is barricaded. Shortly after the catastrophe they probably closed off access to everything first because they hoped they'd be able to open the store again soon. Not everyone seems to have taken the warnings and news bulletins seriously back then! It's a good thing our ancestors got themselves to a safe place back then right away...
Force the door open
The Wood that was used to barricade the door from outside is already rotten. <<dynamicmessage>> It's a sure thing that the door behind it is locked, but maybe we can pry it open...
That'll be as easy as pie with an axe!
Without any Tools at all that's still going to be a hefty chunk of work!
Haha, it's almost fun chopping these wooden panels into kindling! Although the door was locked, we were still able to pry it open with the axe blade...
That's not going to get us anywhere, chief. We had no problems removing the wooden panels, but the door won't budge an inch! We'd need a crowbar or something like it...
Collapsed Side
Climb over the wall remnants!
Well, there's nothing left to salvage here where the Building caved in except for rubble and weather-beaten Scrap. A corridor leads further inside from here, except that it's half-buried, too...
Buried Corridor
Clearing away all that rubble is going to be anything but easy!  <<dynamicmessage>>
But it should be doable with a shovel...
That's definitely going to take forever without a shovel. Maybe we'd be better off looking for a different route?
That was strenuous work, but now enough rubble has been moved aside that we can get inside! <<dynamicmessage>>
At least we had a shovel with us, otherwise we'd probably never have gotten it done...
That's not going to work, chief. <<dynamicmessage>> Doing it this way we'll still be at it next week! Maybe we'd be better off trying it via a different route...
If we at least had a shovel on hand!
Roof
Climb up onto the roof!

Okay, chief. From here I can spot a door to the top of the stairwell on the roof. From there we can get directly into the upper floor and down to the ground floor below. The ladder on the roof still looks stable, too - let's hope the roof is as well!
Across the Roof
Well, let's hope for the best - it creaks and crunches here with every step you take!<<dynamicmessage>>
The roof still ought to be able to bear our weight is what Ms. Builder says! At least it should if we cross it one by one and stay away from the point where it caved in...
Whether the roof can still bear our weight seems questionable to me. Judging that is more for someone who knows the ins and outs of the building trade!
Phew! I had to hold my breath for a second when my foot broke through - but nothing's happened! <<dynamicmessage>>
Good thing we didn't all tromp across the roof right behind each other!
Damn! The roof gave way underneath me and I landed on the floor below. <<dynamicmessage>> Luckily the fall wasn't too far down, but I think I sprained my ankle...
If we'll be hopping around on rooftops in the future, we ought to take someone along who's able to assess their stability, too!
Upper Floor
Take a look around!

Well, at any rate we're all on the upper floor now, chief. The whole area here is filled with tables, chairs and comfy couches! Something like this would've gone down well back then in the Endzone instead of the sparse furnishings in the canteen...
To the Ground Floor
The stairs probably collapsed together with the caved-in side of the Building, chief. We could try to cautiously climb down - <<dynamicmessage>> but we won't be coming back up via that route anymore!
but we do have some Cloth with us. We can knot it into a rope...
but it's a sure thing that falling down in the process is going to hurt! If we only had some Cloth with us to knot it into a rope.
Okay, we've climbed down! <<dynamicmessage>>
Wasn't too hard at all thanks to the rope!

Jeez! A broken-off landing gave way while climbing down the stairs, and one of us fell as a result! The few scrapes and scratches are no big deal, but it looks like the leg might be broken... although we've all made it down now, we really ought to be better prepared when we set off, chief!
Furniture Showroom
Well, naturally we can't use all this furniture as is, but it'll turn into some first-rate construction Material! <<dynamicmessage>>
We have axes and saws with us, so we can neatly cut it all down to size for the way back!
With no axes or saws we'll only be able to take along the smaller pieces of furniture - we'd hardly be able to drag a whole wall unit of cabinets all the way to the settlement!
So, that turned out to be a tough piece of work, but now we can save ourselves the trouble of chopping down Trees in the near future! All that remains is to lug it back to the settlement...
Good, we've rounded up what we really can actually carry! Even though it's far from everything that could be scavenged here, without the right kinds of Tools that's about all we can do...
Ground Floor
Search everywhere!

The store's already been thoroughly cleaned out, chief! After the catastrophe it's likely that people climbed in to do some looting, probably through the side entrance to the Building that's now caved in. Oh well, it's a sure bet we'll still find something once we look around!
Office
The door to the offices has already been forced open! All that can be seen here are cabinets filled with files and a few old computers and printers. <<dynamicmessage>>
Although, there should still be functioning components among them that we can remove - good thing our Teacher taught us something about Electronics!
Are they still good for anything? One of our bright minds would probably be in a better position to judge that. But we could simply take a few things along at random...
So, the circuit boards still ought to be recyclable, the same goes for the power adapters. We've removed the usable parts, the housings can stay here - then what we have to lug won't be so heavy!
Good, we'll lug two of the computers back with us. Somebody in the settlement should take a closer look at them!
Store Shelves
Although it's apparently been looted here, there's still stuff to salvage, chief - and it's all simply standing around on the shelves! This is nothing short of paradise!
Fantastic! We've rounded up practically everything we can put to good use: Tools, hardware, building materials, fabrics ... That was really worthwhile, chief!
Upper Floor

You can't really call that a stairs going up anymore, chief. It probably collapsed together with the side of the Building that caved in. I can't picture us being able to climb up there - the only way left for us is the route across the roof!

Ouch! I made it halfway up, but then I lost my footing on a ledge. That's going to give me a few unsightly black-and-blue marks and bruises! We did say it won't get us anywhere - you could've listened to us from the start, chief!

That is one big Building, chief! There's a symbol emblazoned on the front side. Looks like a roof with a dot above or an open triangle. Must deal with some corporation's logo - back then people probably recognized it right away. At any rate, this appears to be the remnants of a factory: chimneys, machinery, Depots... but no indication of what was produced here! Nevertheless, a little excursion to come here is surely worth it if a few technology pros with appropriate Tools come along!

We've arrived, chief! It doesn't look as if everything's already been looted here - after the catastrophe people probably weren't able to do a thing with the machinery at first. <<dynamicmessage>> Where do we start, chief?
Our technician's already rubbing his hands with glee!
Let's hope we'll be better off without our technology pros!
Factory
Find a way inside!

The Building has caved in on one side - we should probably be able to get in and look around without any problems. And there's a door at the rear of the Building! But there's also a ladder leading up to the roof here, and on the roof there's a door to get inside the factory. <<dynamicmessage>>
Climbing up shouldn't be too difficult for us - we're all still young!
But not all of us are what you'd call youngsters anymore, and the climb up is definitely going to be strenuous!
Collapsed Side

We climbed up over the remnants of the collapsed wall. But we won't get any further here, the way inside is blocked by rubble. What we can do is to take a look at the boiler tanks standing here! <<dynamicmessage>>
With the right Tools and some time we can take them apart and recycle them!
We probably won't be able to take them apart for recycling without the proper Tools...

The fact is, that really was <<dynamicmessage>> a tough piece of work, chief - and if we had weeks of time it's a good bet we'd be able to recycle even more! As it is, at least we've taken one of the boiler tanks apart. We can put the Metal to good use!
despite our Tools
No can do, chief. We'd be busy for weeks before we'd finish taking this boiler tank system <<dynamicmessage>> apart!
without Tools
Door
Hm, locked! That was to be expected - <<dynamicmessage>>
but up till now not one rusted door has stood up to our crowbar!
but why don't we see if we can get the door open even without Tools!
It took a while, but eventually the door gave way! <<dynamicmessage>> Not much to see in here: empty crates, a few old wooden pallets... and a door that probably leads to the big production hall!
With pure muscle power we wouldn't have gotten anywhere!
Whoa! The door must be barricaded from the inside or specially reinforced! At any rate, without a crowbar or other Tools we're not going to make progress here...
Roof
Alrighty, we're getting in via the roof! These rusted ladders don't look very stable - we ought to watch out where we step!  <<dynamicmessage>>

We'd be better off taking two rungs at once if the ladder's too unstable!
With some of the rungs it's probably better not to step on them and pull yourself up instead. For anyone who's older, hopefully they can do it, too!

Great, we're up there! A few rungs on the ladder broke off, but nothing happened to anyone <<dynamicmessage>>! The door up here on the roof isn't locked. That saves us the trouble of investing more effort...
- good thing we've all still got plenty of power in our arms and are able to hold on tight

We're up there! A few rungs on the ladder broke off. Someone fell almost two meters as a result and injured their legs! <<dynamicmessage>> Luckily we were able to hoist them up by the arms to us. At least the door up here isn't locked...
We shouldn't take any older people along for these kinds of dangerous activities - at least the younger ones among us don't get injured right away when we fall!
Production Hall
Keep going!

We're standing in the middle of the production hall now, chief. Probably no one's been here anymore since the catastrophe - the dust is centimeter-thick on the conveyor belts, the machinery and the floor. What should we take a closer look at?
Assembly Lines

The conveyor belts for the assembly lines take up the greater part of the hall - hard to believe that people used to spend the greater part of their lives here.
