The same movements day in, day out so that some corporation can rake in the profits. As for me, it's no contest that I prefer our Community where we share and share alike! Well, at any rate we can dismantle the belts. <<dynamicmessage>>
It's probably going to take a while, but at least we have the proper Tools with us!
But without Tools it's likely that we're not going to be able to get it all apart!
All done, chief! <<dynamicmessage>> There's going to be an awful lot to lug around, but we can definitely put the parts to good use in the settlement!
What luck that we had Tools with us!
All done, chief! We took apart what we could. It's not all of it, but that's all we can do<<dynamicmessage>>. The point is, all these parts have to be lugged back, too!
without Tools
Machinery

You could say that's one monster of a machine, chief! <<dynamicmessage>> There's no way we could move the machine away from here - the best option would probably be if we removed the most valuable parts.
Good thing our hotshot techie is along - otherwise it probably never would've occurred to us that apparently components for air filtration systems were manufactured here!
No idea what was once produced with this machine. One of our hotshot techies might've been able to help us out there!

Without our technician we'd truly be up the creek without a paddle, chief! But this way we were able to remove the most usable components. It took quite a while but it should pay off - and in the meantime we learned something, too!

Admittedly, at the sight of all these pipes, levers and components I can't say which of them are valuable to us. If we only had someone along who knows their way around technology! Maybe we ought to come back again...
Control Room

There's a small control room halfway up the stairs to the roof, chief. Apparently the machinery was controlled from there... a few of the fixtures and computers might still be able to be recycled! <<dynamicmessage>>
Luckily we've had educational training and can recognize what's usable for us!
But not one of us has really been properly trained, so it's hard to say which of this stuff could still be usable to us.
<<dynamicmessage>> I think we must've removed the most usable parts... we're eager to hear what you intend to do with them, chief!
Basically it's all pretty easy to understand if you've ever occupied your time with electronic component assembly!
Gee, we simply got going by removing all sorts of fixtures and scooping up all the cables and parts. Let's hope there's something usable among them!
Depot
Take a look at that hall!

Luckily the Storage Depot is still intact. Raw materials for the factory were probably kept here. There are containers standing next to the Building, too. They look interesting. What should we take a look at first, chief?
Depot

Would you look at that - the gateway to the hall wasn't locked. All it took was a little bit of muscle and it could be pushed open! Crates are stacked up in here, all emblazoned with "EXPORT PROHIBITED - SOLELY FOR NATIONAL USE" in thick red letters. The crates are wrapped in plastic and nailed shut - <<dynamicmessage>>
but with our Tools we won't have any problems opening them.
with a little bit of brute force maybe we can open them even without Tools!

We've opened up a few of the crates, chief- <<dynamicmessage>>they're all filled to the brim with Cloth Masks! The most you can cover with them are your nose and mouth, and they don't look too durable, either - they probably won't help us a bit, but we can make use of the Cloth. They were probably produced and hoarded during the major pandemic back then instead of distributing them to countries where they were needed. These days we'd hardly be able to survive if the name of the game was "every man for himself", right, chief?
a piece of cake with our crowbar -
Ouch! We won't get anywhere with bare hands, chief. There's nothing to be gained here without a crowbar or something like one except for splinters.
Container
There are also a few containers standing outside the hall with that logo on the side. Maybe there's still something inside them? <<dynamicmessage>>
It won't be any problem to pry the containers open with our crowbar!
Let's see if we can get the containers open - not such an easy venture with no Tools at all...
There you go, open in a jiffy! But damn it, every one of the containers is empty - there are just a few wooden pallets lying inside. Apparently they never got around to loading them back then...
Phew, no chance, chief! We can hurl ourselves against them as much as we want: the containers are bolted shut... We'd have to come back again with a crowbar or other Tools!

Hey, chief, it's one of the Scouts on the line. I ran into the Ruin of a restaurant out here - the way the sign at the entrance looks, they probably served fast food. Maybe you still remember, chief, the elders from the Endzone had spoken about them: hamburgers and French-fried potatoes, greasy, salty, unhealthy - but damn delicious! One side of the Building has already caved in, so getting in there won't pose any problem. The business was probably already looted after the catastrophe, but maybe something usable will still turn up... It'd be best if you sent veteran Scrap Collectors along. They'll know best what can still be made use of!

We're ready to get started! As the Scout already mentioned: We can simply enter the Building via the caved-in side. But why in blazes people used to have to pay for Food in businesses like this one is beyond me. Just imagine if we had to haggle with each other over Food, chief!
Restaurant
What does it look like inside?
Faded signs are still hanging everywhere on the walls here - "Keep Your Social Distance!", "Disinfect Hands" and "Wear Nose & Mouth Protection!" What was that all about?
Service Counter

Hm, the cash registers here were apparently broken into when the business was looted back then. But so what? We can't do a thing with money, anyway. But the electronic cash registers, now that's a different story! <<dynamicmessage>>
We've got some bright minds along who can remove the electronic components without breaking anything!
Then let's take those cash registers apart - hopefully nothing will get broken in the process! Actually we'd need a few of our bright minds here for a job like this.
All set, we've taken the cash registers apart. <<dynamicmessage>> It's a sure thing that something can be done with the parts at home!
We were very careful while handling the sensitive components!
All set, we've taken the cash registers apart. We accidentally broke a few circuit boards in the process, but the remaining parts should still be okay!
Cold Storage Room

Apparently Food used to be stored here - of course, in the meantime it's all certainly been looted or rotted away! But we can take a look inside anyway. Maybe there's still some non-perishable synthetic Food. <<dynamicmessage>>
On the basis of the ingredients, our Researchers ought to be able to detect whether it can still be eaten or not.
Maybe we ought to let a Researcher look over the ingredients.

Everything empty or already disintegrated into dust! All that's left are a few shrink-wrapped sacks. Listen to this label, chief: "MUELLERS A-1 MEAT SUBSTITUTE POWDER - TASTES LIKE THE REAL THING! NOW WITH 10% LESS SAWDUST!" Did the people back then know what kinds of things they were stuffing themselves with? According to the list of ingredients, our Researcher says that so many long-lasting chemical preservatives were mixed into the powder that it should still be edible. Definitely not an appetizing prospect, but it might help us get through hard times!

Everything empty or already disintegrated into dust! All that's left are a few shrink-wrapped sacks. Listen to this label, chief: "MUELLERS A-1 MEAT SUBSTITUTE POWDER - TASTES LIKE THE REAL THING! NOW WITH 10% LESS SAWDUST!" Did the people back then know what kinds of things they were stuffing themselves with? At any rate, all those ingredients don't mean beans to me. We're better off leaving it here.
Kitchen
Naturally there's no Food here anymore - we would've been surprised if there was! But we can take the kitchen appliances apart and recycle them. <<dynamicmessage>>
We have Experts along who know what's still recyclable!
Although we don't have anyone along who knows the ins and outs of recycling Scrap, we'll simply take anything that still looks more or less okay with us!
That's over and done with! <<dynamicmessage>> We were able to remove a few electronic and metallic components, and besides them some Scrap to recycle, too.
Child's play thanks to our Experts!
That's over and done with! We were able to remove a few metallic components and some Scrap to recycle. The rest doesn't look as if it's still usable...
Seating Area
The whole area is full of knocked-over tables and chairs. Most of it is junk, but some of it may still be recyclable!
So, that seems to be just about everything we could put to use - at any rate, there's some Plastic among it, too! We don't have to worry about leaving the rest behind...

Hey, chief - there's an old apartment house standing around out here. Looks pretty much like the other houses, too, but a message was written in white paint on the roof: "Three Survivors, Help!". The paint is already old and faded, but it might be worth taking a closer look at the house, okay?

We're there - the message can't be seen at all from down here... Why would they have written it on the roof back then? Maybe they actually thought they'd be rescued. Whatever, we'll take a look around inside...
Main Entrances
Try the main entrances!
Ready to roll. We can give the front door or the back door a try.  <<dynamicmessage>>
We've got Tools with us - up till now we've gotten in everywhere with them!
Hopefully the doors aren't locked. Locked-up doors aren't always easy to open without any Tools!
Back Door
The door is locked. <<dynamicmessage>>
But that's no problem. With the crowbar we'll have it open in a jiffy!
A crowbar would be useful right now, but we'll just give it a try using brute force!
<<dynamicmessage>> the door didn't hold up for long!
Thanks to the crowbar,
Ouch! We were able to kick the door open, but I sprained my ankle in the process...
Front Door
Looks fairly sturdy for a wooden door! <<dynamicmessage>>
But with our axe we'll have it open in a jiffy!
We could make short work of the door with an axe! But we'll give it a try with bare hands...
So, we took care of that - the door's open! <<dynamicmessage>>
Easy as pie with an axe!
Nothing doing, chief. We won't get the door open with bare hands. May we ought to give the back door a try?
Floors
Search every floor!
We ought to be able to get into every floor from the stairwell. The dust is inch-thick on the stairs here - no one else has been here for ages...
First Floor

All the apartments on this floor seem to have been cleared out. The Inhabitants probably packed up their belongings and abandoned their apartments to find a place to survive. We'll take a look around<<dynamicmessage>>
, maybe we'll still find something useful! We have a genuine Marco Polo with us!
, but I don't think we'll still find anything useful. Somebody would've had to come along who's a real expert when it comes to exploring!

Oh well, better than nothing - a few pieces of old Clothing and old Cloth, empty cans of Food, some Scrap. One second, there's still something left here: a box full of books! <<dynamicmessage>> Looks like teaching materials - like the old out-of-print exercise books we had in the Endzone. We can put this to good use for our School!
Our Expert discovered them under a pile of junk!
Oh well, better than nothing - a few pieces of old Clothing and old Cloth, empty cans of Food, some Scrap... <<dynamicmessage>>
Next time we'd better take one of our Experts along! At any rate they know where it's worth taking a closer look...
Second Floor
It's all as good as cleared out here, chief. But we did discover a small safe in one apartment! <<dynamicmessage>>
We might be able to get it open with our Tools!
But it's not likely that we'll get it open without any Tools...

Phew, that was no piece of cake - but thanks to the right amount of force along with a hammer and chisel we were able to chisel out the lock! Hey, wait a sec - the only thing in here is a damn note. Listen to this, chief: "PUBLIC ADDRESS", "PRIVATE KEY" and some sequences of numbers and letters... what the blazes is that supposed to be?
Phew, nothing doing! We'll bite our teeth out on that safe with no Tools, chief. That thing seems to be built to last...
Third Floor

Looks like the Inhabitants set up a little cache of supplies up here to survive! There's canned Food, mattresses, blankets, Medicine ... The Food's probably not all edible anymore, but we'll give the supplies the once-over!

We were just in the process of compiling the last useful things when we came upon something odd, chief. One of the bedrooms is scribbled from top to bottom with phrases like "There's no hope in the north!" or "Rescue's on its way!" There's an impresssion shaped like a human body on a mattress on the floor. Not a pretty sight, the remains have probably decayed into dust. But at least that explains what happened to one of the survivors. Did the others find a refuge up north?

Found the Ruin, chief. It's... it's an old church sprayed with graffiti. When all is said and done, faith didn't protect us against what lies ahead of us, either. But when I look at this Building I can't say that I don't understand why people pray. Even though it's fallen apart, it stil looks very impressive.

We made it, chief. So that's what the Buildings looked like where the ancients worshipped God. Don't know if we'll find much here - but hey, have faith and all that, right? Where should we start, chief?
Main Gateway
Can you get in there?
The gateway to the church seems to have been made to last an eternity. Very thick Wood. <<dynamicmessage>>
But it shouldn't be any problem to open the gateway with the Tools. Though it's a pity about the lovely workmanship.
We'll give it a try, chief, but it's going to be tough to pry the gates open without Tools. Hopefully it'll be worth it.
Church Door

Although the door is weather-beaten you can still see the ornaments and old embellishments, the finely crafted Metal parts covered with ancient religious symbols. We'll try to get the door open, <<dynamicmessage>>
luckily we remembered to bring Tools which will make the work easier!
unfortunately we don't have any Tools with us to make the work easier!

So, whaddaya say to that! We've opened the door, chief, and actually managed to destroy a lot less than I'd thought. Plenty of creaking and grating, but the door slid open all the same. <<dynamicmessage>>
That's why we always take along the right Tools for stuff like that, yeah!
Umph, nothing doing, chief. The door won't budge an inch. Damn! <<dynamicmessage>>
If we'd had Tools with us it certainly wouldn't have been a problem.
Nave
What does it look like inside?

The vestibule entrance area is a small room all by itself with stairs to the galleries. At the same time the vestibule leads to the prayer hall and the shrine located behind it. Despite the destruction it's all still pretty impressive.
Prayer Hall

Man, that's one mighty echo here, even though rubble can be seen everywhere, a few holes, too. Must be heavy duty to sing in here. Whatever, let's see what we find here. At any rate there's a skeleton or two lying around here. Apparently some of them prayed here right up to the end... Let's see if we find anything useful. <<dynamicmessage>>
Luckily we have someone along who knows what's valuable. Or is that what people mean by a small miracle?
On the other hand, we can't really tell the difference between what's useful here and what's not. I knew we should've taken someone along who knows the ropes.

Ha! Not bad at all. We were able to reduce the benches to kindling and the organ above was still in such good shape that we could salvage some Metal out of it! But even so I still got this kind of queasy feeling. A bible lay open near one of the skeletons. Only a few sentences were still legible on the page: "The fourth angel poured out his vial upon the sun; and power was given unto him to scorch men with fire. And men were scorched with great heat."
Sorry, chief, the pickings were pretty sad there. We reduced the benches to kindling, but that was it. Damn!... Oh, maybe I shouldn't swear here...
Shrine

There's a stately shrine in the back of the church, chief. Apparently there was some looting here: the panels and trim are partially torn away and stones were knocked out. Maybe they were searching for something valuable... and probably found it, too. We'll take a look around and grab what we find.

Chief! We were not only able to secure various quantities of Cloth, we also found a compartment underneath the shrine that was stuffed full of medical goods. Whoever did the preaching took protecting their flock seriously.
Absolutely nothing to salvage here except a little Cloth. It wasn't worth it, chief. But hey, you can't strike it rich all the time, right?
Side Door
What have you found?
This entrance looks less promising than the main gateway, but who knows, it could've been the access to the priest's living quarters. We'll know more once we get inside.
Priest's Living Quarters
We're going through the apartment. It all looks pretty frugal. Either someone was already here, or whoever lived here didn't have much to begin with. We'll see. <<dynamicmessage>>
Luckily we have someone along who knows precisely what they have to look for. We'll manage to salvage stuff here that can be put to good use.

That was more successful than I thought. Some Medicine, Cloth from bed sheets and the like, Wood from chairs and benches, and we even found several Class 1 filters in the back room. And the priest himself, apparently. At least a skeleton with a revolver in the hand and a cassock. Rest in peace.
The apartment was a washout. No pickings at all. All we found was a skeleton in a priest's outfit together with a revolver. Guess he opted for a quick death...shit.
Small Chapel

An inconspicuous door led us into a small chapel that the priest probably used for praying in private. The windows are made out of that typical glass in churches we still know from photos. In the middle there's a statue of an angel...or Mary, I'm not sure. We'll take a look around.
A switch made it possible to get a kind of internal Cistern going. The Water was fresh and not contaminated…how is that possible?! <<dynamicmessage>>
If we didn't have the Wellkeeper along with us we wouldn't have noticed the mechanism for opening the Cistern. What a stroke of luck! Or maybe divine intervention?

Nothing to salvage here, chief. And besides that, it was pretty creepy searching for Resources under the eyes of that damned statue. Was probably a Well once upon a time. Whatever, there's nothing flowing here anymore now.

Looks like an old gas station. Even after all these years, there's still a smell of gasoline hanging in the air... At any rate, there are still two Buildings here where something still might be found, chief. It'd be best if you send someone along who knows their way around Technology!

Okay, we're there. The Scout was right - near the gas pumps it still really reeks of gasoline. Maybe some valve sprung a leak and the vapors from the underground fuel tank are rising. We'd be better off not to light up a Campfire here!
Gas Station
Take a look around!

As for the two Buildings the Scout mentioned, they apparently deal with a car wash and a repair workshop for cars - at least that's what it says on the signs above the garage doors. We ought to take a closer look at the old gas pumps. Maybe something can still be recycled!
Car Wash
The door is locked, but the sliding doors don't look very sturdy. With a little bit of force we should be able to pry them open! <<dynamicmessage>>
One of the youngsters ought to try their hand!
Admittedly, we're slowly getting too old for feats of strength like that, chief...
And that was that! <<dynamicmessage>>We were able to jack the sliding door up a bit and wedge it. Sadly, the pickings weren't too good inside - a few hoses and tubes, Tools and other odds and ends...
No problem at all for young folks with power in their arms!

Ouch! We were able to jack the sliding door up a bit and wedge it, but I strained my back in the process. You know how it is with getting old, chief... Oh well, at any rate we found a few hoses and tubes, Tools and other odds and ends inside!
Repair Workshop

Couldn't get the sliding door to the garage open, but we were able to get into the repair workshop through the front section of the Building. A small car is propped up here. Unlike the wrecks outside in the wilderness, this one still looks like it's in very good shape. Enough Tools are lying around here, so let's get to work on stripping it!

That was one tough piece of work, but it was worth it! We just about took the whole car apart - it's a sure thing we can recycle most of the stuff! The only thing we'll leave here is the engine block. It's simply too damn heavy to carry...
We were able to take a little bit apart, but with the more complex things we simply don't have the know-how. Maybe we ought to take an Expert along next time.
Gas Pumps
Naturally we can't do a thing with the gas pumps in one piece, but maybe we can strip them down into parts. There's even supposed to be Electronics built in! <<dynamicmessage>>
It's a safe bet our Technician can handle that without her destroying the sensitive Electronics!
Although we don't have the slightest idea of Technology like that, there's no reason why it should be that hard...
Alrighty! Our Technician carefully detached the sensitive components - and she didn't break a thing. I probably wouldn't have managed to do it!

Unfortunately, while prying the housing open we've apparently destroyed some of the circuit boards, too - this electronic stuff really does have to be handled with kid gloves. Oh well, next time we'll take along one of our lady Technicians for a job like that!

Hey, chief, there's a Ruin of a Hospital out here - that is, if you can give any credence to the eroding letters and the green cross above the entrance. One part of the Building has already collapsed and probably been long since looted here... But if I were you, I'd still send an Expedition! It's a sure thing there'll still be something left to salvage!

That's wild - such a huge Building to help sick people. How many could be treated here at the same time? When I think back and remember the little medical ward in the Endzone with no more than 5 beds...
Main Entrance
How does it look at the entrance?

All it took was one strong kick to open the door to the entrance; we're standing in the lobby now. Looks pretty desolate here - the Scout was probably right with his assumption that looting already occurred here after the catastrophe. At any rate, we can get to the upper floors from here via the stairwell or farther inside the Hospital via the main hallway.
Main Hallway
The hallway leads farther inside the Hospital. The odds might be very good that it hasn't all been looted there yet!
All set, we've headed farther inside the Hospital. Though it is kind of creepy here - footsteps produce a mighty echo along the hallway!
First Floor

According to the signs, two medical wards are located on this floor - unfortunately, there's not much left of one of them because that part of the Building collapsed. All that's left in the other ward are basically beds and a few old computers; most of what was here has apparently already been looted. <<dynamicmessage>>
But our Scrap Collector is certain: She says we can still reutilize all of it!
Maybe we should've taken one of the lady Scrap Collectors along to be able to tell the difference between what's usable and unusable!
So, that's done. It's going to be a major haul to get all this back to the settlement, but at least it was worth it!
So, that's done. Guess that was everything we could make use of in the settlement somehow - but I'm not sure of it!
Second Floor

Half of this floor has collapsed, chief. All there is on the other side is a medical ward that's already been pretty much cleaned out. Hey, in the storeroom here there's a whole shelf full of bed curtains made of Plastic! <<dynamicmessage>>
Our Tailor's already rubbing his hands with glee because it can be turned into first-rate Protective Clothing!
Would one of our Tailors in the settlement be able to do anything with that?

We've packed up the curtains and took apart a few of the beds to boot. What's more, we've hauled together other stuff that could still be reused somehow. Which means it's truly been cleaned out up here now!

We've packed up a few of the curtains because you never know. What's more, we've hauled together other stuff that could still be reused somehow. Which means the ward up here ought to be considered emptied out now…
Junction
Where are you now?
We're at a junction. Two more hallways lead away from here. There are signs on the wall: SURGERY, NUCLEAR MEDICINE and ADMINISTRATION. Which way should we go?
Surgery

These operating rooms must've been well equipped in the past - even operations on open hearts were able to be performed there! With our limited means, all we can do is dream of that nowadays; an infected wound can readily turn into a lethal problem...

Okay, we've combed through all the rooms and still found some antiseptics for wounds, bandages and a few Medications that hopefully still work. But the survivors apparently already helped themselves to what was here after the catastrophe!
Nuclear Medicine

I've read about that - At nuclear medical wards diagnosis and therapy were performed with the help of radioactivity. Hard to believe that radioactivity can be something positive, too, isn't it? <<dynamicmessage>>
Oh well, at any rate, as for our Technician, she thinks there has to be high-quality electronic equipment there!
There's probably some valuable pieces of equipment here - if we manage to take them apart!
I've never seen such complex gadgetry before! Taking it apart wasn't easy without damaging all the Electronics, but <<dynamicmessage>> we got it done.
with the help of our Technician lady
I've never seen such complex gadgetry before! Without someone who has a better grip on this stuff, we'd be better off not playing around with it.
Administration
My guess is that we won't find anything other than cabinets full of files. But we'll take a closer look around! <<dynamicmessage>>
Maybe we'll find a few medical textbooks, too. Ones that help us further in the settlement!
Of course, we could also use all this paper for our Campfire...

Wonderful! Without medical training you would've hardly realized that the stack of files deals with a study on the treatment of disinfecting wounds via commonplace natural remedies! We ought to take a closer look at that and draw our own conclusions. Oh, and we've hauled together a bit of other stuff, too!

Oh well, we've hauled together a little bit of stuff, but as expected: nothing other than files, files, and more files. I'll take one with me. At least it'll make good tinder to ignite the Campfire at the settlement!

Hey, chief, it's your favorite Scout. I came across the Ruin of an old Storage Depot on my foray out here. More or less caved in, but there still ought to be some Scrap to salvage! I just spotted something: There are two sealed containers standing behind the Ruin that probably haven't been looted yet...

Compared to the other Ruins this one's pretty much a wreck - the whole Depot will probably collapse the next time a severe storm comes along! Watch out that none of those metal struts falls on your heads! We could've put some thought into protective gear. But who would think you'd need helmets after the world had come to an end?
Storage Depot
What's it look like inside the Depot?
Well, seems like the Scouts assessed the situation correctly - there's apparently not much to salvage here except Scrap. But maybe there's a surprise waiting inside the containers!
Storage Depot
Not much to see here. Apart from lots of rotten Wood and rusty Metal bars, the most interesting thing is a forklift whose best days have long since come and gone...

Hey, hard to believe! Somebody actually hid a few bottles of booze in the little office: "MEIER'S HIGH-OCTANE - 80 PERCENT & RARIN' TO GO!" - Think the stuff is still any good? If it's the alcohol content that's meant on the label, then it's hardly able to go bad - smells like pure alcohol, too! Just the right thing for long nights by the Campfire...
Gee, that about sums it up for anything that's still usable somehow...
First Container
The latch for opening the container was pretty rusty, but a little force got it open. Guess no one thought it was necessary to attach an extra lock...

Oh well, no wonder - the only things in here are cases filled with black powder. One second! Our Charcoal Burner here says it's probably the pulverized Coal that's used to produce compressed Coal briquettes! Good thing we have him along - it never would've crossed my mind, not for the life of me...

Oh well, no wonder - the only things in here are cases filled with black powder. It was probably shipped somewhere for further processing. Well, at any rate, I don't have any idea what we could do with it...
Second Container
The container is sealed, but we'll get it open <<dynamicmessage>>!
with the crowbar we brought along. Sure thing
, maybe even without a crowbar

Child's play! The container is filled with crates. Want to guess what's inside the crates, chief? Stuffed toys! The only place I've seen animals like that until now was in old books! Lions, polar bears, seals, elephants... we'll take a few with us, our littlest ones will surely get a big kick out of them!
Nothing doing, chief. The container and lock are sturdy and built to last. Force alone won't get us anywhere with them...

Found the Ruin, chief. It's a Church - sprayed with layers upon layers of graffiti! Listen to this: "WHERE ARE YOU", or "WE HAD A DEAL". It must've been hard for religious folks during the last days... Oh well, maybe they truly are in a better place now, while we live in the dirt.

Pretty run-down, but it's still an impressive Church! People probably gathered here after the catastrophe and wrangled with their fates and God and the world. That is, if you give any credence to what's written... "Day of Reckoning" - I've heard that before, but where?
Church
What do you see?
Think we've got two options, chief: comb the surrounding area or try to get into the Church.
Church Portal
Hm, the portal was barricaded. Aren't the doors to a church supposed to be open to everyone at all times? Oh well, at any rate we won't get them open so easily. <<dynamicmessage>>
But with some hands-on know-how something will definitely occur to us.
The most we could do is to try brute force.
We're inside, chief! <<dynamicmessage>>
Hard to believe that it really worked using that elongated lever.
Nothing doing, chief. That door must be ancient by now, but it's still incredibly sturdy. "LET THE LITTLE CHILDREN COME TO ME" - isn't that what it says on the church tower up there? We'd love to...
Church Nave
What does it look like inside?

The rear part of the church's nave has caved in and buried the altar beneath it. In the center of the space the floor is discolored with soot and benches are arranged all around. It seems like the survivors probably sat near the fire and held out...
Collapsed Altar
We were able to clear away the rubble of what was the altar, maybe we'll still find something among all the debris. At least a little construction material still ought to be in this for us...

That was one piece of hard work. Unfortunately, the altar was completely destroyed by the roof caving in. Don't think it's worth it to keep on combing through the rubble here... Hold on a sec: What the blazes is that? Hard to believe, chief! There's a crucifix edged in gold and a bible in a fantastically crafted binding here, and both of them are absolutely intact! It's nothing short of a miracle that nothing was damaged by the rubble...
That was one piece of hard work. Unfortunately, the altar was completely destroyed by the roof caving in. Don't think it's worth it to keep on combing through the rubble here......
Wooden Benches
The wooden benches are made out of solid, sturdy Wood - and no one here needs them anymore. They'd make some good building Wood for our settlement…
Good, that's it for the benches - the Wood is stacked and can be transported back to the settlement...
Surroundings

There are some graves here with weather-beaten, illegible tombstones. We could dig up the graves - sometimes valuable things were buried with the dead. But we don't exactly feel good about doing it. <<dynamicmessage>>
However, we have someone along who's not bothered by the prospect. He digs our graves, too...
Isn't there someone from the settlement for this kind of work who has no problem with it?

The gravedigger's getting to work, but all we'll do is watch. Hey, apparently someone had themselves buried together with old game consoles - probably didn't want to go without them in the great beyond. "SEGA DREAMCAST" - never heard of it... Oh well, hopefully you're happy now, chief. Taking away a dead person's final resting place and their toy for a few electronic parts...
No way, not with us, chief. Despite everything, there are certain limits - if you're absolutely dead set on having these graves dug up, then you'll have to send a gravedigger here!

Hey, chief... I wasn't aware that we're so close to the coordinate, but one of the other Endzones is here. Looks like it's taken a pretty good beating, but I didn't want to risk getting any closer, either. You think maybe we could send an Expedition team there? I'll show the team the way when I get back.
We've arrived, chief. Looks like our facility. We've checked the Power supply and the elevator can still be operated.
Elevator
Where do we go from here?

Well, apparently all the elevator buttons can be pressed. At least they're all lit up. But nothing happens except for the button for the first floor. According to the display, the Hydroponics Station is supposed to be located there.
1st Floor
The button says that the Hydroponics Station is located on this floor. Our Food was grown there at our facility. I'm eager to see what we'll find there.
The elevator's moving! Creaking and grating as if it hadn't been used anymore for a long time, but it works!
Hydroponics
What does it look like down there?

Damn it, chief! The elevator's stopped and all of a sudden we're standing in water up to our ankles! Pieces of skeletons and other objects are floating here and there in the water - what the blazes happened here?!  The way it looks we can get into the main hall where the plants were kept and watered. Or we'll take a look around the machine room where the pumps are supposed to be, too.
Main Hall

In a nutshell: Everything's under water here. Some of the Plants still seem to be alive, but otherwise everything here is all moldy and permeated with moisture, even when it's not directly standing in water. It's not very pleasant here and we're poorly equipped for something like this, but we'll see what we can fish out of the water, chief.
Okay, chief, there's nothing I'd call the least bit pleasant here, but we were able to rescue some Plants. What's more, there are some rare Plants among them that have medicinal benefits.

Not a chance, chief. The things are either soggy or long since covered with mold. Nothing to salvage here anymore. Guess this Endzone was literally the end for the people seeking shelter here. Damn it!
Machine Room

Chief, we've found the defect. Apparently there was a malfunction in the pump systems. Instead of evenly distributing all the Water that had been stored to safeguard the survival of the people here, it all got pumped up here. The pump units broke down in the process and immersed everything under water from this level down. The people must've drowned a miserable death... we want to at least take a look if we can dismantle the pumps.

Not much to salvage here, chief, but we were able to take apart some of the machinery, despite the state it was in. In any case, I'm afraid we don't stand a chance of pumping the water out of here anymore. We'd be better off just getting out of here.

Damn! Just as we were about to to take the systems apart, a pump exploded and buried one of our people beneath it! We were able to rescue him, but he doesn't look good. If only we'd never came down here in the first place…

Hey chief, I took a look at this. It apparently used to be a store for Clothing. You can still see a shop window dummy on the ground floor. The Building isn't in the best shape anymore, but it doesn't seem to have been looted yet. Could be worth sending an Expedition there!

All set, we've arrived. The Scout was right. It appears that no one has strayed in here anymore since the catastrophe. Part of the Building's wall has broken off and there's a gaping hole in the hallway on the first floor - we ought to watch out where we step!
Third Floor
What's at the top?
Hey, at some point this was probably an apartment, too. A bit small, cramped, and the roof slopes down in here, but at least it offers a lovely view!
Attic Apartment
Let's see if we find something valuable! <<dynamicmessage>>
There's even a telescope standing in front of the window here - at any rate we can take that apart!
There's even a telescope standing in front of the window here - our Researcher thinks we could make good use of it for future Research!
All we found in addition was merely a little bit of stuff to recycle. But we have the telescope to make up for that!
Except for the telescope, there's really not much to find here, chief.
Second Floor
What's on the second floor?
They seem to be completely normal apartments that don't have anything to do with the store anymore.
First Apartment
Doesn't seem to be anything special, but maybe we'll find something! <<dynamicmessage>>
Meanwhile we're real Experts when it comes to combing through old Ruins!

We've gathered up pretty much all the stuff that's still usable! Fixtures and furnishings, electronic appliances and equipment, pieces of Clothing, and even a few old comic books that we nearly would've overlooked in the midst of a stack of paper! "Bunkerboys' Adventure in the Wasteland" Weird what people used to dream up just for fun. But at least it's some enjoyable reading for the trip home!

So, guess that was pretty much all the stuff that's still usable. Some fixtures and furnishings, a few old electrical appliances, pieces of Clothing, but that was all she wrote. We didn't notice anything special...
Second Apartment

Holy moly - the whole apartment is stuffed full of all kinds of junk and old newspapers! Can't even picture us living like this in the Endzone - but whatever, we'll take a look around... <<dynamicmessage>>
The wooden floor creaks and squeaks like crazy. Probably hasn't been oiled anymore for ages...
According to our Builder, the floor is already so out of whack it might give way at any time. We ought to be careful.

<<dynamicmessage>> A piece of the floor gave way - but I was still able to hold tight to all the junk here. Nothing happened. There were no good pickings here, anyway - almost all of it was garbage...
Our builder certainly knows what he's talking about.

Ahhh, of all the luck! While searching across the room the floor suddenly gave way and we fell to the floor below. Couldn't call it a soft landing, but the way it looks nothing worse happened. Next time we ought to be more careful when we're combing through a Ruin.
First Floor
Take a look around there!
This floor was apparently once part of the store, except that half of the hallway has caved in here. But there's still another room we can take a look at.
Showroom
The shelves in here are still full of old pieces of Clothing. We can make good use of the Cloth!
Awesome, that ought to help replenish our stockpiled Inventories! If we were only able to simply find everything we need to survive in a store...
Ground Floor
What does it look like down there?
Down here was probably the Sales Room, and it seems like there's a small Storage Room, too.
Storage Room
The door is locked. <<dynamicmessage>>
Let's see if we can get it open without Tools...
We can pry the door open with our crowbar!

The door is open! There are lots of pieces of Clothing in here, some still packed in boxes. "Collection July 2026 - To dispose of" is written on about half of the boxes. "Collection August 2026" is written on the other half. Sounds as if the people used to sort out clothes and already throw them away a month later. But why in blazes anyone ought to do something like that. All the clothes still look as good as new! That's pretty strange after all this time. Must be because of the high percentage of Plastic in the fabrics. But that suits us just fine!
Nothing doing without Tools, chief. Seems to be one sturdy bolt!
Sales Room
Besides a few pieces of Clothing and the shop window dummy, there's an electronic cash register system still standing in a corner that we can take apart.
Alrighty, we can still make use of the Cloth and we've removed the usable parts from the cash register. We'll take the mannequin along, too - it's a sure thing it'll make work easier for our Tailors!

I've arrived at the coordinates, chief. The Building looks fairly unremarkable from outside. Seems there was once a bar on the ground floor. Somebody wrote a call for help on the outer wall - but I can't see anyone, could be pretty old by now. It'd be best if you sent an Expedition here to take a closer look!
Then it's time for us to see if there's any substance to what the Scout said! At any rate, it won't be any problem getting in. The side wall of the Building has caved in...
Ground Floor
Take a look around!
Several bar stools, a bar counter, dusty bottles on the shelves - apparently people used to meet here for a drink after work! In the back there also seems to be a Storeroom and a stairs going up.
Stairs
The stairs still seem to be in good shape. The apartment above presumably belonged to the people who ran the bar here.
Hey, there are tracks here on the dusty stairs - maybe the call for help isn't so old, after all. <<dynamicmessage>>
Looks like something was dragged up the stairs here.
Hey, there are tracks here on the dusty stairs - maybe the call for help isn't so old, after all.
Counter
The layer of dust is missing on some of the bottles. Looks as if someone was here not too long ago! Let's see what else we find here... <<dynamicmessage>>
We know the usual hiding places!

Hey, a baseball bat was lying under the counter - what would that've been good for? And a book was lying here, too: "Mixology - The Art of Serving Alcohol". We can definitely still learn a thing or two from that. In addition to the bottles on the shelves we found a few more underneath the floorboards. That must be the good stuff!

Hey, a baseball bat was lying under the counter - what would that've been good for? And a book was lying here, too: "Mixology - The Art of Serving Alcohol". We can definitely still learn a thing or two from that!
Storeroom

The floor here is littered with shards and the shelves are empty. Apparently someone's already looted the room. However, in one corner we did find a crate with intact bottles still full. Unlike the others, there's no label on it. Somebody wrote "All the best from the Doctor" by hand. <<dynamicmessage>>
What's that supposed to mean? At any rate, our Pubkeeper didn't feel it was beneath him to take a slug straight out of the bottle. Seems like it's first-class moonshine!
What's that supposed to mean? Well, at any rate the liquid in the bottles reeks of alcohol. Is it a safe bet to drink it?

Hey, it tastes really good - but it packs a punch, too! Which means that at any rate it still ought to be drinkable. <<dynamicmessage>>I'm already looking forward to long nights by the Campfire with this stuff!
Our Pubkeeper says time and again that when Liquor is high-proof it can't go bad in the first place!
Oh well, we'd be better off leaving the bottles where they are. In the end we'd go blind if we drink that stuff!
Stairwell
Go on
Okay, we're on the first floor now. The tracks here lead along the hallway, but there's still another floor, too. It literally reeks of Liquor somewhere here...
Second Floor
The stairs lead up to the second floor. The dust lying on the steps is inch-thick, so it's a sure thing that nobody's been up there anymore for ages.
We're at the top! The steps creak and squeak like crazy, and not much light gets in here, either.
Tracks
We followed the tracks and now know where the smell of liquor comes from, too. We found a man in a room, unconscious.

A little Water in his face and he was wide awake! Apparently his companions left him behind here because a leg injury left him unable to keep up with them anymore. Good buddies, right? We're taking him with us to our settlement before he drinks himself to death here. He was so grateful he even shared his most valuable possession with us - a new Seed!
Another Room
The only things in here are a huge couch and an old television set. Oh well, at least we can recycle them! <<dynamicmessage>>
Of course, we really could use a saw now...
So it wasn't for nothing that we packed up a saw to take along...
There you go, one couch reduced to easy to handle pieces - just large enough to be able to conveniently carry them to the settlement! And we dismantled a few electronic parts from the TV set, too...

Phew, we're simply not getting this couch to come apart, and there's no way we're going to haul that thing back to the settlement in one piece! Oh well, at least we can take a few electronic components from the TV set along...
Upper Floor
How does it look up there?
Two rooms that we can search head off from the hallway. And there's a ladder that heads up to the attic, too…
Room

Apparently truly no one has been here since the catastrophe anymore - everything looks untouched. Almost feels like a journey across time! 
<<dynamicmessage>>
You nearly get a kind of queasy feeling rummaging through all this here...
Our veteran is urging us to ransack everything in sight!

Almost everything here is already disintegrating into dust, chief. We still found a few pieces of jewelry and gold coins hidden in the bed mattress. <<dynamicmessage>> And we took apart a few old pieces of electronic equipment, too.
Naturally our veteran spotted them right away.

Most of the furniture here has rotted away, the clothes have been eaten up by moths, and otherwise there's hardly anything worth grabbing. We took apart a few pieces of electronic equipment. Everything else here is going to disintegrate into dust soon, anyway...
Attic
There's not much space up there, but apparently the attic is stuffed full of boxes. If there's anything useful inside?

Books, books, and more books, in every single box! Apparently they were really well-read bar owners... Oh well, we'll comb through the well-preserved copies and take along whatever sounds intriguing. Seems like they're primarily novels!

Hey chief, about that Ruin you sent me to: There's a light on in the windows! Although I haven't seen anyone up till now, apparently someone has set up camp there... It'd be best if you sent a small Expedition here!
It's true - light! Maybe we'll run into somebody...
Illuminated Entrance
Knock on the door!

We ran into a young lady! Apparently she set off on her own because of some differences of opinion with the Inhabitants of another Endzone and set up camp here. The Power for the lighting is generated by an old generator she got back into shape - seems to have a good grip on Technology! We made her an offer to join up with us. She didn't seem to think it was a bad idea.
Generator
The woman is helping us take the generator apart and would join up with us afterwards!
Right on, that's taken care of! She still has to pack her things and then she'll join us. We can really use Experts like her - hope we have a place to sleep left over for her, too!
Upper Floor
According to our hermit there's no good pickings up there. Just some old Scrap and rotten wooden crates that were stored there.
Even so, naturally we can make use of Scrap and Wood!
Store
There was once a small store in the front part of the Building where all kinds of stuff was sold. Maybe we'll still find usable items.

Looks like that's about everything - a few household items made of Plastic, Cloth rags and a few fixtures to turn into Scrap. We also found a crowbar under the counter - was it supposed to be for self-defense?
Looks like that's about everything - a few household items made of Plastic, Cloth rags and a few fixtures to turn into Scrap. Sadly, not much usable this time!

I'd call that a Ruin, chief! Seems to have been a restaurant at some point, but there's not much left of it to see anymore. It's all pretty dilapidated - I'm not sure if it's worth sending an Expedition here...
Just like the Scout reported - not much left standing from the Building anymore! The upper floors have caved in, but we can take a look at the ground floor.
Restaurant
How does it look there?

Everything's pretty run-down here - no wonder, with no protection at all against the weather. I can't imagine that there are any pickings left on the caved-in upper floors. We'd be better off taking a look at what's left of the kitchen…
Kitchen

Hey, even signs with the dishes offered are still here: "Pumpkin soup" - would be just the right pick-me-up now! Other than that, except for a few old electrical appliances there's nothing interesting here...

We've removed all the electronic components. The number of things you find built into an old fridge is nothing to sneeze at! <<dynamicmessage>> But hey, wait a sec! We nearly overlooked a hatch in the floor that was buried under all the dust and grime...
Turned out to be a piece of cake for our Technician.

We were able to remove a few electronic components from the old fridge. The rest doesn't seem to be recycable anymore. But hey, wait a sec! We nearly overlooked a hatch in the floor that was buried under all the dust and grime...
Stairs
Looks like the stairs'll cave in any minute now. We can take a cautious look around upstairs, but would it be worth it? <<dynamicmessage>>
From here it looks like all that's left up there is rubble...
Nothing's left up there except rubble...
Among the debris at the very top there was still some Scrap <<dynamicmessage>>. That was one heck of a climb. Luckily nothing happened!
that our Expert spotted.
Yeah, as expected - nothing except rubble. We don't see any point in climbing up to the top. In the end someone'll hurt themselves!
Floor Hatch
A floor hatch?
The hatch seems to lead to a basement. Maybe there was once a Storeroom or a room like it down there - let's take a look!
Basement
Not much light gets in here, but it doesn't seem to be a lot of space. Jute sacks are stacked on the shelves...

The sacks are full of shriveled-up old beans - not edible! Hold on, there's a human skeleton lying between the sacks in the corner. Looks like all the teeth are missing from the skull - and something's been scratched onto the wall: "FORGOT CAMP STOVE". Did he try to survive by living on raw beans?

What someone sprayed on the wall here is downright scary! Looks like a skeleton with horns that appears to be rising out of the floor - who comes up with spooky ideas like that? Well, at any rate the Building is still in good shape - it'd be best if you sent an Expedition here...

The Scout really wasn't exaggerating - that mural on the wall is creepy, but somehow fascinating, too. Was it maybe supposed to be a warning? Well, at any rate it'll be easy for us to get into the Building. Part of the rear wall has collapsed...
Back of the Building
Try it there!
We're inside now and standing in the middle of a small store. Apparently everything under the sun was once sold here: Food, household goods, Clothing...
Stairs
A stairs here leads to the upper floors!
Good, we'll take a look around the other floors...
Small Office
There's a door to a small room here. Probably used to be the office. Everything's packed pretty much to the brim in there!
Files, big mounds of paper and old boxes. Hard to picture how anyone was able to run a business in this chaos. Oh well, at least a dusty laptop was still lying on the desk!
Shelves
Okay, let's take a look at what's stacked on the shelves here.  <<dynamicmessage>>
SURVIVAL FOOD is written here on a crate - seems to deal with prepackaged Food Rations. All sorts of chemical terms I've never heard of are written on the packages...
SURVIVAL FOOD is written here on a crate - seems to deal with prepackaged Food Rations. Luckily I know a thing or two about chemistry and understand the list of ingredients on the packages...
No reason it shouldn't be edible! <<dynamicmessage>> We've also packed up all sorts of other stuff that we can put to good use...
There are at least enough additives in it to preserve that stuff for ages!
It's a sure thing that stuff isn't edible anymore, whatever the chemistry says! But don't worry, we've packed up all sorts of other stuff: Plastic items, pieces of Clothing, Scrap...
Stairwell
Go on!
The stairs lead all the way up to the top floor. Which floor should we take a look at?
First Floor
Appears to be the door to an apartment. But bolted from inside... <<dynamicmessage>>
A crowbar would be helpful right now!
No problem, for situations like this we always have a crowbar with us...
Okay, the door is open - or to put it better, burst apart. Somebody actually did attach a heavy iron bolt to the door from the inside...
Nothing doing! Whoever lived here wanted to make dead certain that no one can break in...
Second Floor
The door to the apartment on the second floor is wide open. But watch out, parts of the hallway have already caved in...
The weather has already done a fair share of damage to this floor, but at least we were still able to salvage a few smaller objects from one room that can be turned into Scrap.
The hallway is not exactly sturdy and I just stepped right through the floor with one foot! Luckily nothing happened, but we'd be better off making a detour around this floor...
Top Floor
Locked! <<dynamicmessage>>
Maybe we can get the door to the top floor open with a little brute force...
No problem, isn't that why we've got our Tools with us…?
So, that's taken care of - not what you'd call a sturdy lock!
Ouch! Okay, the door's open, but I think I bruised my shoulder while forcing it...
Apartment
What's in the apartment?
We're standing in the hallway now. Doesn't look remarkable here at first, but we'll take a look around.
Bathroom
Maybe we'll find a few usable things in the bathroom.

At least we can dismantle a few of the faucets and fixtures and take them with us... Whoa! A skeleton's lying in the bathtub - looks as if the rear skull bone had been broken. Did the person in the bathtub slip and die from the skull injury? Not exactly a spectacular way to go...
Bedroom
Otherwise there's nothing particularly special about the apartment. We can also take a look at the bedroom<<dynamicmessage>>.
, maybe we'll get lucky and find something else...
, thanks to our Expert we know where the typical hiding places are!

Well whaddaya know - we found a complete set of survival gear underneath the floorboards!<<dynamicmessage>> Protective Clothing, Mask, Food Rations, tent, and even a crossbow. Whoever lived here had apparently prepared themself for doomsday...
We found the hiding place right away!

Seems to be a run-of-the-mill bedroom, even though I can't get rid of the feeling that we might have overlooked something! Oh well, we took the bed apart, so at least we're not walking out of here empty-handed...
Study
This room looks interesting - tons of bookshelves and a hefty armchair in the middle of the room. Could it've been a scientist who lived here? <<dynamicmessage>>
We're sure to find a few useful books!
One second, the books here don't look to me like they're special scientific literature...

Listen to these book titles, chief! "5G AND THE NWO", "CHEMTRAILS AND THE EARTH'S ORBIT", "A DEEPER STATE INSIDE DEEP STATE? PUBLISHER THINK TWICE TELLS THE STORY". They all seem to be far-fetched manuscripts about some sort of crazy theories.<<dynamicmessage>> Oh well, at least they'll probably be good for a few laughs while reading by the Campfire...
If anything at all, the most we'll learn is something about the screwed-up people before the catastrophe.
Top Floor
So, what's up there?
At some time it must've been an apartment. At any rate, the windows offer a nice view from up here!
Living Room
The living room nearly extends across the whole top floor! Hey, there's a huge TV set and loudspeakers standing back there...<<dynamicmessage>>
We can't haul them back intact. If we had a Technician along we could remove the most usable parts...
Our Technician can remove the usable parts, then we don't have to haul back all of it intact...
<<dynamicmessage>>That ought to be all of the usable electronic components. We've also gathered up a few more objects that can be turned into Scrap!
There we go, our Technician is all done!

We've cracked the pieces of equipment open and are just taking a few of the electronic components with us - hopefully we can make use of them! And we've also gathered up a few more objects that can be turned into Scrap!
Bedroom
Wow, there's a huge bed in here! 5 or 6 people could easily sleep in it at one time - why would you need something like that? Oh well, let's take it apart...
The bed frame was made of high-grade Metal, and we found pieces of Clothing in the cabinets, too!

Hey chief, it's your Scout - sorry that I have to whisper! I've arrived at the Ruin, but I don't dare get any closer. I spotted a woman with a rifle up on the roof who's watching the surrounding area through binoculars. In addition, warnings have been posted everywhere on the Building that she'll shoot as soon as she sees strangers! I have no idea what we're supposed to be doing here... Maybe you could send a few Settlers to come by who should approach cautiously and start up a conversation or two?
The Scout was right, warnings really have been posted everywhere on the Building. Guess she means business... But I can't see anyone at the moment - should we get closer?
Building
Approach slowly and with caution!
Damn it, keep your heads down! The woman just fired a warning shot out of one of the windows!
Hands Up
Maybe we'd be better off staying where we are and signal that we don't mean her any harm?
Okay, we've called out to her that we've come here with peaceful intentions and all we want to do is talk to her!
Just Keep On Moving!
If we just keep on moving quickly we can find some cover in the Ruin!
Damn, she's fired off another round! That wasn't a warning shot anymore, but luckily it barely missed us. At any rate, to just keep on moving is too dangerous, chief...
Aaah, she hit me in the leg! Maybe to just keep on moving when somebody's aiming a weapon at you isn't such a good idea, after all.
Conversation
And then?
She's allowed us to come closer, but she's still aiming the rifle right at us out of the window!
Start Up Conversation
It'd be best if we started off by telling her about us and our settlement!
Okay, she's not aiming at us anymore. So she seems to like what we're telling her.
Get Inside the Building! Fast!
Maybe this is the chance to quickly get the last yards to the protective Ruin behind us!
Go back, go back! She fired off another round again! We're not getting anywhere this way, chief...
Aaah<<dynamicmessage>>! Go back, go back!
, now she's hit me in the arm, too!
, she hit me in the arm!
The Survivor
What's her story?

No wonder she's so suspicious of strangers! Apparently she and her husband bartered some pieces of equipment for Food from some other survivors, but the Food turned out to be so highly contaminated that her husband is lying severely ill at their camp now. She's afraid the group will come back and finish what they started.
Help the Sick Man
We ought to offer her and her husband our help! <<dynamicmessage>>
Unfortunately, we don't have any kind of Medicine with us that might help the guy!
With our Medicine I think we can get the poor guy back on his feet again!

Good thing we had the Medicine in our bags! The woman led us to the sick man and after a while you could see he was already doing better - that truly was a good deed, chief! Now the two of them would be glad to join up with us - they say their chances don't look good all alone out here. And naturally they'll share their gear with us, too!

I wouldn't know how we can help the two of them without Medicine. The sick man's not going to make it back to the settlement, not in the state he's in, and his wife won't leave him behind no matter what. The only thing left for us is to head back to the settlement...

Looks to me like the Ruins of a fast food outlet. Must've been nice to be able to just go into a place like that whenever you got really hungry... But there's not very much left of it. One side of the Building has already caved in. It'd probably be enough if you sent a small team here.
At any rate, thanks to the caved-in wall it won't be any problem getting in. At least, this time we don't need any Tools to force any doors open!
Diner
What does it look like inside?
Let's take a look: That must've been the counter over here, the Kitchen over there, a Storage Room next to it and the customers probably sat back there...
Counter
That's a whole bunch of Electronics for a simple counter - multiple screens and cash registers. Good for us<<dynamicmessage>>!
- our Expert will get to work right away
- even though we don't know much about this technical stuff, we'll just take everything along that we can carry
With the right amount of caution <<dynamicmessage>> we were able to dismantle all the parts!
and a grip on the subject at hand,
Damn - we should've been more careful handling the screens. Oh well, maybe the rest can still be recycled...
Kitchen
Awesome appliances! A huge grill, deep fryers, refrigerators, ovens...<<dynamicmessage>>
Taking that apart ought to be a piece of cake for our Technician!
Taking that apart professionally is not going to be easy!

Wow, <<dynamicmessage>>that took a lot of time! But as a result we've taken all the appliances apart into easy-to-handle small parts, and all we have left to do is to bring them back to the settlement. No doubt about it, the effort paid off!
even for our Technician
We took apart everything we could. The rest of the appliances are too big and heavy to drag them back to the settlement.
Storage Room
The room has already been completely emptied. Although, one second - there seems to be a trapdoor underneath the shelf in the corner...
Yeah, a ladder here leads down to a small basement!
Seating Area
There are still lots of tables and chairs made of Plastic standing everywhere here that we can turn into Scrap...
Hard to believe how long Plastic stays intact. Even though this Plastic furniture is weather-beaten and filthy, it's still fairly sturdy and definitely good to recycle...
Basement
What's down there?
We've moved the shelf aside and are climbing down the ladder. Hand me the light!
Basement Room
Looks as if someone used this place as a hideout. What's more, there are pickaxes, shovels and buckets full of rocks lying around here...

There are even Food Rations here that still look edible! It couldn't have been too long ago that someone lived here... Oh well, he sure won't need his gear anymore. Hey, listen to what's been scribbled in a notebook: "THROW ME OUT OF THE ENDZONE, DON'T MAKE ME LAUGH! IF THEY DON'T WANT TO LET ME IN, I'LL JUST DIG MY WAY BACK! HAHAHAHA...." - and that keeps going on for pages! Luckily there weren't lunatics like that in our Endzone...
Tunnel
It seems to be a pretty long tunnel<<dynamicmessage>>...
- at least the same length as the danger of it caving in, if you ask me, chief
- it looks anything but stable, but I don't understand a thing about tunnel construction, anyway

The tunnel is definitely nearly a hundred meters long! All that's left all the way at the end here is a pile of rubble blocking the way - One sec, something's peeking out from among the rocks... a leg! Sure thing it's the poor guy who dug the tunnel - must've caved in above him. Would've been better if he'd shored up the tunnel ceiling! We ought to take that to heart if we ever want to operate mines...

Hey chief, I've discovered an abandoned military base - there's even a rusty tank standing around here! If you want to send an Expedition here you ought see to it that it's well equipped! It's a sure thing it won't be an easy proposition to turn everything upside down here and collect usable materials...
If we'd discovered the base earlier on it might've served as a top-notch base for us, chief! There are even a few barracks that haven't collapsed yet. Where should we take a look first?
West Side
Take a look around there!
There are two weather-beaten barracks standing on the west side of the base that we ought to take a closer look at. A few rusted wrecks that we can scrap for parts are standing around here, too.
Second Barracks
The door is already hanging crooked on its hinges - it's a sure thing everything's already been cleaned out here!<<dynamicmessage>>
But who knows? Maybe our experienced Scout will still find something, anyway!
Sadly, we don't have any veterans along who'd know how to thoroughly turn a place like this upside down...

Everything here has already been turned upside down, but at least we can still recycle the cots. What's more, <<dynamicmessage>> we've discovered a few small crates hidden under the floorboards where photos and other mementos were kept for safekeeping - and a few small bottles of Hard Liquor!
thanks to our veteran
As expected - no good pickings at all. The lockers and boxes have all been long since looted. But at least we can recycle the cots!
First Barracks
Hey, I think I heard voices coming out of the barracks - we ought to go see what's up!

We encountered two survivors inside who are apparently making their way aimlessly across the wilderness and are taking a rest here. After we shared our Food Rations with them they set aside their initial skepticism and began to trust us. We were even able to convince them to accompany us back to our settlement!

We encountered two survivors inside who are apparently making their way aimlessly across the wilderness and are taking a rest here. They seem to be all tuckered out, but unfortunately we weren't able to convince them to join us. I had the sneaky feeling they don't trust us one bit...
Wrecks
That's going to be a nice piece of work. There's even a rusty tank standing around here!<<dynamicmessage>>
But with our Expert's help it's a sure thing we can scrap the old wreck for parts!
I'm not sure if we're able to scrap the wreck for parts - an expert might be more the right one to help us further here!
<<dynamicmessage>>It took a while, but we've pulled everything out of the wrecks worth taking along!
You realize right away who knows their way around this stuff - our Expert sorted out the useless parts in nothing flat!
That sure took its sweet time, chief. It's a safe bet that an expert would've made shorter work of this! Oh well, I think we've pulled enough usable material out of the wrecks...
East Side
What does it look like here?
The old hangar looks very promising. We can also take a look around the tents or climb up the watchtower.
Watchtower
Doesn't seem to be particularly sturdy to me anymore - you sure we ought to head up there?

Hey, now that's what I call a view! If I'm not mistaken, I can even make out the silhouettes of our Station back there on the horizon! Hey, one second - there's a small knapsack lying here in the corner. Somebody must've deposited it here at some point... There're a few useful things inside!
Ouch, damn it! The rungs on the ladder didn't carry my weight and broke apart - not exactly what you'd call a soft landing, as you can surely imagine. Luckily no one is seriously injured...
Hangar
The door to the hangar is bolted shut and the entrance is locked. <<dynamicmessage>>
But we can pry it open with our crowbar!
Seems to be pretty sturdy - probably nothing doing without a crowbar!
It took us a few tries to find the right point to set the crowbar, but then it was no problem. The door's wide open!
Nothing doing, chief. Sad to say, but it's not as easy as forcing open the doorway to some Ruin...
Tents
There are cots standing in the tents - this must have been a sickbay. But it looks as if everything was already looted here a long time ago...
Oh well, at least we can recycle these cots and a few tarpaulins!
Hangar
How does it look inside?
If that doesn't beat all - that's a helicopter! What's more, there are all sorts of cabinets and shelves here filled with Spare Parts and Tools.
Helicopter
Think that thing still works? This here in the cockpit seems to be the start button - but nothing's happening. At any rate, it would've seriously surprised me.<<dynamicmessage>>
So we'll take the thing apart - it'll definitely take a while, but luckily we've got a technical Expert with us!
It would definitely be worth it to take the thing apart - but it's a sure thing that nothing's doing without a technical Expert.
Goodness gracious, that took forever! But we've taken practically everything apart - except for the engine block, it's just too heavy. And in the process our Expert showed us a few tricks, too!
Oh well, we've removed a few components and parts of the paneling and plating. To dismantle the rest without destroying it we'd need more expertise...
Cabinets and Shelves
There are lots of different Tools lying here in the cabinets, and all sorts of Spare Parts on the shelves!
We can scrap the Spare Parts, and we can make good use of nearly all the Tools at the settlement!
Trapdoor
Hey, here's a recess with a trapdoor in the floor...
A metal ladder here leads to a narrow passageway below...
Shelter
What's down there?

After a few minutes the passageway ends at a door - looks like a solid Radiation Protection door similar to what we had back then in the Endzone. But it can be easily slid open - won't take a second! There's a fairly small room behind it. Was probably conceived at some point as a shelter in the event of an emergency...
Monitors
On the one wall there are monitors and panels containing electronic components built into the wall - but nothing happens when the buttons are pressed.<<dynamicmessage>>
Our Technician is sure that no power has flowed here anymore for a long time - but we can make good use of the equipment!
I'd say we tear the monitors out of the wall - we can recycle them afterwards at the settlement. Naturally it'd be a whole lot easier if we had a Technician along...
<<dynamicmessage>>We can make good use of the components at the settlement!
All this electrical stuff may very well be quite valuable and save us a bunch of Refinery work. That's what our Technician says!
I'm afraid we've damaged most of the components - next time we'd better take an Expert along who can take that kind of equipment apart properly!
Lockers
There are a few lockers standing against the wall here - one sec, we'll have them open in a jiffy...
There's a Radiation Suit hanging in each locker! Perfect! That means we're well equipped for the next contaminated rain!

Chief, this is the Scout on the line. I found an old vehicle at the destination. If I've got the information straight in my head, it's a Harvester. They were used to farm the Fields on a large scale. Send a few people over here. Maybe there's something good to be gotten out of this thing.
We've made it, chief. I wish we were able to get this thing back in shape again... It'd save us a ton of work at home! At any rate, we'll take a look around!
Harvester
Look around!
Maybe we'll still find useful stuff in the cockpit or the canister!
Cockpit
Up front is the cockpit where the driver must have sat. Maybe something's hidden under the seat?

It was easy to get the cockpit door open, chief. Sadly, there's not much to be had, but we did find an old photo of a cornfield and two people arm in arm under the seat. There are two Seed kernels glued to the picture. "For Sara, for our future" is written on the photo. Too bad the two of them probably won't live to see the future anymore...or luckily for them?
Resource Canister
At the rear end of the Harvester is the canister that took up the stuff that was reaped. The space is limited, but maybe we'll get lucky and still find something useful.

Damn it, chief! One of us fell into the canister and seems to have sprained something! It's no piece of cake getting someone back out of there! And the canister was empty, too, so all the effort wasn't worth a thing...

Hey chief, Scout 1 on the line. I've found a site here that could be interesting for our folks. Lots of steel, containers, and a big plot of land. But I'd recommend bringing along Tools and being careful. Although it's been standing for a while, it could still collapse.

We've made it, chief! I think this here was supposed to become a Building at some point, but it was never completed. Man, this is really incredible. There's still equipment standing around that was used for construction. Apparently building material and containers, too. The things in the back, I think they're old toilets from way back when. But we'd be better off not using them.
Construction Site
Is there anything useful there?
We'll see, chief. We can take a closer look at the containers, and at the Building itself. Besides that, there might be something to find at the toilets.
Building

These are the remnants of the Building that was supposed to be built. Maybe an office Building? Hard to say. In the end, it doesn't matter anyway. There's one room that's completed, and back there you can climb up a ladder.

We were able to fish some stuff out of the unfinished Building, though a lot is just plain garbage! Primarily Metal, building materials and Plastic. But we also found an abandoned Storage Room with an old tent and a few Radiation Suits. No dead bodies. Whoever set up this Storage Room is not coming back.
Damn it! One of us fell off the ladder when a rung broke off. That didn't have to happen. All that action didn't really get us anywhere, either... The room was empty, except for a little Metal.
Construction Container

Chief, I think these things here are old construction containers. If memory serves me, building debris was collected in them to have it transported from the construction site later on. So it's a definite possibilty that we won't find much useful stuff here. <<dynamicmessage>>
Luckily we have someone along who knows more about what we can recycle and what we can't make any use of.
Ha, got it open. We had to do a roundabout job of prying the cover open, but it was worth it! <<dynamicmessage>>
Thanks to our experienced people we were able to do a good job of assessing what's usable and what's not.
Whew, everything here just looks like it's junk. No good pickings, I'm afraid. But for that little bit of Scrap, well, the effort wasn't worth it.
Shipping Container
Old containers they used on ships. I'd say other things were stored there, too. Maybe we'll find something here that's worthwhile! <<dynamicmessage>>
It's no problem getting in with the Tools on hand.
We got the containers open. A damn tough piece of work. The locking mechanism was completely rusted, so the only way we could move the door was with a lot of muscle. <<dynamicmessage>>
If we hadn't had the Tools I know for a fact that we wouldn't have gotten in!
Oof, nope, no way, chief! These doors don't move a fraction of an inch. It doesn't look like we'd get them open, not without the right Tool.
Toilets
Blue containers that used to be used as toilets. The Elderly say that sometimes things are found in them. At least that's apparently the way it was in some old video games. Let's see what we find.
No, no, and no way, that was one big zero. We went in, saw disgusting stuff, and headed right out again. Really nasty stuff. Let's change the subject.
Product

Production Output
