We've finally left the Endzone. Just look at this beautiful scenery! It's marvelous, even though it's a bit different from what we had pictured. We were able to secure a few basic resources and are storing them in our bus.

I’m glad we've prepared ourselves well for this kind of scenario. Especially since our Inventories in the Endzone ran low. Don't forget that if you need additional information you can look at our Survival Guide at any time.
Well done. Everything you need to know should be right here. I think the time has come for us to at last to build ourselves a new home here.
Survival 101
Open the Survival Guide

The first thing we ought to do is to establish a working <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Water Supply</style></link>. So we'll move on to our first construction contract. Place and build a <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Jetty</style></link> by a Lake in the vicinity of your <link="18"><style="DefaultLink">Town Center</style></link>.

Very good! <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">The Jetty</style></link> was completed as planned. Now we have a place where we can collect Water. There are other possibilities to gather Water, too, but the Jetty is the simplest and most cost-effective method.
Our First Water Source

Before we can construct Buildings at all, we have to assign the profession <link="3"><style="DefaultLink">Builder</style></link> to several Settlers so that they can take care of Construction contracts. In general, it’s your responsibility to decide which Tasks are important and how our Settlers are supposed to be distributed to attend to them.
Alright, your Builders will be ready as soon as Construction contracts have been issued. It's time to start focusing on our key and most basic need: Water!
Work Distribution

We can obtain and store Water from different sources like a <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Jetty</style></link>, <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Rain Collector</style></link> or <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Well</style></link> in the Cistern. The Cistern should always be in close proximity to a Water Source so that our Water Carriers don’t have to walk too far.

Great! We have now installed a working water supply and Water is now transported from the <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Jetty</style></link> to our <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Cistern</style></link>. Consider hiring more Water Carriers if you don't have enough Settlers available. You can never have enough Water in storage.
Storing our Water

Now we should focus on <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Food Production</style></link>. It’s important to ensure the supply right from the start. A <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Gatherer's Cabin</style></link>, a <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Hunting Lodge</style></link> or a <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Fishing Hut</style></link> can directly remedy the situation. I suggest starting with the Fishing Hut, since we're already located near a Lake.

Good work. We’ve now taken care of our basic supply via Food and Water. Make sure that enough Food and Water are on hand at all times, especially if you want to upgrade your settlement. A population that grows too fast can quickly unbalance your Food and Water Supply, bringing major difficulties for you if you don't watch out.
Our First Source of Food

<link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Crops</style></link> are another excellent way of getting Food because they constantly grow as long as the soil is moist enough. Each Seed has different Yields and Growing Times. This means that it can take some time until your Field is ready to be harvested, in contrast to your <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Fishing Hut</style></link>, where Production can begin right away.

Looks good! Remember that we need the widest variety of Food Sources to stay healthy. You should also plan ahead for drought periods that might come when it's not going to rain. Stock up on Food and adapt your Production to avoid bottlenecks. I’ll show you a few more strategies later on.
An Additional Source of Food

At the beginning we don't have much <link="15"><style="DefaultLink">Scrap</style></link>, <link="15"><style="DefaultLink">Wood</style></link> or other Resources. We could build a Production Building. But to obtain Resources as fast as possible it's best that we start gathering right away. Assign a "Gather All Resources"-Tasks. All the Settlers who haven't been assigned any Profession by you are going to accept these kinds of Tasks. In addition, Settlers distribute Resources within your settlement.

Since we now own plenty of Resources we can start to build a real Production Building. Then you don't have to always make efforts by hand that collecting is taking place. Production Buildings are not only easier to manage: they are also distinctly more effective than simple Tasks. Don’t place Production Buildings too far away from your settlement. You’ll be able to change their working area at any time later on.
Gather Resources from Your Surroundings

Right on! The best thing for us to do now is to build a <link="15"><style="DefaultLink">Forester’s Lodge</style></link> to automate our supply of Wood and make it more effective at the same time. Foresters are not only able to chop down trees: they plant them, too.

Good job! You might want to change this Building's working area later on to tell your workers where they should get their Wood from. Ah, and for your information, if you want you can also tell your Forester's Lodge that they only ought to attend to reforesting an area in order to create a lush green forest which generations to come can use.
Create a Stable Supply of Wood

Very good! Now we ought to take care of collecting <link="15"><style="DefaultLink">Scrap</style></link>. Scrap is one of our most valuable Resources, because the quantities present are limited and we can recover other Resources from Scrap. Unlike the Tasks we just had, the <link="15"><style="DefaultLink">Scrapyard</style></link> allows larger quantities of existing Scrap to be dismantled than with Ruins or Wrecks.

Great! You can change the working area for the Scrapyard, too. We can recycle Scrap into four additional Resources: <link="16"><style="DefaultLink">Cloth</style></link>, <link="16"><style="DefaultLink">Metal</style></link>, <link="16"><style="DefaultLink">Plastic</style></link> and <link="16"><style="DefaultLink">Electronics</style></link>. We’ll do that shortly, but for now we ought to take care of your Settlers' needs first.
Our First Scrapyard

Our people want a place to sleep and live. <link="4"><style="DefaultLink">Cabins</style></link> fulfill their need for safety and privacy, and increase the Confidence of their Inhabitants. In other words: Building Cabins increases their willingness to start Families and... <link="4"><style="DefaultLink">reproduce</style></link>, if you know what I mean.

Besides <link="4"><style="DefaultLink">Cabins</style></link> you can also provide <link="4"><style="DefaultLink">Sturdy Houses</style></link> and <link="4"><style="DefaultLink">Shelters</style></link> as Housing. Sturdy Houses withstand Sandstorms better and have an increased storage capacity to boot. Children living in Houses gradually fill up the House's stockpiles. Settlers do not reproduce in a Shelter because they lack privacy.
Provide Housing

Let's return from our excursion into housing and refocus on <link="15"><style="DefaultLink">Scrap</style></link>. With the help of a <link="16"><style="DefaultLink">Recycler</style></link> or a <link="16"><style="DefaultLink">Refinery</style></link> Scrap can be <link="16"><style="DefaultLink">sorted</style></link> into four different Resources. A Recycler always takes Scrap apart one Resource at a time, while a Refinery automatically produces all four Resources. To start off you should build a Recycler and produce Cloth.

You can instruct your Recycler to produce a different Resource at a time. It’s important that you focus on the Resources you really need, at least in the beginning. Cloth and Metal look like good options if you want to equip us with Protective Clothing and Tools.
Refine Cloth from Scrap

Happy Settlers are industrious Settlers. That's why we ought to look after our people and protect them against the surroundings and dangers like Radiation. So, let's start by transforming our newly recovered Cloth into Protective Clothing! A <link="11"><style="DefaultLink">Tailor</style></link> will be able to help us with that.

We categorize <link="10"><style="DefaultLink">environmental Radiation</style></link> into four levels: No Radiation, Low-level, Medium-level and High-level Radiation. The Radiation changes constantly and is influenced by weather and contaminated rain. Protective Clothing helps to protects us against this kind of Radiation, but it takes a while before it's produced and Production relies on a steady flow of incoming Resources. Try to establish production chains at an early stage and start to stockpile goods so that some are always on hand.
Produce Protective Clothing

The <link="12"><style="DefaultLink">Tools</style></link> we brought along from the Endzone are slowly but surely running out, so now let's focus on manufacturing new Tools! The Tools will help us to work effectively. We’ll need Metal for that, so we'll prepare for Production by building another Recycler, which we'll commission to recover Metal from Scrap. After that, we'll need a <link="12"><style="DefaultLink">Workshop</style></link> to enable the manufacturing of brand-new Tools.

With our lovely new <link="12"><style="DefaultLink">Tools</style></link> we are now prepared to work effectively. Should you ever run out of Metal, keep in mind that you can also instruct your Workshop to manufacture Tools from <link="15"><style="DefaultLink">Scrap</style></link> instead of Metal. Though they won’t be quite as effective, it's still better than being forced to work with bare hands!
Tools for the Masses!
Set your new Recycler to produce <link="16"><style="DefaultLink">Metal</style></link>.

Down in the Endzone we had sufficient time and resources to educate ourselves properly. But our Children don’t have this luxury. We ought to build a <link="17"><style="DefaultLink">School</style></link> and pass on what we've learned. As a result they will be able to survive and work better and more effectively.

Perfect! Besides the fact that Educated Children work more effectively, we'll also teach them to be more careful with their Protective Clothing and Tools. This, in turn, leads to them staying intact longer and we conserve valuable Resources.
Knowledge is Power

Now that our population is starting to grow, we ought to again turn our attention to the topic of Food Production. We are already accumulating Fish and tilling our Fields. A <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Gatherer's Cabin</style></link> will now enable us to gather <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Mushrooms</style></link> and <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Berries</style></link> from the Forests nearby.

Very good. As you can see, the <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Gatherer's Cabin</style></link> is an effective possibility to get Food quickly. But watch out! After a drought it's going to take some time before the Plants have regrown. As is the case with most Buildings, here too you can relocate the working area at any time.
Yet Another Source of Food!

Although we are sufficiently supplied at the moment, our survival depends on diligent planning. If we can lay out a plan for an <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Orchard</style></link>, then we can start to plant Fruit or Nut trees we can harvest after a few Seasons.

The Orchard has been laid out and the Trees are already beginning to grow. Similar to Crops for farming, Trees need some time until they are fully grown. But once they have grown, they can be harvested again and again until they have to be newly planted.
Let's Plant a Few Kinds of Fruit

Our <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Gatherer's Cabin</style></link> gathers Food from the surrounding Forests. However, there are any number of other Plants there which we can use as well. These Plants can be gathered by an <link="9"><style="DefaultLink">Herbal Hut</style></link>. The Herbs gathered there can be consumed by Settlers to replenish their Health.

Well done. We can equally utilize the gathered <link="9"><style="DefaultLink">Herbs</style></link> to convert them into <link="9"><style="DefaultLink">Medicine</style></link> later on. It might happen that an Illness breaks out in our settlement from time to time and spreads among our Settlers. That's why we always ought to have enough Herbs on hand.
Collect Some Healing Herbs

<link="10"><style="DefaultLink">Radiation</style></link> is the main reason why the <link="9"><style="DefaultLink">Health status</style></link> of our settlement can decrease. Although our Settlers already use Protective Clothing to shield themselves against environmental Radiation, it might occur that our sources of Water become contaminated. We should start to filter our Water to prevent this from happening. We will need a great deal of <link="11"><style="DefaultLink">Charcoal</style></link> to accomplish this. The <link="11"><style="DefaultLink">Charcoal Kiln</style></link> will burn Wood to produce Charcoal.

Great. We can use the <link="11"><style="DefaultLink">Charcoal</style></link> in conjunction with a Filtration System to purify our Water. Unfortunately, our <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Cistern</style></link> is not able to do this. Only the <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Water Tower</style></link> has the necessary equipment for this capability.
Produce Coal

It would be a disgrace if we had to demolish our trusted <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Cistern</style></link> just to erect a <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Water Tower</style></link> in its place. What we ought to do instead is upgrade the Cistern itself. A Water Tower can store much more Water and provides Workplaces for a lot more Water Carriers than our old Cistern.

Our new <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Water Tower</style></link> is up and ready for action. Good work! Filtering the Water is an important next step because clean drinking water is a key mainstay of any stable society.
Upgrade Your Cistern to a Water Tower
Upgrade Your Cistern to a Water Tower.

Let's begin with filtering our Water. To save on <link="15"><style="DefaultLink">Charcoal</style></link> we ought to ensure that at least a little bit of Water not contaminated by Radiation is being stored in our <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Water Tower</style></link>. Water gained from a <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Well</style></link> is never contaminated by Radiation, so it suggests itself for that purpose. Then we can use the remaining Charcoal to produce better Protective Clothing.

Good work! We are continuously taking steps towards being better and better equipped to be able to survive in this hostile environment. Filtered Water is a precious asset, and later on we can even use it to irrigate our Fields. But let's not get ahead of ourselves!
The Quest for Clean Water
Activate the Filter in Your Water Tower

Not only our Water can become a hazard for our Settlers due to Radiation: our Food can, too. We ought to erect a <link="11"><style="DefaultLink">Decontamination Post</style></link> to prevent Settlers from eating meals that are contaminated with Radiation.
Very good! The Decontamination Post is going to supply all Buildings that stockpile Food and are located in its working area in order to purify the Food that has been affected by Radiation.
Clean Food

It's true! We should never forget that even when we optimally prepare and protect ourselves, we're still going to lose friends and members of our families time and again. We're going to mourn them, come what may. But if we're able to bury them in a <link="8"><style="DefaultLink">Cemetery</style></link>, then we'll get over the pain and let them rest in peace.

Okay. The <link="8"><style="DefaultLink">Cemetery</style></link> will help us to quickly get a hold on ourselves and focus on the Tasks that lie ahead. It's not a pleasant thought, but that's the way things are. At the very least, we're pioneers, aren't we?! Maybe we ought to distract ourselves to lighten up the mood.
A Final Resting Place for Our Loved Ones

We can erect a number of Buildings to increase Confidence in our settlement, including, for example, a <link="8"><style="DefaultLink">Campfire</style></link> or a <link="8"><style="DefaultLink">Pub</style></link>. In this situation, however, our best option would probably be to upgrade our Town Center. Settlers can visit the new Town Center and, by doing so, increase their Confidence for a while.

Very good. The new <link="8"><style="DefaultLink">Town Center</style></link> not only gives us more Storage Space: at the same time it functions just like a <link="8"><style="DefaultLink">Campfire</style></link>, too. Settlers can visit the new Town Center and, by doing so, increase their Confidence for a while. Now that we have made efforts to ensure the spiritual well-being of our Settlers, we ought to attend to their physical Health as well.
A Place to Rest and Recuperate

Our Settlers can get sick from time to time. Settlers who have become infected with a Disease can die from it if they are not treated. Settlers will go to a <link="9"><style="DefaultLink">Medical Facility</style></link> to have themselves treated and will be admitted there, provided that beds are still available. We ought to ensure our Settlers' medical healthcare.
With this step we have ensured the survival of the settlement for a while. Very good work! Since more and more Children are being born these days, we should start to plan for the long term.
Medicine for Everyone

While <link="4"><style="DefaultLink">Cabins</style></link> are a good way to get Settlers to start a Family, they only provide limited space. This can quickly lead to people having to live on the street. Allow me to suggest to you that Cabins be provided only in a very targeted manner in order to control the population growth of your settlement. Nothing is worse than not having enough Resources to provide for everyone. We ought to build a <link="4"><style="DefaultLink">Shelter</style></link> to be able to provide other Inhabitants with a roof over their heads, too.

Very good! Remember that when Children grow up they're going to leave their Parents' house and look around for a new place to live. It might happen that they don't find any home at all. We ought to build a Shelter to be able to provide all Inhabitants with a roof over their heads.
Provide the Homeless with a Roof Over Their Heads

I've already pointed out to you that it could become very dangerous if we were to run out of Food at some point. Since a lot of people are going to be living in the new Shelter, we ought to provide them with an access to Food in their vicinity. A <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Hunting Lodge</style></link> can look for Wildlife in the surrounding area to bring a little Meat to the menu.

Perfect! The <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Hunting Lodge</style></link> equally provides us directly with Food, but it functions somewhat irregularly because it relies on Wildlife in the surrounding area. Nevertheless, it can be indispensable during a drought because even then Deer and Wild Boar still roam around the Forests.
Another Source of Food

However, Wild Animals can not only be shot, they can be captured, too. When a Wild Animal has been captured, it can be brought to a <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Pasture</style></link> and serve there as livestock. In order to capture Wild Animals you have to instruct your Hunter to do this. You also ought to set up a Pasture and assign a Herder.

Animals captured by a Hunter are brought to a Pasture where they are tended to and cared for by Herders. Some Animals produce Resources such as Milk or Eggs. Other Animals can only be slaughtered to eat. You ought to find out for yourself which type of Animal brings you which benefit. On each Pasture you can choose which type of Animal ought to be kept there.
Capturing Wild Animals

You must provide Water for the Animals you keep on your Pasture. This enables them to survive and reproduce. When enough Animals are fully grown the Herder will start to slaughter them. If you don't want Animals to be slaughtered you can also instruct the Herder not to do so.

Now your Herders know how they ought to handle the Animals. And now that you've already captured several Animals, don't forget to instruct your Hunters to hunt Animals again in the future so that they can continue to gather and provide Food.
Keeping a Herd

With our increased Production our Stockpile is going to run out soon. The supply routes for our Production Buildings are getting longer and longer, too. To tackle these problems you ought to build a <link="18"><style="DefaultLink">Temporary Storeroom</style></link> and have <link="1"><style="DefaultLink">Roads</style></link> laid out.

Good. <link="18"><style="DefaultLink">Temporary Storerooms</style></link> increase your settlement's general Storage Capacity. Place them in a targeted manner in order to shorten the routes for goods between your Production Buildings. <link="1"><style="DefaultLink">Roads</style></link> are equally a great benefit because Settlers moving on Roads can go distinctly faster than on a normal supporting surface.
Provide Additional Stockpiles and Roads

To improve the whole thing even further, we can build a <link="18"><style="DefaultLink">Market</style></link> to improve Logistics at the settlement. Besides being an enormous Stockpile for Resources that is even able to store Water, the Market is responsible for distributing Resources within your settlement. What's more, it also increases your Settlers' <link="8"><style="DefaultLink">Confidence</style></link>.

<link="18"><style="DefaultLink">Logisticians</style></link> are able to amass Resources from your whole settlement and bring them to the <link="18"><style="DefaultLink">Market</style></link>. This improves the flow of your Products and leads to your Settlers having to walk shorter distances to fulfill their individual needs. The combination of these attributes makes the Market the ideal Building when you want to enlarge or even relocate your settlement.
The Flow of Goods

The larger your settlement gets, the farther some Settlers have to travel to get to all of the Food you produce. To make life a little easier for them you can build <link="18"><style="DefaultLink">Food Station</style></link>. Logisticians who work at a Food Station will collect Food from your Storage Buildings and Production facilities and bring it to the Food Station.

With the new Food Station your Settlers are now able to supply themselves with Food directly on-site. If your settlement is supposed to grow even further you can think about whether you want to provide additional Food Stations.
Food Stations

Distributing Food at your settlement is going to prove to be extremely practical. However, your Settlers not only need Food to survive, they need Water, too. To be able to distribute Water in a targeted manner you can build a <link="18"><style="DefaultLink">Water Point</style></link>.

Now that your Settlers also have a Water Point available they can supply themselves with Water and Food. Similar to how it's done at the Food Stations, this enables you to precisely control at which places your Settlers are able to attend to their needs.
Water Point

Since we have our Logistics under control, now we can concern ourselves with the <link="7"><style="DefaultLink">Weather and its challenges</style></link>. We can build a <link="7"><style="DefaultLink">Weather Station</style></link> to enable us to make a forecast regarding upcoming Weather and learn if potentially contaminated rain might be coming our way. It can also be used to prepare our <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Crops</style></link> and <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Rainwater Collectors</style></link> we might have against contaminated rain by covering them.

Very good! Now that we know what sort of Weather awaits us and how we can protect ourselves against contaminated rain by covering our <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Crops</style></link> and <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Rainwater Collectors</style></link>, we ought to attend to collecting the Rain we want.
Weather Forecast

Rain not only <link="7"><style="DefaultLink">humidifies</style></link> the soil: it can also be automatically collected via <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Rainwater Collectors</style></link> to generate a steady flow of additional Water. Since we've already built our <link="7"><style="DefaultLink">Weather Station</style></link>, we're able to decide what kind of circumstances would make us want to cover our <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Rain Collectors</style></link>.

Never forget that our Settlers might get sick if we distribute Water contaminated with Radiation at our settlement, even if they're wearing Protective Clothing. We should make sure that the collected Water is as purified as possible.
Water from the Sky

We can have our <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Crops</style></link> covered to shield our Seedlings against Radiation. But once they've been covered, naturally they won't be irrigated with rain anymore. To rectify this problem we can build an <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Irrigation Plant</style></link> that is able to artificially regulate soil humidification. Place this building with care because it is only going to irrigate the soil within its impact radius.

Fabulous. As long as our <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Irrigation Plant</style></link> is supplied with filtered water it is able to neutralize a possible contamination of the soil due to Radiation. But watch out! When Water contaminated with Radiation is fed into the system, this can lead to precisely the opposite, and the Irrigation Plant itself may possibly cause radioactive pollution of its surrounding area.
Artificial Irrigation

Alongside contaminated rain there are other environmental hazards such as <link="7"><style="DefaultLink">Sandstorms</style></link> or <link="7"><style="DefaultLink">Droughts</style></link>. The soil dries out during a Drought, and Sandstorms sweep across the landscape from time to time. These Sandstorms can damage your buildings and ultimately make them unfit for use. We ought to prepare for this and assign several more Builders to enable potential damage to be repaired.

You can decide which type of Task your Builders ought to give priority to at our <link="7"><style="DefaultLink">Town Center</style></link>. You can instruct them to merely repair Buildings, to erect new Buildings, or do both at the same time. This enables you to react quickly in crisis situations, for instance in the event of a <link="7"><style="DefaultLink">Sandstorm</style></link>, you can quickly attend to having damaged Buildings repaired.
Get Ready for Repairs

Now that we've taken care of all the necessary needs of our settlement such as Food, Water, Protective Clothing and Tools, our next efforts ought to focus on increasing the settlement's overall Productivity. A Research Station allows us to develop different Technologies. One step in moving our settlement ahead is to make it possible for our Refiners to acquire Electronics from Scrap. We should perform Research on the appropriate Technology to achieve this and instruct one of our Refiners to produce Electronics.

Very good! With this new Research Station and the ability to acquire Electronics from Scrap we can provide our settlement with all the Materials we need. The Research Station is very useful in enabling us to adapt ourselves to our surroundings by using the right Technologies in any situation.
New Technologies

Down in the Endzone we dealt with the concept of a <link="13"><style="DefaultLink">Solar Collector</style></link>. This Solar Collector is able to collect sunlight and convert it into <link="13"><style="DefaultLink">Electricity</style></link>. We wanted to try out whether our idea works and build a Solar Collector.

The <link="13"><style="DefaultLink">Solar Collector</style></link> produces energy by capturing sunlight and feeding this energy into a grid. The Solar Collector also gives us all the relevant information we need to keep an eye on our settlement's Power Consumption.
Produce Electricity

Each of your Buildings automatically hooks up to this Power Grid when you set up an <link="13"><style="DefaultLink">Electric Power Pole</style></link> within the Building's range. Buildings supplied with Electricity work distinctly more effectively and produce faster as a result. What's more, housing supplied with <link="13"><style="DefaultLink">Electricity</style></link> increases the Confidence of the Settlers who use it.
Fantastic! I can only picture how our ancestors must have felt with their almost infinite supply of energy. However, you ought to constantly keep an eye on your Power Consumption to avoid outages.
Connect Buildings to the Power Grid

Logically, the <link="13"><style="DefaultLink">Solar Collector</style></link> is only able to produce energy during the daytime. It would be beneficial if we could also make Electricity available at night so that our settlement remains effective. It's clear that we currently work slower at night. So let's try to store the surplus energy we produce during the daytime to enable it to be used at night.

That looks good! Some Buildings are now connected to the Power Grid. Although a well-structured settlement that's hooked up to a Power Grid consumes a certain amount of Resources, it is enormously effective. Oh, and just as an aside, you can have Electric Power Poles put up on many surfaces, even on roads.
Store Energy

With a settlement producing on a stable scale, we can now focus on exploring our surroundings. Though we heard a bunch of stories in the Endzone, now we can explore the Ruins our ancestors left behind firsthand to find treasure and Resources. Let's build an <link="14"><style="DefaultLink">Expedition Station</style></link>.

Well done! Assign Settlers to be <link="14"><style="DefaultLink">Scouts</style></link> and prepare <link="14"><style="DefaultLink">Expedition Rations</style></link>. When you want to send off an Expedition you can decide the quantity of Expedition Rations with which to supply the Expedition. As a result you can control how long and how thoroughly it is able to explore a Ruin.
Build an Expedition Station

Let's send out a few <link="14"><style="DefaultLink">Scouts</style></link> to find a Ruin. The Scout will visit the Ruin you have designated and explore it. As a result the Scout will supply us with important information about the site that we should pay attention to when we start an Expedition.

Our <link="14"><style="DefaultLink">Scout</style></link> has returned and brought along a variety of useful information. Now that we know what we have to reckon with, we can put together a team in order to explore the Ruin more precisely.
Discover an Interesting Place

Each Ruin has its own challenges, secrets and valuable resources. Choose Settlers who fulfill the necessary prerequisites for the respective Ruin and give them enough <link="14"><style="DefaultLink">Expedition Rations</style></link> to take along. In addition, don't forget to equip them with Protective Clothing and Tools to the best of your ability before you send them off.

Now that you've commissioned the <link="14"><style="DefaultLink">Expedition</style></link>, it's now in the preparation stage. Expedition Rations and other necessary Resources are being amassed. Afterwards, the Settlers you selected will relinquish their old Tasks, assemble, equip themselves and subsequently set off together on their way. Get yourself ready to make tough decisions.
Prepare Yourself for an Expedition

Good news! Your <link="14"><style="DefaultLink">Expedition</style></link> has finally reached it's destination. Now it's all up to you. Contact them and listen to what they have to say to you. Make wise decisions and guide the Settlers through the Ruin with meticulous care.

Well done. Your decisions during an <link="14"><style="DefaultLink">Expedition</style></link> are decisive for its success. Try to be as well prepared as possible and make wise decisions, because the consequences could be fatal. Now let's loot this place and get out of here. Take as many Resources as your Settlers can carry and bring them back to your settlement.
Lead the Expedition

Now that you know how you can help your Settlers to manage in this environment so hostile to life, I'd like to show you how you can design your settlement in such a way so that your Settlers are not only able to survive in it: they're actually glad to be here, as well. Your Settlers are eager to live in surroundings that please them. For instance, they'd rather not live next to a Building that produces lots of noise or dirty grime. You can switch to the heat map of dwellings' Attractiveness to be able to see just how attractive the dwellings in your settlement are.

In this view you see which Cabins and Shelters have been placed in attractive surroundings and which ones are in unattractive surroundings. If you want to make your Settlers particularly happy you should pay attention to providing them with attractive surroundings.
Attractiveness

To increase the Attractiveness of a residential area you can put up some <link="20"><style="DefaultLink">Decorations</style></link> to beautify your settlement. Each Decoration increases the Attractiveness of the area where it has been placed. Maybe it's time for you to design your settlement a little more attractively to make your Settlers happier.

Your Settlers are really going to like the newly built Decorations. This way you can even manage to design a residential area attractively that's located near industrial Buildings. And with sufficient time and energy, even create a settlement where all your Settlers are glad to live in it.
Decorations

Although, living in a pretty neighborhood isn't the only thing that interest your Settlers. They want you to take care of their other needs as well. If you provide them with a <link="21"><style="DefaultLink">Forum</style></link> they'll make their wishes and request known to you. You can find out what means a lot to them there.
Excellent. Many of your Settlers' request are collected for you at the Forum. You ought to check every now and then whether you might be willing to agree to one of those wishes.
Forum

However, the Forum is not only responsible for enabling your Settlers to turn to you. At the Forum you can address them, too. You can issue Decrees and establish Rules at the Forum stating how your Settlers need to behave. This way, for example, you can ration Food and Water, or go so far as to prohibit your Settlers from reproducing in the near future.

Many of the Decrees are extremely helpful toward enabling the survival of your settlement. Though you should watch out that you don't demand too much of your Settlers. If you ask too much of them, it can lead to Discontentment spreading throughout your settlement. That's why you always ought to use caution in deciding which Decrees you want to impose.
Decrees
The Ammunition Factory

Although, such a thriving settlement like this one here not only has its advantages. It could be that the attention of prowling Raiders is drawn to you and you'll have to defend yourself against them. First of all it's going to be important to set up our own <link="23"><style="DefaultLink">Defenses</style></link>. An Ammunition Factory is going to be necessary to arm those Settlers who will be defending the settlement in the future. It would be best if several Technicians were also assigned right away who are supposed to work at the Ammunition Factory.

Very good. It's left up to you to decide whether you want to have your <link="23"><style="DefaultLink">Ammunition Factory</style></link> manufacture lethal or non-lethal <link="23"><style="DefaultLink">Ammunition</style></link>. While lethal Ammunition deals damage to the attacking Raiders, non-lethal Ammunition ensures that their Morale sinks. If the Raiders have lost all their Morale, they'll flee.
The Sulfur Mine

No matter what type of Ammunition you want to have manufactured, one thing can't be missing: your Ammunition Factory requires some <link="23"><style="DefaultLink">Sulfur</style></link> for Production. Sulfur can be obtained in your <link="15"><style="DefaultLink">Mines</style></link>. To do this, simply instruct your Mines to mine Sulfur in the future.
Very good, old friend! Now the Production of Ammunition can get going full steam ahead.
The Watchtower

To be able to give your settlement blanket protection against attackers, the next thing you want to do is to build several <link="23"><style="DefaultLink">Watchtowers</style></link> and assign <link="23"><style="DefaultLink">Militia</style></link> there. Your Settlers will fire at Raiders from these Watchtowers. It will be best if you place your towers in such a way that they don't stand too close to each other so that your entire settlement can be protected whenever possible.

Very good. These Watchtowers form the center of your defense. At each Watchtower you can individually configure the type of Ammunition the Militia who have been assigned there are supposed to fire at the Raiders.
An Attack

As you can see, the <link="23"><style="DefaultLink">Raider Force</style></link> is now on its way here. Pay attention to the direction they're coming from. You might have enough time to adapt your defense a bit. I'm going to keep my head down for the time being until those scoundrels don't bother the settlement anymore. Good luck!
It looks as if they were the last raiders. And the settlement's still standing! Well, it did get a few scratches here and there, but nothing we couldn't recover from.
Tribute

However, in many cases the Raiders won't be paying you a visit just like that without any advance warning and a reason. Most of the time they'll demand <link="23"><style="DefaultLink">Tribute</style></link> from you beforehand. If you can pay this Tribute they'll leave you in peace – that is, at least for a certain period of time. This time I want you to pay the Tribute the Raiders are demanding from you so that we can focus on rebuilding here at the settlement.
Very good! By doing so you've bought us a little time to enable us to prepare ourselves further.

I think the time has come at last for me to bow out as mentor. I've taught you everything I know, and you've proven yourself by keeping us healthy and in good spirits. I may have taken care of heading our last days in the Endzone, but now all my faith lies with you. I believe that you are going to lead us to a glorious future.
I'll do my best!
You've made it through the Tutorial. Now you can decide if you want to keep on playing this session or if you'd prefer to start again from the very beginning.
Continue playing

Okay, but you'll try to watch out for us, right?
We Don't Have Enough Water
Hey, chief! We're worried that our Water reserves might not get us through these hard times. Shouldn't we be collecting more?
It doesn't look good, chief! Our Water reserves are still pretty low.
Alright, chief, you did it! Our Water Carriers doubled their efforts and were able to collect even more Water than usual. With these kinds of reserves we'll definitely survive!
We Don't Have Enough Food
Our people are getting hungry. I think we should focus on gathering more Food. What do you think, chief?
Our people are still hungry, chief! I don't think we can keep this up for much longer.
We all knocked ourselves out, just as you instructed, chief. We worked day and night and were able to collect a large quantity of Food. Thanks, chief!
Our Settlers Are Low on Health
Health conditions in our settlement are decreasing rapidly. We ought to do something to prevent an Illness from breaking out.
Darn it, chief! That's not enough yet. We really need those Herbs to keep our Settlers healthy.
Since everyone joined in to gather Plants, we were able to distinctly increase our output for Herbs. Your quick acting saved us from hard times. Thanks, chief!
We Don't Have Enough Protective Clothing
Many of our Settlers are forced to move across this wasteland unprotected. We should boost our production of Protective Clothing.
I don't think this will be enough, chief! We really need this Protective Clothing to be able to survive.
It's a sure thing this new Tailor's Shop will do a wonderful job. We've already started Production and achieved the preliminary figures, chief!
We Don't Have Enough Tools
Professionals are complaining about a lack of Tools. Maybe we ought to build a Workshop to be able to ensure that everyone's working effectively?
If we don't receive any Tools to be able to work effectively, that diminishes our chances to survive. We do have faith in your decision, but sooner or later we'll need those Tools.
The new Workshop is up and ready for action. Our engineers made an extra effort to immediately do something against the shortage of tools. That will surely help us quite a bit. Thanks, chief!
We Don't Have Enough Housing
Our people are living on the streets, chief. We shouldn't let anyone sleep outdoors under these conditions.
This isn't good, chief. There are still too many people without a roof over their heads
People are pretty happy with their new homes. They'll move in and look toward a brighter future. Maybe our population will even grow. And there's also some material left over from construction.
Your Settlers' Confidence Is Low
Confidence at our settlement is declining. Maybe we ought to offer our Settlers an opportunity to relax.
We'll stick with it, chief. But having something cool to drink in a Pub would be really nice!

The Pub is truly a blessing. Lots of people are already starting to gather here and we decided to throw a little party. We've already started to supply beverages to be able to keep up with the increased consumption.
This Illness Is Nothing to Sneeze At
This Illness is gradually getting out of hand. If we don't provide any medical assistance, many of our settlers could die from it.
It's bad, chief, really bad. The next time something like this happens, we'll urgently need a Medical Facility.

Sick Settlers are being isolated from the rest of the population and brought to the new facility. Our doctors are working day and night to treat the patients and provide enough Medicine. They're already reporting intial successes. See for yourself, chief!
Our Settlers Are Exposed to Radiation
Many of our Settlers are complaining of symptoms that sound like excessive levels of Radiation. We have to make sure they're protected in this hostile environment.
If we're unable to protect ourselves against Radiation, our settlement will die out sooner or later. We really need Protective Clothing urgently and some way to take care of these poor people.

The new Buildings are up and ready for action. People complaining of symptoms are being treated, and a few of them were able to be saved in time before the damage was irreversible. You saved those people, chief! We're deeply indebted to you! Forever!
Incoming Radio Message

Hey, chief, we just picked up a radio message. There are survivors from another Endzone who are looking for a new home! They'll think about joining us if we can meet their high demands for housing, Protective Clothing and Rations. We really could use the additional workforce, but is it worth the effort at the moment?
Damn, we weren't able to collect enough Equipment and Resources for the outlanders. We let them know about this and they declined to join our settlement. The least we can do is wish them luck...
Amazing, chief! We've managed to meet all their demands and they're on their way to our settlement. Every helping hand makes us stronger! We should prepare a warm welcome for them.
Community and Living Space

We ought to make some space available to the outlanders to help them forget their long and exhausting journey. As a quick workaround, a Shelter would probably be the best solution. We could provide them with a Campfire, too.
I don't think the newcomers are going to feel that everything's rosy at the moment. But I think they'll do just fine. At least they have a place to stay.

Yeah, we hustled really hard to provide them with the best possible welcome to our new settlement. We'll take good care of them, chief! Oh, they said they had some Medicine with them that they want to share with us.

Good work! Remember that there are still other people out there. Maybe we can take them in as well. But be careful: If we grow too fast, our economy might take a tumble. That's why you'll have to make a tough decision too now and then.
If you say so, chief! It's probably better to attend to the needs of our own people. We've already got enough problems of our own.
Outlanders
Hunting Season
One of our Hunters tells us that the local Wildlife population is on the rise. We ought to take advantage of this opportunity to get some more protein on our tables.
Darn it! All that work for nothing. It’s a shame this didn’t work out the way we'd pictured it. Well… at least we haven't lost anything. Let’s just stick to focusing on the important stuff.

Our Hunters found some interesting plant remnants in the animals' stomachs while they were gutting them. One of our experts thought that we might be able to grow the Plants on our Fields if we could find an undigested specimen.
An Unusual Find
Why don’t we comb the Forests and search for that Plant, chief?
Darn it! All that work for nothing. It’s a shame this didn’t work out the way we'd pictured it. Well… at least we haven't lost anything. Let’s just stick to focusing on the important stuff.
Yes, chief! We actually found something. But this specimen is more of a small and weak one. We should handle it with the utmost care.
Grow Little Seedling, Grow
If we create an environment for the Seedling where it can grow safely, maybe it might pull through. If we construct a module for our Irrigation Plant, our Specialists think it has good chances.
Darn it! All that work for nothing. It’s a shame this didn’t work out the way we'd pictured it. Well… at least we haven't lost anything. Let’s just stick to focusing on the important stuff.
All the really hard work we did has paid off! We were able to accumulate enough Seeds to plant our Fields with it.
A New Seed
Now we ought to try to boost our agriculutural output right away. If we create a new Field, we'd be able to test the new Seed firsthand.
Darn it! All that work for nothing. It’s a shame this didn’t work out the way we'd pictured it. Well… at least we haven't lost anything. Let’s just stick to focusing on the important stuff.
I'd chalk this whole venture up as a fairly major success, chief! We've found a brand-new Seed and learned a lot from it.
Well, okay, chief. You're probably right. Hunting down more Wildlife at the moment could cause their numbers to severely decline again.
An Unsuspected Opportunity
Sick Outlanders
Incoming Radio Message

Hey, chief, we just picked up a radio message. Other survivors have asked if they'd be allowed to join our settlement. They fled from their own settlement because it was stricken with a severe illness. Some of them appear to be really sick and sound pretty despondent. Are we in a position to add them to our settlement and treat them properly? Or is that simply too risky at the moment?
That's not good! Without enough Medicine we're not able to guarantee our own Health. Under those circumstances we don't really want to take in the new Settlers, chief.
Good news. We were able to ramp up our Production of Medicine so far that we're able to treat the sick outlanders.
Create New Housing
Now we ought to take care of our basic needs. We should provide our new Settlers with some Cabins. The risk of a pandemic would be too high in a Shelter.
We weren't able to build enough Cabins in such a short time. If there's no housing the outlanders won't join our settlement.
We did it. We were able to build enough Cabins for all the newcomers.
Stock Up on Water and Food
Now all we have to do is increase our supplies of Food and Water.

Damn it, chief! We weren't able to stock up on enough Water and Food. Under those circumstances, some of our own Inhabitants are not willing to help the sick. They're afraid we might run into problems with our own Health.

Really good. Those poor sick people will now have a very good chance to recover from their Illness. With the supply of Water, Food and Medicine we've made available to them, they ought to truly feel cordially welcome here.
Yessiree, we did it!
It's really too risky for us at the moment, chief! We already have enough problems keeping our own people healthy, bright-eyed and bushy-tailed.
Epidemic
Investigate and Improve
Our doctors are experimenting with a new type of Medicine. I'm supposed to ask you on their behalf if we're able to provide them with more material for their research.
I don’t know if that's something we can ignore. But you're the chief! Hopefully something like that won't happen again in the near future.
We made a crucial error at our Medical Facility. Something went wrong with the experiments on the new type of Medicine. Now some of the Medics are reporting that they have strange symptoms.
Back to the Roots

The Medication at our Medical Facility isn't safe to use anymore. Looks like we'll literally have to go back to the roots this time. Luckily, some of us still know their way around the Plants and Herbs that grow in the local Forests.
I don’t know if that's something we can ignore. But you're the chief! Hopefully something like that won't happen again in the near future.
We've gathered enough Herbs to be able to produce a remedy against this new strange Illness. The problem is, we need to get into our Medical Facility to produce it.
Rehabilitation

Sending someone into the Medical Facility without Protective Clothing would be pretty brutal, chief! Even though our suits are really only supposed to shield against Radiation, they might protect us against germs, too.
I don’t know if that's something we can ignore. But you're the chief! Hopefully something like that won't happen again in the near future.
Our people made it to the Medical Facility and were able to manufacture an antidote. In the process they were forced to note substantial damage to the equipment. A lot of it won't be usable anymore.
A Fresh Start

Although we now have the Medicine we need, we don't consider the Medical Facility to be safe any longer. To prevent this Disease from being able to break out again under any circumstances, we'd be better off completely refittting the whole Medical Facility.
I don’t know if that's something we can ignore. But you're the chief! Hopefully something like that won't happen again in the near future.
It deeply pains us to have to destroy all the equipment. It took quite some time before we were in a position to finally get it all set up and going. But it can't be helped…
Well alright, chief! Better safe than sorry. Experiments are always dangerous, and we'd be better off sticking to what we know.
In the end we got off lightly and made it in one piece.
Old Tools
Useful Junk?
Our Scrap Collectors think they've discovered some old Tools in good condition at the Scrap Piles in our vicinity. We wanted to ask if they could get some support while searching?
We took a good look at everything everywhere and it looks like our Scrap Collectors were wrong. It's just the same old junk we know only too well...
We think we've gathered up everything. It's quite a lot of Scrap.
Sort Out the Good Stuff
Ready to roll, chief! All we have to do now is sort out all that stuff. If we instruct our Refiners to look for Metal we'll definitely find something.
We took a good look at everything everywhere and it looks like our Scrap Collectors were wrong. It's just the same old junk we know only too well...

Our Scrap Collectors were right on the money. In addition to all the useful Scrap we collected, we were able to sort out a whole bunch of old Tools that are still in pretty good shape. We can use them as if they were new.
Okay, chief, it's your call. We'll leave the Scrap be and focus more on the important tasks at hand.
Yeah, we did it!
Electrical Overload

There was a sudden overload in our Solar Collector. It looks like it was damaged. Some Electric Power Poles are affected, too. A few Settlers were injured during the accident. We should treat them as fast as possible.
We weren't able to give proper medical care to the injured. Before we continue to concern ourselves with the Power Grid, we'd be better off attending to the poor people.
Alright. The injured are being cared for. We don’t know exactly what happened, but it looks like we'll have to replace some parts on the Solar Collector and the Electric Power Poles.
Improvise, adapt, overcome
This time we want to do it right from the beginning. We should let our specialists find out exactly which parts we need.
It appears that we're not going to be able to find the right parts. Then we'll just have to work with what we've got.
We've assembled the right parts. The system ought to be considerably more stable in the future as a result. Even if nothing good emerged from all this, at least we learned something.
Better safe than sorry
Our specialists have found out what went wrong. In their opinion, a supplementary Battery should be able to prevent future overloads.
Unfortunately, the Battery wasn't finished on time. Well, let's just hope something like this doesn't happen again.

The new Battery is built and ready for action. We still have a few parts left over from the repairs on the old Electric Power Poles and the Solar Collector that we might still be able to use for a few other things.
If you say so, chief. At any rate... At least we'll be repairing the damage that has arisen. Maybe the whole thing was just a stupid coincidence… who knows?
Yeah, we did it!
Mysterious Barrels
Chief, one of our Refiners found some interesting Metal Barrels while he was looking through his Scrap. They're pretty heavy and filled with something. Should we open them?
We didn't manage to open those Barrels. It's a shame, there could've been something valuable inside ...
We opened the Barrels and guess what we found?! Lots of edible Food! Just what we need! It really was a good idea to take a closer look at those Barrels.

We opened the Barrels and guess what we found?! Lots of Food! But sadly the Barrels are highly contaminated with Radiation. In fact, the level of Radiation is so high that the whole area around the Recycler got contaminated …
Better safe than sorry. Who knows what would have awaited us inside those Barrels ...
The Long Summer

In the scenario called "The Long Summer", heat is your greatest enemy. While Radiation and other dangers lurk in the background, merciless periods of Drought lie ahead of you that steadily get longer over time as the cool-down phases in between get shorter and shorter.

I wish I had better news, but the way things look, hard times lie ahead of us. Just as the Radiation Levels approach a reasonably low intensity, the sun seems to be kicking up a notch. According to the latest calculations we're facing an unprecedented phase of heatwaves whose duration and intensity may increase more and more.
Good Preparation Pays Off...

It'd be best if you begin with the preparations right away - gather as much Food and Water as possible. And maybe now would be the right time to get the ventilators from the Endzone ... Which means move it, get to work. There's plenty to do before the first Drought sets in!
Very good! By being this well prepared we have the best chances to weather the first Drought successfully.
Unfortunately, we didn't manage to take all the necessary measures until the first Drought began. The settlement is doomed.
The First Ordeal
It's starting. Our gauges are showing a rapid rise in temperature. Let's hope we have enough supplies.
There you go, that wasn't so hard at all. The first Drought has been weathered!
That was that - the heat conquered our settlement. The first Drought alone was already too much for our little vulnerable Community.
A Moment of Respite
We have to quickly take advantage of the pause until the next Drought starts to gather sufficient new supplies.
Excellent! We've done our best and now face the next heatwave full of pride and confidence.
We've weathered the first Drought, but unfortunately we're not sufficiently armed for the next one. Sadly, this way we don't have any chance of surviving.
A Long Dry Spell

It looks like the coming Drought really is going to persist longer than the last one. But if the initial calculations are right, in the long term we can reckon with an end to this relentless hot spell - maybe even as soon as after the Drought that lies ahead. So get moving!
Made it! The temperature's finally dropping again! It won't be long before we can drink genuine fresh Water from a Lake, pick fresh Berries from bushes, and marvel at Wildlife in dense Forests again!
It's over, the sun conquered our settlement. After we survived the first heatwave, now we have to throw in the towel to this new, even more merciless period of Drought.
One Last Breather

Additional calculations have shown that another, a last heatwave on an epic scale lies ahead of us. So we have to get ourselves supplies again and do everything we can so that as many of us as possible live to see the end of this Drought.
Fantastic! We've done what we could and are now prepared as well as possible for this monster of a heatwave that's heading our way.
Darn it. Even though the end of this hell is already close at hand, we didn't manage to prepare ourselves well enough for this last Drought.
The Last Great Surge

For millennia mankind has faced nearly insurmountable enemies time and again. Yet these days our foe is equipped with neither armor nor weapons. Our enemy is the sun. Tales of this time shall be told and songs sung of it for centuries to come. About the time when human beings vanquished the sun! So get going, let's make history!
We've done it! The great wave of Droughts is over and done with!
It's all over, we failed. Despite our enormous efforts, we didn't manage to weather this unprecedented heatwave. Even though the end was within reach...

Just as we were about to lose all hope. Just as we had forgotten how cool, fresh Water tastes, how the rustling of leaves in a dense Forest sounds, and how juicy fresh Berries melt in your mouth, we did it. We have actually weathered what's probably the worst hot spell in the history of mankind!
With that, the scenario "The Long Summer" comes to a close. Now you can simply go on playing or switch back to the Main Menu.

The heat was simply too intense, too unbearable for our fragile Community. Hopefully other settlements will have more luck than we had, otherwise this hell on earth will probably mean the end of mankind.
Weather the first long Drought
Weather the second long Drought
Weather the last long Drought
The Bet
A New Hope
Shared Suffering
Rome Wasn't Built in a Day

As Inhabitant of a flourishing colony, you were chosen to start up another settlement in the immediate vicinity as an outpost. Having just arrived at the destination, you have unloaded your supplies and begun setting things up when horrible news reaches you. A terrible Disease has broken out in your home colony and already claimed numerous lives. The colony threatens to crumble apart because there are no longer enough healthy Inhabitants able to provide for a sufficient supply of Food and Water. You must act quickly and obtain large quantities of Water and Food in order to save the colony along with your remaining friends and relatives from certain death!

Hey, youngster, are you there? What's it like in your parts? You've surely heard what's going on here with us. I won't lie, the situation is serious. The Disease broke out shortly after your departure. We still don't know exactly what kind of Disease it is that we're dealing with, but the doctors under the direction of Doc Kennedy are working full steam on an answer. In the meantime you'll have to supply us from outside.
First Delivery

Please urgently send us Food and Water until the doctors have gotten the situation under control. Oh, and one more thing - I'm supposed to send regards from Susan and let you know that she's doing fine - and that she's sorry. Please hurry!

Thanks a lot, those supplies are truly a big help to us! Although our doctors still haven't found any suitable treatment for the Disease, meanwhile we do know that it's apparently a virus that infects both the upper and lower respiratory tracts.
<N/A>
Second Delivery

The streets are as good as deserted, the nights filled with the coughing of the sick and dying. Please make absolutely sure to send us some masks with the next delivery too in order to slow down the spreading of the Disease and give us more time to find a suitable treatment!
Thanks, that was a last-minute rescue! The good news is that the doctors have meanwhile identified the viral strain and we now know how we have to treat the Disease.
<N/A>
Third Delivery

The bad news is that we don't have sufficient Medication stockpiled and in the meantime over 60% of the Inhabitants are sick. In addition, our supplies have nearly completely run out. Please do everything in your power and send us one more last delivery - and make sure you don't forget the Medication!
Thanks, kiddo, you're our knight in shining armor! Just like the cavalry, you arrive at the last second and save the day!
<N/A>

With all these new supplies, masks and Medication the colony has been saved. When everything has gotten back to normal again here we'll await you and show our gratitude with a rip-roaring party in your honor!
Sadly, you didn't manage to rescue your home colony. With your demise, your fate has been sealed as well.
With that, the scenario "Shared Suffering" comes to a close. Now you can simply go on playing or switch back to the Main Menu.
Collect all Water and all Food for the first Toll
Collect all Water, all Food and all Equipment for the second Toll
Collect all Resources required for the third Toll

You've let yourself get talked into a daring wager with Arthur Sawchyn, your old friend and mentor. In the course of a cozy evening at the local Pub you've betted on who can get their hands on the most species of Plants in the form of Seeds from unexplored Ruins. The next day the two of you set off to start up new outposts, each with a troup of Settlers and some supplies. The race begins!
Say there, youngster, did I wake you up? We've found a fitting site and are in the process of setting everything up. I thought I'd give you a little head start to make things more interesting.
A Small Selection

Since I'm dead sure of what I'm doing, I'm going to put my feet up for the moment and read a bit until you've, let's say, found the first four Seeds. Until then I won't even start to believe that you've got it in you to be serious competition for me.
Wow, kiddo, not bad! Although I'd reckoned with you a lot earlier, what I always say is: Better late than never!
<N/A>
The Second Coup
Then let's get started. You'd better hurry up and gather a few more Seeds, because starting now two can play at this game!

My compliments, a number of seeds have already made it into your Collection. That's truly very good! How do you think my Collection is doing? Aaaah, not worth mentioning … until now all I've gathered are eight Seeds.
<N/A>
The Final Spurt

Oh, wait a sec... That's two more than you have. [...] Come again? Are you claiming you'll manage to find 10 different Seeds before I do? Don't deceive yourself there, kiddo! Okay, fine, that's the way you wanted it!
Well, I guess you can't win 'em all. You beat me fair and square.
<N/A>
Let's give credit where credit's due! I didn't reckon for a second with you actually snatching victory from right under my nose - Congratulations, kiddo! The next round's on me!
Ha! Sorry, my little young upstart, but I won! Now, don't let it get to you - it's no disgrace to lose againt the best!
With that, the scenario "The Bet" comes to a close. Now you can simply go on playing or switch back to the Main Menu.
Gather a small number of different Seeds
Enlarge your Collection of Seeds
Find the remaining Seeds required to win the Bet

Ever since they left the Endzones the people have been wandering around restlessly. Settlements are founded, Towns fall into decline and the Inhabitants move on. But you have bigger things in mind. You want to create a City that stands the test of time, that becomes the new established center of the world.

April 21st, 2184. When I was still just a little boy back then in the Endzone, my father always read something to me before I fell asleep. We didn't have that many books, but if I had my way I always listened to the stories about ancient Greece and Rome that my father read out loud to me with a great deal of enthusiasm. So it shouldn't be surprising that the thought occurred to me one day to give something back to the world that it had lost a long time ago: an Eternal City like Rome once was.
Phase I

Marcus Tullius Cicero once said: “The beginnings of all things are small.” And just like Rome wasn't built in a day, either, the center of the new world is going to need its own time to arise. Most of the settlements that have come since leaving the Endzones only last for several months to a few years. The goal meant for me is that this City we are founding today outlasts a human being's whole lifetime!

Our present date is April 17th, 2259. Nearly exactly 75 years ago my father founded this City based on the bold desire to offer new hope to mankind. To found a City that, unlike all the other settlements at that time, was supposed to be lasting. Today, 75 years later, this City still stands, even when you and my father have long since ceased to walk upon this earth anymore.
<N/A>
Phase II

And, as a tribute to him, we defy all the adversities and obstacles that life places in our way. My father founded this City and helped it to undreamt-of size and stability. I shall perpetuate the memory of him and keep this City along with its Inhabitants alive, whatever the cost!

The 3rd of May, 2334. More than 150 years ago the cornerstone of this City was laid by my ancestor, Aeneas Pathfinder. All the other Towns and settlements from that time have foundered over the course of time, but not ours!
<N/A>
Phase III

I take pride in gazing at my line of ancestors and all they accomplished. This City was once a dream that could only be talked about in whispers - just a bit louder and it would have burst like a soap bubble. That's how fragile it once was. And yet, over 150 years later the dream still lives on - and I shall make sure that people will still be able to dream in the future, too!

21st of April, 2434. Dear Fellow Citizens  - Today we are celebrating the 250th anniversary of the existence of our magnificent City. It has been a quarter of a millennium since my ancestor, Aeneas Pathfinder, built the first Homes, dug the first Wells, and laid out the first Fields here at this very site together with merely a few courageous men and women.
<N/A>

My ancestor's dream has come true. Our City is the light in the darkness of the modern history of mankind, a beacon of hope, a new Eternal City just as Rome once was. A long and very rocky road lies behind us and this metropolis - but I promise you one thing: This is nowhere near the end!

Despite the greatest of efforts, I have sadly not successfully managed to give the people a new home. My greatest wish was to erect a City for humanity that, solid as a rock, was supposed to endure. Yet today I am forced to realize that I have failed.
With that, the scenario "Rome Wasn't Built in a Day" comes to a close. Now you can simply go on playing or switch back to the Main Menu.
Survive 75 Seasons
Survive 150 Seasons
Survive 250 Seasons

Together with several like-minded souls you set off, out into the world, to create a new homeland for yourselves. For you, there's no doubt that strong population growth is the key to the long-term success of your settlement.
Aaah, wonderful, just look at the land around here! How often have we dreamed of being able to live in such a beautiful place. Hurry! Let's not waste time - we'll make sure that our dream comes true!
The First Step

The most important Resource in this world is not Wood, Food or even Water: it's the human being. We can't ever forget that. And since this Resource is our most valuable asset, we ought to take care of having as many of them as possible!
Very good, the beginning has been accomplished! The cornerstone for a healthy Town has been laid. Now we have to make sure that it's fortified and expanded further.
<N/A>
The Second Step
The flock of our citizens is growing steadily, but that's no reason to rest upon what's been achieved. The next milestone already awaits us.
Accomplished! I'm glad to see how our little Community is slowly but surely turning into a real metropolis.
<N/A>
The Last Step
It's not too far anymore and we're there. Just a few more Inhabitants and we've created a stable basis.
Accomplished! Fate hasn't always made it easy for us, but an iron will to survive and meticulous planning really do pay off in the end.
<N/A>
With so many Inhabitants our City has what it takes to face larger crises, too. Now we can confidently look forward to a glorious future ahead!
<N/A>
With that, the scenario "A New Hope" comes to a close. Now you can simply go on playing or switch back to the Main Menu.
Achieve and provide for a small Population
Achieve and provide for a medium-sized Population
Achieve and provide for a large Population
User-Defined
You are currently not using any preset or you've changed something. You can have the settings specified again at any time via the Options Menu.
Normal
Play a well-balanced but equally challenging game round using neutral settings.
Build Mode

All hazards are sharply reduced. Hardly any Radiation or other negative influences pose a threat to you. All game contents are available to you right from the start. You can focus all your efforts on building here.
Maximum Challenge
For Endzone veterans who are looking for the maximum challenge. Fight against a merciless environment under the most unfavorable conditions. Very difficult, but the journey is the reward!
No Trees
Start a normal, well-balanced game. Your greatest enemy is the scarceness of Wood because there are no trees located on the map!
No Lakes
Start a normal, well-balanced game, but completely without Lakes!
Easy Game
Start an easy game in which you still have to combat threats such as Drought. On the other hand, you have much more time to react and prepare yourself.
Relax & Discover
You can lean back here because hardly any dangers pose a threat to your settlement. You can set off on a discovery journey, enjoy the scenery and build away nice and relaxed.
Advanced Difficulty
This setting makes the game more difficult in comparison to a normal round. If you've already accumulated some experience, this mode presents you with a new challenge.
Map Code
The settings for this game session were preset via a map code.

A Vague Message

Hey, chief! We just picked up a radio message. Unfortunately, we're not able to make any kind of stable connection. We could try to improve the connection if we adjust our equipment a bit. But we'd need a few kinds of Materials to do that.
We've completely lost contact. If there really is someone out there, then we'll stay alert no matter what.
We've managed to make a stable connection. It apparently deals with survivors who were on the lookout for others, too.
Helping Hands
The survivors radioed that their supplies are low and they're running out of equipment. If we provide them with some Materials we can make it possible for them to get here.
Unfortunately, we were unable to provide the newcomers with everything. But even so, now they have a place they can call their new home.
The newcomers have been provided for and equipped by us. They still had some things with them that we can surely make good use of. Let's welcome our new Settlers.
It's probably better this way, chief! In the end, all it was were normal malfunctions and we're using up valuable Materials for nothing.
Strange Explorers

We've just been contacted by several Explorers from another settlement. They're on their way back from an Expedition and they're running out of Rations. They'd be willing to trade some of the things they discovered for provisions.
Unfortunately, we were unable to provide the team with anything. We had no other choice than to wish them the best and send them on their way.

That team was really lucky. If they hadn't run into us, there's a good chance they wouldn't have made it back home. In gratitude for our support they gave us a portion of the Seeds they discovered on their Expedition.
You're right, chief! We really do need our reserves for ourselves to be able to survive.
Got it, chief! It'd probably be best if we provide the team with new Rations.
