Unhappy Kids
Several Children in our settlement are unhappy. The harsh environment doesn't have much to offer for kids. The children are calling for new toys and Clothing that's better tailored to fit them.
Understandably, the Children are sad that you haven't fulfilled their wishes.
The Children are happy that you've responded to their wishes. That's a good sign, chief! Happy kids will lead to a better future for all of us.
The Children are very sad that you're not responding to their wishes. What's to do, chief? Surviving takes priority at the moment.
A very good idea, chief! After all, the Children are our future. You're right to try to make them happy.
New Medicine
Our Doctors are experimenting with a new type of Medicine. I'm supposed to ask you on their behalf if we can provide them with more Material for their Research.
Sadly, our Doctors weren't able to finish their Research. It wasn't possible for us to make sufficient Medicine available.
Our Doctors' experiments appear to be promising. Although, in their opinion they could still put more Materials to good use to make sure everything runs smoothly.
Quest for Herbs
When we prowl through the Forests and keep an eye out for more Healing Herbs, we might possibly find something that can help us.
Among the Herbs we gathered, unfortunately there was nothing that could help our Doctors make progress. Dismayed, we had to suspend the experiments.
Great news, chief. Thanks to the Healing Herbs that were provided, our Doctors were able to produce a lot of medical supplies! They'll definitely come in handy.
If you say so, chief! Better safe than sorry. Experiments are always hazardous and we're better off sticking to what we're familiar with.
Unknown Researchers

We've just been contacted by some Explorers from another settlement. They're on their way back from an Expedition and they're running out of Rations. They'd be willing to trade some of the things they discovered for provisions.
Sadly, we were unable to supply the team. We had no other choice than to wish them the best and send them on their way.

That team was really lucky. If they hadn't run into us, there's a good chance they wouldn't have made it back home. In gratitude for our support they gave us a portion of the Resources they discovered on their Expedition.
You're right, chief! We really do need our reserves for ourselves to be able to survive.
Got it, chief! It'd probably be best if we provide the team with new Rations.
Angry Settlers
General discontent caused riots to occur in our settlement. The rampaging Settlers damaged several Buildings in the course of the riots.
We'll have to attend to repairing the damaged Buildings. Maybe it also wouldn't be a bad idea to do something to combat the awful mood.
Missing Mother
The Children we rescued mentioned that they had been separated from their mother. Maybe we ought to draft a radio message in order to search for her? What do you think, chief?
Since we haven't been able to transmit any radio message till now, I don't thnk anyone's going to get in touch with us. At least the kids are safe and sound.

We received a reply to our radio message. Although we weren't able to find the two kids' mother, the settlement they come from picked up our bulletin. It looks like the mother had no chance of surviving the wild animals' attack. Her remains were found a few miles outside the other settlement.
A Better Home

Apparently the conditions in the other settlement tend to be worse. The other Settlers are asking us to take care of the Children here. If we can assure them that the Children will have good lives here, the others are willing to send us the rest of the mother's belongings.
Under these circumstances the foreign Settlers are not willing to hand over any of their meager Resources to us. That's a shame, chief! We could've put the additional support to good use, too.
The strangers are convinced that the kids are plainly doing better in our settlement than they were in their own. The rest of the mother's belongings will help enable all of us to survive!
You're probably right, chief! It'd be better if we didn't get the kids' hopes up for no reason. In this wilderness it's highly unlikely that anyone can survive on their own, anyway.
All set, chief. We'll transmit the radio message and hope that someone gets in touch.
You've just begun to establish a new settlement when the meteorologist in your group points out particularly menacing weather conditions to you that call for preparations to be made quickly.
Hey chief, I know we've just arrived and you probably have enough to do with forging ahead with setting up the settlement, but this here is important.
Rainy Season

I'm Susan Melfi, a meteorologist. To put it briefly: According to my observations, a series of highly radioactively contaminated cloud banks is moving directly towards us. The smallest and luckily weakest cloud bank is moving fastest and ought to reach us soon - we have to make provisions quickly and provide our Settlers with sufficient Protective Clothing!
Okay, so much for our period to prepare. The first clouds are gathering on the horizon back there - let's hope that we've prepared well enough!
Oh my god, what have we done? The Rain is going to kill all of us! If we'd only made better use of the time that was available to us to get prepared … it's the end …
Rainy Season

It's starting, the first radioactively contaminated raindrops are falling on our settlement. Now the motto is to hang tough and hope that we weather the first wave of precipitation safely! If I were you, this time I'd make an exception and not go dancing in the Rain.
Very good, we've made it this far! And it was easier than we thought!
Oh my god, what have we done? The Rain is going to kill all of us! If we'd only made better use of the time that was available to us to get prepared … it's the end …
Rainy Season

However, the next cloud bank is already heading our way. Due to its larger spread it's slower and consequently had more time to soak up Radiation in contaminated zones. Which means we'll have to increase our efforts if we want to survive this even more hazardous approaching rain shower.
Here we go, the new clouds are there, the Rain's about to pick up steam. Better get the umbrellas out, it's going to get very unpleasant!
Oh my god, what have we done? The Rain is going to kill all of us! If we'd only made better use of the time that was available to us to get prepared … it's the end …
Rainy Season
And the heavier rainfall is already coming down. As expected, this time the Radiation is measurably higher than it was the first time. Hopefully this whole thing has been weathered soon.
We did it! That was by no means a walk in the park. We can truly be proud of ourselves.
Oh my god, what have we done? The Rain is going to kill all of us! If we'd only made better use of the time that was available to us to get prepared … it's the end …
Rainy Season

But the biggest chunk still awaits us now. If my calculations are correct, this cloud bank is roughly the size of the region that was once Russia! We have to do everything in our power to prepare ourselves as fully as possible. Forget the myth about fleecy clouds like sheep. What's heading our way is a genuine monster but shaped like a cloud!
Okay, hopefully you've all engrained it well in your mind's eye what the sun looks like, because we're not going to be seeing it anymore for a heck of a long time.
Oh my god, what have we done? The Rain is going to kill all of us! If we'd only made better use of the time that was available to us to get prepared … it's the end …
Rainy Season

The sky is getting even darker. Quick, put on your Protective Clothing, it's going to get really dangerous now! The gauges on my instruments are pinned so high there's no more room! What's coming down on us now may look like Rain, but the truth is it's a liquid combination of incredible pain and agonizing death.
It's over, we've survived - we actually survived it!
Oh my god, what have we done? The Rain is going to kill all of us! If we'd only made better use of the time that was available to us to get prepared … it's the end …
All these people owe their lives to you - thanks a million, chief! If it wasn't for you this settlement would now be one big wet cemetery. You've truly accomplished something great here!
Oh my god, what have we done? The Rain is going to kill all of us! If we'd only made better use of the time that was available to us to get prepared … it's the end …
With that, the scenario "Rainy Season" comes to a close. Now you can simply go on playing or switch back to the Main Menu.
Survive the slightly contaminated Rain
Survive the mid-range contaminated Rain
Survive the highly contaminated Rain

As the leader of an Expedition you establish a new settlement in a region where there are nearly no Water Resources anymore. Surrounded by nothing other than dried-up earth and Radiation, it's up to you to create a flourishing town in this extremely hostile area. But luckily an old friend is accompanying you on this journey into the unknown ...
So, here we are, kiddo. Welcome to the badlands. Nowhere else on Earth are you going to find less Water and Life than you will here. Yes, sir, we've picked ourselves one fine challenge, haven't we?
Desert Flower
Then let's get to work. The little Water we have isn't going to last all too long, so our first objective has to be to set up a stable Water Supply.
Very good. With this supply of Water our colony's survival is assured for the time being.
Unfortunately, you didn't manage to collect sufficient supplies of Water in the short time.
Desert Flower
The next thing we have to do is to attend to our Food. Because here too our supplies are gradually running out.
Excellent, with that our Settlers' supply of Food is safeguarded for quite a while, too.
Unfortunately, you didn't manage to gather sufficient supplies of Food in the short time..
Desert Flower

Now that we've accumulated sufficient supplies of Water and Food, what do we still need to be able to make long-term progress with building our Settlement? Precisely - construction material. And what would be more suitable than the renewable Resource Wood?
Excellent, you've made the impossible possible. You've created a veritable oasis in the midst of a dry-as-dust landscape!

A good leader knows when the time has come to give up. Sadly, we didn't manage to accumulate the Resources we would need to be able to survive in this hostile territory in the short available time span.
And that's why you deserve the greatest respect. Thank you so much for your unwavering commitment!
We have no other choice than to beat a retreat. But we'll come back again - the next time we'll do it better!
With that, the scenario "Desert Flower" comes to a close. Now you can simply go on playing or switch back to the Main Menu.
Provide your settlement with Water

Knowledge Is Power

Hey, chief! One of our Settlers came up with an idea. He wants to use the filter system in our Water Tower for a few experiments to learn more about the correlation between Radiation and our Water supplies. We have to shut down our Water Tower's filter system to enable the experiments to be carried out. But as soon as we're finished we ought to activate the system again right away.
Our experiments flopped. Unfortunately, the filter system was damaged in the process… We're sorry, chief.
The experiments displayed very promising results. We can definitely put this accumulated Knowledge to good use.
You're right, chief! It's probably better if we don't conduct any experiments and focus on what's certain instead.
We have to shut down our Water Tower's filter system to enable the experiments to be carried out. But as soon as we're finished we ought to activate the system again right away.
A drought without water?
The landscape is going to dry out soon, chief! And we already don't have much Water left in reserve. We urgently ought to do something.
It looks bad, chief! Our reserves are still really low. Hopefully we'll survive this somehow.
We've doubled our efforts to stay on the safe side, chief! The reserves ought to hold out for a while, at least we hope they do...
I don't think we can ignore this, chief! We urgently need Water!
Alrighty, chief! We'll do our best!
A Drought Without Food?
The landscape is going to dry out soon, chief! And we already don't have much Food left in reserve. We urgently ought to do something.
It looks bad, chief! Our reserves are still really low. Hopefully we'll survive this somehow.
We've doubled our efforts to stay on the safe side, chief! The reserves ought to hold out for a while, at least we hope they do...
I don't think we can ignore this, chief! We urgently need Food!
Alrighty, chief! We'll do our best!

Old Shafts
Our Miners have found an old tunnel. It's blocked by debris, but we think we can break through if we try. We just wanted to check with you first.
Breaking through proved to be harder than imagined. We sadly had to abandon the venture due to reasons dealing with safety. We're sorry, chief.

Bad news, chief. The old tunnel was apparently used as a final repository for nuclear waste. We had to cave in the tunnel. Unfortunately, some of the Radiation was still able to leak out and the first Miners are already reporting symptoms.
Bad News
We ought to give our attention to looking after the contaminated Miners.
It doesn't look good, chief. We sadly weren't able to help those poor people in time. They'll just have to live with the high dose of Radiation...

Balanced Diet
Hello, chief. Our Settlers are complaining that their diet is very lopsided. They'd be glad if you were able to organize more variety into their meal plan.

Excellent, chief! Our Settlers are really happy with the new meal plan.

Very good, chief! I'm sure our Settlers are going to be glad to hear this news.
Coal Mining
Mining Coal at a mine is considerably more efficient and conserves more Resources than Coal production from a Charcoal Kiln. This Technology additionally unlocks the Building "Mine".
Mining Iodine

This Technology enables Iodine to be extracted at Mines. Iodine can be used at Medical Facilities to produce Iodine Tablets that can be consumed by Settlers to free themselves of Contamination. This Technology additionally unlocks the Building "Mine" and the product "Iodine Tablets" for Medical Facilities.
Mining Tunnel Construction

As a result of this Technology our Miners are able to force deeper tunnels into the surrounding Mountains. That will make it possible for us to be able to place our Mines closer to each other without their working areas mutually influencing each other's Productivity while extracting Resources.
Reinforced Backpack
With the reinforced backpack Explorers are able to take along more Resources on an Expedition or transport them back from a Ruin to the settlement.
Improved Radio Mast
Using the improved radio mast at our Trading Post we can contact Traders in a targeted manner. That enables us to choose the next Trader who lands at our settlement.
Defense Strategies
This Technology unlocks the Buildings Watchtower, Ammunition Factory and Mine along with the product "Sulfur". These Technologies serve toward defending against Raiders.
Fish Feed
This Technology enables our Fishermen to lure more Fish. As a result, Fishing Huts can be placed closer to each other without their working areas mutually influencing each other's Productivity.
Pipe System

Well shafts are built more accurately using this Technology. As a result, Wells and Electric Water Pumps can be placed closer to each other without their working areas mutually influencing each other's Productivity when obtaining Water.
Unknown technology
This technology will automatically be explored as soon as the expedition in the North has been fully completed.
This technology will automatically be explored as soon as the expedition in the East has been fully completed.
This technology will automatically be explored as soon as the expedition in the South has been fully completed.
This technology will automatically be explored as soon as the expedition in the West has been fully completed.
Lem's useful devices

Whether it's a blender, a scale or a pasta machine, Lem's useful devices will increase the efficiency of food preparation from now on. As a result, less food and water is lost during processing, reducing the use of resources throughout the settlement.
Improved power systems

All power systems in the settlement benefit from the knowledge the expedition gained while repairing the ship. As a result, electricity production and battery capacities are significantly increased across the board.
Durable structures

The settlement's buildings are now also reinforced with the battle-tested structures that were used to defend the platoon in the desert. This will increase their resistance to raider attacks and sandstorms in the long run.
Regular gathering of the merchants

Since Ole started regularly inviting his fellow merchants to jovial gatherings in his bar, the cheerful atmosphere has also had an effect on the prices at the trading post. From now on, goods can be purchased at a lower price. The lively discussions at the regulars' table also have a positive effect on the logistics within the settlement. Proper stocking increases the capacity of all warehouses.
Resources in this Inventory can be freed from contamination via Decontamination Kits. <<amount>> Resources can still be purified via the stockpiled Decontamination Kits.
Radioactively Contaminated Water
A major portion of the Water reserves we've stockpiled seems to be contaminated, chief! We urgently ought to do something about it so that our Settlers stay healthy.
That's not good news at all, chief. Our Settlers ought to be exposed to as little Radiation as possible.
We're making good progress, chief. Our Filter systems are working at full speed to keep our Water clean.
Is that really such a good idea? But it's your call, chief!
Got it, chief! It'd be best if we were able to filter the stockpiled Water.
Radioactively Contaminated Food
A major portion of the Food reserves we've stockpiled seems to be contaminated, chief! We urgently ought to do something about it so that our Settlers stay healthy.
That's not good news at all, chief. Our Settlers ought to be exposed to as little Radiation as possible.
We're able to report initial successes, chief. Our Decontamination Post is working as fast as it can to keep our Food clean.
Is that really such a good idea? But it's your call, chief!
Got it, chief. It'd probably be best to build a Decontamination Post that takes care of the radioactively contaminated Food.

Exodus

Many of our Settlers are convinced that our Community is no longer able to survive. Some of them have offered that they could leave the settlement to at least ensure the survival of the remaining Population. We feel that making this decision asks too much of us, chief, and would like you to decide.
We hope for our friends that they'll manage out there in the wilderness. As a result of their willingness to go we're able to redistribute the remaining Resources we still have.
You're right, chief! We won't leave anyone behind! We'll endure and get through this together!
A Rebellion

A rebellion occurred at our settlement. Some of our Settlers were injured during the riots, chief! We urgently ought to do something to change the poor morale at our settlement so that something like this doesn't happen more often.
With such a bad mood at the settlement it's no wonder that riots occur. You ought to see to it that the Confidence of your Settlers is increased, chief!
Thirsty Thieves

We have a problem, chief! We've just been forced to realize that some of our Resouces have been stolen. Our Settlers are looking toward the future with so little Confidence that they'd rather watch out for themselves than that everyone survives! This here is the list of the things that were stolen.
Things like that might happen more often when the mood is grim. I think you ought to keep an eye on that, chief!
Relax a Bit for a Change
Our Settlers want to improve their living conditions. Now that basic supply is running fairly smoothly, you should also give us the opportunity to relax.
It's not being received particularly well to promise the people you'd lend an ear to their wishes and then don't fulfill them. Our Settlers are pretty unhappy with this situation.
We're glad that you've responded to our wishes, chief! We're certain that together we'll be able to live well in this inhospitable world!
Your decision is not exactly falling on sympathetic ears. Our Settlers don't want to just work themselves to the bone all the time, especially since there's a sufficient supply of everything, chief!
No One Should Have to Live This Way

In our Settlers' opinion, the situation can't exist that some of them have to live on the street and don't wear any Protective Clothing while others are doing just fine. They want you to change something about that.
There are still Settlers who have to live under adverse conditions, chief! These people had really hoped you'd pay attention to their wishes.
We're really glad we've got you, chief! With you in charge, we believe we can lead a halfway reasonable life in this wasteland! And that means together, all of us!
Your Settlers are seriously asking themselves whether their well-being matters enough to you. It's not particularly helpful for the mood in general to simply ignore their wishes.
A Celebration
Our Settlers came up with the idea to organize a festivity to be able to celebrate that we're still here on this planet and are jointly re-establishing civilization.
Many Settlers are gravely disappointed that it didn't work out with the celebration. It didn't exactly do much good for the mood here, chief!

The Settlers are truly satisfied with your decision to treat them to their celebration! Many of them drank a toast to your well-being, chief! And tomorrow we'll go to work with even more pep in our step!
Your refusal disappointed a lot of Settlers. They'd actually thought that you'd allow them to live their lives a bit more relaxed for a change, chief! At least for a little while...
The Way To Someone's Heart Is Through Their Stomach

Although the mood at our settlement is fairly bright, it could still be a bit better. I'd suggest that you slightly improve the Population's quality of life, chief! If we could add more variety to designing the meal plan that would definitely make a lot of our Settlers happy. We should also ensure that Settlers have access to clean Water.
It's a shame it didn't work out. It surely would've done a world of good for the mood at the settlement!
Excellent, chief! The new Foods are not only tasty, they're healthy, too! Our Settlers are better protected against Diseases through a balanced diet.

Anything you say, chief! However, you should watch out that your Settlers are happy, and a balanced diet is a good step in that direction. They'd not only be happier as a result, they'd live healthier and get sick less often, too.
A Brighter Future
Our Settlers believe that their basic supply is safeguarded. They think the time has come to do something for culture and our quality of life, too. After all, we want to live and not merely survive.
We don't fully understand why you promise to pay attention to our needs on the one hand, but don't really do anything to achieve that on the other. At any rate, we're not happy about it.
That's really wonderful. The new Clothing and new Tools are very welcome additions for us. Thanks for watching out so well for us, chief!
It's your call, chief! Nevertheless, the Settlers would've certainly been pleased if their quality of life had increased a bit.
Stockpile Supplies

Basically we're doing quite well, chief! We have everything we need for our survival. But some of us still think there could be a bit more, after all. That group wants to stay on the safe side so that we have supplies when bad times come, too. Actually, not a bad idea at all...
Unfortunately, we weren't able to make the numerous voices happy. Now expressions of discontent keep cropping up among the Settlers every now and again, chief.
Your Settlers are extremely pleased that you've made sure that we were able to work so well with what we've got in stock. The mood at the settlement is getting better and better.

The decision not to make provisions didn't go down particularly well with the Settlers. It just doesn't sound very trustworthy when the person who's supposed to be in charge of us doesn't want to take precautions...
A Test for the Economy

Your Settlers are very satisfied, chief! To enable their good mood to be pepped up even further, I'd suggest that we fit them out with the best Equipment we could manufacture. However, that might end up being a major burden on our economy! It's your call, chief!

Unfortunately, that didn't work out so well, chief. Now many of them are asking themselves why so much energy was spent on producing the very very best despite the other problems we have, too. Apparently the idea has sadly backfired...
Awesome, chief! The Settlers are overjoyed about the new Equipment. They're particularly pleased that, even though the burden was great, you showed them that our economy is still able to function.
In other words, better safe than sorry! You're probably right, chief!
The Land of Milk and Honey

We're doing damn well, chief! Despite all the stones that life has laid along the face of our path, we're looking very confidently toward the future. We think the time has come to create our own "land of milk and honey." Would a sumptuous meal be too much to ask?
It didn't occur to us that we'd be disappointed with regard to this humble request. We merely wanted to treat ourselves to something, but apparently that was asking too much.
Take a look at that, chief! Our Warehouses are full of delicacies. It's a feast!
Our settlement is flourishing and we're still supposed to eat the same stuff day in, day out? A little bit of luxury would've hit the spot, chief.
Since we're doing better from one day to the next, we can certainly allow ourselves a bit of diversion to while away the time.
We wouldn't have thought that we'd be so disappointed. We merely wanted to treat ourselves to something, but apparently that was asking too much.
The specialties we've allowed ourselves are a delectable treat. We feel like we've been transported to another era. Thanks, chief!
On Solid Foundations

We are very content and also confident that we'll be doing well in the future, too. Yet we still have to reside in these old shacks. At least a few of us would've deserved to live in a better home. Can you take care of that, chief?
The way it looks, we're still not ready to enjoy our prosperity to the utmost yet. Then we'll just keep on living like we have until now, even though it's hard for us.
Our new Houses have been completed, chief! Shouldn't be any problem to cope with that.
A House with solid walls that we don't have to sweep clean after every Sandstorm is apparently going to remain a dream. Even when happiness is just a few strokes of a hammer away.
Decorations

We don't want to sound like we're complaining, but our settlement isn't exactly the prettiest. Isn't it about time to improve the quality of our lives? A few decorations would certainly do wonders, chief.
It's a shame that the beautification of the settlement couldn't be brought to completion. That's a real downer for us, chief.
Our settlement is revealing itself to be one heck of a beauty, chief. A magnificent sight!
A beautification of the settlement probably plays no role in this world battered by Radiation and natural catastrophes. That's a real downer for us, chief.
A Light for Nighttime
Your Settlers are very pleased about the possibility to finally be able to generate Electricity. In their opininion, now you also ought to see to it that you supply their homes with Power, chief!
Unfortunately, there are still Houses that don't have a hook-up. Your Settlers are not exactly pleased about not having gotten what you promised them.
Just look at how beautiful our settlement looks at night now, chief! Really living well is no problem at all here! Thanks a lot, chief!
Our Settlers aren't exactly what I'd call happy about your decision, chief… Lots of them still think that they deserve to have a higher quality of life after all the hardships.
Bad Weather Forecast
Our weather forecasts seem to have been wrong, chief! The way it looks, there's going to be tons of contaminated Rain in the near future! We ought to get ourselves well prepared for that, chief!
This Radiation could become truly dangerous. Hopefully we've prepared well enough for it, chief!
Unpredicted Droughts
Our weather forecasts seem to have been wrong, chief! The way it looks, a longer wave of Droughts is headed our way! We ought to get ourselves well prepared for that!
Hopefully it won't throw us too far off track, chief! We should always be prepared for anything that comes!
Vermin
Vermin have infested some of our Warehouses and Depots. We sadly had to throw away a great deal of our stockpiled Food reserves.

Guess we'll have to live with it for the time being. Our Storage Buildings and Warehouses just happen to be the biggest sources of Food far and wide. Not only for us. That really got screwed up, chief!
Mining of Coal researched: <<amount>>

Our Researchers have an idea to try their luck with a new Technology. Their idea is to develop a Mine that enables us to extract Coal from the surrounding Mountains. They want your permission to be allowed to commence their studies.
Tunnel engineering researched: <<amount>>

Our Researchers have an idea to try their luck with a new Technology. Their idea is to develop a technique that enables our Miners to dig deeper tunnels so that more Mine shafts can be erected close to each other. They want your permission to be allowed to commence their studies.
Kitchen researched: <<amount>>

Our Researchers have an idea to try their luck with a new Technology. Their idea is to design a Kitchen where we are able to process our accumulated stocks of Food efficiently. They want your permission to be allowed to commence their studies.
Our First Settlers

We've been back on the surface again for quite a while now, chief! All of us were born up here! Although, without the first Settlers who still came from the Endzone we never would've made it here. Some of our Settlers came up with the idea to put up a monument to those Settlers so that we never forget where we all come from.

It's a shame we haven't been able to erect the statue until now, chief! To be honest, we don't want to forget the first Settlers. Don't you think maybe we could still get this finished in the near future, after all?
Our Settlers are very happy about the new memorial. Here we're able to see just how far we've gotten, despite everything. And without the first Pioneers we never would've made it this far!
That's a real shame, chief! I think it would boost our Settlers' morale if we could use this statue to show them how far we've already come.
Lots and Lots of Children

Lots of Children were born recently, chief! We have to watch out that our Settlers are equally able to sufficiently provide for this up-and-coming generation. Maybe it would be better to notify the Settlers that in the near future they shouldn't have any more Children at first. What do you think, chief?
Since you haven't issued any instructions until now, chief, our Settlers are assuming that everything's just fine. If that's not the case, then maybe you ought to take action, after all.
Okay, chief, we're going to stop having any more Children until you tell us differently. Don't wait too long so that your Settlers don't get too old.
All set, chief! But even so, you ought to keep an eye on developments and take action later on as needed!
We're Getting Older and Older

Many of our Settlers are getting older and older, chief! A lot of them think the time has come again to provide for offspring so that our settlement doesn't go under due to overaging. We ask you to provide us with dwellings in order to have Children, chief!
You still haven't given us any answer, chief! Many of us are truly worried that we're all getting older and older and no next generation will follow.
Thanks a lot, chief! We really do need a new generation of offspring to be able to survive in this barren landscape in the future, too.
We don't think that's a good idea, chief! If we don't provide for up-and-coming generations, then sooner or later we're going to suffer for it. We disagree with your decision!
No Ale Before Four

Hey, chief, our local drunkard told us that he previously worked as Pubkeeper in another settlement. Although the settlement ultimately had to be abandoned because the surroundings were contaminated with Radiation, they planted and farmed Wheat, brewed Ale and ran a Pub there. The Settlers liked it and it apparently strengthened the sense of solidarity, too! What do you think, chief? Wouldn't we be able to handle a beer after work every now and then, too? After all, at least we have the right Seeds now!
We were really looking forward to a nice cold glass of Ale, chief! It's a shame it didn't work out...
Wonderful! At last a place to recover from the daily trials and tribulations and look back on the day. You're naturally entitled to the first beer, chief - let the partying begin!
It's a shame, but of course you're right, chief. There are obviously more important things than a cheerful glass of Ale in a cheerful Pub. Oh well, there's no law against dreaming, right?!
Off The Hook But Not Off The Rack

Hey, chief, our little excursion gave me a bright idea: Now that we have a tailor's dummy and Cloth, maybe we ought to take advantage of the new Equipment to provide our Tailors with an opportunity to try out new techniques.
Unfortunately, the new techniques and new Equipment didn't prove to be particularly helpful. We didn't really get anywhere with our tests. What a shame, chief!
Awesome! Our Tailors were able to make a few extra Neck Scarves right away.
Thought it'd be a good idea, but so much for that. Hopefully we won't get any contaminated Rain!
The next thing the Tailors are eager to try their luck on are Activated Carbon Masks. But besides Cloth we'll also need loads of Coal to do that.
Unfortunately, the new techniques and new Equipment didn't prove to be particularly helpful. We didn't really get anywhere with our tests. What a shame, chief!
That seemed to have worked pretty well, too. Their new work steps enabled our Tailors to accumulate a lot of experience.
We're wholeheartedly on top of this and don't want to stop here yet. Our Tailors' next target is to try their luck on testing Radiation Suits. But they still need some more Plastic to do that.
Unfortunately, the new techniques and new Equipment didn't prove to be particularly helpful. We didn't really get anywhere with our tests. What a shame, chief!
Fantastic! It was a brilliant idea of yours to allow us to try out new techniques. At any rate we've learned a great deal for the future.

Feast

Some of your Settlers came up with the idea to distribute some of our reserves to the Inhabitants so that they can all have a real feast again for a change. Do you think we can treat ourselves to that, chief?
Thanks a lot, chief! That will surely improve the mood in our settlement!
No problem, chief! We fully understand that a luxury like that isn't possible at the present time. Would've been nice, though…
No Education Opportunities
Our Children don't have any place where they can learn how to survive in this hostile environment sensibly and effectively. We ought to make sure that they can go to school, chief!
We still don't have any possibility to educate our Children, chief! That could really become a problem!
At the new School our offspring can learn everything they need to survive in this settlement! It was really good that you built the School, chief!
I don't think that's a good idea, chief! If our Children don't learn what they need to survive, it's going to set your settlement back a long way!
Unscheduled Types of Research

Hey, chief! Our Researchers have come up with a new idea. They're not quite sure yet whether their plan could work. If you could provide them with a few Materials they'd commence with their types of Research. Maybe that would get us quick results.
Awesome, chief! Our unscheduled Research has been crowned with success. We can surely put this Technology to good use in order to survive in this world.
Whatever you say, chief! Then we'll go back to devoting ourselves to our normal work schedule again!
Field Testing

Hey, chief! Our Researchers have come up with a new idea. They're not quite sure yet whether their plan could work. If you could provide them with a few Materials they'd begin with some tests right away!
Awesome, chief! These new tests have brought us a load of empirical experience. We can certainly put this new Knowledge to good use if we devote ourselves to our Research!
Whatever you say, chief! Then we'll go back to devoting ourselves to our normal work schedule again!
But No Contaminated Food!

There was nothing pretty about the fate that awaited the two of them there! Maybe we ought to take a few precautions so that our Food Inventories aren't contaminated as well? It'd be best if we build a Decontamination Post where we can produce Kits for decontaminating!
Maybe we were overly cautious there, chief! But even so, you ought to keep an eye on just how highly contaminated our Foods are.
There you go, the Post has been built! And we kicked off by producing a few Decontamination Kits right away, too!
Oh well, maybe it's not that important, either. Let's just hope that none of us gets sick from eating contaminated Food!
It'd be best if we got going right away to produce enough Decontamination Kits to be prepared for any occasion!
Great, that ought to be enough at first! It makes you feel a lot better right away when you can be sure that you're not going to have to perish from contaminated Food!
Maybe we were overly cautious there, chief! But even so, you ought to keep an eye on just how highly contaminated our Foods are.
Electrifying

Hey, chief, that lady, our new good buddy, not only has a great grip on Technology: she also has good ideas how we can supply our settlement with Electricity! With electrical lighting we could not only work more effectively but at night, too!
Looks like we were being a bit overly ambitious, chief! What sounded good in theory we sadly weren't able to put into practice.
Okay, that ought to be enough for the time being! We can use the new electronic parts in our settlement to turn on the lights!
Oh well, you're right of course - naturally we have more urgent worries. But at some point we're also going to need Electricity if we don't want to keep living in the Stone Age!
All we need now is a draft for a Wind Turbine. Then we'll put it up in the vicinity of the Buildings we want to supply with Power. Afterwards, in the future we'd be able to work at night, too!

It works! Just look at how the Wind Turbine blades are turning and how Electricity flows into the neighboring Buildings! Awesome, chief - that means a new era is dawning for us! And we already have ideas for an even better Power Supply, too...
Looks like we were being a bit overly ambitious, chief! What sounded good in theory we sadly weren't able to put into practice.

In an environment so hostile to life it's your responsibility to not only make sure that your Settlers survive but to equally ensure that they are happy in their new home. It's your mandate to show one and all that the new beginning of civilization is going to be a magnificent endeavor. Build a settlement in which each and every Settler who has come from one of the Endzones would be glad to live.

The time has come to have civilization start anew. We have held out a long time to be able to come here to the surface at last! Now the time has come to show one and all that we are not only going to endure but are able to lead magnificent lives.
Garden of Eden

Establishing a new civilization takes time. The first thing you should do is to see to it that more and more people live in this new Garden of Eden. We are ready to deal with harsh conditions for the time being and to make do without some things. But even now you ought to be readily planning this new settlement in such a way that in the future everyone will be eager to live here!

The first steps have been taken. While others merely make sure that the Settlers' survival is ensured, you have shown us that you possess the foresight to readily pursue our Great Vision from the very start!
How could that happen? I think I understand now why all other settlements merely see to their survival… Maybe we set our goals too high, after all…
Garden of Eden

The first steps have been taken. Although, to erect a truly great city we are still going to need several more things. You should begin by creating many Tools and continue to beautify our settlement. What's more, your Settlers will want to be incorporated into your decision-making processes. Show them that their wishes mean a great deal to you!

The new civilization being created here is going to be capable of surmounting all obstacles in its way. Thanks to your leadership we look toward the future with courage and enthusiasm. We think that you will be in a position to truly create a Garden of Eden for us all.
How could that happen? I think I understand now why all other settlements merely see to their survival… Maybe we set our goals too high, after all…
Garden of Eden

You are on a very good path. Although, to achieve the best quality of life for your Settlers it's still going to be necessary to provide them with sufficient Protective Clothing. When that's been taken care of, we also ought to provide all dwellings with Electricity. Other settlements won't be able to afford that kind of luxury. Should you complete this Quest, this settlement here shall become a shining example of the new civilization.

You did it! While others still struggle to survive, you've managed to become a shining example for all those who want to rebuild civilization anew. This settlement is surely going to serve for a long time as a model that humanity smiles in the face of adversity, even under the most arduous conditions!
How could that happen? I think I understand now why all other settlements merely see to their survival… Maybe we set our goals too high, after all…
And you deserve the greatest respect for it. Thank you so much for your unwavering dedication!
How could that happen? I think I understand now why all other settlements merely see to their survival… Maybe we set our goals too high, after all…
With that, the scenario "Garden of Eden" comes to a close. Now you can simply go on playing or switch back to the Main Menu.

We'll do what you decree, chief! On the other hand, we don't feel good about doing it, sending all these poor people away. They've already done so much for our settlement! We demand that you make efforts to ensure that we don't have to do something like this again!

If those are your instructions, chief, then that's the way we'll stick to them. Even though we're not particularly happy about them and would gladly decide for ourselves when we start our families. It would be better if you could see to it that we're able to continue to grow!

That's an awful instruction you're giving us, chief! We don't want to ever be forced to do something like that again! We demand that you dedicate your efforts so that something like this never has to occur again!
We can't take this for long, chief! If there's not enough nourishment for everyone, then it's your responsibility to change that! To ration our Food is not exactly doing wonders for our tempers!

Sometimes reserves are scarce, we're well aware of that. But Water is the most important thing we need to survive. Make sure we have enough of it stockpiled! Because we're not going to put up with this kind of rationing for long!
We'll try to be more effective in the near future, chief! But watch out that you don't slave-drive us too hard, otherwise we won't be able to get all that done anymore.

When the Supplies run low we'll be more careful in the way we deal with our things. Although, we are worried that we have to economize on such important things like Protective Clothing and Tools. Please make sure that enough of them are always available for everyone.
We'll see to it right away that all Health measures are taken, chief! If sufficient Medicine is on hand, then we'll have to use up some of it, chief! Make sure that enough is on hand!

That will be a big help to us, chief! It'll cost a fair amount of work and commitment, but it's important that all of our Settlers are well educated. Nonetheless, in the future all Children ought to be able to attend school!

It's not easy for us if we can't make it possible for our ancestors to have their last resting place. That's not going to have a good effect on the mood in the settlement, chief! But we'll follow your order.

A longer, interrelated tutorial that includes all important aspects of the game. Follow Arthur Sawchyn's instructions and obtain important clues and useful information to survive in the merciless world of Endzone - A World Apart.
Main Tutorial
A brief introduction to the system of Barter Trading in Endzone. Become familiar with the Trading Posts and how to deal with different Traders.
Barter Trading System Tutorial

Welcome to this exercise, old friend! In this session I want to show you and explain how you can <link="22"><style="DefaultLink">close a Barter Trade Deal</style></link> with Traders who come from other settlements.
To start off, it's naturally first of all important to attract a Trader to your settlement to be able to make a Barter Trade Deal with him.
Welcome

You can build a <link="22"><style="DefaultLink">Trading Post</style></link> to get Traders to come to our settlement. In addition, you ought to assign several <link="3"><style="DefaultLink">Logisticians</style></link> who will work at the Trading Post. Logisticians assigned to the Trading Post will stockpile the Resources you want to trade in a Barter Trade Deal at your Trading Post. As soon as your Trading Post is built, Traders will pay a visit to your settlement from time to time.
Now that the Trading Post has been built, it's only going to be a matter of time until a Trader arrives. When a Trader has arrived you can close a Barter Trade Deal with him.
The Trading Post
A Trader is on the way to our Trading Post! Once he or she has arrived, choose the Trading Post and switch to the Barter Trade Deal window there to be able to view the Trader's Offer.
You and the Trader were able to agree on a deal! While the Trader sets off again your Settlers are now going to distribute the bartered Resources among the Warehouses in your settlement.
Closing a Barter Trade Deal

Once you have researched the Technology called <link="22"><style="DefaultLink">improved radio mast</style></link> at the Research Station, you can decide for yourself which Trader should be the next to come to your settlement. I have already taught this Technology to your settlement so that the settlement can practice using it.

Now that you know how you can attract Traders to your settlement and have learned how to close a Barter Trade Deal, I've shown you all the things you need for successful trading. In closing, I'd also recommend to you to always be on good terms with Traders. Traders who have a high opinion of you might every now and then offer you might valuable things like Knowledge or Seeds.
Summon a Trader
Now that the Barter Trade Deal has been completed the Trader is going to leave your settlement. After a while a new Trader will pay a visit to your settlement.
At the Trading Post you can see which Trader is going to be the next to pay a visit to your settlement. Each Trader specializes in certain Resources.
The Barter Trade Deal has been closed

A Trader always carries only a certain number of Resources with him. At the same time, he is only interested in certain Resources, too. You can make the Trader an Offer now as to which of your Resources you'd be gladly willing to barter in return for his Resources. Watch out that your Offer doesn't become too unfair, otherwise the Trader won't accept the Offer.

Whenever the Trader visits your settlement again he'll have a friendlier attitude towards you and the probability is greater that he'll accept what would normally be an outrageous Offer.

But if you've made many generous Offers to a Trader in the past he'll always display more and more good will towards you. So it could be that what is normally an outrageous Offer turns into a shameless Offer.

Confidence Tutorial

Welcome to this exercise, old friend! In this session I want to demonstrate and explain what's behind your Settlers' <link="8"><style="DefaultLink">Contentedness</style></link>, the ways it affects your settlement, and how you can influence it. To start off you should choose a Settler to open the Settler's individual window. From there you can switch to the window for Contentedness.

In this window you can see which factors influence the Settler's Contentedness. You can see why the Settler is unhappy or happy. This view is useful in discovering how you can make your Settlers even happier.
Welcome

The most important thing to your Settlers is that they are provided with the absolute necessities. If they don't have Food, Water or a roof over their heads it's going to be very hard for you to sharply increase their Contentedness. Although your Settlers currently have enough Food Items available, they don't have a place to sleep. It'd be best if you <link="4"><style="DefaultLink">took care of this</style></link>!

If you take a look at one of your Settlers again, you'll see that the Settler is happy with their new housing. The Settler's Contentedness has increased. That's very practical! The more content the Settler is, the more effectively they're going to work. In addition, particularly happy Settlers are going to move faster, too. For a more precise overview of the kind of influence Confidence has on your Settlers you ought to read up on it in the Survival Guide.
Ensuring the Basic Supply

When the basic needs of your Settlers have been covered, you can make them even happier by giving them additional opportunities to relax or amuse themselves. Several possibilities are available for you to do this. One way to achieve this would be the <link="8"><style="DefaultLink">Campfire</style></link>.

Now that the Campfire has been built, your Settlers will start to visit. This will increase their Contentedness. At the same time the Campfire has another, a second effect. Settlers whose dwellings are located in the vicinity of a Campfire perceive their environment as more attractive.
A Place to Relax

Your Settlers are eager to live in an environment that pleases them. For instance, they prefer not to live next to a Building that produces a lot of noise or dirty grime. To be able to see how attractive the dwellings in your settlement are you can switch to the view displaying dwellings' Attractiveness.

In this view you see which Cabins and Shelters have been placed in an attractive environment and which ones in an unattractive environment. If you want to make your Settlers particularly happy you should pay attention to providing them with an attractive environment.
An Attractive Environment

To increase the Attractiveness of a residential area you can put up some <link="20"><style="DefaultLink">Decorations</style></link> to beautify your settlement. Each Decoration increases the Attractiveness of the area it has been placed in. Maybe it's time for you to design your settlement a little more attractively to make your Settlers happier.

Your Settlers are really going to like the newly built Decorations. This way you can even manage to design a residential area attractively that is located near industrial Buildings. With enough time and energy you might even be able to create a settlement in which all of your Settlers live in an attractive environment.
Laying Out Decorations

At the upper edge of the screen you can tell at a glance what the Average Contentedness of your settlement is at the moment. This Average Contentedness of your settlement has effects on how your Settlers behave and on the kinds of requests they pass on to you. To enable you to address your Settlers' wishes in the best possible way you should set up a <link="21"><style="DefaultLink">Forum</style></link> and check the Bulletin Board there to see if your Settlers have a Quest for you.

The Forum is where your Settlers accumulate all the various requests they want you to address. You should pay special attention to the kinds of requests that have an effect on the Contentedness of your settlement.
The Forum

However, the Forum is not only responsible for giving your Settlers a place where they can turn to you. At the Forum you can address them, too. You can issue <link="21"><style="DefaultLink">Decrees</style></link> and establish Rules at the Forum stating how your Settlers have to behave. For example, this way you can ration Food or Water, or go so far as to prohibit your Settlers from reproducing in the near future.

Many of the Decreees are extremely helpful toward enabling the survival of your settlement. Though you should watch out that you don't demand too much of your Settlers. If you ask too much of them, it can lead to Discontentment spreading throughout your settlement. That's why should you always use caution in deciding which Decrees you want to impose.
Burdening Your Settlers
Now you know what the Confidence of your Settlers deals with and how you can influence it. In closing, I'd also like to recommend that influencing it is precisely what you should do.
Confident Settlers live longer, work more effectively and move around your settlement faster. On the other hand, unhappy Settlers work and move slower.
The Effects

You can read what your Settlers want from you here. In this case they want you to build a <link="8"><style="DefaultLink">Pub</style></link>. When you look at the Mission it indicates that this Mission deals with a Quest that is going to have an effect on the Total Confidence at your settlement. If you decline to carry out the Mission or are unable to complete it on time, your Settlers are going to be unhappy about it. Their Confidence will drop. By contrast, if you complete the Quest they will become even more confident.
You have successfully completed the Quest posed by your Settlers. This will boost the Confidence of all of your Settlers.
View This Quest!
You have declined to carry out your Settlers' Quest. This lowers their Confidence. You ought to take the Quest on and complete it. It'd probably be best if you gave it another try.
You were unable to complete your Settlers' Quest. This lowers their Confidence. You should make an effort to complete the Quest. It'd probably be best if you gave it another try.

Oooh, ow , the old bones. Heh? Hey, don't stare like that... or d'you like what you see? Hehehe. But Old T. Bara's even got much better things in store. I know how to make customers happy. Take your time, look around. I'm sure we'll do business with each other. *cough*

*cough cough* Aaah, this damned weather. Let's see where T. Bara landed this time...Hmmm? No! Not you again! *cough cough* Are you set on hoodwinking Old T. Bara again down to the last cigar? Oh no, no chance, not twice. Hurry up and take a look around!
Aaah, a familiar face. Did you miss Old T. Bara? I certainly hope so!! *cough* Hurry up, take a look around. T. Bara's got extraordinary stuff with her again!

*cough cough*... Aaah! If that isn't my absolute favorite customer? Sure it is, have faith in Old T. Bara, she knows 'em all! Once again T.Bara's got only her very best stuff along! *cough cough* Take your sweet time, T. Bara's got to quiet down her lungs again...

Hahaha, Old T. Bara knew all along we speak the same language! That would truly be a good trade! T. Bara would even throw in a kiss *cough cough*....for free...*cough* hah... no? Oh well, doesn't matter!

...Hmmm? Really? Is that what you're offering?! So you can be a real gentleman, after all! Now, Old T. Bara surely won't cast doubt on your good will! *cough* Sit tight and stick with it, sweetie. T. Bara and you, maybe we can still become good friends, come what may!
...Oh my! What a delightful Offer! Old T. Bara is more than happy! How good you are to an old lady! It's true, believe me. *cough cough* One genuine heck of a customer!
Hahaha. Aaah, you really do always know how to make an elderly woman's heart beat faster. No, honestly, I could kiss you *cough* Aaah, Old T. Bara doesn't want to move on yet, not one bit…

Aaah, that sounds fair! A nice, agreeable deal! And with such a good-looking gem to boot, hahaha, great! But hurry up. Even though I'd love to stick around to show you the added advantages of making a deal with Old T. Bara, nonetheless *cough cough*, duty calls!

Well, with an Offer like that at least you appreciate the value of T. Bara's merchandise. But don't think you're back to being my sunshine right away, either. No, you'll have to put more effort into it!
T. Bara's always glad to do business with you this way, sweetie!
*cough cough* Are you mad at Old T. Bara?! No, I'm just asking! Should I bring something special along for you again next time? How about a little kiss? No?
Hmmmm...? Oh no, that won't work. After all, T. Bara has to survive somehow! If you're serious about this, then I'll have to give it some considerable thought about whether I stop by here again.
Bah, you're treating Old T. Bara like radioactive filth with an Offer like that! *cough cough* How am I supposed to keep my business running this way?
That you're not exactly *cough cough* the most generous guy around, this I already knew. But with a proposal like that you really ought to be ashamed of yourself!
Hmmm...? What the...*cough* Oh well, T. Bara gets the drift. Times are tough out here. And you've always treated T. Bara well. I'll pretend I didn't notice this time, ...for your sake!

What... *cough cough* what a shameless Offer... Hmph! Well I never! Don't get any bright ideas that a pretty face is payment enough all by itself. I've got a business to run! *cough cough cough* Oh, T. Bara won't forget an impertinent gesture like this!

*cough cough*...Ha-ha...LOOKS LIKE YOU WANT TO TAKE T. BARA FOR A RIDE! Of all the nerve... *cough* In all these years T. Bara has never been treated with such a lack of respect! And so often time after time! Bah, acid rain ought to pour down on you! Take that back right now, buddy!
What the...*cough* Old T.Bara is not happy about this Offer. What should I do with this junk?! I thought we were always on good terms with each other! Do you want to ruin my business? *cough cough*
*cough*... T. Bara is truly trying to grasp what just happened.. I mean …times are tough, I know... But do you really want to hoodwink T. Bara like this?!

Yee haaa, what a hell of a ride. Me? I'm Rusty Rolph! The one and only, far and wide! What's that, never heard of me?! Well, Rusty Rolph! Trader with a passion. But I'm yakking too much again. Come on, I'll you show my goods!
Hey hey hey, if that's not the stingy settlement. Rusty Rolph is here to cure you of your tight-fisted existence! Put your faith in good old Rusty!
Hello, my friend. Is everything nice and rusty with you? Hehe! I've got incredible Offers with me again and I'm sure that this time we can reach a much better bargain for me... ehm “us”.

Sure as shootin', he's back again! The fabulous, one and only, incredibly charming: Rusty Rolph! And extra-special, just for you! Yep, neither Sandstorm nor toxic cloud nor bloodthirsty raider can keep me from flim-flamming my best customers...eh, naturally I mean from making them “happy”.

Amazing, I knew what a great person you were as soon as I laid eyes on you. Yup, I said to myself: "Rolph, that's gonna be a heck of a customer…". No, forget that: You're the best customer! Believe trusty Rusty, I already see my golden future awaiting me... I mean our future… heck, yeah!
I knew you wouldn't leave me, your good old Rusty, high and dry just like that! We simply got off on the wrong foot! Nothing that couldn't be set right again with, let's say... a few subsidies!

That's my point, no two ways about it! The mark of a good bargain! I'm well aware that you've picked up one or two tricks from me, the incomparable Rusty Rolph, haha... I'm sure I'll find a few more white elephants in my balloon that I haven't shown you yet...

Hahaha, I knew for a fact I could rely on you again. Simply warms the heart to see such a good deal. Great! My regular customer of the month, no, no, the year! Heck, what am I going on about? A regular of mine who can't be beat!

With that Offer of course I wouldn't say no, not a chance. All I mean is you don't seem to know good old Rusty yet. No, don't get me wrong. I'm saying this is just the start of a lasting friendship! The ties that bind need to be nurtured!

Gee, how should I put it? Not everyone can be as brilliant as I am! It's an improvement, yeah, let's call it improvement. From an itty-bitty miserly cockroach to a frugal piggy bank. But don't worry. I'm the great Rusty, I'll find your soft spot!

Haaah... What? No! I'm not disappointed in the least! The great Rusty would never be disappointed in a trade that was clearly fair for both sides! Haha, don't you see me laughing?! I'm naturally pleased as punch...
And once again bright-as-nails Rusty has brought a fabulous dea…One second. Are you sure about that Offer? No, no, nothing's wrong. Really. A good and ...fair trade.
Stop, stop! We don't want to rush things here, do we?! I mean, look at me. I'm the great Rusty Rolph. I'm your glorious future full of Scrap... Okay, skip the last line!
Hahaha. We're being stingy again, aren't we? Give it another try! As long as a smile doesn't get these whiskers to wiggle, the brilliant and one and only Rusty Rolph won't make any deals with you!

What? No! There's no way... One second. Just let me...Hmmm? No, didn't count wrong, after all. But... but…that can't be right. I'm your buddy, right? The great Rusty Rolph! There's got to be room for more, isn't there?

One second… something's off key. Haha, a joke, you're making a bad joke! That's the kicker, right? You'd never try to bamboozle good old Rusty like that, would you? I mean, we're friends, pals, …radiation buddies. After all, it's me, good old Rolph!
I swear on my mother's grave...okay, my mother never had a grave in the Endzone! But are you dead set on ruining me?!!! I've got a whole family of one to feed! Me!

Bankruptcy! You… you really and truly want to be my undoing. Me, good old Rusty, who raised you like his own flesh and blood. No, not another word. The only thing that can save this relationship now is a miracle!

My grandpapi used to say: “Rusty, a well-groomed mustache cheers a man up, but it takes a free-handed deal before your expenses are paid.” Do you know how often I have to comb this miracle of nature? Not to mention the Wild Boar grease to keep up the shape! Come on, give good old Rusty a helping hand!
By the hairs of my mustache! Me, the great and one and only Rusty Rolph, I'm forced to report the first case of radioactive insanity, and of all people it's my best customer.

Hi there! I'm Susan Melfi, meteorologist and flying saleswoman for a versatile number of ... ehm.... versatilities! I have a whole range of things your settlement can definitely make good use of! Maybe we could do some business, huh?!
Hello! I was just passing through and still have some space in my  ... ehm... airy storeroom. If something interests you maybe we can do some bartering. Otherwise I'll just fly on!

Hi there! I'm Susan Melfi, meteorologist and flying saleswoman for a versatile... Oh! We've had that one already, right? I apologize, but I really do get around a lot. Which is why I've got a number of things with me again today, too! Take your time and have a look!
I wish you a lovely day! I'm glad to be able to be back here again. I've packed a whole range of ... ehm ... super-awesome things for you! Take a look and see if you're interested in something!
That sounds like a good Offer, my friend! If we're able to agree on this deal, in the future maybe I'll even bring along useful... ehm... more wonderful merchandise for you!

Hmm... That sounds like an amazingly good Offer! I've got to admit I wouldn't have expected that! Maybe I ought to come here more often, after all! As for me, we can gladly take this deal and …ehm... negotiate it!
That sounds like a fabulous deal. I knew it was a good idea to drop by here again! If we can agree on this barter trade, then I'll see to it that I'm able to reserve some of my best items for you!
Fan-tastic! It's a fact that one can always do good business with you! If it keeps going like this, soon I won't need any other customers at all! Can we shake hands on this deal?

I'd be willing to agree to that. It seems to me as if it might have been a good idea to land here. I think that if I'm able to close such wonderful... ehm... truly great deals here, then I'll drop by more often. Can we shake on this one?
I'm glad you found something. This way both of us can replenish our stock a bit before I move on. I'd be willing to agree to that.
Time and again, always a pleasure closing a deal with reasonable people! I think both of us would make out well with this deal, don't you?
That would be a solid deal! Our business relationship is truly a great benefit to both sides! I'd agree to a barter trade like that!

This Offer truly is a bit skimpy... But I get the picture! Sometimes things just aren't running too well and there's not much to spare. I know that from the settlement I come from... Believe you me! If that's the way it has to be, then I'd say let's do it.
My my, I must say... It really is hard to do profitable business in this settlement! But alright! I can go along with it if you really truly can't spare more.

Are things not doing too well in your settlement at the moment? That's not exactly much for what I've offered you. But it'll work out in the end, only it shouldn't happen too often! Should we close this deal?
Under normal circumstances I'd turn down something like that... But you've treated me fair in the past, too. I'd accept the Offer and hope that my goods are able to help you, my friend!

Hmm... I'm sorry, but under these kind of circumstances I can't do any bartering deal with you. Please don't get me wrong, but if I want to keep on running my business I have to see to it that I at least make a little profit.
There's absolutely no way that's going to work! Not a chance! I can't even pay for the fuel anymore with that. I'm not going to close any Barter Trade Deal like that with you!

Sorry, but I can't afford to make a deal like that. Even I have to see how I keep this balloon up in the air and flying... If you don't accommodate me a little more here, then I'll sadly have to fly on again without us doing any business.
I'd really love to help you, but I simply can't accept an Offer like that. Don't you have anything else you can add on top? Because this here is really and truly not enough!
Ole Sørensen

Ole Sørensen, at your service! We sell Food Items and Water of the finest quality and quantity. Especially nowadays you can use all these delicacies to turn your settlement into a little spot worth living in!
I thought we'd stop by again and offer our merchandise once more. The last times the business deals weren't particularly promising, but you never know what you might still run into.

Greetings from up here! Ole Sørensen is back in town again with some exotic delicacies waiting to be unpacked! After all, if memory serves me there's always been a few good buyers here for our merchandise, right?
Ole Sørensen lands once again in this gorgeous oasis of culinary well-educated folks! Today we have a whole range of treasured edible treats on offer! Specially assorted just for you.
This case here truly deals with a genuine gourmet! If I'd been aware of that before we would've already come here more often. Ole Sørensen would be willing to go for this deal!

A few scrumptious treats even have what it takes to drive away a bad mood! If we can agree on this deal then I'll look and see if we're also in a position to supply you with the stuff that only our best customers ever receive.
Time and again, Ole Sørensen is always glad when his goods are met with approval. At last someone who appreciates a good selection! Shall we close the deal now?
This really still is my favorite place to come to! If we can agree on the terms, then I'd enjoy drinking a toast to this deal with you! And the drink's on me!
Ole Sørensen is pleased to be able to do business with you! I think I'll drop by every now and then in the future if we manage to agree on this deal.
That works for me. At least it's not quite as bad as it was the last time. I'd be willing to accept this Offer!
Glad to be able to do business with you! This way all the Food Items find their way into those hungry mouths, after all! Can we shake on it?
Great! We're truly gratified that our supply on offer are met with this kind of approval! Ole Sørensen would be ready to close this Barter Trade Deal! Are you ready, too?
Harrumph... That's about as lean as it gets.... but alright, I'm in a good mood today. Today I'd be willing to accept this deal!
How is Ole Sørensen supposed to keep his business running when they always drive such a hard bargain here? Well, okay... If that's how it has to be then I'll accept the deal. Should we shake on it?
A deal! Not a particularly good one the way I see it, but a deal's a deal! Is Ole Sørensen supposed to sign somewhere?
Normally I wouldn't do something like this, but since you're a good friend of Ole Sørensen's, today we'll look the other way! But only today! Are you okay with that?
No no no! That's no way to negotiate with Ole Sørensen! To get anywhere you'll have to offer me something else on top!
Absolutely inacceptable! Ole Sørensen has already let you get away with much too much the last times! Under these circumstances there's no deal!
Ole Sørensen is not able to accept that! Don't you have anything else you can add on?
Ole Sørensen is a good friend of yours! So how can you make him an Offer like this? Do you want to make a poor man out of me?
Lizzy Rasmus
Hey, I hope this sleazy settlement has stuff I can do something with. At any rate, it's your lucky day because Lizzy Rasmus has precisely what you pitiful little worms are looking for.
Hell's bells, now I've ended up flying back to this dump again! The last time the deals left me strictly in the red. But okay, now that I'm here I can at least wheedle a thing or two more out of you!
Bah… that's truly no sight for sore eyes from up here. But if you're just passing through you can make a stop here. At least you people pay halfway decently!

What's up, you blind little know-nothings? Long time, no see? That's not true at all. How are things going with you? Hope you're in the mood for a party, 'cause Lizzy's got a lot of the right stuff with her!
Fine, we can work out something with that! Though your mugs are a fearsome sight, what's on the inside puts things right. Just stick with what you're doing and Lizzy will come by and see you again.
Aha! Does someone want to apologize? The last time I clearly let you off much too easily! This Offer here is at least a step in the right direction...
That's acceptable! With an Offer like this, at any rate you've bought yourselves the chance that I put something aside for you on the next foray... But it's not a promise, so don't press your luck!
Well, now there's someone with a generous touch. Watch out that you don't end up selling me the shirt off your back! Carry on and I'll fly by your tumbledown shacks more often.
You're not exactly making the best impression. With those long faces it's already about as low as it gets. Come on, shove that stuff over here before I get second thoughts!
For all I care. But next time you ought to add something on top. Right now, all you're doing is boring me.
Well, to say I'm delighted would be stretching a point. But it's better than nothing. Come on, hand it over!
Aaah… for all I care. Deal. But next time you'll put more on the table, or else there'll be trouble!

Pfff… what's that supposed to be?! I haven't had a ridiculous Offer like that in quite some time. It's your lucky day, 'cause I wouldn't have minded taking a few slaves to boot. Although… nooo, all they do is whine too much for my taste.
What made you think you could offer me trash like this?! Luckily I've still got a few more settlements on my list. Otherwise I'm in just the right mood to show you what's what.
What kind of miserable little heap are you proposing I look at?! There was a time when we were past all this…
Under normal circumstances I'd turn down crap like this... but somehow your disfigured mugs bring out the mother in me. Such soft-hearted nonsense comes out of my mouth… I'm losing my touch.
What kind of outrageousness is this? I come all the way here and this is all you've got to offer me?… Watch out that I don't blow the whistle on you to my sisters. They won't let you off this easily!
Bah… *spits on the floor* Are you serious? Do you have any idea whom you're dealing with here?! Don't be surprised when a few of your silly Cabins go up in flames sometime soon...
Hah, sweetheart! Do you think that just because we had a few negotiations that went well that I'd go for this kind of nonsense? Not with me! You'll have to come up with a better deal!
If this wasn't such a bad joke I might laugh at it... But all in all, you'll have to put a little bit more effort into it!
Fairness
