Radiation

A brief introduction to radioactive contamination in Endzone and how you can combat it. Learn the necessary steps to enable you to protect your settlement and its Inhabitants against the invisible danger.
Radiation Tutorial

Welcome to this exercise, old friend! In this session I want to show and explain to you how you can deal with <link="10"><style="DefaultLink">Radiation</style></link> in order to protect your Settlers against it. This Radiation is invisible to your Settlers. However, you can view the Radiation Levels in the surrounding area by toggling over to the Radiation Heat Map.

As you can see, there are some areas in your settlement that are radioactively contaminated. Different colorings of the areas signal different intensities of the Radiation levels. There are low-level, medium-level and highly contaminated areas. In the key for the Radiation Heat Map at the lower edge of the screen you can see which Radiation level is marked with which color.
Radiation
To free an area from Radiation you can instruct your Settlers <link="2"><style="DefaultLink">to dig up the Soil</style></link> and remove the Radiation this way.

Now your Settlers are going to begin to remove harmful Radiation from the area you have chosen. Over time the Radiation around your settlement is going to change again and again. Clouds can carry acid rain to your settlement, which can pollute the soil even more.
Digging Up the Soil

So that your Settlers are not constantly occupied with digging up the soil and remain protected even when they enter an area that's contaminated, it's going to be imperative that you equip them with sufficient Protective Clothing. You can produce different kinds of of Protective Clothing for your Settlers. The basic material for all Protective Clothing  is <link="16"><style="DefaultLink">Cloth</style></link>. In order to manufacture Cloth you ought to build a Recycler and assign a Refiner there.

The Recycler is responsible for sorting out Scrap and, in the process, producing a number of further Resources. One of these Resources is Cloth. So the newly built Recycler is now going to start to convert Scrap into Cloth so that you can utilize it for further Production.
Sorting Cloth

Of course, Cloth alone is naturally not enough to be regarded as Protective Clothing. To accomplish this the Cloth has to be tailored into Protective Clothing first. The <link="11"><style="DefaultLink">Tailor's Shop</style></link> is in charge of this. It would be best if you built the Tailor's Shop near your Recycler so that the assigned Tailor is always supplied with enough raw material to perform their work.

Very good! For a start, your Settlers are going to be shielded against the hazardous Radiation in the environment via the Neck Scarves produced here. Neck Scarves provide your Settlers with protection against all areas that have low-level contamination. However, if they come into contact with higher levels of Radiation, in other words areas that have medium-level contamination or are even highly contaminated, then the protection provided by Neck Scarves is not going to be sufficient.
Making Neck Scarves

To protect your Settlers against higher levels of Radiation you ought to make an effort to provide more effective Protective Clothing. If you equip your Settlers with Activated Carbon Masks instead of Neck Scarves, they would be even better protected. On the other hand, until now your Tailor's Shop unfortunately still doesn't have access to all the Resources it needs to produce these Masks. What it lacks is <link="11"><style="DefaultLink">Coal</style></link>. Coal can be produced in the Charcoal Kiln where Wood is charred to form Coal.

The Charcoal Burner you assigned is now going to begin to bring Wood into the Charcoal Kiln and produce Coal there. In a similar way to the Cloth you have produced, this Coal can then be utilized further.
Coal Processing

Now that Coal is also being produced by your Settlers in addition to Cloth your Tailor's Shop can start producing <link="11"><style="DefaultLink">Activated Carbon Masks</style></link>. However, to achieve this you have to instruct your Tailor's Shop to produce these Masks. Otherwise the shop will go on making Neck Scarves.

Awesome! In the future your Settlers will now be equipped with Activated Carbon Masks. Consequently they are even more protected against intense Radiation. But even then, these Masks don't fully protect your Settlers. Highly contaminated areas still pose a threat to them.
Making Activated Carbon Masks

If you want to fully protect your Settlers against Radiation in the environment you're going to have to equip them with Radiation Suits. Your settlement already produces the major part of the Resources required to do this. However, <link="16"><style="DefaultLink">Plastic</style></link> is still needed to make these Suits. To obtain Plastic it has to be sorted out from Scrap. But since you need not only Plastic but Cloth as well, I don't think it's a smart idea to simply convert your Recycler from Cloth Production to Plastic Production. You'd be better off having a second Recycler built instead.
With Cloth, Coal and Plastic, all the Resources you need for the manufacturing of Radiation Suits are now available.
Sorting Plastic

If you now instruct your Tailor's Shop to redirect their efforts towards producing <link="11"><style="DefaultLink">Radiation Suits</style></link>, the Tailor's Shop will discontinue the Production of Activated Carbon Masks and focus on the newly assigned Task.
Excellent! With the new Radiation Suits your Settlers will be protected even against the highest-level Radiation in the environment. Radioactively contaminated rain can't do a thing to them anymore!
Making Radiation Suits

Then again, Radiation is a treacherous thing and endangers your Settlers from the inside as well as outside. Although you've protected your Settlers, they can still absorb Radiation into their bodies when they ingest radioactively contaminated Water or Food. So you ought to also take measures to safeguard your Water and Food Supplies. A first step would be to purify the Water Supply. Sadly, your Cistern isn't able to do this. But if you upgrade it into a <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Water Tower</style></link>, then you can purify the Water stored there via Coal Filters. So upgrade your Cistern and then activate the Coal Filter!

As a result, your Settlers' Water Supply is also now protected against radioactive contamination. As long as you can make sufficient Coal available, your Water Carriers will see to it that any contaminated Water that gets into the Water Tower is purified.
Safeguarding the Water Supply

As the last step, now your Settlers still have to be protected against radioactively contaminated Food. The <link="11"><style="DefaultLink">Decontamination Post</style></link> is going to be responsible for this in your settlement. Decontamination Kits are produced at this Post. Your Decontaminators will subsequently distribute these Kits to all your Production Buildings that produce Food. All your Storage Buildings and Warehouses will also be equipped with these Kits.

Great work! Now your Settlers are protected against all types of Radiation! You should always keep an eye on the Radiation in your surroundings and see to it that you have enough Protective Clothing and Decontamination Kits in stock.
Safeguarding the Food Supply
Food Tutorial

A brief introduction to Food Supply in Endzone. Learn the necessary steps to supply your settlement and its Inhabitants with sufficient Food Items along with the kinds of different possibilities they have to get their hands on Food in this hostile environment.

Welcome to this exercise, old friend! In this session I want to show and explain to you how you can provide your Settlers with <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Food</style></link>. If sufficient Food Items are not available to your Settlers, in the worst case this can result in starvation and could lead to death. At the present time, the fastest method will surely be for you to simply instruct your Settlers to roam the Forest <link="2"><style="DefaultLink">to search there for Mushrooms and Berries</style></link>.
Settlers who currently have not been assigned any Profession will now see to it that they perform the Task you have given them. The initial Hunger at your settlement can be appeased as a result.
Food

Since Food naturally bears a fundamental importance, it's much better when some of your Settlers could take care of roaming the Forest on a long-lasting basis. If you build a <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Gatherer's Cabin</style></link> and assign a Gatherer there, the Gatherer will take care of searching for Berries and Mushrooms on a permanent basis.

Very good! Now that the Gatherer's Cabin has been built, the assigned Gatherers will keep an eye out for Mushrooms and Berries in their working area. Ensure that, in the best case, the working area for the Gatherer's Cabin contains as many Trees as possible because the Plants your Gatherers are looking for can only grow on these Trees. You can shift the working area for your Gatherer's Cabin if at any time the area is not filled to be optimal.
The Gatherer's Cabin

Although Berries and Mushrooms are a good start, it's important for your Settlers to be able to nourish themselves from as many sources as possible. This not only helps to offset possible shortages of Food: it also leads your Settlers to living healthier lives and becoming more resistant to outbreaks of Diseases. Your Water Carriers already collect Water from the nearby Lake. The next thing you ought to do is to place a <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Fishing Hut</style></link> there to catch Fish.

Your Fishermen will now begin to catch Fish. Provided, of course, that Water exists. During a Drought your Fishermen will not be able to fish. Unlike the situation with the Gatherer's Cabin, the working area for the Fishing Hut cannot be shifted. Pay attention that the working areas of multiple Fishing Huts do not overlap, because this decreases the Effectiveness of this Building.
The Fishing Hut

Your Settlers not only rely on the Food they are able to gather in their surrounding environment. They can also create <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Farmland</style></link> on their own to provide themselves with high-quality Food Items. Farmland is dependent upon Soil Humidity. Ensure that your Fields are established on Soil that is as moist as possible to ensure that the Plants cultivated by your Settlers can thrive.
Now your Farmland is ready to be farmed. However, your Farmers are not going to begin to plant anything yet.
The Farmland

Because to do this you first have to tell your Farmers which <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Seeds</style></link> are supposed to be cultivated on the Field. To enable this, choose the particular Farmland and decide which kind of Seeds are supposed to be planted there.

As you can see, now your Farmers are beginning to plant the Seeds on the Farmland. Once the Plant has ripened the Farmer will harvest it. As soon as the entire Farmland has been harvested, the Farmer will reseed the selected Farmland with the same seeds. In other words, you don't need to take care of this anymore.
Choosing a Seed

Besides Farmland you can also create <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Orchards</style></link>. They are equally managed by Farmers. Unlike Fields for Farmland, however, Fruit or Nut Trees are planted here. These Trees can be harvested several times before they have to be replanted. In contrast, they need quite some time before they bear Fruit for the first time.

For both Orchards and Fields for Farmland you can issue instructions at any time to harvest the Field or Orchard right away to ensure quick Crop Yields. In exactly the same way at any time you can redesignate which type of Seed ought to be planted next.
The Orchard

As you may have already noticed, a whole bunch of Wild Animals roam the area around your Town Center. If you build a <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Hunting Lodge</style></link> you can instruct the Hunters there to hunt Wild Animals and consequently make an additional source of Food accessible to your Settlers.
Similar to the Gatherer's Cabin, with the Hunting Lodge you also ought to ensure that Wild Animals are located within the Lodge's working area so that your Hunters are able to hunt them.
The Hunting Lodge
Wild Animals can not only be shot, they can be captured, too. To capture Wild Animals you have to instruct your Hunter to do this.
The Animals captured by the Hunter are now brought to the Hunting Lodge. In a second step, they can be brought from the Lodge to a Pasture to be kept as livestock.
Capturing Wild Animals

A <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Pasture</style></link> makes it possible for you to keep the Wild Animals you have captured as livestock. Any type of captured Wild Animal can be kept on the Pasture. But always only one type of Animal at the same time. Set up a Pasture and assign a Herder to be able to utilize the Wild Animals captured by your Hunter.
As you already know from the Fields and Orchards, your Herder won't yet be able to begin with his work as well.
The Pasture
To achieve this, first you have to choose a type of Animal that is supposed to be kept on the Pasture. Choose the particular Pasture and select a type of Animal that is supposed to be kept on it.

Animals captured by a Hunter are brought to a Pasture where they are tended to and cared for by Herders. Some Animals produce Resources such as Milk or Eggs. Other Animals can only be slaughtered to eat. You must provide the Animals you keep on your Pasture with Water to enable them to survive and reproduce. As soon as enough Animals are fully grown the Herder will start to slaughter them. If you don't want Animals to be slaughtered you can instruct the Herder not to do so.
Keeping a Herd

All kinds of Food are now being produced by your settlement and can be eaten by your Settlers. To be able to provide even better Food you can build a <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Kitchen</style></link> and assign Cooks. Normally your Researchers would have to first perform Research on the necessary Technology for constructing a Kitchen, but I have already taught your Settlers what they have to know to accomplish this.

The Kitchen will now produce processed Food from all possible kinds of Foods and those kinds the Kitchen has access to. This processed Food can bring different advantages with it. I'll leave it up to you to decide for yourself what your Kitchen ought to produce. Your decision is naturally not final and the menu can be changed at any time.
The Kitchen

The larger your settlement gets, the farther some Settlers have to travel to get to all the Food you produce. To make life a little easier for them you can build <link="18"><style="DefaultLink">Food Stations</style></link>. Logisticians who work at a Food Station will collect Food from your Storage Buildings and Production facilities and bring it to the Food Station.

Fabulous! Now your Settlers are not only producing loads of Food, they're able to process it further and distribute it effectively within the settlement, too. As a result your Food Supply is solidly ensured!
Food Stations

Now you can test whether the Food Production you have set up is sufficient. In the event that your Settlers still have difficulties getting their hands on Food, you should build more Production Buildings and assign more Settlers to Food Production.

As you can see, the Food Supply of this small settlement has been secured by you. However, you shouldn't forget that larger settlements need more Food, too. Always keep an eye on whether your Food Production is sufficient.
A Stable Supply
Below Ground

Hey chief, I noticed something else about the tunnel the guy used to dig his own grave: shiny black rocks could be seen on the tunnel walls. That was Coal! If we dig a shaft into a promising Mountain - and shore it up better of course - we'd have an abundant source of Coal. But first we'd naturally have to give some thought to the best way for us to build and operate a Mine like that...
Unfortunately, until now we haven't had any idea how we ought to approach this, chief! It'd probably be best if we put this project on ice for the time being...
Alrighty, we've worked out a concept and can start building the Mine! And we already have ideas how we can even improve the present concept...
Oh well, maybe it's better like this. At least this way no one's in danger of being buried alive...
Then let's get to work! Naturally the Mine has to be built next to a Mountain so that we can sink a tunnel deep enough into the rock!
Sadly we weren't able to stay on schedule, chief! We're sorry...
Whew, this work is so tough it really knocks you out, but it's worth it! We've already put together the first load of Coal!
Dead Bodies on Our Streets
More and more dead bodies are accumulating on our Streets, chief! You really ought to see to it that we give these poor souls a place where they can rest in peace!

The worst-case scenario has kicked in, chief! A lot of our Settlers have gotten seriously ill. That's what happens when dead bodies pile up in the streets! If we don't watch out now, it won't take long before a lot more bodies lie next to them.
It's a good thing this can be taken care of now, chief! We've assured the Families of the deceased that their kinfolk receives an appropriate last place to rest in peace.
The people are outraged that you turned down their request, chief! Is it truly their fate to end like that? To simply be left lying in the dirt?
Reset your Hunting Lodge to the "Capture" option.
Assign a type of Animal to your Pasture as soon as your Hunter has captured an Animal.
Instruct your Settlers <link=9><style=DefaultLink>to remove Radiation</link></style> from an area.
Eva Pirveli
Instruct your Hunter to capture or hunt Wild Animals
Have your Tailor's Shop produce Activated Carbon Masks
Have your Tailor's Shop produce Radiation Suits
Research Tutorial

A brief introduction to the Research system in Endzone. Learn the steps to perform successful research and consequently acquire new Buildings, Technologies or Production formulas for your settlement to ensure the survival of your settlement on a lasting basis.

Welcome to this exercise, old friend! In this session I want to show and explain to you how you can perform <link="19"><style="DefaultLink">Research</style></link> at your settlement. These various types of Research are going to help you in advancing the development of your settlement, showing you how to make it even more sturdy, resiliant and long lasting in a hostile environment. As a starting point you'll need a <link="19"><style="DefaultLink">Research Station</style></link> where your Researchers can work.

At your new Research Station, the Researchers you have assigned will begin to generate <link="19"><style="DefaultLink">Knowledge</style></link>. This Knowledge is necessary to perform Research. It's going to take a while. You can observe your Researchers' progress at the Research Station.
Welcome

I have already taught your Researchers some things about Knowledge so that they can begin right away. I want you to instruct your Researchers to perform Research on Electronics. Keep in mind that your Settlers not only need Research Points for this but several Resources, too. However, they have already accumulated enough Resources for Research on producing Electronics. As soon as all Resources have been brought to the Research Station, that’s why they will be able to begin with the Research right away.

Now that your Researchers have researched the Electronics Technology, your Refiners are not only able to salvage Cloth, Plastic and Metal from Scrap, they can also get <link="16"><style="DefaultLink">electronic parts</style></link> for use at your settlement.
Electronics

On the other hand, Electronics alone are not sufficient to generate enough <link="13"><style="DefaultLink">Electricity</style></link>. Additional Research is required to do this. If you take a look at your Research Tree, you'll now see that your progress in researching Electronics allows you to advance to other types of Research that build successively upon one another. What would it be like if you now gave your Researchers the Quest to perform Research on the <link="13"><style="DefaultLink">Wind Turbine</style></link>?

Very good! With this, now you have also completed an advancing type of Research. Your Settlers are able to carry out many types of Research on their own. Once sufficient Knowledge and the necessary Resources are available, you can instruct them to begin these types of Research. However, some types of Research are too complex for your Settlers and need additional <link="19"><style="DefaultLink">utensils</style></link> to be able to perform them. You find these utensils in the dilapidated Ruins spread across the map. Send out Expeditions to search for these useful Research materials. Although, for the time being I have brought along several Research utensils so that we can focus on the Research itself.
Advancing Types of Research

With the Research utensils, the necessary Knowledge and the required Resources available on demand you can now instruct your Settlers to conduct a complex type of Research. What would it be like if you instructed them to perform Research on the <link="15"><style="DefaultLink">Solar Collector</style></link>?
Excellent! With this your settlers are also able to make use of such a highly complex Technology in the future. It will surely be able to help them a lot further.
Research Utensils

As you can see, it's completely your choice as to which types of Research your Settlers ought to carry out. In turn, this enables you to address the needs of your settlement precisely and, as a result, make choices according to what you want to prioritize.

I have thus taught you what you need to know to be able to perform Research in Endzone. In closing, I'd like to give you an added bit of advice and that is to look around everywhere for opportunities to obtain Knowledge. Because Knowledge is found everywhere in this harsh world and doesn't have to be generated in an unavoidably tedious and laborious way by your Researchers.
Well Done!
Water Tutorial

A brief introduction to Water Supply in Endzone. Learn the necessary steps to supply your settlement and its Inhabitants with this indispensable Resource for survival along with the different kinds of possibilities they have to get their hands on it in this hostile environment.

Welcome to this exercise, old friend! In this session I want to explain and demonstrate how you can supply your Settlers with <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Water</style></link>. When your Settlers don't have sufficient Water available, in the worst case this can lead to making them suffer from thirst and, as a result, possibly even die.
To be able to prevent this I am going to show you what kinds of measures you can take to create a stable Water Supply.
Welcome

The first thing your Settlers need is a place where they can stockpile and consume Water. The <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Cistern</style></link> is probably the most practical site to start off with. Place a Cistern in the vicinity of the nearby Lake and assign several Workers to the Profession <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Water Carrier</style></link>.
Your Water Carriers have the Task of transporting Water from different sources into your Cistern. This is so your Settlers have a place to go to supply themselves with Water.
The Cistern

However, to gather Water you not only need a site where it can be stored, you also need a source from which your Water Carriers can obtain the Water. To accomplish this, build a <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Jetty</style></link> out of Wood near your new Cistern. You must make sure that part of the Jetty stands in the Water so that your Water Carriers have access to the Water. It might be necessary to rotate the Jetty so that it can be set in the right position. You can click on the middle mouse key to do this.

Now that the wooden Jetty has been built, your Water Carriers have a place where they can obtain Water and bring it to the Cistern. If your Water Carriers don't begin to move toward the Jetty, then you might have to shift the <link="3"><style="DefaultLink">working area</style></link> for your Cistern. This is because your Settlers will only deliver Water to your Cistern when the source is located within the Cistern's working area. You can shift the Cistern's working area by clicking on the Cisterns and choosing the icon for "Change Working Range".
The Jetty

However, the Lakes in your surroundings are not the only source of Water that's available to you. A <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Well</style></link> is able to pump groundwater out of the ground. Build a Well and assign a Wellkeeper to have another source of Water. Your Settlers are also able to supply themselves directly from the Well, however a Well doesn't have the same Storage Capacity as a Cistern or a Water Tower. That's why I recommend that you place your Wells in a Cistern's working area so that your Water Carriers can also retrieve Water out of the Well.

Wells can be built everywhere. Although, if you place them too close to each other it will lower their Productivity. So make sure that your Wells don't lie within the working area of other Wells. Unlike the situation with Cisterns, you can't change the working area of a Well.
The Well

Since I was just talking about a <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Water Tower</style></link>: Even though your Cisterns do provide space for Water, a Water Tower provides even more space and you're going to need a lot of Water to be able to supply all your Settlers when your Population figures grow. You can either build a new Water Tower or upgrade your Cistern to convert it into a Water Tower. To do this, choose the Cistern and upgrade it to a Water Tower.
Very good! The Water Tower is ready for use and your Water Carriers can now stockpile Water here as well. It provides a greater storage capacity than a Cistern.
The Water Tower

But your Water Tower is not only able to store more Water than a Cistern can, it's also able to filter and thus purify<link="10"><style="DefaultLink">Water contaminated with Radiation</style></link>. Because it's not particularly healthy for your Settlers to consume radioactively contaminated Water. To filter the Water that is being brought to the Water Tower, click on the Water Tower and set the filtering to "Active".
Good! Now all your Water will be filtered by the Water Tower. To do this your Water Tower is going to need Coal, so make sure that enough Coal is available to you.
The Filtration System

With the new Filtration System and the possibility to filter radioactively contaminated Water you are able to make use of another source of Water. The <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Rainwater Collector</style></link> can capture and store rainwater. No manpower is needed to do this. However, it could naturally happen that the rain has been contaminated by Radiation, which obviously is why your Rainwater Collector is collecting contaminated Water. But that's why you've taken precautions for precisely this situation and activated the filtering in your Water Tower.
Excellent! Now your settlement is collecting Water from different sources and is consequently well able to supply itself.
The Rainwater Collector

As you already know, the rain that falls from the sky might possibly be radioactively contaminated. At the lower edge of the screen you can track which <link="7"><style="DefaultLink">Weather</style></link> you can expect in the near future. At the moment your Settlers aren't able to make any precise statements about how contaminated the rain is going to be in the future. However, precise forecasts can be made if you build a <link="7"><style="DefaultLink">Weather Station</style></link>.

Your Weather Station now shows you how highly contaminated the rain is going to be in the near future. If the rain is too highly contaminated with Radiation, at the Weather Station you can also give instructions that your Cultivated Fields and Rainwater Collectors are to be covered so that they are not affected by the Radiation.
The Weather Station

Another Building that can help you to produce clean Water is the <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Electric Water Pump</style></link>. This pump functions the same way as your Wells, except that no manpower is needed to convey the Water. Extremely practical!
The Electric Water Pump has been built and is ready for use. Although, in its present condition it won't be able to convey any Water as of yet.
The Electric Water Pump

To do that it's going to need Electricity. I've taught your Settlers how to build <link="13"><style="DefaultLink">Wind Turbines</style></link>. If you hook up your Electric Water Pump to a Wind Turbine it will be able to start doing its work.
As you can see, your Electric Water Pump is working now. Make sure it is always supplied with sufficient Electricity if you want things to stay this way.
Power for the Pump

With this I've shown you the kinds of sources form you can obtain Water. But in the case of larger settlements, just collecting and purifying Water is not going to be enough. Your Settlers must have access to the Water as well. A <link="18"><style="DefaultLink">Water Point</style></link> allows you to provide your Settlers with Water locally, on-site.

The Logisticians you've assigned will transport Water from your Water Tower to the Water Point. This, in turn, enables you to create a network that is able to supply your Settlers with Water everywhere in your settlement. Access to sufficient clean Water is key to your settlement's survival. See to it that your Settlers are always well supplied with Water.
The Water Point
Connect an Electric Water Pump to a Power Grid: <<amount>>
Wait until your Researchers have generated Knowledge
By the way, there was a protective mask still lying on the pilot's seat. It looks completely different from the masks we know. Seems to be a special Filter attached to it. We'll take it with us!
Oh yeah, before I forget, our Expert showed us how we dismantle the rotor unit. Rotor shaft, swashplate, swivel joints and a whole bunch of other stuff. Sounds useful!

By the way, underneath the books there was also an ancient volume on the subject of “Inorganic Chemistry.” There were lots of formulas in it, nothing thrilling at first glance, but maybe it'll help our Experts. We packed it up to take along!

Besides the putrid tanks there are still work stations with a large array of lab equipment standing around. We'll pack up some of it carefully to take along. It's not so easy to manufacture stuff like that!
While screwing things apart we also came across well-preserved Generators. We'll remove the most important parts and sketch a few drawings. That might help us in the future.

Besides the whole bunch of computer stuff there are all kinds of plans lying around here. Somebody seems to have prepared for the catastrophe here. These sketches could be useful. They don't correspond in the least to any of our construction plans from the Endzone.

This steam-driven turbine functions completely differently from what we had in the Endzone. We made some schematic diagrams while taking it apart. Could be that we might be able to reconstruct parts of it in simplified form, right?

This steam-driven turbine functions completely differently from what we had in the Endzone. We made some schematic diagrams while taking it apart. Could be that we might be able to reconstruct parts of it in simplified form, right?
It just occurred to me: We found a box of test tubes left over in one of the corners. Judging from their shape, they're not anything we'd be able to produce so easily. We'll take it along with us.

You really don't want to experience something like that, chief! But despite it we combed through the room. I mean, it shouldn't have been for nothing, right?! The doctor still had various utensils on his work table. We took it all with us.

Besides all the schoolbooks there was a big tome lying here, too, “Higher Mathematics: Compact”. I get cold shivers running down my back at the thought, but some folks at the settlement might like the subject.

Some old machinery and Tools were lying in the containers that were probably meant for the construction site. Some of it looks usable and could maybe help us with our own construction sites in the future.

While we're at it, what's this lying here? Its title is: “In Ten Steps to Sustainable Coexistence” and written next to it: “for Dummies”. Well, when even dummies get the point it must be good. Sounds as if it could be interesting.

One second. There's a lab table for experiments here in the corner with crucibles, a mortar and petri dishes on it, and a book lying alongside: “The Path to the Self-Producing Gold Reserve”. What a bunch of crackpots... Oh well, the equipment looks good, we'll take it with us!

Here's a small Plastic box with those little electronic devices lying inside. Yeah, right, they were called “smartphones”, and there's some jewelry, too. The jewelry's pretty nice, but these “smartphones” are so well preserved, it's a sure thing they could be useful.
This telescope is a real beauty, even the lenses still seem to be intact! We can use it to look at the sky and the stars, and it's a sure thing we'll learn a few things!
Before I forget, there was still a solidly packed binoculars lying next to the priest. I'm not sure what he needed it for, but the lens still seems to be in very good condition. We took it with us.

Wait a sec, it looks as if this “DREAMCAST” is something electronic, right? Good, the electrical components have apparently stood the test of time really well. So there still ought to be something that can be done with it. On the other hand, that really wasn't nice of you, chief!
As for the pumps and power units, there are several components that can't be manufactured so easily. We'll pack them up real fast. They might prove to be helpful later on!
She's giving us a self-made, hand-operated dynamo and her blueprints, too. That might serve us very well in the future.

Besides the Tools there was also a well-preserved steel cable with a spool lying around here. It was mounted on the front of the vehicle, maybe for hauling loads? We nearly overlooked it, but we can definitely put it to good use.

Besides the individual parts we were also able to remove the alternator. It ought to do a good job serving a different purpose as a small Generator, at least that's what it said in our Survival Guide in the Endzone.
We found well-preserved glass bottles and test tubes in a sealed case in a corner. Did they still try their luck experimenting on Plants here? At any rate, the equipment is definitely helpful.

Apart from our awesome find, the Plastic case is filled with some small test tubes and bottles. There are some kind of tablets inside. Don't have the slightest idea what's with the tablets, but the little things made of glass might be very practical.
Naturally we packed up the fixtures, gadgets and laboratory objects, which were in great condition. We ought to be particularly able to do something with all those test tubes and pipettes!
Open the Research Tree
Electric Pump researched: <<amount>>

Our Researchers have come up with the idea to give a new Technology a try. Their idea is to automate our Wells so that they no longer require any manpower and can operate purely via a Power Supply. They want your permission to be allowed to begin their studies.
Loitering Ban researched: <<amount>>

Our Researchers have come up with the idea to give a new Technology a try. Their idea is to perform Research on a Decree that can bring your Settlers to relax less and focus more on their work. They want your permission to be allowed to begin their studies.

Really, chief? Do we have to hustle even more to get things done? If you keep slave-driving us like this we won't last long! We'll make the effort and do our best. But afterwards you ought to give us time for a break, too!
We won't take any more breaks
Burnt Coal
A fire occurred at one of our Charcoal Kilns while burning Wood.
The Building was severely damaged and some of the workforce was injured badly.
Burst Pipe
A burst pipe occurred at one of our Water Towers.
Although we were able to temporarily seal up the hole, a lot of Water leaked out and the Water Tower ought to be repaired as fast as possible.
Manufacturing Defect

Some of the workers have complained that their Tools have broken quickly. After our Technicians took another look at the Tools already produced, they were unfortunately forced to find that serious manufacturing defects had occurred.
Sadly, many of our stockpiled Tools are unusable and have to be disposed of.
Destroyed Nets
One of our Scrap Collectors was considerably damaged due to sharp pieces of Scrap.
We'll have to repair it.
Problems in Production
A work-related accident occurred at one of our Tailor's Shops.
Luckily no one was hurt, but we'll have to replace a major portion of the Production equipment.
Accident at the Scrapyard
An accident occurred at one of our Scrapyards.
Luckily no one died as a result, but besides damage to the Building some of the workers were injured, too.
Upgraded Tailor's Shop researched: <<amount>>

Our Researchers have an idea to try their luck with a new Technology. Their idea is to develop an improved form of our Tailor's Shop that can produce more effectively and supports a larger workforce. They want your permission to be able to commence with their studies.
Upgraded Workshop researched: <<amount>>

Our Researchers have an idea to try their luck with a new Technology. Their idea is to upgrade our Workshop in order to get to Tools faster and more effectively. They want your permission to be able to commence with their studies.
Expeditions Tutorial

A brief introduction to the Expedition system in Endzone. Learn the steps to complete Expeditions successfully in order to find Resources, Knowledge and Research utensils so that your settlement can develop further.

Welcome to this exercise, old friend! In this session I'd like to show you and explain how you can send your Settlers on <link="14"><style="DefaultLink">Expeditions</style></link> in order to find useful Knowledge and materials that will help you to survive in this harsh environment. The first thing you ought to do is to build an <link="14"><style="DefaultLink">Expedition Station</style></link> because Expeditions are prepared and sent off at this Building.
Very good. Now that the Expedition Station has been built, the first step that's necessary to enable your Settlers to explore the Ruins in your surroundings has been done.
Welcome

The next thing you ought to do is to get yourself ready for your first Expeditions. Assign Settlers to become <link="14"><style="DefaultLink">Scouts</style></link> and prepare <link="14"><style="DefaultLink">Expedition Rations</style></link>. When you want to send off an Expedition you can decide the amount of Rations you want to provide the Expedition with. This enables you to control how long and how thoroughly the Expedition is able to examine a Ruin.
Very good! Now that your Scouts have produced some Expedition Rations, future Expeditions can be equipped and provided for.
Expedition Rations

However, your Scouts have another function besides producing Expedition Rations. You can send them out to discover an <link="14"><style="DefaultLink">interesting place</style></link>. A Scout has to reconnoiter an interesting place first before you'll be able to send Expeditions on their way to this location. The Scout is going to need some time until he reaches his destination. As soon as he has arrived he will report in and notify you of what he has found out. While you wait for his report you can have additional Expedition Rations produced in order to be well prepared for the Expedition.

Very good! Your Scout made it to the Ruin and has already accumulated some information about it. If you reopen the Expedition Overview window you'll see that the Scout has communicated his assessment of the on-site situation to you. This shows you which type of Ruin it deals with here and which <link="14"><style="DefaultLink">Qualifications and Resources</style></link> are going to be advantageous on your Expedition.
Sending Out Scouts

Make sure that the Settlers you send on the Expedition are the kind who are Experts in the field that the Scout feels is important, and that you equip them with suitable <link="12"><style="DefaultLink">Tools</style></link> and <link="11"><style="DefaultLink">Protective Clothing</style></link>. Provide them with sufficient <link="14"><style="DefaultLink">Expedition Rations</style></link> as well to be able to ensure that they have as much leeway to act as possible.
Excellent. Your Scouts will now begin to bring all of the necessary materials for the Expedition to the Expedition Station and start preparing the Expedition.
Sending Off an Expedition

As soon as your Scouts have brought all the materials you have chosen for the Expedition to the Expedition Station, your new Explorers will assemble and jointly set off on their way. As soon as they arrive they will report in to you and wait for your instructions. Take charge of the Expedition as soon as it has arrived at its destination.
At any rate, it's all worked out very well up to this point! You've built an Expedition Station, examined a Ruin and headed a successful Expedition.
Heading an Expedition
With that, I've taught you what you have to know to be able to carry out Expeditions in Endzone successfully.

In closing, I'd also like to advise you to take a look at as many of the Ruins in your surroundings as possible. It's a sure thing that you'll be able to find lots of useful things there. In addition to useful Resources and Knowledge, it could also be Research utensils or even other survivors you can help. It's always worth it to keep an eye on the environment you're in!
Well Done!
Bleak Times
A settlement on the brink of destruction. Your mission will be to give the people hope again and to stand by their side during reconstruction to keep them from going under.

Good thing you're here! We have major problems. The last Sandstorm did a lot of damage and our supplies are running out. Many of the Settlers believe we won't be able to survive much longer. Can you help us?
We're Struggling to Survive

First and foremost, the most important thing will be that we survive in the first place! But just how we're supposed to do that, well, we don't know. In this case we're putting our faith in your experience and leadership!
What luck that you've come to help us! I don't think this settlement would've survived without you! At the very least, the first steps have already been taken!
So that's what the future looks like for all of us... There's no rescue in sight for us anymore!
We're Rebuilding

So we've made it up to this point! But I don't have the feeling that we can already be sure we've weathered this crisis. As the next step maybe we ought to try to stabilize our circumstances. What do you think?
Incredible! With someone at the top who has as much experience as you have we can make it, even out of desperate situations like these!
So that's what the future looks like for all of us... There's no rescue in sight for us anymore!
We're Developing Further

We've put the worst behind us for the time being, right? We'd really like to be in a position to stand on our own two feet in the future. So now it would also be good if you could show us what we have to do so that we don't get into a dilemma like this again in the future.
I can hardly believe it... Before you came I still thought it was all over and done with for us. But we've survived! And we're in an even better position now than we were before!
So that's what the future looks like for all of us... There's no rescue in sight for us anymore!

We are greatly indebted to you. Without your leadership we wouldn't have made it out of this crisis. You've saved us, all of us! From this point on I think we'll manage on our own. You've shown us how we can extricate ourselves from even the direst situation.
So that's what the future looks like for all of us... There's no rescue in sight for us anymore!
With that, the scenario "Bleak Times" comes to a close. Now you can simply go on playing or switch back to the Main Menu.
Survive
Upgrade
Improve
Help the settlement to get out of the immediate crisis!
Head the rebuilding of the settlement!
Help the Settlers to be well armed against crises in the future, too!

Your Scout has reached the Ruin and already taken a bit of a look around. As a result, he's already able to give you some information about what your Settlers have to reckon with when you send them on their way here. By looking at the advantages indicated you can see which Specialists among your Settlers you ought to send on this Expedition and which Equipment you ought to provide them with so that they are as successful as possible.

Your Expedition has arrived. Now it's up to you to guide them through the Expedition itself. As long as they have sufficient Expedition Rations at their disposal your Settlers can search through the Ruins.
The First Expedition
Instruct the Expedition

Your Settlers are now going to enter the Ruin and notify you of what they encounter. Then you can decide how they should proceed from there. Take note that your Settlers have to use up Expedition Rations for each route they investigate.
Garage

Your Settlers can take a look at this part of the Ruin. Although, as you can see this part of the Ruin isn't the only one. Now you can either let your Settlers proceed further here or choose the other part.

Your Settlers have forced their way into the Garage and gathered up everything useful they were able to find. If, in your opinion, there's nothing else your Settlers can achieve at this Ruin, then you can send them back again at any time.
Can't go on!
Shop

As you can see here, it's not guaranteed that your Settlers have success when they want to take this route. However, if you have paid attention to the different advantages and your Settlers are well equipped you can distinctly increase their chances of success.

Your Settlers were able to force their way into the Ruin and search it. They will notify you of everything useful they found here. If, in your opinion, there's nothing else your Settlers can achieve at this Ruin, then you can send them back again at any time.

Unfortunately, your Settlers were not successful. That can happen when they don't utilize all advantages to the fullest extent. With some options your Settlers can keep trying over and over again as long as they still have enough Expedition Rations at their disposal. With others they can only try once. At this point here your Settlers can try once more.
Storage Room
While searching the shop your Settlers discovered a Storage Room. Now they can penetrate further inside the Ruin if you urge them to do so. Here too, certain advantages are going to be useful again.

Your Settlers were very successful with their search. They found a few devices they will be able to make good use of for Research activities later on. You should keep a sharp eye out for these kinds of Research utensils because they can only be found on Expeditions.

Unfortunately, your Settlers were not successful. That can happen when they don't utilize all advantages to the fullest extent. With some options your Settlers can keep trying over and over again as long as they still have enough Expedition Rations at their disposal. With others they can only try once. At this point here your Settlers can try once more.
A Radioactive Reminder

Hey chief, it's been quite some time since we ventured out of our Endzone. We've experienced a lot for the better, but we've had to go through a lot, too. Particularly this damned Radiation demanded a lot from us. We think it's time we erected a Memorial that always reminds us not to repeat the mistakes our ancestors made!
We know that what we're wishing for can't be completed from one day to another. But please don't forget this concern of ours. The Memorial is really important to a lot of us!
This truly is an awe-inspiring place. May it remind us for a long time of the sacrifice we and our Families have made to build up a little bit of hope for ourselves.
We know that what we're wishing for can't be completed from one day to another. But please don't forget this concern of ours. The Memorial is really important to a lot of us!
A Big Sunscreen

Hey chief, especially during the Drought it's going to get hotter than you know what, and some kind of protection against the sun would be really accommodating, especially when you have to take a break now and then. Some of us have given some thought to something. Picture it like a kind of huge tent where we can gather and relax underneath it!
What a shame, chief! Oh well, we still have the blueprint to construct the Building some other time. At any rate it'd be a fantastic opportunity for the settlement!
Perfect, that's a real help to us, especially during the hot and dry phases. But generally speaking you can chill out pretty well here, too!
What a shame, chief! Oh well, we still have the blueprint to construct the Building some other time. At any rate it'd be a fantastic opportunity for the settlement!

Whenever the Inhabitants came down here, then … I don't want to picture it. Man, are we lucky. Like the people here, our ancestors also made their homes underground for 150 years. They survived so that we're able to return to the surface. We owe it to them to remind ourselves of who they were.

There are plans still lying on the cabinet. Looks like they're for one of the tents, just bigger. Chief, I think it was supposed to become an open-sided Pergola for relaxing whenever it rained or the sun was too much. At any rate we'll take the plans along with us.
The doc thinks it would be good for our sick folks, too.

There are plans still lying on the cabinet. Looks like they're for one of the tents, just bigger. Chief, I think it was supposed to become an open-sided Pergola for relaxing whenever it rained or the sun was too much. At any rate we'll take the plans along with us!

Inside the reactor … that was like standing in the heart of the catastrophe. Damn it, we almost didn't make it out of there again. Unbelievable that our ancestors built all that. We've got to do something, chief … we need a place that reminds all of us of this mistake.

I won't ever forget his face when he was killed in action. We had no protection, nothing at all, as if the reactor were a playground. We ought to know better, especially us! And was it really worth it, for a little Scrap? Looking for the reactor was a mistake. We should place a symbol of humility so that no one repeats it.

The woman said that the Building was once a "c-a-k-e s-h-o-p". No idea what that is, but a whole bunch of recipes are lying around here. She recommended one to me. It's called "pound cake". I think we'll manage to make it and people might get a kick out of it.

Besides the Rations, he also revealed a secret to us how he was able to survive for so long: on stew. Yeah, I didn't believe it, either. He claims it even brings the starved back to life again. He wants to prepare one for us straight away when we're back at the settlement again!

A huge pipe system is hanging from the ceiling that leads to a Well outside. No idea what you'd need so much Water for. We're not able to dismantle it, chief, but we've made a drawing. Maybe our Researchers can do something with it!

There are drawings here in the container that have stayed dry. They planned to set up aquaculture farms for breeding aboveground. They wanted to supply the Fish with special feed. It's all described here. I think it works for our ponds, too. Good thing we took a look around here.
Wait until the Scout has examined the Ruin.
The Unshakable Ago
You've said my people are hopeless cases. We were, once. I took in one and all, together we are strong. Give us what we need, then no one will get hurt.
Yes, everyone leads a comfortable life. But when someone doesn't fit in here, they're simply sent away. Look at us, we're back! Give us what we want or else we'll take it!
Yeah, yeah, you got lucky! Don't start getting ideas! Don't forget the people who didn't get a thing. That's precisely the point, we've survived and now we're here. Get used to treating us decently!

The outcasts come to me because I keep them alive. True, we don't have much and we work hard, each and every day. But we don't just do as we're told, not by anyone. Don't think for a second that you're better than us.
That's a good thing. I believe you've understood.
Fine, don't relinquish the least bit of what's yours. Then it's time for us to come to you!
We'll rise again, over and over again, and that's a promise!
Enjoy the moment. Soon you'll be laughing from the other side of your faces!
You think you're something better. You deserve what's happening here!
Liam the Prophet

The catastrophe showed where we made our mistakes. Progress is a path that leads astray. My visions have shown me a different place! Let's join forces and heal, it's the only path there is. Will you support us – or will you oppose us?
I get the point. You don't learn. What you call progress has already wiped out mankind once. Grasp that you're walking on the wrong path. Give what you have. One day you'll be grateful to me!

The old demons plague you, you let yourselves be ruled by Technology. Free yourselves, for only doom awaits you here. I know the path, as if I could see it right before my eyes. Will you cheer us on – or place yourselves in our way?

There is hope, I know it. When I lost my sight I was able to see more clearly than ever before. A path exists to a pure world. I've seen it in my dreams. You know this, too: Leave this place! Will you join us on our path?
I may be blind, but my people say that what you're giving is a lot. I hope for your sake that you'll soon follow us.
You blunder through this world, Technology poisons you. Let me free you!
These souls had struck out on the path to a better life. You had to kill all of them. Was it worth it?
These people reached out their hand to you, but you refused to take it. I hope it's not the end of you.
Everything we've done was in your best interests. I hope you'll understand that at some point.
Lynn the Queen
I am your queen, I have given freedom to my people. You're afraid, aren't you? Roar your silly commands, crawl away and hide in your holes. Free people simply take what they want.

My forefathers survived here on the surface while you still waited like worms underground. We, we have survived. A human being was never so free. I've never followed an order, not one. I'll show you what freedom is!

You scurry and scrabble about so busily, and all just to hold out a bit longer. Go on, hand over everything you've got, that's what your leader wants. You live like ants, sometimes underground, other times above. That's what you are: bugs, not human beings.

My people follow me, they love me. They're sick and tired of slaving away like animals for others. Now they live as they please, and I let them take what they need. Do you really believe you can stop them?
Yes, fair and square, give what you've got, that's the way! Don't be afraid, I won't do a thing to you. You can go on living whatever your lives were.
I'll squash you between my fingers!
They've come, they've fought, they've died. That's how it is to really, truly live!
Soon the people will run off and leave you, too. They'll yearn to have us back!
And so you lie there in filth, waving your scrawny arms around. It won't get you anywhere!
Mike the Mega-Devourer
They say I eat anything. You've got plenty. *Sniffs* … I can smell it, yeeeaaah, smell it all the way here. Give it to me! I want ALL OF IT!
Some call me a pig. *Smacks his lips* Do pigs eat people?
Is that your machines? Ahh, just my stomach. My stomach's growling!
Nothing left, again. All gone. Not one bit anywhere. Mhm … we're hungry! Your food! Hand it over!
Mushrooms and berries. There's venison now and then. Nothing to be found anywhere! You've got so much food. Where did you get it, hm? Where? Give us some!
Ahhhh … just the smell of it!
Mealtime!
Eat or be eaten!
Hmm …. You've got talent. Wait and see. I'll be back!
To survive means to devour!
The Nihilists

We want to take part in your fun. Don't worry, we won't rob you or kill you. But you do have so many things we can destroy. On the other hand, you could pay for protection, but that would be so … boring!
When was the last time you destroyed something? Go on, give it a try! There's no feeling in the world like it.
You get your little kicks out of building up all these pretty things. And we have fun tearing them down again. That's called splitting up the work.
Do we want to enjoy ourselves? Please don't pay any tribute. We only offer the option because that's how it's done. We don't want to stick out like a sore thumb.
What a shame... maybe some other time.
You can't do a thing. Try dancing around a bit.
Looks like this round goes to you.
We'll be back, we'll leave nothing behind, you'll be stripped down to the bare bones.
That's a real playground you've got there. We'll come back again, that's a promise!
Pay the Tribute?

You can see the kinds of demands the Raiders place here. You can decide whether you want to pay them or not. Normally the Raiders would attack you if you're not willing to pay, but this is naturally just an exercise. I'll leave it up to you whether you want to hand over Tribute or not.
You have paid the Raiders. They won't attack you this time.
The Raiders are now on the way to your settlement.
Your defense was able to stop all the Raiders. Very well done.
Your defense was able to force all the Raiders to flee. They won't be back so fast.
Unfortunately, your defense was unable to force all the Raiders to flee or to stop them. Next time you ought to be better prepared.
Raider Tutorial
A brief introduction to the Raider system in Endzone. Learn to protect your settlement against attacks or avoid them altogether.
Welcome

Welcome to this exercise, old friend! In this session I want to show you and explain how you can prepare your Settlers for <link="23"><style="DefaultLink">Raiders</style></link>. The larger and more successful your settlement gets, the greater the likelihood that Raiders are going to take notice of you.
However, there's no need for you to worry that you're helpless and at the mercy of these Raiders. Today I'd like to show you several strategies you can use to protect your settlement.
Ammunition Factory

First and foremost, it's going to be important to set up our own <link="23"><style="DefaultLink">Defenses</style></link>. An Ammunition Factory is going to be necessary to arm those Settlers who will be defending your settlement in the future. It would be best if you also assigned several Technicians right away who are supposed to work at the Ammunition Factory.

Very good. It's left up to you to decide whether you want to have your <link="23"><style="DefaultLink">Ammunition Factory</style></link> manufacture lethal or non-lethal <link="23"><style="DefaultLink">Ammunition</style></link>. While lethal Ammunition deals damage to the attacking Raiders, non-lethal Ammunition ensures that their Morale sinks. If the Raiders have lost all their Morale, they'll flee.
Mine

No matter what type of Ammunition you want to have manufactured, one thing can't be missing: your Ammunition Factory requires some <link="23"><style="DefaultLink">Sulfur</style></link> for Production. Sulfur can be obtained in your <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Mines</style></link>. To do this, simply instruct your Mines to mine Sulfur in the future.
Very good, old friend! Now the Production of Ammunition can get going full steam ahead.
Watchtower

To be able to give your settlement blanket protection against attackers, the next thing you ought to do is to build several <link="23"><style="DefaultLink">Watchtowers</style></link> and assign <link="23"><style="DefaultLink">Militia</style></link> there. Your Settlers will fire at Raiders from these Watchtowers. It will be best if you place your towers in such a way that they don't stand too close to each other so that your entire settlement can be protected whenever possible.

Very good. These Watchtowers form the center of your defense. At each Watchtower you can individually configure the type of Ammunition the Militia who have been assigned there are supposed to fire at the Raiders.
Siren Tower

Besides the manned Watchtowers you can also set up unmanned <link="23"><style="DefaultLink">Siren Towers</style></link> that are driven by a Power Supply. These Siren Towers will emit a loud alarm signal and reduce the Morale of Raiders who venture too close to the tower.
Very good! The new Siren Tower has been erected. Make sure that it is supplied with Electricity in the event of an attack. Otherwise it could happen that it's not operational at the decisive moment.
Blockade

Your Watchtowers and Siren Towers are now ready for action. You can additionally set up <link="23"><style="DefaultLink">Blockades</style></link> to hold back advancing Raiders even further. These Blockades will slow down the gangs of marauders and consequently provide your towers with more time to reveal their devastating effect.
Very good! This settlement seems to me to be sufficiently secured now.
An Attack

As you can see, a <link="23"><style="DefaultLink">Raider Force</style></link> is now on its way here. Pay attention to the direction they're coming from. You might have enough time to adapt your defense a bit. I'm going to keep my head down for the time being until those scoundrels don't bother the settlement anymore. Good luck!
It looks as if they were the last Raiders. And the settlement's still standing! Well, it did get a few scratches here and there, but nothing we couldn't recover from.
Paying Tribute

However, in many cases the Raiders won't be paying you a visit just like that without any advance warning and a reason. Most of the time they'll demand <link="23"><style="DefaultLink">Tribute</style></link> from you beforehand. If you can pay this Tribute they'll leave you in peace – that is, at least for a certain period of time. This time I want you to pay the Tribute the Raiders are demanding from you so that we can focus on rebuilding here at the settlement.
Very good! By doing so you've bought us a little time to enable us to prepare ourselves further.
Goodbye
With this I have taught you what you need to know in order to defend yourself against Raiders in Endzone.
In closing, I'd also like to give you a tip to try out different strategies and use the area surrounding your settlement to your advantage.
Withstand the Raiders' first raid
Withstand the Raiders' second raid
Withstand the Raiders' third raid
Hunters and the Hunted

Regular assaults by Raiders have hit the people in the region hard. Deprived of their livelihoods, they are searching for a new homeland. You have the mission to build a Shelter at an abandoned outpost that withstands the upcoming attacks. Upon your arrival you find nothing more than a few rusty Watchtowers. A slick-talking Trader implies that your intention hasn't remained a secret to the Raiders. Can you provide the people seeking help with a new homeland and defend them against all attacks?
Everyone has arrived at last. Since the raid these people haven't had any home. Now there's a place where they can establish something new for themselves.
An Abandoned Outpost

It's going to be quite a challenge to get this site set up and ready. At least we have some Watchtowers. We should go take a look at them. And word has it that the Raiders are at loggerheads with each other. That gives us time we ought to make use of for preparations.
Excellent! We've managed to establish a new home for ourselves. Our people have hope again that things are looking up.
How did that happen? In my mind this was a formidable task we had set out to do. It was simply too much for us!
We're Going to Fight!
There they are, the Raiders, they've banded together again! There was reason to fear that. We have to assign Militia and man the towers. We can't give up this place.
Thank god, the Raiders are gone! They'll be back, but there's valuable time left for us until then.
There were too many of them, much too many. We fought bravely, but our Defenses were simply no match for them.
A Safe Shelter

After that attack I'd say the Raiders have had their fill for the moment. That gives us enough time to reinforce our Defenses. However, the Raiders have devastated two settlements in the surrounding area, the Inhabitants lost everything they had. Now those people are on their way here. We're their last hope for protection.
What we have achieved is impressive. Our people feel safe, even after all the dangers they had to face.
How did that happen? In my mind this was a formidable task we had set out to do. It was simply too much for us!
They're Fighting Back!
The Raiders, they're back again – and there are even more of them! It seems like many of their victims have joined up with them in order to survive. Let's hope that our Defenses withstand the attack.

The Raiders are retreating! We've done a good job of defending ourselves! The raids have brought the people in this region to the brink of destruction. We're their hope! This settlement has proven its defendability. The people from the surrounding settlements have set off on their way to us.
There were too many of them, much too many. We fought bravely, but our Defenses were simply no match for them.
An Impregnable Fortress

Let's provide all people with a safe and secure home! The Raiders have pulled back for now, which gives us the time we need. Despite all optimism, we have to be on the alert. The Raiders know that there's plenty to loot from us. Word has it they're getting ready to strike a mighty blow. We have to scale up the Defenses even further.
Everyone has found their place in our settlement and can lead a protected life. That's worth a lot!
How did that happen? In my mind this was a formidable task we had set out to do. It was simply too much for us!
All or nothing!
There they are! My god, so many all at once. Our worst fear has come true: They want to raze this settlement to the ground.
We did it! This place has become a fortress that will offer us protection for a very long time.
There were too many of them, much too many. We fought bravely, but our Defenses were simply no match for them.
No one is left. It seems like survival in this world doesn't stand a chance.
Word has it that the remaining Raiders are moving on to regions farther away. There's no easy prey for them here anymore. We've driven them off for good!
A Special Price for Friends

Hey hey, remember me? Rusty Rolph's here! The Raiders are breathing down your necks, aren't they? Listen: I've got blueprints for you. That's right, this ought to scare them out of their wits if they come here. I'd love to just hand them over to you … the only thing is ... my business isn't doing too hot at the moment. Haha, yeah, that's how it is. What do you think? You help Rusty and Rusty helps you?
Say, you're one peachy person, really, you are. And the two of us, we're a class team. I'm gonna split before – well, whatever.
You've got to understand it has to be worth my while, too. Deals and stuff, offers, you know … m-hm, yes, sure, an offer ... can be turned down, right.
A Tempting Offer

First of all, the good news: Rusty's back again! And now the bad part: The Raiders are gathering. Man oh man, I tell you, there's lots of them. I've got something here - they're blueprints. This ought to stop them in their tracks if they attack. Surprise, surprise, huh? I can help, sure thing, I'll give them to you … but you might have to do me a small, just a teeny-weeny favor.
I told you so, I told you so: There's good business to be done with you. No kidding, if the Raiders come, I just hope … aah heck, you'll take care of it, sure thing … somehow.
Come on, I thought we had something special going between us. True friendship is, what's the word … priceless, yeah, right. Well, then good luck … pal.
Wait until the Raiders arrive
No more Raiders nearby
All set, chief! In the near future we'll be on the lookout for radio messages sent out by other survivors and notify you if we run into anything.
We'll keep an eye out for outlanders.

Our Researchers have an idea to try their luck with a new Technology. They propose developing a number of Defense Strategies that ought to protect us against potential attacks. They're waiting for permission to be allowed to commence their studies.

Our Researchers have an idea to try their luck with a new Technology. They propose developing Barricades that can slow down advancing Raiders during their attack. They're waiting for permission to be allowed to commence their studies.

Additional Survivors

A group of survivors has reached out to us. The situation apparently deals with a larger group of survivors. They're requesting that we let them join our settlement. But to provide for such a large number of newcomers there are several preparations we'll have to make. Do you think we can allow ourselves a project on this scale at the moment, chief?
We've made all the preparations as far as we could, chief! Now we're in a position to accept the group. We've already spoken with them and they're already on their way to our settlement.
We're sorry about it, but we're going to notify the group that we're unfortunately not going to be able to let them join us.
Sadly, we're not going to manage to also provide for these people as well, chief. We have no other option than to send them on and wish them all the best.
Roaming Outlanders

We've just received a radio message, chief! A group of roaming survivors has requested that we support them with a few kinds of Materials. According to the info they sent they need Food, Water, Protective Clothing and the like. Do you think there's anything we can spare?

We've collected in the settlement and gotten everything together we were able to spare. We ought to have helped to ease those people's worst hardships with that stuff. One part of the group has even decided to join our settlement. It's a sure thing we'll be able to put the extra hands to good use.
If you think so, chief! I'll give them the news that we're not able to help anyone at the moment.
If we're not able to provide those people with the barest necessities, it will probably be best if they simply moved on. It's not easy, but we just can't spare a thing.
Collect for the survivors!
We can't spare a thing!
Defend yourself successfully against the Raiders.
If the Quest fails, the Scenario fails.
I think the time has finally come for me to bow out as advisor. I firmly believe that you will lead us to a glorious future.
VSync must be switched off to be able to set the maximum frame rate.
A Large Population Growth

Hey, chief! There are more and more of us Settlers lately! If our population figures continue to rise so rapidly it might lead to supply bottlenecks. You can control the population growth a bit by housing more Settlers in Shelters, or via the Forum by prohibiting the Settlers from reproducing in the near future.
The decision's up to you. We just thought you definitely ought to know that we're reckoning with a whole bunch of new Children in the near future.
Watch Your Population Growth!
Well-Fortified Preparation
We've heard about marauding groups that are making the surrounding area unsafe. Our Settlers want you to initiate measures to defend them against possible attacks by Raiders.
We've created a good basis to enable us to defend ourselves against Raiders in the future. On the other hand, you shouldn't rest now and keep on upgrading our Defenses wherever possible!
That's bad, chief! If we're not able to defend ourselves, then we're entirely at the mercy of the Raiders. We probably won't have any other choice left than to comply with their demands.
Imminent Raider Attack

Hey, chief! Alarming rumors have reached our ears. Apparently a force of Raiders is assembling right near us and it won't be long before they try to attack us. You ought to make sure that our Defenses are able to withstand an attack!
We should stay alert, chief! Who knows when the Raiders will set off on their way here.
The Raiders Have Been Defeated!
We beat the attackers, chief! We were able to gather up some of the gear they had with them. Some of those things could prove to be extremely useful.
The Raiders Have Been Driven Away
The Raiders have fled head over heels! While taking flight they apparently left part of their gear behind. We've gathered up whatever of it we'll still be able to use.
