We think we've gathered up everything.
Prosperity Tutorial
An introduction to the new content in Endzone - A World Apart - Prosperity. Get acquainted with new raw materials and Buildings, as well as how the Town Hall functions.
Welcome

A warm welcome to you! I’m glad to have the pleasure of welcoming you again. In this Tutorial I’d like to stand by you during the steps your settlement is going to take in order to become a stalwart cradle for a new civilization.

Up till now you’ve managed to enable your Settlers to survive in this bleak, barren world. You have furnished them with Food, Water, Protective Clothing and a roof over their heads. You have also already begun to make Electricity available to them again and improve their quality of life.
Town Hall

Now that this supply is ensured, your Settlers are going to noticeably demand more luxury in their lives. After the lengthy trials and tribulations, they finally want to be able to enjoy the fruits of their hard work. The place where they can turn to you with such requests is the Town Hall. To build a <link="24"><style="DefaultLink">Town Hall</style></link> you have to have the Town Center upgraded.
Very good. Now that your Settlers have a Town Hall, it will only be a matter of time until they assemble there to direct their demands on you.
Settlers’ Demands

Unlike the Forum where your Settlers make suggestions to you as to how you can ensure their survival, the Town Hall is where your Settlers will call for your enactment of their <link="24"><style="DefaultLink">demands</style></link>. When doing so they will always give you two options. To satisfy them you must always fulfill only one of these demands. Maybe you ought to go take a look now and see if your Settlers are already making demands and fulfill one of them.

That worked out well. If you don’t fulfill your Settlers’ demands or ignore them for too long, your Settlers are going to become more and more displeased with your style of leadership. So see to it that you always keep them satisfied when they make a demand.
Sand Mine

Settlers’ demands are going to have a great deal to do with improving their living conditions. To achieve this, sooner or later you’re going to need completely new construction materials and Resources. Let’s start here with <link="15"><style="DefaultLink">Sand</style></link>. Sand is an important raw material required during the Production of <link="25"><style="DefaultLink">Glass</style></link> or <link="25"><style="DefaultLink">Concrete</style></link>. Build a Sand Mine near the small Lake in your settlement to be able to mine Sand.
The Sand Mine has now been built and is ready for operation. Your Miners will now begin to extract the Sand and store it.
Concrete

In addition to Sand, <link="15"><style="DefaultLink">Cement</style></link> is also needed to produce <link="25"><style="DefaultLink">Concrete</style></link>. Cement can be obtained from Mines. To do this, instruct one of your Mines to mine Cement in the future. At the same time, you should build a <link="25"><style="DefaultLink">Cement Factory</style></link> to provide the necessary resources to start producing Concrete.
Very good! With that, your settlement is now in a position to produce another valuable construction material on its own.
Material Factory

But Concrete isn’t the only new raw material you’re going to need to be able to appease your Settlers who have become so demanding. The <link="25"><style="DefaultLink">Material Factory</style></link> is able to obtain <link="25"><style="DefaultLink">Glass</style></link> out of Sand or <link="25"><style="DefaultLink">Strengthened Metal</style></link> out of Metal. You’ll need both raw materials to erect Buildings like the Greenhouse or the Aquafarm. But I’m getting a bit ahead of myself. Perhaps we should focus first on building the Material Factory.

The Material Factory is now up and ready for operation! Very well done! Now that the new construction materials are available to you we can address more ambitious Projects. Ever since your Settlers initially arrived here they immediately began to collect Water. The time has come to improve this process a bit.
Pumping Station

If you place a <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">Pumping Station</style></link> next to your Lake and supply it with Electricity it will begin to pump Water to your Towers, all by itself and fully automatic. Then you can assign the Workforce that’s been freed as a result to a different place. Practical, isn’t it? However, to enable your Water Tower to be hooked up to a Pumping Station you still have to <link="6"><style="DefaultLink">upgrade it once more</style></link>.
The Pumping Station works! This is a big step for our settlement. A Pump like that is going to make the Settlers’ lives safer and more pleasant!
Aquafarm

With the surplus Water from the Pumping Station we could try to run an <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Aquafarm</style></link>. The Aquafarm breeds Fish without them needing a Lake to breed in. As long as it is being supplied with some Water the Aquafarm is able to continue to produce Food.
Excellent. With this Aquafarm our Food Supply will become less and less dependent on the Weather, and now even during a Drought, we’re in a better position to feed ourselves.
Greenhouse

In addition to supplying them with Fish during a Drought period you can also make efforts to have your Settlers receive Seeds, too. With the newly obtained Glass you can commission the construction of a <link="5"><style="DefaultLink">Greenhouse</style></link>. In a Greenhouse like this you can plant all the kinds of Seeds that your Settlers would normally sow on Fields.
The Greenhouse has been built. Now the Seeds can grow there, completely protected against the Environment, and continue to provide for your settlement. That’s going to be a big help!
New Dwellings

With all the additional construction materials that are now available, your Settlers are also going to ask you to gradually begin to  <link="4"><style="DefaultLink">further upgrade their dwellings</style></link> so that they provide more comfort and become more resistant to weather conditions.

Your Settlers are pleased about their new, much more comfortable dwellings. They’re glad to live in this settlement because it can provide them with a safe and secure, dignified and - at the same time - a comfortable life, too. You’ve done a very good job of setting things up!
A Cradle of Civilization

All of our progress has led to us being on the best track toward becoming the cradle for a new Civilization. Through constant and stable Growth this settlement will slowly but surely rise to become a true metropolis and a shining example of our will to survive. The more Settlers who call this settlement their home, the closer we will get to our goal to create a safe and sound future for humanity. If you’d like to know how many more Settlers you need on your path, you can have your Growth Progress shown to you.

In fact, maybe we should begin by erecting a symbol which shows the whole world that, despite all the obstacles, we have survived successfully. What do you think? Although, we shouldn’t forget, that blind Growth could quickly lead to not being able to sufficiently provide for all your Settlers. If you intend to continue to grow, that’s why you ought to be certain that your population can also handle that Growth, too.
Goodbye

And with that I’d like to readily take the opportunity to bow out again! In concluding, I want to urgently advise you to pay attention to your population’s demands time and again, because if you ignore them, it could quickly lead to a large degree of discontentment arising in your settlement.
However, I am convinced that you are going to lead your Settlers to a great future.
A Beacon of Hope

The larger and more satisfied our settlement becomes, the more Inhabitants it can provide for. Sooner or later, word will get around that you are able offer a worthwhile future for one-and-all. Your settlement will soon be on the way to evolving into a full-fledged metropolis. When Growth has progressed far enough we can start to erect a <link="25"><style="DefaultLink">Monument to Our Success</style></link>. You can already have the basic structure for it laid out now.

With that, the first step has been taken! Keep on growing to enable construction of the Beacon landmark to be completed. This might turn out to be a long and rocky road, but I am convinced that you will manage to master this path as well.
The Factory Unit

With such a large population figure that it might possibly become difficult for our Production facilities to provide all the Settlers with sufficient Clothing and Tools. If you build a <link="18"><style="DefaultLink">Factory Unit</style></link> near this Production Building the Factory Unit will speed up Production at the facilities. However, to accomplish this the Factory Unit requires a steady inflow of Glass, Concrete and Strengthened Metal.
Very good! This Factory Unit will further boost Production at our Tailor’s Shops and Workshops in order to prepare us for the larger Growth of our population.
With that you have successfully completed the Tutorial to Prosperity.
Open the Growth Overview

Your Settlers are now protected against environmental hazards and external attacks. They feel safe and sound in your settlement. What might still happen now is that your Settlers come to you again and again to call for a bit of luxury in their lives in order to be able to enjoy the fruits of their hard work for a change after all the lengthy trials and tribulations. The place where they will turn to you with such requests is the <link="24"><style="DefaultLink">Town Hall</style></link>. To obtain a Town Hall you have to have the Town Center upgraded one more time.
Now that Electronics are finally available to us you can have your Town Center upgraded one more time to provide for more Storage Capacity.
Very good! The additional Storage Capacity is going to be very useful.
Upgrade Town Center
Find one Research Utensil and enlarge the selection of Food offered
Build a Kitchen and expand the amount of Farming
Build Greenhouses and cultivate Coffee
Back to Back

After a series of internal disputes, this so promising Research colony has split into two camps and threatens to break up altogether. On one side are the Researchers, on the other the Scouts. If they were to work together they could improve mutual life on a lasting basis. Instead, the Settlers fight over food! You have been appointed mediator as a last attempt to settle the squabble. Will you bring the divided settlement together while not losing sight of the common goals?

It’s all one big circus here! The Scouts are supposed to salvage Utensils from the surrounding area so that the Researchers can cultivate the Plants they’ve selected in the fields. Whatever’s left over during harvesting lands on the table.
No one’s ever starved yet! Not with me! Every belly’s full, it’s all super-duper! But all I hear is nag, nag, nag!

Yeah, yeah, I get the point. The Scouts slave away day in, day out, and what ends up on the plate is always the same. But what else am I supposed to cook, huh? The only things grown are Cabbage and Pears – that’s how the Researchers want it, it’s not my fault.
Clenched Fists

Chief, it can’t go on like this. The Scouts want more variety and the Researchers insist on their Utensils. The damned whiners, now they’re not even talking anymore! Just between us: The Food here really always is the same – and a drink wouldn’t hurt, either.

They’re welcoming the Pub with open arms! Now there’s finally different kinds of meals and a shot of Hard Liquor to boot. Don’t need a thing more to have a nice evening. But the people aren’t exactly fond of each other yet.
One Hand Washes the Other

The Researchers go on about how important their Project is to prevent a famine. But they’ve sure taken a liking to the new variety in the Food. They think we ought to grow more Plants – for Research purposes, of course. The Scouts are dead set on having a real Kitchen. You think we can get that done?

I’ve been hoping and praying for a Kitchen for ages! There’s even a small selection here to choose from, with a real menu! I’m telling you, a hot meal does wonders. It simply puts people in a better mood. The Scouts have even found one more Utensil.
Hand in Hand

This Scientist, she proposed building a few Greenhouses for Research. That would be a really fine step for everybody. Just picture it, she had a few Coffee beans with her that could be planted. Man-o-man, chief, Coffee and Cake! Now there’s a good reason to put in some overtime!

A-OK! At the beginning we had the same stuff to eat, I mean every single day, and the Scouts weren’t talking to the Researchers. Not one word. That sure didn’t help anybody. Now we even have Coffee and Cake! It wasn’t that hard, after all: a little bit of consideration and lots of cooperation.
Actually, the whole thing wasn’t that hard, after all: a little bit of consideration and lots of cooperation were enough.
I really hoped that the people here would find a way to get along again. But they were so at odds with each other we didn’t have a chance to survive in this world.
With that, the scenario “Back to Back” comes to a close. Now you can simply keep on playing or switch back to the Main Menu.

The Creators of Endzone
Secure the dilapidated structures in the Endzone
Provide for a long-term supply of raw materials
Stockpile Supplies for Generations
Future Without Sunshine

The opinion is prevailing more and more that the Settlers ought to enlarge the old nearby Endzone again and go back beneath the surface. They want to wait there until conditions have improved. It’s becoming increasingly clear that this deals with an enormously ambitious but achievable endeavor.

It’s been decided: We’re going to rebuild our old Endzone again. Thanks that you’re going to manage this project. I have tried to guide this colony through all its crises. What comes now is no job for an old guy like me. I was set on retiring … but I think I ought to stand by your side and advise you the best I can.
Basic Structure

We won’t be able to survive here on the surface, and the attempt has already cost us too much. Future generations need a safe place. Initial studies show that first we have to restore the Endzone’s crucial structures.

A capsule to survive in, without sunshine, wind and weather. I almost forgot what a strange place the Endzone was ... At any rate, we’re making good progress. The crucial structures are at a point where they’re sustainable again. But we still have a fair share of work ahead of us.
Equipment

Our descendants need massive amounts of Resources for maintenance, upkeep and consumables. In addition we ought to make means available to them for Research. They’ll have plenty of peace & quiet and time to work on a return to the surface.

Very good, we’ve gotten the raw materials and Research equipment to the Endzone. Hopefully they’ll be useful. Maybe our descendants will be smarter than we are. I hope they can find a solution to our problems …
Energy

Once they are down there our descendants won’t be able to build up any Power Supply anymore. That’s our Mission. We ought to bank on more reliable solar energy, including Batteries, in order to provide sufficient Energy for Generations.
Excellent. This way our descendants will hopefully be able to supply their vital systems with Electricity for decades, not to mention the Research instruments and other equipment, too.
Final Precautions

We’re on the home stretch, but we shouldn’t forget the necessities: Water and Food – lots of it, because it will have to last for a long time. We also have to stockpile Iodine Tablets and Radiation Suits. That way at least Expeditions to the surface are possible.

We’re done! I clearly recall: When we came to the surface back then I was delighted by the sunshine and fresh air. Even though it was exhausting, I had always wanted to be here. Now I ask myself sometimes if I gave everything I had, if we tried every possibility.

You have ensured the survival of many generations, even though they’ll grow up without sunlight. But the Endzone already rescued us once, it’s the right decision for you – just not for me. I won’t be going along. My place is here and I’m staying.
I had hope back then. Maybe we were blind to the risks and reacted too slowly. Now it all lies in ruins – were we naive to dream of some fresh air and a blue sky?
With that, the scenario “Back to the Endzone” comes to a close. Now you can simply keep on playing or switch back to the Main Menu.
An Aquafarm
Hey, chief, isn’t it about time to improve the quality of the Food we eat? If we were to breed our Fish on an Aquafarm the risk of contamination would be considerably lower.
Good work! You can really be relied on, chief!
Comfortable Living

Hey, chief, we’re still living in Cabins made of sheet Metal and Scrap that can’t even stand up to a Sandstorm. Although, we certainly ought to be able to build more longer-lasting accommodations, shouldn’t we?!
The new dwellings are much better than the old ones. Hats off to you that you took care of it so quickly, chief!
Running Water
We need Water for almost everything, chief! Our Technicians think they can automate the Water Supply even more. That would really save a lot of work! We need your support, chief!
The new Pumping Station turned out to be truly impressive. This way we don’t have to worry about the Water Supply anymore! Fan-tastic!
Safe Farming
At the moment our Fields are very susceptible to Radiation and dry periods. With Greenhouses we could control the quality of the Crop better. We hope you’ll start a pilot project soon, chief.
The Project was a complete success. It’s not only efficient, it’s impressive to look at, too! This way we’ll have much better Food soon.
A Chilled-Out Evening

You read about how people used to smoke Hemp to relax. Sure, Joints like that would be a genuine luxury item, but we’ve all worked hard for our Prosperity, too. Wouldn’t that be a great way to reward ourselves?
The mood has definitely become more relaxed. Lots of people here are content with the little bit of luxury they’re being granted.
Not Just Half-Cooked
At the moment we eat most of our Foods raw. The Cooks say that we can process our Food Items to make a Stew in order to get even more out of our supplies. Let us give it a try, chief!
The people are virtually streaming into the Kitchen to try out the Stew. It really fills you up, too!
A Demand for Cake
In the early days we had to make do without when it came to Food. Now that that’s behind us, we want to treat ourselves to more luxury in our diet. We think that Cake would be just the right thing!
Cake is truly precisely what we needed. It’s a good sign that we’re able to treat ourselves to it in these times!
A Nice Cold Beer
Besides the hard work we ought to arrange our leisure time nicely. We should give brewing Beer a try. That’ll sweeten up things for lots of folks after work.
The better mood is noticeable, the people are already looking forward to knocking off work! Good job!
The Desire for Cleanliness
Some places in the settlement smell pretty nasty, chief! If Soap was available to everyone the daily hygiene would be a lot more effective. At any rate, it can’t stay the way it is now!
Now we really truly get all that filth off our skins. What an improvement!
Coffee
We’ve heard that you can cultivate Coffee Plants and prepare the Beans. Wouldn’t that be a joint venture we ought to tackle? I’m sure that a little luxury will go down well with every one of us.
The Coffee is nice and strong, and it really wakes you up. We were missing a Beverage like that up till now.
Landscape Beautification
We all ought to remind ourselves that together we have created a new Civilization through hard work. We could express that with a Building all its own.
A truly impressive achievement! It’s a genuine verification that we’ve not only survived, we’re able to live in a civilized manner once again.
The First Demand

You’ll find your Settlers’ first Demand on this page. You can address your efforts to either this Quest or the other one. It is not necessary for you to fulfill both Demands. This time they want you to make Cake available to them.
Very well done. By doing so you have fulfilled your Settlers’ Demand. It’s going to take a while before they’ll turn to you with new Demands.

If you don’t fulfill your Settlers’ Demands their Confidence is going to decline. This will go on for so long until you have attended to the Quest that has been posed for you to do. So you ought to try to fulfill Demands whenever possible.
Rejecting your Settlers’ Demands is not going to make them particularly happy. Their Contentedness will rapidly decline if you ignore their wishes.
The Second Demand

You’ll find your Settlers’ second Demand on this page. You can address your efforts to either this Quest or the other one. It is not necessary for you to fulfill both Demands. This time they want you to make Stew available to them.
Very well done. By doing so you have fulfilled your Settlers’ Demand. It’s going to take a while before they’ll turn to you with new Demands.

If you don’t fulfill your Settlers’ Demands their Confidence will decline. This will go on for so long until you have attended to one of the Demands made on you. So you ought to try to fulfill Demands whenever possible.
Rejecting your Settlers’ Demands is not going to make them particularly happy. Their Contentedness will rapidly decline if you ignore their wishes.
Demands
Choose one of your Settlers’ Demands that you want to fulfill!
Fulfill your Settlers’ demand on a timely basis to maintain their well-being.
Accept Demand
View Demands
With each fulfilled Demand you receive more time before you have to accept the next Demand.
Shifting Down a Gear
With all this Technology around, shouldn’t there be something that helps all of us to relax, too? We thought of some Joints, for example. Don’t forget, chief, it’s about our well-being!
At last! With all this Productivity it's important to shift down a gear once in a while. How cool that it worked out.
How About Trying Out a New Recipe?
It would be nice to have a little more variety in the Food. We don’t need to cultivate any new Plants, we’ll just take what we have and make Stew out of it. Why shouldn’t that be possible?
It's working magnificently. Amazing what a difference a good recipe makes – you don't have to plant anything new at all.
Don't Forget Dessert!
We have good, hearty meals at the settlement. But a lot of us want a change of pace, in other words a genuine alternative. How about Cake? That ought to be doable, shouldn't it?
Just as expected, the Cake is a super-duper alternative to the other dishes.
An Ancient Tradition
People used to brew Beer from Wheat and Water. We have to try that out, chief!
A Beer like that is a fine thing. What luck that we're carrying on with this ancient tradition.
Clean as a Whistle
Personal hygiene is very important, chief. We wash ourselves regularly, but you don’t get really clean with just Water. We really ought to start to produce Soap.
All the dirt and grime is gone at last. Makes you feel like new right away.
Nothing Like a Coffee in the Morning …
Chief, on gray days lots of us have problems with really waking up. Looks like people used to drink Coffee to get them going better in the mornings. That might work for us, too. What do you think?
Now a gray morning is no problem for us, either. Just brew up a little Coffee and off you go.
More Than a Roof Over Your Head
Some Buildings here are very sturdy, but lots of people still live in shacks. We can do better than that, chief, can’t we? No ifs, ands or buts about it! We need comfortable accommodations!
Life here is truly a lot better now – Why didn't we already do this a while ago?
A Few Lovely Nooks and Crannies
Our settlement looks quite presentable. But we ask ourselves if it couldn’t be prettier. After all, we’re not living in misery anymore ...
Now you truly see the Prosperity of this town. Nice place we've got here!
Develop Cement as Construction Material
Process Resources into High-Grade Materials
Provide for Comfortable Houses
More Than Survival

When the first Settlers came out of the Endzone they had to struggle to survive. They made tremendous efforts to safeguard their basic supplies and protect themselves against extreme weather conditions and Radiation. It seems like the phase of hardships is now over and done with. A new Generation of Settlers is beginning to dream of progress and prosperity for their future. They view themselves as citizens of this newly created Civilization and, as such, lay claim to having their say in what goes on. You have received the Mission to mediate between different ideas and make the best of them a reality.

The settlement is flourishing! And yet everything was improvised at the beginning. I was entrusted with the planning back then and allocated work. Yes, sometimes there were long faces. The thing is, we had to survive. There was this one time, –
Grandfather, you had a suggestion, didn't you? Grandfather loves these stories – and meanwhile I know them by heart.
But back to the suggestion...
A Place For Exchanging

The suggestion, yeah, right, exactly … So now we’re able to upgrade our Town Center to a Town Hall. Then the survivors are allowed to make a few smaller suggestions there about upgrading the settlement.

The time has come for me to bow out. I’d like to take things a little easier at my age. You’ve met Ella. She’ll take care of everything at the Town Hall. Drop by and, if you want, let yourself be inspired when making your decisions.
A Mighty Foundation

Grandfather accomplished a great deal – but he can be very “strong-minded”. It used to be that everyone had to survive, no time for contradicting! These days people want to have a say in things. We’re here to put their wishes into practice. There are already two issues on my desk at the Town Hall. No matter which one of the two you decide to go for, in any case we’re going to need Concrete. So get to work!

With the Concrete, now we’re able to build much more stable structures. And it’s really great that you’ve seen to the Settlers’ concerns. Honest, the people appreciate that, even though it’s not possible to get every wish fulfilled.
Best Materials

Now there’s not one but a whole bunch of exciting plans to obtain valuable Materials from collected Scrap and, by doing so, improve our Water Supply. By all means, we should do it! Then I have two more suggestions here. What do you think, which one will we put into practice?
Awesome! The new Materials will open up lots of new Technologies. Particularly the Water Supply is doing a fabulous job. Hard to believe that the first Settlers hauled Water in buckets.
A Home To Feel Good In

So many ideas! People somehow always find time to give some thought to our future. They suggest making our long-serving dwellings a bit more stable and comfortable. And drop by at the Town Hall for a minute. You have to help me make a decision in favor of a suggestion!
Amazing, this project worked out well, too. What a luxury we’ve achieved. I’m simply delighted!

At long last, we’re dreaming again – and this time together, so that no one will be left out! After all, everyone has the right to shape their own future. Thanks for helping me with this – I never could have put that into practice all by myself.
With that, the scenario “More Than Survival” comes to a close. Now you can simply keep on playing or switch back to the Main Menu.
Empty Plates
Hey, chief, we’re running out of Coffee and Cake. Fixed groups have formed that get together in the afternoons. It gives them support, especially the older ones!
Thanks a lot for taking care of that. Now the get-together is just as nice again as it was before.
Hey, chief, this here is an important matter, you shouldn’t just lose track of it.
What a shame. We really thought we could improve our living conditions on a lasting basis. It’s a step backwards!
In a Hangover Mood
Hey, chief, no Beer and no Joints far and wide. The evenings were always nice and chilled-out up till now, but what’s supposed to happen with our time after work now?
Very good, chief, we knew you’d get it straightened out!
What, really, that's it for relaxation now? That's pretty tough, don't you think so, chief?
We thought we were doing well and could dedicate our efforts to bigger issues. But if we can't even produce Beer and Joints reliably, we'd better scale back our ambitions.
Unprotected Plants
Hey, chief, what’s up with our lovely Greenhouses? We wanted to reserve them for times of crisis. Are we supposed to just go back to eating Vegetables from outdoor Fields again?
They’re back again, the Greenhouses! They look gorgeous, don’t they?
First you build Greenhouses, then all of a sudden they disappear. Now you refuse to rebuild them - what's up, chief? Is this what's called sustainable planning?
We already had Greenhouses - and now suddenly it's supposed to be impossible to rebuild them? Actually, we are making progress, but this really is a strange state of affairs!
The Fish Isn’t Fresh
What are you doing? We just finished building the Aquafarms and now they’re gone again?! How are we supposed to get our hands on Fish when there’s a Drought?
Simply terrific, an Aquafarm like that. Hopefully they’ll still be there when I come back tomorrow ...
We thought that building Aquafarms was a done deal. But suddenly they're gone and now you don't want to build new ones? That's really tough to figure out, chief!
Chief, are we really going backwards? We already had Aquafarms, so what's so difficult about rebuilding them?
Lovely Evenings at the Pub

In the evenings after all the work, sometimes we just want to tune out. It’d be cool if there was something like that! Maybe a nice cold Beer and a Joint to forget all the stress – there’s gotta be room for that!
Very good, Beer and Joints are fine and dandy. You’re cordially invited to relax on an evening with us, chief!
Convivial Lunchtime Breaks

There’s always something missing with this whole hearty lunchtime meal. Sometimes we still want to sit together and shoot the breeze. A strong cup of Coffee and a piece of Cake hit the spot for that! You can set that up, can’t you?
Awesome that you took care of that, chief. Coffee and Cake for dessert, they motivate a heck of a lot more to keep on working.
Hey, what’s wrong with you, chief? First you promise a lot and then don’t deliver?! We really expected more, no kidding!
Sure, you can’t agree to every wish. But to simply ignore us completely, now that’s really disappointing.
In the Hothouse
With more technical options we’d be able to build Greenhouses. They’re crisis-proof, more productive, and the Crop tastes fresher. We ought to treat ourselves to that!
The new Greenhouses look fantastic! With all the grime in the air, it’s definitely better if our Plants grow inside them.
In the Goldfish Bowl
With better Water management we’d be able to build Aquafarms. That way we’ll have fresh, healthy Fish, even during a drought. Meanwhile we’ve earned that!
The plant system is running, the Fish are doing magnificently. What prosperity this is. Now we have fresh Fish, no matter what.
What happened, chief, did you really make an effort to help us? Let’s hope you do a better job of it next time.
Are you really so busy that you can’t take a minute to listen to us? We’re truly disappointed in you, chief!
That Little Something Special
You can’t forget the everyday problems, chief. Some meals don’t really fill your belly, and apart from that we only use Water to wash ourselves. You never really get clean that way!
The Stew is delectable. We haven’t eaten our fill like this for quite some time. By the way, the Soap does wonders. It smells a lot better on every corner right away.
Four Strong Walls
Sometimes we ask ourselves why some of our Buildings are still such shacks. Can’t they be built a little sturdier so that they don’t just collapse?
Thanks to the new Concrete the Buildings look much sturdier right away. Now the Sandstorms can come. No weather’s going to get the best of us.
You assured us that you’d take care of it, chief! We ask ourselves just how important the Inhabitants of this settlement really are to you!
Is it asking too much that you listen to the people from this settlement for once? Plenty of us have good ideas for the future. You’d do better to listen to them!
Fulfill one of the two Demands your Settlers have made on you!
It’s a real pain that you wouldn’t be able to help us. We hope that our wishes get more of your attention in the future, chief!
Really disappointing. We thought you’d take some kind of action.
Sure, we understand that there’s a lot to do. But the matter was very important to all of us, chief!
Anyone who gives his word ought to keep it, too, chief!
Got the point. Not everything’s as easy as it looks at the start. But we’ve already gotten so many things going together, we really would’ve expected more!
First you said you’d attend to it – now we hear that nothing’s happened. Can’t we do better than that, chief?
Maybe we’d be better off saying nothing next time. You’re obviously pretty busy when you can’t take care of something as simple as that!
It does make us wonder that you weren’t able to settle the issue. That basically wasn’t asking to do the impossible, was it?
We think you ought to take more time for our concerns, chief!
We want to have our say about the future of this settlement, chief! You ought to take time for us. After all, we’re the ones who built up everything here.
Sure, there’s a lot to do. But is it really so much that you can’t listen to us for a moment, chief?
Don’t you think you ought to take the time to discuss several important issues, chief?
We’ve all worked hard for this kind of life. In return, we equally have the right that our voice is heard!
Sure, we’ve come a long way. But we believe the time has come for innovative ideas. You really ought to give a listen to what we have to say, chief!
We don’t have all the time in the world to wait here. Next time, hopefully you’ll condescend to letting us be heard, chief!
Hey, chief, meanwhile some of us are asking ourselves why you don’t have any time for our concerns.
How Green the Evening Mood
We could cultivate hemp and dry the leaves afterwards. That enables Joints to be produced, the perfect thing for a relaxed afternoon in the sunshine – after work, of course.
The Joints are a big hit. Absolutely perfect for enjoying the midday sunshine – of course, only when there's no work to be done at the moment ...
More to Choose From
We think that more variety can never do any harm. One possibility in the Kitchen is to serve Stew in the future. What do you think?
A first-rate supplement to what was offered before. Thanks for the change of pace, chief!
With Cream on Top, Please!
Always eating just to fill your belly – we yearn for more luxury! We ought to give Cake a try.
The Cake is delicious. Feel like trying a piece too, chief?
Water Is What You Wash With
We drink Water all day long, chief: mornings, noon and nights. A change of pace would be advisable. How about Beer?
Thanks for listening to us, chief. The Beer is perfect for quenching Thirst.
Not Just Clean But Spotless
Our laundry is getting dirtier and dirtier, chief. Without Soap it’s not so easy for us to get the gunk from work off. That ought to change!
Our laundry has come out really clean again. It feels a lot better on your skin right away.
Brown Gold
We could try our luck with more exotic Plants. Coffee used to be cultivated in big quantities. People apparently loved the stuff. It’s sure to be a big hit here!
It's not hard to understand that people used to be crazy about Coffee. Awesome stuff!
A Comfortable Home
Sure, our homes are warm and dry – and nothing’s comfy about them. A bit of luxury, we’d certainly manage that when it comes to our own dwellings – right?
Finally a little bit of luxury at home, too. Makes you feel a lot more comfy in your own four walls right away.
Something for the Eye
Here and there the settlement still seems to be bleak and boring. We’re living in a new, a better world here – shouldn’t our settlement look that way, too?
Sometimes we just cross the streets and are happy about how nicely we live. Thanks, chief!

A Trading Post at the End of the World

Ever since the conditions got worse, not one Trader comes to this area anymore. But we could build a Trading Post to provide a port of call. Even if they don't rescue us – maybe they have things we can make use of.
Good. We won't need some of our goods down there. We can barter them in exchange now.
Maybe we ought to focus ourselves entirely on our project and, by doing so, complete it as fast as possible.
We underestimated how much energy this venture costs. It'd be best if we target our efforts solely on upgrading the Endzone.
The Use of All Materials
The upgrade is eating up tons of recycled materials and we're not able to buy all of them from Traders. We could build a Refinery to cover the need effectively. Could we manage to get that done?
Excellent! With the Refinery we can sort out the Scrap much more efficiently. That will save a lot of time.
Maybe we ought to focus ourselves entirely on our project and, by doing so, complete it as fast as possible.
We underestimated how much energy this venture costs. It'd be best if we target our efforts solely on upgrading the Endzone.
Gazing Far into the Future
It's going to be hard to obtain precise Weather data from the Endzone. We should set up a Weather Station up here. Otherwise our descendants will be as blind as we are when they come back.
It's a step ahead, the Station is already collecting data! Over time it might be possible to read out more from the Weather data than we can. Our descendants won't be groping around in the dark.
Maybe we ought to focus ourselves entirely on our project and, by doing so, complete it as fast as possible.
We underestimated how much energy this venture costs. It'd be best if we target our efforts solely on upgrading the Endzone.
A Time Capsule for Plants

The data from the Weather Station paint a gloomy picture. Much bigger storms are approaching us than we had anticipated. Long phases of acid rain might wipe out many of the Plants up here for good. We have to rescue their Seeds and prevent a mass extinction!
An extinction of Plants, now those are gloomy prospects for the future. But whenever our Children come back, at least now they have the possibility to restore the flora.
Maybe we ought to focus ourselves entirely on our project and, by doing so, complete it as fast as possible.
We underestimated how much energy this venture costs. It'd be best if we target our efforts solely on upgrading the Endzone.
See the World and Learn

Although time is short, we still ought to see about getting the best possible Education for our Children. Now they still have the opportunity to experience the world with their own senses. Once they are underground they will have to learn everything from books again.
At least our Children are getting a good Education. After all, they're the Researchers of tomorrow. Our future and our survival lie in their hands.
Maybe we should focus entirely on our Project and complete it as quickly as possible.
We underestimated how much energy this venture costs. It'd be best if we target our efforts solely on upgrading the Endzone.
Not all at once!

In light of the urgent situation, chief, it won't be long before we're missing the most basic Resources up here. Maybe you ought to pull off a few Logisticians from the upgrade so that goods are distributed better and our economy remains stable.
Fine and dandy, a too hasty course of action won't get us anywhere. Hopefully the logistics problems will be resolved soon now all by themselves.
Okay, chief, then let's finish the project as fast as possible and get everything we have into the Endzone. Speed is the name of the game!
There are probably more important things to do. Let's just hope that the Production of goods up here won't be disrupted.
Something for Everyone

Whatever the conflicts may be, we're having problems distributing even the most necessary goods. A Market as a central transit hub would be great. We can employ Logisticians specifically for goods transport there.
Awesome, goods distribution is already running much more targeted this way.
Okay, chief, then that's how it's going to have to work.
Chief, it's really urgent. We can't afford that basic supply breaks down!
A New Stage of Civilization

Hey Boss! After the hardships of reconstruction, the citizens want you to provide them with a town hall. We can voice our concerns and discuss them there. It would be a great step for all of us in the direction of a new, flourishing civilization. To do this, upgrade the town center to a town hall.

The Town Hall is now open to all Settlers! It marks the start of a time of Prosperity and self-determination. Starting now, the residents of this settlement are going to state their Demands. It's natural that not every concern can be taken care of, but no doubt you'll make the right decisions and maybe you can learn something from our ideas, chief!
As Abundant as Sand on the Beach
Hey, chief, we've given some thought to new construction materials. Concrete and Glass are particularly promising. A good first step would be to perform more Research on building a Sand Mine.
Very good. We're already eager to see how our Invention does in real-life practice.
Where Do We Get Cement From?
We're already able to mine Sand, but we're still missing the necessary Knowledge to obtain Cement. That ought to be our next Research project!
With this Technology we have all the initial materials to produce Concrete.
Built Out of Sand

Sand and Cement are available to us, chief. What we still need now is a kind of facility where we can process both of them into Concrete. At best, our Researchers should make a few proposals about this.
We've got it, Concrete! Then let's see what this new miracle material can do for us.
Materials Science

We're simply missing the right materials for truly innovative Technologies, chief. The Experts say we have to develop a new type of Production facility to get them. Although some Research will be necessary, afterwards we'd be able to build a Material Factory like that.
Very good. When we've really gotten that Material Factory up and running, then we'll have completely new possibilities at our fingertips.
A New Home for Fish
We still get our Fish from Lakes, chief. Maybe the time has come to look around for an alternative. With the right Knowledge it's a sure thing we could build an Aquafarm.
Our Researchers report that they have completed their studies. Now we're ready to build an Aquafarm. Very good!
Shielded Growth
We ought to concern ourselves with the idea of a Greenhouse in order to improve the growth of our Plants even more. Can you make the necessary means available to us, chief?
That really brought us further. Now we're ready to build and run our first Greenhouses.
More Water!
Our Researchers say they have some ideas about upgrading the Water Tower. Can we make the necessary means available to them?
Very good. The newly designed Water Tower is a real step ahead compared with the old one.
Water, As If By Magic?
By hooking up a Pumping Station to the newly designed Water Towers we'd soon be able to fully automate our Water Supply. The only thing necessary would be some Research, then we'd be ready to go.
This Technology is fantastic. When we put it into practice, our Water Supply will soon be running all by itself!
Built for Eternity
With our improved materials we're in a position to build our Buildings with considerably more stability. What do you think, chief, wouldn't a bit more durability in this world be of great value?
Right away our Buildings are much more stable than before. A very good investment of Research Resources!
The Plants Are Thirsty
Our Water Supply is becoming more and more advanced. With the right Knowledge we could use our Irrigation Plants to supply a much much bigger area with Water in the future.
This Technology will get us through long Droughts even better. It's really good that now we don't have to worry as much about irrigating the Fields.
Comfy Co-Existence
Some of us live in a Shelter. Shouldn't we commission our Researchers with making these accommodations a bit more comfortable?
Very good. Now we've already gotten so far as to have concrete plans for making life more pleasant in the future. We ought to put them into practice soon.
Living Rather Than Dwelling
We are convinced that our dwellings could be distinctly more comfortable. We ought to put our ingenuity to work on that!
It's really awesome what our creative minds have come up with for dwellings. They are very promising concepts!
A Lovely Place to Drink
The Pub has become an important place in the community. We really ought to see if we can't design the place even prettier and better.
Those are great ideas for the Pub. Let's put them into practice as fast as possible.
A Delicate Little Plant

Chief, one of our people just found something in the undergrowth. It's a little Coffee Plant! Hard to believe in this Climate. It looks pretty much the worse for wear, too. We ought to replant it and pep it up with lots of fertilizer. Maybe that way we'd be able to cultivate Coffee soon on a plantation-size scale.
Very good, it worked. Now we have several young Coffee Plants that we can distribute on the Fields. We should do that as soon as possible.
It's a very sad fact, but the little Plant died. It's a miracle that it survived out here. With a bit of cautious care we probably could have saved it, but we simply lacked the means to do it ...
That's a real shame, chief. But if you think we can't afford the time and effort, then we'll just have to let this chance for Coffee pass us by.
Green Dreams

We found some Hemp Seeds in a small old case. With a little Soil we've gotten them to grow, but for cultivation we'll probably need several kinds of special Tools. Could you make them available to us, chief?
With the special Tools we were able to ensure the Plants' Growth. Now they're ready to be cultivated on Fields.
Sadly, we didn't manage to get the Hemp Seeds growing. Ultimately we were missing the right Tools ...
It's a real shame, chief. We really thought we could get that to work. Unfortunately, this way we'll have to make do without the Hemp Plants.
Flourishing Fields of Wheat

Chief, you're not going to believe this: We got our hands on some Wheat Seeds so that we can cultivate them as soon as possible. Man, we're already really looking forward to the first Crop. Think of all the things we can do with that ...
Perfect. The Fields are thriving, just the way we pictured it.
That's really annoying, chief. We went out of our way to get those Seeds. And now you're not doing a thing with them! That's really disappointing!
Really not, chief? This is a genuine chance for us. Wheat is the perfect Plant for a Crop. But if you say so ...
The Cattle Roundup

Lots of Livestock from the old world have reverted to running wild. Recently we saw a herd of Cows that had eaten their fill in the Forest. If we could plant some Trees nearby, it's a sure thing they'd come back again and we could bring some of them to the Pasture.
We really managed to wrangle a few Cows. Now, if we settle those Cattle down on the Pasture we'll soon have the first liter of Milk at our disposal.
The Cows don't come to us just like that. They've probably long since moved on to other regions. It's truly a missed opportunity, chief!
We really truly thought this idea might bring us a step ahead. But apparently we don't have the means to put it into practice ...
Tempting Offer
One of us recently spotted a herd of wild Goats roaming around. If we only used some Food to lure them closer to us – then we could capture some of them and bring them to the Pasture.
We were able to lure the Goats to our Pasture. That was a really good initiative, chief.
The Goats are not going to stroll onto our Pasture just like that. But apparently we didn't have enough Feed left over.
Not even a little bit of Feed for the Goats? Now that's really disillusioning ...
The Ancestors' Technology

Hey, chief, we found a very interesting apparatus nearby. None of us knows what it's good for. But it looks like we could learn a few things about the Technology our Ancestors had. However, the thing is highly contaminated with Radiation. The only way we ought to risk a closer examination is with Protective Clothing.

We examined the device and we're still not sure what purpose it once might have served. But we have learned a few things about Mechanics and Electronics. Strange, the stuff our Ancestors invested all their time and Resources in ...
No, we're not going to examine the part without protective clothing – it's just too dangerous.
It's a shame, but we apparently can't expand our Knowledge this way.
Goldberg Contraptions

One of our most talented tinkerers has a suggestion, chief, but to do it she needs some Plastic and Electronics. No one actually understands exactly what she intends to do, but for the most part her ideas are worth their weight in gold. We ought to give her a chance, don't you think?
Truly top-notch. What she's built is totally crazy and we're not sure if there's a practical way to use it, too. But in the process we've learned a few things, so it was worth it.
Sadly, our inventor wasn't able to implement her project because she lacked the means to do it. Now she's already got other plans. Missed opportunity!
It's a shame, chief. We ought to approve more ideas like that in the future, even if their benefit isn't always immediately identifiable.

A Compliment
Even if everything's not perfect, the people really do appreciate your dedication, chief. At any rate we're on the right track!
Break-Ins at the Warehouses!
People are forcing open the doors to the Warehouses. Look at that ... The shelves are full. Why do you keep us on a tight leash, chief?– Stop treating us like fools!
The Finest Goods, All Looted!

People want to enjoy the Prosperity we live in, too. Don't forget how hard they've worked for everything here! If you're not willing to give us anything, then we'll just help ourselves to what we're entitled to anyway!
The First of Many?
You're not the only one who decides where fortune takes us, chief! If you don't take our concerns seriously, soon a lot more people are going to leave this settlement.
Off the Beaten Track
This settlement belongs to us! Don't forget that, chief! If you don't listen to us, then we'll look for a new place where we can choose for ourselves where fortune takes us.
Don't Always Produce the Same Thing!

What do all the precautions and security get you when things aren't making any progress? The people think that lots of our operations are superfluous. It'd be better if you didn't rebuild them in the first place and took care of us instead!
The Magpies and Their Nests

Chief, our progress is your Mission, but you simply ignore what concerns us. Don't be surprised that people are emptying the Warehouses and Depots! They want to make their lives nicer and take what's on hand. Don't you think all of us should be pulling in the same direction again?
Setting Off into the Unknown

People are asking themselves if their well-being still really means a lot to you, chief. Plenty of them have already set off. To them, this settlement is a dead end where their wishes don't play a role anymore.
The Anger of Many
The people have lost all their patience, they can barely be kept at bay. That's your fault. You haven't taken any of our wishes seriously, have you? Did it really have to come this far?
Preparing for the Worst

If you don't address our concerns, chief, then how are we supposed to still believe that things function fair and square here? People are already starting to stock up on the most valuable goods. Chaos is going to reign here soon!
Fresh Hope
A really good thing, chief! That'll encourage the people to express more of their ideas and concerns again.
Golden Time Off
Awesome, the people are delighted. Yeah, the work is sometimes hard – but in return we can enjoy our time off all the more!
Arousing Young Ambitions
People are bursting into bloom. If they're listened to for once, they come up with the wildest topics – and some innovative ideas are always among them.
More Involvement
At last we're able to have a joint say in deciding on our future! Your commitment gives us hope, and that boosts the inventive spirit of the people here.
A Good Reason to Work
With so many good ideas we'll master the challenges to come, too. Not all of the problems have been cleared up yet – but it won't take long now.
The Forefathers' Pride
What would our forefathers probably say if they could only see how well we're doing these days? I think they'd be proud of our Prosperity and the self-determination we relish.
We're Making the Choices Ourselves Again
We finally have the means to tailor life according to our needs again. Our Prosperity is even attracting people from other settlements. Let's welcome them!
Big Step Ahead
Sometimes I ask myself what are all the things we survivors can achieve. And then I hear about lots of great ideas that are being made a reality here! I want to live in a place like that!
The Value of Self-Determination
The greatest wealth is worth little without self-determination. Meanwhile lots of travelers come to live here. With us, life and the future belong to one and all. Everyone has a say.
Citizens Instead of Workers
We're a shining example! We're not only Workers, we're part of a righteous community. That's why so many people come here who are searching for a better life.
A Safe Haven
So many people are heading our way because they've heard about our Prosperity. Let's welcome them and let them share in our wealth!
Golden Times

Yes indeed, these truly are golden times. We're not only surviving, we're allowed to shape our lives here according to our views. All of that wouldn't be possible without you, chief. Thanks a lot for your dedication and the wise decisions!
Did Everything Really Used To Be Better?
Nowadays, whenever I read some texts and stories from the old world I ask myself if our ancestors really were better off than we are – I can't imagine it.
The New Heyday After the Fall

After the catastrophe we human beings ultimately all joined together! Every single one of us here worked to generate part of our Prosperity and provided ideas for our Progress. We owe that to your commitment, chief, and we want to thank you for it!
Demanding

Comfy

Thanks
Budding Strength

That we jointly shape our future is a key pillar of our success. However, most of us consider our settlement to be too small to face the challenges of the future. They think we have to grow to ensure our wealth on a lasting basis.
This place has become larger with the passing of time, just like many of us had wished.
Growing Wealth

We've evolved into a remarkable community and ought to set forth on our path of Growth. What's more, we have long dreamed of dedicating a meaningful monument to our success. We believe the time has come to commence with the work on a landmark like that.
Yesterday we were still a few of the weak, today we're many and strong! The work on the Beacon landmark is progressing well and this settlement is more alive than ever.
Flourishing Prosperity

Growth is what made our Prosperity possible in the first place and this place will still be able to provide many, many more people with a safe home in the future. Our Beacon landmark ought to rise high into the sky, visible to one and all, as a symbol of our Confidence.
This place is no longer merely a settlement of survivors. It has evolved into a town, into a homeland for citizens of a great Civilization who look with hope and optimism toward the future.
A New Era – With You or Without You?

We are deeply indebted to you, chief! It would be an honor for us when your advice continues to accompany us. Yet thanks to you we no longer have to rely on it. Our manpower and resourcefulness will be sufficient to master even the challenges to come. Nonetheless, will you continue to stand by our side or go into well-deserved retirement?
Fulfill your Settlers' Demand for Beer!
Fulfill your Settlers' Demand for Cake!
Fulfill your Settlers' Demand for Coffee!
Fulfill your Settlers' Demand for Joints!
Fulfill your Settlers' Demand for Soap!
Fulfill your Settlers' Demand for Stew!
Settlers' Demands rejected.
Accept Demand
Reject Demand

You read that people used to smoke Hemp Plants to relax. Sure, Joints are more like something to have for leisure time, but we've all worked hard for our Prosperity, too. We'd really like to try that out, chief!
At the moment we eat most of our Foods raw. The Cooks say that they've cooked lots of our Food Items into Stew. Do you think we can have some of that, chief?
Besides the hard work we ought to arrange our leisure time nicely. Beer would be just the thing to sweeten up the evening after work.
After only a few of us have had Coffee to drink until now, these days more and more people are getting a taste for it. But Coffee actually ought to be there for everyone, right?
It would be nice to have a little more variety in terms of the meals. Now some people have gotten a taste for cooked meals. Do you think we can prepare Stew for everyone, chief?
We have good, hearty meals at the settlement. But a lot of us want a change of pace, in other words a genuine alternative. Cake for everybody, now that would be something, wouldn't it?!
More and more people enjoy their evening after work with a chilled beer in their hand. Do you think you can get your hands on enough Beer for all of us, chief?
We have some quantities of dried Hemp at our disposal. Joints can be made from them. They'd be just perfect for a relaxed afternoon in the sun – after work, of course. Could that be arranged, chief?
Coffee used to be consumed in large quantities to alleviate fatigue. Maybe we could establish this tradition among our people, too. Should we give it a try, chief?

<style="ColoredHighlight"><<seasons>> Seasons</style> ago our ancestors left the protective Endzone. Despite all the risks and dangers we have found our path to a good life.
We lead an existence in harmony with nature. We were able to tame its perils and have learned to make use of its treasures to the benefit of our Prosperity.

This flourishing town has <style="ColoredHighlight"><<buildings>> Buildings</style> in which <style="ColoredHighlight"><<settlers>> Inhabitants</style> live today. Together we have explored the surrounding area and developed new Technologies. Back then our forefathers weren't even able to picture where progress would bring us one day.
A Fabulous Achievement
Beaming Confidence

Now we ought to conclude the work on our Beacon landmark. This tower is not solely an expression of our success, it's supposed to provide an orientation to those who are searching for a better life in this world. All of you are welcome!
Chief, it's an honor for us that you're continuing to stand by our side with your advice. Now we have the means to shape life here according to our own ideas. What do you have in mind, chief?
More Efficient, Even More Efficient?!

Our Scientists want to design Factory Units in order to make the same machinery available to all facilities. The Productivity of many of the neighboring facilities would be increased that way. Can we make the necessary means available to put these ideas into practice?
Awesome, chief, that's a first-rate concept for boosting Productivity at this settlement. Now all we have to do is to build a Factory Unit like that and put it into operation.
Connect the Factory Unit to a Power Grid.

Due to its sturdy construction this Building can stand up better against Sandstorms. Performing Research on the Comfortable House ensures that the Sturdy House is researched as well when this hasn't already taken place.

A Comfortable Shelter houses a large number of Settlers, however it is not suitable for producing offspring. In addition, it increases the Contentedness of its Inhabitants by providing itself with Electricity from wind energy. Due to its sturdy construction this Building can stand up better against Sandstorms. Performing Research on the Comfortable Shelter ensures that the Upgraded Shelter is researched as well when this hasn't already taken place.

The necessary Resources are missing to fulfill this request.

Expedition to the East

... Hello? Do I have a connection? Or has the stupid Antenna shifted out of place again? Whatever! *clears throat* ... In case someone out there hears me, here are my coordinates! I could use a couple of helping hands. Previous technical experience is ... um ... an asset!
Has someone just landed there? If you did, then press the button at the gate! The intercom only works when you ring the bell!
Large gate
Rotten luck, it's bolted shut! But there are some speakers up there. A bit improvised, but in good shape. Looks like we'll have to ring the bell.
Inspect the gate!
Bell
It looks like an improvised intercom system. Here's a button that must be the bell!
Ring the bell!

Hello? That's too much for me, the bell actually works! Who's there? And much more importantly, do you have the Potatoes with you? This ... This is the first big visit in years, nonsense, decades! I must say ... This is ... Can you hear me at all?
Problems connecting
The connection is bad, Boss. Should we keep trying or look around here first?
What's going on?
There are several crates scattered around here. They look pretty sturdy. <<dynamicmessage>>Just for our safety, who knows what is going on here ...
Strange crates
Pry them open!
Let's take a look. These are pots and pans, at least a dozen. Some of them are barely even used. Why would anyone throw these away? Well, I guess we can take them along ...
Another damn crate. Whoever nailed these crates shut did a pretty good job. We can't get them open.
Thank goodness we have enough tools with us to break them open.
If only we had brought some tools with us. Should we try to break them open anyway?
Continue conversation
Hey, we can't hear you very well. The intercom is going crazy. Can you hear us?
Try again
Hello ...? This damned Antenna. I knew that ... I'm opening the gate, okay? ... The roof. You hear me? There's an Antenna on the roof. All you have to do …
The line's gone dead, Boss! He said something about an antenna up there on the roof. It's probably broken. I don't have a clue how we can get up there.
House
What was that?
At home, this ladder would have ended up at the junkyard. But it looks pretty stabile. Let's just hope that none of the rungs snap when we go up. <<dynamicmessage>>
Ladder
Go on up!
Some of the rungs creak a little, but the ladder holds our weight.
Just as we feared: one of the rungs has broken and a member of our party has sprained his ankle. Let's hope he can manage until we're back home.
Luckily we have someone along who knows about scrap! We'll find out which rungs aren't sturdy enough to bear our weight anymore and then we can bypass them.
None of us really have any experience with this kind of scrap! We'll just have to try our luck.
There is a porch roof outside the building. Looks sturdy at least. It'll be a difficult climb, though. Definitely not for the faint of heart. <<dynamicmessage>>
Porch roof
Volunteers first!
Well, that was actually easier than it looked. Sometimes you just have to take a risk.
Shoot, Boss, someone slipped and hurt himself. Hopefully it's not as bad as it looks.
We're all young and agile. We can do it!
Some of us aren't exactly the youngest anymore ... maybe we can find another way that's better for those who aren't all that sure-footed?
Intercom system
Up here is the antenna and this looks like a fuse box here in the corner. That weird guy said something's broken here. Looks pretty improvised.  <<dynamicmessage>>
To the antenna!
Antenna
This antenna looks pretty .... uh .... improvised. But we could try to fix it. <<dynamicmessage>>
Give it a try!
Perfect. We just need to move it around a bit and bend a few wires.
No, it's not going to work. We just can't get to it without hurting ourselves. One of us already got a shock!
Our specialist is familiar with systems like this. We're sure we can get the antenna fixed.
None of us are very familiar with this kind of thing, Boss! We could fiddle around with it a bit, but we don't have really know what we're doing.
Fuse box
The fuse box is locked. It doesn't look like we'll be able to get it open. The cables look okay from the outside. Maybe there is a loose contact somewhere inside ...
Kick it!

Bingo! Who knows if we've solved the problem for good. But the kick fixed it at least for the time being. A big piece with wires and cables fell off. Let's pack that up. The system seems to be working without that stuff.
Unfortunately "Just kick it" doesn't always work. It doesn't seem to have an effect on anything, except the sore foot.
Down

Holy taters! You've repaired the system! Haha. Welcome, my helpful guests. My name is Lem, Inventor and ... third generation Builder. I'd welcome you in person, but my mother always said you have to be careful around strangers. At any rate, since you're already here, then do take a look at my technical marvels. Go right ahead, you'll be amazed!
Come back down!
Broken device

Go on, just take a closer look at this gem. That's my Potato harvester. The only problem is it's not working at the moment ... Just so you know, I love Potatoes. They can be boiled, roasted, mashed, baked, stuffed and french-fried. Not to mention the chips. A life without this wondrous miracle would be a tragedy ...
Let's try it!

Sorry, out of luck, one of the tires has gone flat! I'll have to disappoint you, I don't have any Potatoes for you. I'm sorry, but my own, well ... I used them up, that's the word ... They're all gone, that's how it is!
Inspect the machine
Yes, Potatoes! That poor thing actually ought to be working on the Field there ... but it's not running. I'm not the youngest anymore, you know ... Can you do something about the tire?
All of this for potatoes?
Repair
The tire is flat, Boss. We could try to fix it, but that'll surely require some talent. The rubber isn't in the best shape anymore. <<dynamicmessage>>
Give it a try!
Patch the tire, sure, I already had that idea the day before yesterday, too ... But then, well ... something cropped up in the meantime and it slipped my mind again. Good thing you're here.
Easier said than done. The patch is on, but the tire doesn't even hold the air for a minute. If we want to succeed, we'll have to try harder.
But we have someone with us who knows how to do this kind of stuff!
Too bad, none of us know anything about this kind of stuff.
Replace
Boss, there are tires here, too. They're in great shape. We just need to take them along and mount them. <<dynamicmessage>>
Let's go!
Right, the tires ... I forgot all about those ones up front. It ought to work with them. I'll give the fuel tank a refill later on, then hopefully the harvester can get back to work!
Surely the tire would work, but it seems to be attached here and the screws are totally rusted. We'll only hurt ourselves.
That shouldn't be a problem with the tools that we brought along.
This would be a piece of cake if we had the right tools along.
Covered machine
That over there? No need to concern yourselves with that, it's just an early prototype!
Come on, show it!

Nothing beats a well-functioning machine ... Well, soon to be well functioning. All that's left are a few parts, then it's ready to go. But that's no concern of yours right now. Just leave it covered up!
Inspect the machine

It's a secret, get me? And it'll stay that way ... until it's ready. Things unfinished aren't shown, my mother always said. It's going to be a masterpiece, no two ways about it! You'd better take a step back or else you'll break something.
Why?
Step back
We’d be better off taking a step back, chief. Before that thing – whatever it is – falls apart and hurts us.
Do what he says!
That's fine. Admit it, I've made you curious, right? Hehe, now you can't wait to see what's standing in front of you!
Look below it
We can’t wait to see what‘s under the tarp. Do you think Lem would notice if we just took a quick peek underneath it?
Just do it!
Hey, what did I say? Don't just stand there and look at it, take a step back! It's a secret, a very special one: my secret. Did you touch anything? I sure hope not.
The conversation

Okay, fair enough, I know how it is. As a kid I was always inquisitive. Pa had to hang everything on ropes so that I couldn't get to them. But I got my fingers on most of them anyway. Say, do you feel like helping me?
Okay, okay!
Help
Why shouldn't we give him a hand, Boss?
Yearh, sure.

I knew that I could count on you! Listen: There's a settlement northeast of here. It was once my home town, but you've got to watch out. The place is highly contaminated with Radiation and you need special gear. There are some components there that I need for perfecting the machine. You've got to get them.
Don't help
This all seems a bit suspicious. What is that guy doing here? Und what if the covered machine is somehow dangerous?! We'd better not help him!
Yeah, forget it!

No, no, it's all very simple. You'll see, don't worry. No, no objections! Listen: There's a settlement northeast of here. It was once my home town, but you've got to watch out. The place is highly contaminated with Radiation and you need special gear. There are some important parts there that I need for perfecting the machine. You've got to get them.
Strange books
Maybe we should take a look around. Like what kind of books are these? <<dynamicmessage>>
Flip through them!
It looks like cookbooks, Boss. There are scribbles all over the place. There isn't one ingredient without a comment. Some of this information will surely be useful for our work in the kitchen.
Sorry, Boss, we only understand books with lots of pictures. And there are only a few in here. There's nothing we can do, Boss. Let's hope that Lem can get more use out of them.
It looks like there's interesting stuff in here. I think I remember seeing something similar at school!
Wow, they're way too complicated for us ...
Strange apparatus
A gem, isn't it? Just look at it, and it was all my idea!
What is it?
You sit on it and push the pedals. And in the cauldron that makes this, that, um ... What's that thing called again? Okay, the hook … goes round and round. Great machine.
Take a look at the machine
Of course. Well, theoretically, I mean, what should I say? It broke down. There were , um ... teething problems, more than once. Do you think you can get it up and running?
Does it work?
Oil it
The device squeas like crazy, Boss! It just needs a little oil. But the mechanics are a bit confusing. We should have a specialist look at it. <<dynamicmessage>>
Try it!
Oil is like magic. All it takes is a little bit and suddenly everything works. Now all I need is something to stir. Hmm, I'll see to that later.
Nope, Boss, that part looked promising, but it's still squeaky.
We've got similar technology in our wells! Thanks goodness we have someone along who knows how it works!
Don't we use similar technology for our wells? It's a shame we don't have anyone along who is more familiar with how it works ...
Replace

Surely we'll find some spare parts here for the machine. What a mess - there's so much  junk just lying around... well, let's fight our way through it. A couple of parts look like they're in pretty good condition.<<dynamicmessage>>
Keep looking!
What did you find there? The chain! That was what I really wanted to use. But then I couldn't find it. I looked and looked for days. Good, it ought to work better that way than with the bedsheet …
No, Boss, you can only find stuff you aren't looking for in this mess.
Surely our technology ace can tell us more!
But even if ... none of us have enough experience with this technology.
Good thing I've reached you! I'm sending you the coordinates for my old homestead. It would be best to equip yourselves with everything one would need for such an extensive Expedition!

Hey, can you hear me? Ha, it works! Pa always said that radio equipment would be just my kind of thing. Now I can hear you, even though I'm sitting in my armchair. Great! Now we can finally set off on the quest for the Spare Parts.
Landing spot

So? What's it like? Everything's fallen apart, I'd guess. Probably no human being's been there for years. Radio through whatever you see to me, okay? Then I'll try to picture it and guide you in the right direction.
Look around!
Look around
The Radiation is still very high, huh? Everything was in good shape for a long time and you could live well there, but then the acid rain came and suddenly everything changed.
Be careful, guys!
You know, this place means a lot to me. I was there as a child, with Ma and Pa. I know it like the back of my hand, I see it all right in front of me. I know exactly where you have to head to.
A bunch of ruins
There are a whole bunch of ruins here, Boss. Where should we start?
Look around!
South
We could follow this road south, Boss!
Let's head south!
There's a police station in this direction, Boss. Let's contact Lem and ask if he knows anything about it.
Old base
The old police station. We used it as a Storeroom for Potatoes and Grains. It's locked up, you say? Hmmm, there's definitely a way in, for sure.
Ask around!
Front door
Here's the front door. It's barricaded and looks pretty solid. <<dynamicmessage>>
Break it open!

The front door, yeah, I almost forgot about it. My best friend, Anna, once got her hand caught in it ... Ordinarily such a fearless girl, but that time she screamed so loud ... what a commotion that was. Man, I sure miss her.
Ow, my hand! It's harder than I thought. No way through. At least not like this.
This door doesn't stand a chance against our tools!
Without the right tools, this could be a problem, Boss!
Collapsed wall
The wall on the side has collapsed, Boss. If we can make it up there, we might just be able to climb through. <<dynamicmessage>>
Who's brave enough to give it a try?

You know, as kids we weren't allowed in the Storeroom. It was always well guarded. But Anna and I managed to sneak our way in once anyway. We got away with a few Potatoes. Nobody noticed. Those were the days …
No, Boss, with this equipment, there's no way we can manage all those acrobatics. There's got to be another way.
We're all young and in good shape! We can do it!
We're not all that agile anymore ...
Crates upon crates

I remember well that the room stood full of crates. Do you see them? Take a good look around. A wonderful place, isn't it? Packed full of useful things ... There must be a large grain mill behind the crates. That's where you'll find the grinder I need. Get going, find it and detach it.
And now?
Potato crates
Oh yes, the potato crates. Back when I was little I could stand up inside them. When they were empty they were great for playing hide and seek. What fun!
Look inside!
The crates are empty, Boss. But the wood is in good condition. Surely we can get some use out of it.
Old grinding mill

As a child I always imagined that the machine was a monster that gobbled up grain and ground its teeth really horribly as it ate. What's up? Oh yeah, the grinder, right, that's what I need. You have to detach it.
Take it apart!

Hey chief, we were able to detach the grinder, but it's completely rusted and useless. On the other hand, we did find some Metal parts that look useful. We definitely have to keep on looking somewhere else.
Cellar door
The basement was always locked, I was never inside. The grown-ups were often there at night ... I wonder what they were up to there. <<dynamicmessage>>
Go inside!
We're in. And now we know what they were doing down here. Shelves full of bottles, and it's definitely not water. Looks like they turned the potatoes into alcohol.
No chance, Boss, the cellar door is locked tight. We'll just break our tools here.
With your Tools you shouldn't have any problems prying the hatch open!
Without the right Tools it might be quite a feat of strength to force the hatch open!
Workbench
Uncle Bill's workbench. He always squinted his eyes so intensely when he was concentrating. His whole face was full of wrinkles, almost like a leather couch.
Look inside!
Yes, very good. That must be the grinder. It rotates cleanly, you say? Perfect, precisely what we've been looking for. Good thing Uncle Bill always stashed Spare Parts away.
North
We could follow this road north, Boss!
Let's head north!
Looks like there's an old fuel station at the end of this road. Let's ask Lem about it!
Fuel station

Gas station? Oh yeah! You mean the old Workshop! That's where Pa worked. He was always dismantling, installing, converting and tinkering with something. He was a fabulous inventor, almost as good as I am. We ought to find a Pump here, it's dead certain.
Then ask him!
Deteriorated rolling gate
The door is locked, Boss. But this rolling gate looks pretty rundown. We should be able to force it open. <<dynamicmessage>>
Break it open!
It's pretty easy once you find the right spot. We're through, Boss!
Man, that wasn't a very good idea. We're just wearing out our tools. This won't get us anywhere!
Our scrap collectors have done this a thousand times!
We don't really have a tactic ... none of us have any experience with forcing rolling gates open.
Churchyard
Here's an old church, Boss! Should we take a closer look?
Why not?
Here's a pretty sizable garden. There are some graves and a few peculiar bushes.
Workshop

Everything I know about machinery I learned in this Workshop. Right there with Pa and Uncle Bill – I was always watching. Sometimes, when no one was looking, I tried out something on my own. If you've got ideas you have to test them, right?
Go inside!
Old engine
Here's an old engine Boss. Should we see what parts we could get some use out of? <<dynamicmessage>>
Help yourselves!
The engine doesn't look very impressive at first glance. But if you look closely, you can see that it's still in very good condition. Surely we'll be able to get some use out of the dismantled parts!
Just a few pieces of sheet metal, nothing of any use here.
Our specialists will take care of this!
Let's see if we can even get any of this taken apart ... we don't have any specialists along.
Head outside
This is the way out, Boss.
Into the garden!
The door squeaks loudly, but it can be opened.
Churchyard

The old churchyard. That's where Pa simply threw away whatever he didn't need anymore. And is the truck still there, that dilapidated old thing? Take a look at it, there must be an oil pump inside. We need it!
Take a look around!
Old truck
We've really got the remains of an old truck here, Boss. Should we see if we can remove the pump? <<dynamicmessage>>
Give it a try!
Yes, that's it! That's the one ... the one I've needed. All that's left is to clean it thoroughly, then things can get going! We're getting closer and closer to perfecting the machine.
It didn't work, Boss! We can't get the pump out.
We've got exactly the right people along for this job!
But we don't have the expertise ...
Gravestone crosses
There's something else here, Boss: gravestone crosses. They were definitely put up after the catastrophe.
What do they say?
