There are several names. Here's "Bill." The other name is difficult to read, wait a second ... it says "Anna."
Workshop
This is the way to the workshop, Boss. You can already tell from the outside that there are lots of interesting machines, tools and materials inside.
Go inside.
The door is a little warped, but it can still be opened.
Strange plant
Hey, Boss! There's a strange plant growing here. Looks a bit like a small tomato. Should we collect a few samples?
Of course!
Will do, Boss! I've never seen anything like this before. Could it be due to the strong radiation?
West
We could follow this road west, Boss!
Let's head west!
There are several old houses here, Boss. We're not sure if there's anything useful there. Let's ask Lem!
Old house

Our old house is at the end of the street, yes, exactly. The door is probably locked, mhm ... Yes, Ma was always very cautious. But there was a key, somewhere ... Where was that kept …? It's so long ago. It's always the important things that slip your mind.
Good idea!
Upper floor
Parts of the upper level have collapsed, Boss. It's going to be quite a scramble, but at least there won't be any doors in our way. <<dynamicmessage>>
Climb on up!
Phew, that was grueling, but we made it.
We gave it a try, but one of us slipped back down. The post is just too decayed.
We'll just build a stepladder next to the post. We've got everything we need.
It won't be easy getting up there without proper climbing equipment ...
Flowerpot
It looks like the door is still sturdy and locked tight, Boss. Let's see if we can find the key here somewhere. <<dynamicmessage>>
Look around!
Well wouldn't you know, it really was the flowerpot. Now we can unlock the door.
Nothing, not under the doormat, not under the window sill ... Maybe those are just cliches from some old stories.
Our survival guide mentioned rather pointless hiding spots like "under the doormat" or "in the mailbox." What were those people thinking?
The question is just ... where exactly? None of us have a suggestion!
Hallway

How glad I'd be to be there with you now! You know, I grew up there, my home sweet home. The pot we're looking for is in the kitchen ... Do me a favor, okay? Walk through the rooms a bit. I just want to know ... how things look now.
Well done!
Kitchen

Ma cooked here when she wasn't in the canteen ... Just for us, on special occasions. She cooked ... she cooked so well you have no idea, really, not a clue. Her pot is there in the kitchen, for sure. <<dynamicmessage>>
Look for the pot.
Yes, that's the one. It's a crying shame Ma left it behind! Pack it up, you won't find a better one, and meanwhile the second one is broken. At last, at long last, I finally have a new one.
We haven't found anything so far, Boss. I wonder if it's even really here. But it's quite a mess here, too!
You know your way around! You'll find it in a jiffy!
Now all you need to know is what kind of pot it's supposed to be ...
Lem's bedroom
That was my room, my very own. I had cogwheels and screws and springs, so many toys! And then I had to leave it all back there when we left ... simply all of it. <<dynamicmessage>>
Is there anything useful?
A genuine treasure trove of electronics and other parts. It's unbelievable what Lem collected as a child.
Whew, there's so much junk lying around here. Useless children's toys everywhere you look. We didn't find anything we could use.
You know your way around. It's a sure thing that this here is a genuine gold mine. Don't be bashful, take something you can use!
But I'm afraid none of you can do a thing with that stuff.
Living room

We packed our things here ... after the acid rain, when everything got worse and got contaminated with Radiation. That night, all the grown-ups yelled at each other. For weeks after that they didn't say a word. Us kids, we were silent, too ... Then we were gone, headed here for the island. <<dynamicmessage>>
Take a look around!
There's a lot of clothing and medicine lying around here, Boss. They must have left it behind. We'd better take it along with us!
We couldn't find anything useful, Boss!
Go take a look around! Maybe you can use something.
I don't know if you can use anything from inside here.
East
We could follow this path east, Boss!
Let's head east!
What's back there? An old burger place? Let's ask Lem!
Burger place

A burger place? That must be our old canteen ... with the red seating units! We sat there and talked ... everybody, all together. Until we had to flee.
There still has to be a mold here we can use for the machine!
Get him on the radio!
Collapsed side
The back is totally collapsed. You can still see the red tables and seating areas that Lem was talking about. We can just walk right in.
Go inside!
There's a lot of rubble lying around here, Boss. We just hope that the roof won't cave in on us. We really have to be careful!
Celler hatch
We've discovered a cellar hatch underneath all this junk, Boss! It looks like it's not barricaded, just locked. We could force it open. <<dynamicmessage>>
Give it a try!
That was easy! With a hatch like that, you just need the right touch and then it almost opens up by itself.
The hatch is too strong for us, Boss. We can't get it open!
We have everything we need, Boss!
This will be difficult without any tools.
Inside

What a shame! Back then that was a fine little spot here! There was always the best soup ever ... with Potatoes or Turnips, so tasty! Maybe there's still some left there? Oh my, true, it's been a long time. Enough of that. The mold, that's why you're there. You have to find it!
Go further in!
Gray box
The back room. Sometimes I sneaked in. There was a gray box there. And when there was Electricity you could switch it on. Then it swooshed and crackled, like in a snowstorm. <<dynamicmessage>>
Let's go!
Our veteran identified the box as a "televison." Apparently they were something like a radio, but with pictures, and people used to sit around in front of them for hours. Sounds crazy!
This all sounds very strange, Boss. Yeah, there's one of those boxes sitting here, but it doesn't work. There's no electricity either. We can't get any use out of it, Boss.
Maybe your veteran can do something with it. Any chance he's ever seen something like that before? At any rate, a great invention!
Someone with experience can definitely do something with it. At any rate, I've seen those boxes quite a few times ...
Kitchen
A baking dish, says Lem? Sounds like something we could find in the kitchen. Should we look there, Boss?
Sounds reasonable!

A disc made of Metal with holes in it? That's the mold, that's it. Now you're asking yourselves what it is, right? You'll see, oh, you'll be amazed. I'll give you a hint: Flour, Salt and Water! With the mold the machine will be perfect!
Cellar
These look like the cellar stairs, Boss.
Head on down!
Pretty dark here, and cold. I wonder what awaits us down there.
Cellar

Oh yeah, the basement! Ma always said we should run there when it gets dangerous and we're being attacked. We got to practice a few drills, we sure did! It was dark and wet, and I was always so afraid. Anna was there too and she was a lot more fearless. She always told me stories then. But there was never ever an attack. Just the acid rain. I hope no one hid themselves down there back then. It was a horrible place!
What's down there?
Partition
Boss! Here's a partition tha was crudely thrown together out of boards. Looks like some kind of protective wall. There are even slits for shooting. There's a weird smell here, too. <<dynamicmessage>>
What's back there behind it?

Our gravedigger has investigated the matter. Looks like there are people here ... I mean, dead people. There isn't much left of them; they've been down here awhile. They must have entrenched themselves in here with guns and lots of ammunition!
This disgusting smell is only getting worse! It would have been good to have someone along who could bear the smell.
Our gravedigger is sure it's the smell of decay. Oh dear ...
But we can't quite place this odd smell.
Stairs
Here are the stairs going up, Boss.
Head on up!
Gloomy as hell in here. Let's see what is upstairs.
Departure

Wow, amazing. It looks as if you've found everything! Thank you so much, so much. Without you ... yes, I never would've ... What fabulous helpers you are, really. I didn't want to leave back then ... Now I've been on the island for such a long time.
What now?
I ask myself what happened to the others ... to Uncle Bill and Anna ... Where have they gone to?
Departure
We don't know how well Lem will take it if we tell him the truth about what happened here, Boss. What should we do?
Give us a minute!
Truth
We should tell him about the dead bodies and the graves. They must have been there. It's better to tell him the truth, then he can put it all behind him.
That's the right thing to do!

Are they really dead? Mhm ... somehow I suspected it, yes. I would've been so glad to meet them again, to talk with them one more time or eat soup together. To play hide and seek one more time with Anna and tinker with Bill again in the Workshop! I'll miss them!
Avoidance
Let's just pretend we have no idea! After all, there's no definitive proof of what happened here!
Sounds good!
You didn't discover a thing? That's a shame. I had hoped so much that there's some sign of life from them. But: Maybe they escaped it all and will get in touch someday.
Lie
We could tell him that we didn't see anyone and that they've probably moved on. There are tons of places, and in all that time they would have surely gotten far.
Let's lie!

Moved on, you think? That must be it! Then maybe they'll come across my island, just like you did ... And one day they'll simply be standing in front of my gate. Will you let them know if you run into them?

The preparations are moving along fast and furious! Now that we have all the parts together we can start to let my grand invention become a reality. Do drop by, but don't forget to bring me the Spare Parts!
Good thing you're here at last! I've got everything all prepared already, too! If you've brought the Spare Parts with you, then we can get started right away as well!
Side entrance
That's odd; we've discovered a side entrance. We didn't even notice it last time. Should we see what's behind the door?
Go inside!
Through the entrance
There's a door here, Boss! It's not locked and it looks like there's a passage leading deep into the rocks. Hopefully it's not dangerous.
Take a look!

This is ... it's just unbelievable. Wow, Boss, what a pity you can't see it. There's a ... is it a boat? Made completely out of steel? I've seen pictures of something like this before in some book. I think it's a "submarine." It's in perfect shape. How did it get here?
Fishing spot
Ah, there's a light at the end of the passage. Probably another door. Should we go through it?
Sounds crazy!
Fishing spot
We made it! We seem to be on the other side of the rocks. This would be the perfect place to go fishing! Wait a minute ...
What's up?
Lem must have had the same idea! That's bait ... we've never seen anything like it. This is ingenious, Boss. We should use it at home too!
We'll make a few sketches and take a bit of bait along with us as an example.
The gate
Boss, the gate is closed again! Lem seems to take his security precautions pretty seriously ....
Go inside!
The bell
Let's ring the bell. He's waiting for us already! Hopefully the intercom still works.
Yeah, ring the bell!

Oh, is the gate closed? I'll open it up quickly! I can still recall our adventure in the town so well, as if I'd been there with you! And I was, too ... via radio. You told me everything so nicely. Come on in, go ahead, don't be shy. Then we can get started right away!
To the machine

Oh, how wonderful. The parts, they're definitely the right ones, aren't they?! Come on, off to the machine ... Although, wait a second. The Radio Mast hasn't been functioning anymore since this morning. Just static. Thank god you were already on your way here. Take a look at it! That would be great.
Get started!
Radio mast
Lem's radio mast is a ... shall we say ... impressive structure, Boss. <<dynamicmessage>>
Go for it!

A miracle of technology ... chaotic, but ingenious. The dish was just a little out of position; we were able to straighten it out quickly. Lem installed equipment that allows him to transmit much further than we can ... we should do that too, Boss! That could be really useful.
We're not sure if it worked, Boss, but we tried to re-position the dish.
Luckily we have enough tools with us. Let's take a closer look.
If only we had brought tools along. Should we take a look at it anyway?
This extension could be particularly useful for our trading post, Boss. We'd be able to communicate much better with the traders with way!
Machine
That must be the machine, Boss. Lem must have taken the tarp off. So that's what it looks like. It's quite the patchwork. What's it used for?
Let's find out!
My masterpiece ... And now all the parts are there ... Thanks to you, naturally. They only have to be installed, then it'll purr like a kitten.
Start repair
Not so nosy, not so impatient. You won't see until it starts running ... First, install the parts. Get going, get to it!
What's it doing?
The pump
There's a flap on the back, Boss. I'd say that would be the perfect place for the pump that we took out of the truck. <<dynamicmessage>>
Install it!
Very good, one step closer to perfection. The Pump is much better than the Scrap I experimented with at first!
We don't know what Lem's plan was, Boss. The pump doesn't fit in here ... but maybe we're just missing the necessary expertise ...
Our well keeper can surely take care of this!
I have no idea how we should install this. I guess we'll just have to fiddle around with it a bit. If only we had brought a specialist along!
Grinding mill
It looks like this spot is for the old grinding mill that we took from the potato storeroom. <<dynamicmessage>>
Go for it!
Now it can mill grains, coarse or fine, grainy or ... small. Whatever, it can simply do anything. Great work!
This doesn't fit, Boss. We don't know where the screws go either. I wonder what Lem was planning here.
A member of our group has worked on fields before and is experienced with grinding grains.
This could get ugly. If only we had someone along with field experience. Then we might have a better idea of what to do.
Baking form
We could attach the baking form that we found in the burger place up there on the outlet. That would make sense. <<dynamicmessage>>
Attach it!
Super, that's the spot. Everything has to have its place, right? One mold for everything ... simply wonderful.
Boss, we just don't know how this thing is supposed to fit. Inventor or not, this all just doesn't make any sense!
With our technical expertise, we'll make it!
It will be a challenge without any technical expertise.
Pot
Here is an outlet. I suppose we have to put a pot underneath it. Probably the one that we found in Lem's parents' house. It would definitely fit well there, in any case. <<dynamicmessage>>
Put it in position!
So, that's a good place for the pot. The wonderful final product will be collected here!
The pot has gotten wedged in. Nothing can be collected in it like this.
Our cook nods in agreement!
A cook could confirm that for us!
Machine start
Okay, Boss! We've installed all the parts. Is it finally time? Can we start the machine now?
What do you say, Lem?
Not so fast, not so impatient. Hm ... good. We'll venture a try! Start the machine!
Machine start
What? Do I hear something there? Is it running? No? That can't be, after all, I ... The design draft, so much work ... It just has to run. Take another look at it, okay?
Turn it on!
Old fuses
These parts are all old, Boss. Maybe the electrical contacts are just corroded. <<dynamicmessage>>
Fix them!
Yes, that sounds better already ... much, much better.
We've fiddled around with them a little, but, to be honest, we don't really know what we're doing.
Our technology ace will take care of it!
We could try improvising ... none of us know what we're doing ...
New cable
The cables are pretty old. Maybe we should replace them. <<dynamicmessage>>
Replace them!
Yes, that sounds better already ... much better. Hold on! It's still not running smoothly? Oh well, the usual teething problems.
As we said, Boss, we don't have any other cables along. There's nothing we can do.
Luckily we have all the cables with us that we need!
But we don't have the right cables.
Difficulties
I don't know either, but things like that can always be solved somehow. Come on, get going ... a dash of creativity, please!
What next?
Look for tools
It sounds like something in the motor is loose. We need to tighten up some screws, but we need a special tool for that.  There's got to be one lying around here somewhere ... <<dynamicmessage>>
Look for it!
Ah, you've found the toolbox. The Tools you need are lying inside, yes indeed! They enable you to get to the motor. Very good!
You can't find anything in this mess!
Our scrap collectors will find it!
It can take a long time to find something in a heap of scrap, though, Boss!
Transmission
It sounds like the engine has seized. Maybe someone who knows what they're doing can realign the transmission. <<dynamicmessage>>
Give it a try!
Super, that sounds good. I'm telling you, it's the gearbox ... It's ALWAYS the gearbox.
Hopefully we haven't made it worse. In any case, the engine isn't working now.
We've got someone along with lots of technical experience.
We don't have anyone along who is experienced with transmissions and technology.
Another try
Hm ... It's still not running? Don't worry, I've been tussling with machinery my whole life. We'll get it done!
It just doesn't want to work ...
Restart
Maybe it's overheated and we should let the motor cool down a bit. <<dynamicmessage>>
Wait!
Am I hearing this right? Yes! I hear it! Haha, I told you so. Boil the Water, get the Wheat. We'll make dough, we'll make noodles!
How long do we have to wait? We're losing our patience, but nothing is happening yet!
We've got someone along who knows what he's doing.
It's just a guess. None of us know what we're doing.
Kick it
Maybe we should kick it? That works sometimes in our settlement ...
A firm kick!
Am I hearing this right? Yes! I hear it! Haha, I told you so. Boil the Water, get the Wheat. We'll make dough, we'll make noodles!
Was that such a good idea?
A what?

Noodles, yeah ... soup! Noodle soup! Simply fabulous. Ma's recipe. At last there'll be noodles again, noodles for everyone. This, ladies and gentlemen, this is Lem's extra-special Noodle Master 3000. And you witnessed it. If only Ma could see this ...
Dough? Pasta?
A grave
This ... this is her grave, isn't it?
Is that right, Lem?
Yes, Ma, she ... she passed away a few years ago, and I buried her here.
Mother's grave

She was old and happy and loved this island, the sunset and the sea breeze.
I manage all right ... Except for her noodles, they're missing. I simply never got the hang of making them when I cooked.
We're sorry to hear that!
Mother's grave
All this effort ... for a pasta machine? Just to cook pasta?
Is that right?
You don't understand, HER noodles! You've never tried them. Her noodle soup is so superb! Heavenly! I've never had it turn out on the stove like hers.
Mother's grave
But now ... Now there's finally noodle soup again at last ... But Lem-style, using a machine!
And now?
Cheering
That's great! We have to make a conscious effort to keep some everyday luxuries in this world.
You're right about that!
I knew it, you like my machine, I knew it ... Wait, I've got something for you! Go on, take it, in grateful return for your help.
Disappointment
A pasta machine? We risked our lives out there for this? For noodles?
How unnecessary!

You don't like the machine, hm? Too insignificant, hm? But a little bit of luxury makes things easier for all of us ... Life is simply lovelier with noodles. Whatever, you've taken a lot upon yourselves in order to help me. And having said that, here's a gift for you!
Gift

I have a lot more useful devices for your settlement here! I think ... I ought to share my inventions with you. Ma would've wanted it that way! Take this guide. It says inside how you can construct them.
What is it?
Delight
Fantastic, we'll try it out  in our settlement right away! It was a pleasure helping you out, Lem.
Thanks, Lem!
For me it was an ... an honor. It really was!
Irritation
Thanks for the manual. I really doubt it will be of much help to us. Your other machines are all rather ... special. And we've got real problems at home.
So long, Lem.
But thanks a lot, anyway. Maybe your people will understand me when you tell the story. My dear guests, have a safe trip home!
Expedition to the North
Ole Sørensen sends you greetings from afar. I’ve run into a very special place here, but I don’t want to reveal too much yet. The thing is, I need your help here. Urgently!
It's great that you've come. It was slowly getting kind of edgy here. But that shouldn't stop us. Look at this gorgeous spot I've found here.
Door
Fabulous, isn't it? I landed here and knew I wouldn't be leaving this place so fast again. You've got to grasp opportunities where you find them. I'm sure you are able to help me get this door open.
To the entrance!
Door lock
Maybe we can open the door with a bit of skill, Boss. The lock seems to be worn down by the weather. <<dynamicmessage>>
Give it a try!
Very good. The lock was worn down and a few deft moves was all it took to get it open.
No, this isn't working. It's all warped and frozen solid!
This shouldn't be a problem at all with the tools that we have.
It could be difficult without any tools.
Bar
There's a large bar lying next to the crates. Maybe we could use it as a lever to lift the door off its hinges.
Take the bar!
Great, that worked well. We pried the door open!
Shoot, the bar slipped from our hands and someone got hit on the knee. Next time we should think this through a little better.
Pitch black
The waiting outdoors in the snow really paid off, after all. Naturally the passageway is still a bit dark, but I can't get rid of the feeling that we've got something very special ahead of us here.
Go inside!
Darkness
Sure, it's dark ... but what could be dangerous here?! Let's just go on through!
Go on in!
Phew, that was a close one. The floor is covered with junk,  but nobody tripped.
Man, there's stuff lying everywhere. There's no way through!
Torches
A little bit of light wouldn't hurt here, Boss. We can't even see our own feet. <<dynamicmessage>>
Do it!
The torch is burning! It's a good thing we got some light. The floor is full of junk everywhere you look. Now we can avoid tripping over everything.
No light without suitable material, chief!
There are some wooden slats here and we have towels with us. We can make Torches out of them!
Bummer, we don't have anything along that we could burn.
A tavern

Ahhh, what a fabulous place. It's hard to believe, but this Building probably used to be a kind of bar. Just picture it: tables and chairs, a crackling stove in the middle, a little music, good conversations, long evenings. And a couple of good drinks to be had at the bar itself. A Pub at the snow-covered end of the world! You know, I can hardly believe it myself, but a vision is planting itself solidly in my mind. My dear friends ... We have to get the bar back in shape and make it shine like new again.
Have a look around!
Generator

A good bar needs Electricity, of course. After all, there's a whole bunch of equipment standing here that would benefit from it! I brought along my trusty Generator. We can make use of it. Would you like to haul it in from outside?
Let's do it!
There it is. Awesome! It ought to supply us with enough Power to create some cozy lighting here and run one or the other piece of equipment, too.
Connection
Hmm, there's junk and chaos everywhere here. I'll let you have some say in the designing. After all, we're something like ... partners now. What do you think? Where should we hook up the Generator?
Where should we put it?
Cable

Up here, Boss, in the little hut ... the floor is stable over here in the corner. The exhaust fumes can escape better here, too. But we're going to have to connect the generator with cables somehow. <<dynamicmessage>>
Good idea!
Fabulous, one small step in the direction of my fully operational bar.
Like we said, there's nothing we can do without additional cables ...
We've got the right cables along, Boss.
Bummer, we don't have the right cables along. This is never going to work!
Unused wires
Here are some unused cables, Boss. We can hook the generator up to them. But first we need to mount it somehow. <<dynamicmessage>>
Give it a try!
Fabulous, one small step in the direction of my fully operational bar.
Our set-up won't work like this; it's way too flimsy! We'll have to try something else.
We've got some scrap along. I think we could probably improvise.
Well, we don't have any extra material with us, but we could try it without.
Heat
We don't complain much, but it is freaking cold and everything is covered with snow. According to the signs, this big machine in the middle must be a heating stove. Should we try to get it going?
Go for it!
Yeah, it's actually pretty chilly here. Do you think we can get that big thing up and running? That ought to make it really nice and toasty for us!
Stove
I'll admit, it is a few years... um ... centuries past its prime, isn't it? But, at any rate, it's better than nothing.
Looks like it.
Clean
The firing chamber is covered in soot, Boss! We should give it a thorough cleaning or else nobody will ever be able to get a fire going in here. <<dynamicmessage>>
Take care of it!
I can already see that cozy fire crackling away. Then let's put on the heat.
We could give it a good scrubbing ... I doubt it would do much good, though. We just don't know enough about it.
We should let our charcoal burner take a look at it.
Why in the world didn't we take along any experts for cases like this?
Complete overhaul
Boss, this thing is full of holes. It's in desperate need of an overhaul! We should especially check the ventilation. <<dynamicmessage>>
Sounds like it must be done!
I can already see that cozy fire crackling away. Then let's put on the heat.
We won't get far here without any technical know-how, Boss. If we do something wrong, we could burn everthing to the ground!
Luckily we have someone along with technical know-how.
However, none of us are all that technically skilled.
The right fuel
It just crossed my mind ... Fuel would be a good thing. Did you see any here?
Very good!
Coal stash
Boss, there appears to be a fuel stash on the side in the firing chamber. There's still a ton of coal in it. Can we just light it again? <<dynamicmessage>>
Good idea!
We got a fire going despite the dampness. Sometimes you just need a bit of skill!
Boss, the coals got wet too and they aren't burning very well. We're standing directly in the smoke and it just doesn't want to catch fire.
Our expert says that the coal is pretty damp. But we could try it anyway! We just have to sort out the damp pieces of coal.
Only an expert could tell us if this coal is of any use to us like this ...
Old wood
There are some old pallets, barrels and crates lying around here. We could just burn the wood. <<dynamicmessage>>
Get some wood!
Very good. The wood is dry as a bone. It should burn beautifully!
Boss! The wood is totally rotten. It's just disintigrating on us. This will never do.
We've got some of our own with us as well. That shoud be more than enough!
We could certainly use a little more wood, but we'll have to make do with what we've got.
Fireplace
Oh, how wonderful, at last I can sit down next to a crackling fireplace and make myself some Mushroom tea. Grab yourselves a few chairs, take a seat and join me …
Fantastic!
Mushroom tea
Mushroom tea, that sounds ... different. Listen, Ole, we should probably be heading home soon.
If there's nothing else?
What a shame, that's a shame. But you'll come back again, won't you?
In the meantime
I'm glad to hear it. In the meantime I'll do some tidying up and keep the fire going. And I have one last request!
Sure!
Fuel

The fuel won't last forever. I'm afraid I'm a bit short here and I'd really prefer not to burn up the chairs, so ... Could you maybe bring some along with you? Of course, only if you don't mind and it's not too much trouble!
Let's do it!
Gee, I knew I could rely on you. I simply knew it! You've already helped me get a lot further. I'm going to name a drink after you ... I might just call it “The Boss”.
The bar
I think this used to be a bar, Boss! At least that's what it looks like.
Check it out!
No kidding! It's a bar. Even the right kind of stools are here. Are we lucky or what! This place is as if it was made for us.
Start up
OF COURSE it's still good for something! You'll see, it won't be long before the beverages are bubbling away here. But first we have to look and see what this precious gem has to offer.
Is it any good?
Drawers
The drawers look interesting, Boss, but they're locked. Should we force them open? <<dynamicmessage>>
Break them open!
Ooh, there's all kinds of useful stuff in these drawers. Let's take it with us!
It's not going to work, Boss! We can't get them open without destroying them. What a shame that would be!
We've got the right tools along!
Bummer, these tools won't really help us here.
Small chamber
Here's a door, Boss. Should we open it up and see what's behind it?
Do it!
Excellent, there's even storage space for utensils and glasses and bottles here … not to mention the jam!
Jam

Sure, yes, indeed. Hasn't it ever crossed your mind to produce scrumptious jam? Why have I been perfecting my jam recipe all these years? For what? We'll get to that. But first of all let's take a look at the closets and cupboards in here!
Jam?
Force it open
The cupboards and cabinets are locked. Let's pry them open. Everything will need to be re-done here anyway!
Break them open!
Awesome! Here are some old rusty tin cans. Must be canned food. There's something written on here ... could be a date. I wonder if the contents are still edible.
No chance, can't get them open. We must be too weak!
Skill
It looks like we don't even have to force open the cabinets, Boss. With a little bit of skill, we could just lift them off the hinges on the side. <<dynamicmessage>>
Give it a try!
Awesome! Here are some old rusty tin cans. Must be canned food. There's something written on here ... could be a date. I wonder if the contents are still edible.
No, we aren't skilled enough ... or the hinges are too rusty.
Hand me a crowbar!
The question is just which tool to use.
Lots of stuff
There's a lot of stuff blocking the way here, isn't there? Come on and help me clean all this out!
Help him!

Oh my, although I was able to get a very good look inside when I landed, there was no way for me to see this cluttered mess. But even so, I already know exactly what I'm going to do with this corner …
Seating

Then again, yeah ... This is it. The day customers are supposed to sit here and tell each other stories while they enjoy the delicacies this world has to offer! Come on, we shouldn't waste any time. Where do we begin?
What?
Shelf
We should empty the shelf. We don't want any of that stuff to hit someone on the head.
Good idea!

Great. This way nothing can crash down anymore. Speaking of crashes ... It's not my first visit here. I ran into a snowstorm back then and had to make a forced landing. I thought my time had come. And then I spied a tower in the midst of all the raging snow. That was how I got here the first time. Unfortunately, the door was locked! What's more, I was short on supplies and had to leave in a hurry when the snowstorm died down.
Trunks
Here are some trunks, Boss. We should see what's inside them and sort out the things we don't need.
Look inside!

You're welcome to take the stuff from the chests with you. It's just in the way here. It might not seem that way to you, but finding a place like this was blind luck. Nothing you'd find on an old map. For years I traveled with my Balloon from place to place, and now this might just turn out to be a new home for me. Here! In the midst of the snow. Isn't that unbelievable?
Furniture
There are old chairs and furniture all over the place. We can't leave it like this, Boss. We can barely get through with so much stuff lying around!
Tidy up!

It's already a lot better like this! It's a lucky thing you found me here. After I sent off my radio message I waited in the snow for help. There was no way I could know if anyone would even receive it and then come and get me. And if I had left, someone else might have grabbed this wonderful Building for themself. I would never have forgiven myself for that.
I send greetings to all my fabulous helpers who are sitting there far away and thinking of me. Believe it or not, things have changed. Drop by some time and see for yourselves.

My dear fans of all that's fine and delectable, be my guests! Take a look around, it's gotten a lot cozier already. The stove has truly worked wonders! And just look, the surrounding snow has melted to reveal more parts of the Building. Originally it was probably a cooling tower or something. Fascinating, isn't it?
Look around
It goes without saying that you're my guests, but don't make yourselves too comfortable. You can surely give me a hand with one little thing or other.
Have a look around!
Fuel

My dear friends, did you remember the fuel I asked you for during your last visit? Even though the stove belches quite a bit of smoke, without it things here would get anything but comfy. <<dynamicmessage>>
Here it is!

Wonderful! Absolutely wonderful! You can be relied on, I knew it. Here, take a case of Hard Liquor in return. Whether I give it to you as a gift or old T. Bara secretly helps herself doesn't make a difference. A good sip every once in a while gets your head straight and makes room for the best and most creative ideas. ... As long as you don't overdo it, of course.
What? You don't have any fuel along? What a disappointment. If you don't do everything yourself ...
I'm sure you remembered it!
Or does it mean you're going to have to let me down?
T. Bara
Yeah, yeah. *cough* That's for sure, nobody's a guest here yet! Hehehe ... Not even me. *cough* There are still a few things to do before you can *cough* put your feet up, hah!
T. Bara? What are you doing here?

Yes, hahaha ... That's right, it's me. Ole used a few tasty delicacies as a pretense to lure me here and then sentenced me to work ... With the *cough* ... fumes that stove doles out here, nobody else could stand it! Yeahhhh, the only one is old T. Bara ... Once again, she's not above doing just about anything, hehe! *cough*
Some treasures

“Sentenced” she says. T. Bara is an old ... companion of mine and came by to support me. But there actually is something you could help us with. The heat that the Building radiates due to our stove has melted the surrounding snow. Now you can see that there's still a lot more to discover below us than we originally thought.
Our condolences!
Annex
There's an annex on the outside wall, Boss. It must have been hidden under the ice last time. Should we take a closer look?
Look inside!
We already tried to get in, but T. Bara and I were simply all thumbs. Is there any chance you have a knack for this kind of stuff?
Nailed shut
Boss, the door is locked and the lock appears to be all frozen. We could try to break down the door ...
Sure!
Side door
With the right tools, we should be able to get the annex open anyway, Boss. <<dynamicmessage>>
Force it open!
Fantastic! We got the door pried open. Let's take a look inside.
There's nothing we can do, Boss. It's frozen shut. This is getting us nowhere.
Luckily we brought some along!
But since we don't have any tools with us, we'll just have to use the scrap lying around here. Maybe we can find something that will work!
Tilt window
Maybe we don't even need to break down the door. There's an open tilt window outside. We could get in through there; we'd just have to climb in over the porch roof.
Climb up!
Fantastic! It wasn't very easy to keep our footing on that slippery roof, but we're in now. Let's see what we can find inside!
Everything we could grab onto to climb up is covered in ice. We keep slipping. Looks like it won't work after all, Boss!
Balcony
The entire annex was used as a hall closet. It's all full of shelves and boxes and stuff. A bunch of snow must have come in through the open window, everything is covered in it.
What is it?
Pile of snow
If we can get the snow cleared away, Boss, there could be something useful underneath it. <<dynamicmessage>>
Clear away the snow!
Here's a whole pile of tools, Boss. A little rusty, but I bet some of them could be useful!
At first glance, we can't find anything useful. There's nothing here but a few pieces of rusty sheet metal!
We've got the right tools to clear away the snow.
Without the right tools, we'll have to use our bare hands to clear it away.
Cabinet
Here's a cabinet with lots of locked drawers, Boss. <<dynamicmessage>>
Open them up!
There was a lot of stuff in the drawers, Boss. Surely some of it will be useful!
The first drawer was already a nightmare! This isn't going to work - at this rate, we'll still be standing here tomorrow.
Thank goodness we have someone along who is good with his hands. This shouldn't take any time at all!
I wonder if we'll be able to get them open. This could take forever.
Snowed-covered roof
We've already seen the snow-covered roof, too. It could be an additional annex. Could you take a closer look at it sometime?
Check it out!
Boss, it's just a snow-covered roof. I don't know how you can get in there, but definitely not from the outside!
Basement
If we can't get in from the outside, then maybe there's a way in from the inside. We should take a look around in the basement.
Now which way?
Basement
What a lovely idea. I wanted to show you the lower level, anyway. The thing is, we've discovered something totally amazing there.
What's that?
It looks as if a huge boiler had been added here at some point. At any rate, it's much bigger than the little stove here on the upper floor. Let's join forces to find out what it's all about.
Take a closer look.
Ole wasn't lying, Boss. It's huge ... But we should take a look around first anyway. Should we look for the entrance to the annex before we tackle the boiler?
Impressive!
Pile of coal
Here's a big pile of coal, Boss. It's easily wide enough to be hiding a hatch. Should we clear away some of the coal and take a look?
Go for it!
YIKES, MICE! ... Pretty impressive that they've survived this cold! They seem to be pretty comfortable in the coal pile. What a shame - there's no hatch here that could lead to the annex.
Hatch
Hey Boss, here's another wooden hatch. Doesn't seem to be locked. Should we take a look inside?
Open it!

Behind the hatch there was a ladder that did, indeed, lead to the annex. Here's some other useful stuff that we could take along. If the annex is any indication, there could be a lot more hidden in the snow underneath us than we thought. This tower must be huge.
Large gate
This big gate is clearly a passageway, Boss. The entrance to the annex that we're looking for is most certainly behind it.
Open the gate!
Behind the gate is just another storeroom. I've never seen such thick cobwebs in my whole life. But still no entrance to the annex.
Hidden basement
There are several places where we could start, Boss. Why don't you just tell us where to look first. That stupid entrance must be here somewhere.
Thank you!
Search for the entrance
The whole basement is pretty cluttered. There's junk laying around everywhere. Maybe the door to the annex is hidden here somewhere.
Get going!
The fact is, it's not easy to find your way down here. Just take a look around. If you find anything you can make use of, of course you can keep it!
Boiler
Okay, Boss. Should we take a look at the boiler? It looks like a central system and could be important.
Go for it!
It's a huge steam boiler. Must be a heater. And those are the pipes back there. I wonder where they lead.
Pipes
The pipes lead in different directions, Boss. This duct system is huge. We have to explore it more closely.
Take a look!
Moldy pipe
This pipe smells weird, Boss. It's wide enough to climb through. If we have to, we could follow the pipe, but it sure does stink!
Follow it!
The air is pretty humid in this pipe. Maybe it used to be the water system? In combination with the boiler, it could even been heated.
The pipe
Running water? Not to mention hot? That would be a blessing! The customers would love it. We've got to get it going. Let's see ... The big steam pipe is pretty filthy.
What does Ole think about it?
Mushrooms
It's pretty steep going down here, Boss. The side walls are full of mushrooms. We could try to scrape them off. Maybe we could get some out of them? <<dynamicmessage>>
Scrape them off!
Wonderful, the pipe is all clear. Umm ... Do you really want to take the Mushrooms with you? I wouldn't even make tea with them anymore.
Man, scraping them off didn't work. There has to be another way. It's just too steep.
We've got someone along who knows a lot about mushrooms.
None of us know anything about that kind of mushrooms.
Fire
Mushrooms are growing all over the side walls. We definitely need to clearn the pipe! We need to get rid of them for hygienic reasons. A little fire and we'll be good to go. <<dynamicmessage>>
Fire away!
The pipe is clear. I wonder if we'll really get hot water? Ole wil have to put some work into it.
Unfortunately we don't have anything along that we could use to get a fire going.
We've got enough fuel. We should be able to get a decent fire going with all this!
Unfortunately we don't have anything along that we could use to get a fire going.
Rusty pipe
This pipe is completely rusted from the inside, Boss! If we want to get it fixed up, we should check out every single meter. Otherwise we could be in for a nasty surprise when we start up the boiler.
Look for weak spots!
It looks like our fears have been confirmed, but it's even worse than we thought. We're going to have to do something about it!
Big leak
Boss, here the pipe is in particularly bad condition. With a leak like this, it won't withstand the pressure. We're going to have to dismantle this section, repair it and put it back in.
Do that!
Replace
This pipe is only made of flexible steel walls, and there are some more of them lying around up there. We just need to find the ones that fit and then we can repair the leak. <<dynamicmessage>>
Give it a try!
Indeed. We were able to prepare the new pipe in such a way that it should fit perfectly into the place where we removed the old one.
This doesn't seem to fit, Boss. There are gaps everywhere! We're just not sure about this construction.
Our scrap expert has an eye for that!
Does anyone know what they're doing here? Nobody? Well then, let's just hope we're lucky!
Repair it
We shouldn't change the pipe system. It would be better to seal the existing pipe and fix it from the inside! <<dynamicmessage>>
You can do it!
There! Now the pipe is sealed properly. That should hold tight, no more leaks!
The more we fiddle around with it, the more everything is falling apart, Boss! The pipe is crumbling between our fingers!
Our technician can fix it for sure.
But none of us are experts. What do you think, Boss?
Horizontal
Now that all of the leaks have been patched up, we should be able to use the pipe again.
Are you done?
Inspection
What do you think, Ole? That should work, shouldn't it? At some point, you should get someone to help you with tasks like these. A maintenance man, maybe? Somebody who likes to tinker around!
That's right!

Yes, you're right. Let's see if I can find someone. But anyway, thanks a lot for helping me out here. Hopefully this boiler won't be as smokey as the stove upstairs ... Otherwise, with all those fumes no one's gonna come into the bar.
Sooty pipe
This pipe is really warm. It must be in use already! We shouldn't climb into this one, Boss. But since it's warm, maybe it's an exhaust vent for the stove upstairs?
Is there anything else?
There are also some wheels and levers. Maybe these are the valves that are used for regulating the flow through the pipes?
Valves
Judging from the markings, they are probably closed. That must be why all that smoke upstairs isn't clearing out. Everything is under pressure, too!
What valves?
Valves
What do you think? Should we open up the valves, Boss?
Open them up!
Damn it! Maybe we shouldn't have done that, Boss. There's steam escaping now through various spots on the pipe! Outside too! If we don't turn it off immediately, there will be an explosion!
Rust
It looks like this is the leak. If we don't plug it up, it's going to get ugly down here!
Stay calm!
Plug it up
We coud use fabric to plug up the hole. It's an improvised solution, but it should fulfill the purpose. <<dynamicmessage>>
Give it a try!
Okay, that should do the trick for now, but it won't hold forever. We should remind Ole to take a closer look at it.
We don't have any fabric with us! We'll have to find another way to plug up the hole!
We have enough fabric along to give it a try.
If only we had enough fabric along.
Seal it
Here's some plastic and rubber scraps. Surely we can seal up the hole with it! <<dynamicmessage>>
Give it your best!
We were able to melt the rubber and seal the hole with it.Hard to believe, but that should do it!
That's a dumb idea, Boss. It'll just fall apart again! We'll have to try something else.
We brought a few things along ourselves!
Unfortunately, we didn't bring anything along with us. We'll have to make do with the stuff we find here.
T. Bara
Hey, T. Bara, did you come by to give us a hand?
Yeah, tell me what's up!

Ole, that old swashbuckler ... *cough*... Haven't seen him for a long time, ya know. At some point he called me and told me about this place. In the end, ... well ... I weakened to temptation, hehehe.
Play
Hmm? ... Those are dice, my dears. *cough* Feel like playing a round for money? You could make a killing on your bets ... that is, if the dice take a liking to you. Hah! Haha!
What is that on the table?
Dice
Boss, do you really think gambling is a good idea? We could bet our expedition rations, but we don't want to lose too many and have to go back to the settlement too early.
Just roll the dice!
*cough* *cough* ... Whaaat? You're ... gangsters, that's what you are! Cutthroats ... Cleaning out old T. like that ... Whatever, next time I'll get you! One more round?
Yahooo ... T. Bara's on a streak ... That's not what you thought, huh? Underestimated old T., didn't ya? Come on! One more round! *cough*
The stove
That's a fact, and it runs much cleaner than the little stove. Truly fascinating. I think this Generator in the basement was built to free the whole surrounding area from ice!
It works!
Warm feet
Fascinating! There were probably once a lot of people here, maybe even a small town! And when it was cold they just build a huge stove in the middle, so they could have warm feet.
Interesting.
Now that the Generator's running you could stay a little longer. I've just made some fresh jam!
Stove
All of the pipes are cleaned, patched, and ready to go. Shall we start the stove?
Do it.
The stove is finally running. That was some heavy-duty maintenance. If we'd just turned it on, I'll bet everything would have been blown up. We're done here Boss!
Goodbye

Oh, how wonderful! At last Ole Sørensen can heat his bar at the end of the world now! Do you want to leave already? Oh, what a shame. Will I see you again sometime? I hope you'll bring along as much willingness to help next time, too!
Well done!
Goodbye

*cough* *cough* … What?! Does this mean you want to leave old T. Bara already …? *cough* Now that the fun's just getting started? Yeah, yeah, you've got people to tend to, I got it ... Maybe I'll come visit you sometime! Hehehe!
See you later!

It's fascinating, Boss. The whole building is proof that there were people who managed to survive this frost ..., just imagine if we had to build our entire settlement around this giant heating tower. That would be a real challenge!

My dear friends from so far away. The big boiler is pumping out steam full blast! The way it looks, undreamt-of treasures were hidden under the blanket of snow! Do you really want to miss out on that?

Oh, how nice to have you back here again. Did I promise too much? Who could have suspected all the things hiding underneath the ice? Come on, we'll all go take a look at them together. You too, Rusty!
Rusty Rolph
Aaah ... Hahaha, yes ... I know these faces, I sure do! So you're Ole's “experts”, haha ... Then at least there's someone here to put my ideas into practice!
Rusty? Rusty Rolph?
Rusty Rolph

Allow me to introduce my good friend: Rusty Rolph. He's helping me with all the junk. And sometimes he has “suggestions” of his own.... He has also taken care of the improvised repairs you carried out last time.
Anything to do?

So, what were you thinking about, huh? As for me, I'm good at tinkering around, no doubt about it, but Ole ... all he's got are two left hands! He can cook up jam, but with Tools ... hah, he'd be better off keeping his hands off them.
Hidden gems
Well now, two left hands ... What a peculiar idea ... Well, at any rate the heat from the boiler uncovered a number of hidden pearls. I'm sure that many of them can be quite useful!
What's up?
Rusty greenhouse
A bunch of rusty steel skeletons, between them lots of glass ... we've seen this before near our settlement. Isn't it a greenhouse?
A greenhouse?
A genuine treasure trove, right? Take a closer look at it, go on ... There were real inventors at work here! They are truly fascinating facilities.
Dilapidated...

It is a bit run-down. I already had to protect it against Rusty's obsession with collecting, or else he would've grabbed all the steel and all the glass for himself. When we get it back into shape I could grow Fruit for my jam here!
Is it intact?
Hole

It's imperative that we cover up all the holes in the glazing to protect the Plants against the cold in the future. There's enough material lying around here. See if you can work with that. <<dynamicmessage>>
Fix that.
So, it should be airtight. Now cold air can't get in to harm the plants.
Oof! Without the right tools we can't fasten down the covering.
You've got the Tools for the job with you!
Although, your Tools aren't made for a job like this.
Automation

Hey, whaddaya know ... There are some thin pipes here that lead to the Greenhouse. My wealth of know-how tells me that they were probably used for regulating Temperature and Irrigation. Yes, sir, believe you me. We've got to clear the ice off the pipes. <<dynamicmessage>>
De-ice it.
We de-iced all the pipes. Looks like new! The heating and the water supply should work now.
We were able to de-ice the pipes, but we're not sure if it will work. We'll have to keep an eye on it.
You've got a Technician along. He's sure to see it that way, too, hah!
You don't have the slightest idea, but Rusty knows his stuff! Trust me!
Manure
There's a lot of manure here in the corner. I wonder if they used it for the plants. Maybe we could use it too, so that plants can once again thrive here. <<dynamicmessage>>
Try it.
We loosened the soil in the beds and successfully spread the manure. Soon plants will grow here! Let's take the dried herbs from the old beds with us!
The manure is all dried out, I don't think it'll work. We won't get anything growing like this.
In any case we've got someone here who should know about this stuff.
But we don't really know much about fertilizer. Maybe our shepherd should have taught us about it.
Sacks
Hey Boss! Here are some old sacks. Shall we look inside? Maybe there's something useful in them. <<dynamicmessage>>
Rip them open.
Hey, its seeds! That will make the farmers at home happy. Finally something different!
Whatever's in there, we couldn't identify it. Looks pretty useless.
Our farmers will help us identify it.
Unfortunately we don't have any experts with us who could help.
Truck

I haven't examined the old transporter down there yet. As badly wrecked as it is, it's fairly certain there won't be anything valuable to find there. Look around, take your time, and keep whatever you find.
Thanks!

Man oh man! They got junk to tinker with for free? You're quite a guy, Ole. If there's anything useful for me out there, it's a sure thing we can trade, right? Fact is: These doors are sealed shut. You think ... well, can you force them open? For Rusty! Yeah, for your friend Rusty!
The load
I took a look through the windows, haha, just a quick one. There are whole boxes of Radiation Suits. What they're worth! Man oh man, I'm tellin' you! What do you think, can we get in there?
On it!
Shall we go?
The door is locked, but I bet we can break it open, Boss! <<dynamicmessage>>
Pry it open.
Great, we're in. That was easy.
Oh, shoot. The bar slipped. This won't work.
We've got the right tool in our pack!
But we don't have the right tool.
The glass
We cold break the glass here and climb through carefully. <<dynamicmessage>>
Break it!
Great, we're in. That was easy!
Shoot, the glass shattered. We cut ourselves badly on the shards, Boss! Now we've got to take care of our wounds.
Our junk collectors can tell us how best to remove panes of glass.
A junk collector could probably have told us how to best remove panes of glass.
Look around

Oh no, all rotted to the core! Look at them, the suits are completely moldy. What rotten luck, the world ... That's it, the world's against me! Don't matter, so what? Maybe there's still something usable here.
Anything there?
Freight documents
Boss, here are the freight documents. They list everything that was in the van. <<dynamicmessage>>
What do they say?
Let me take a look ... Yeah, mhm, okay ... Just a second, what? Holy moly, could it be that …? Is that what …? Move it, we've got to open up the trailer!
Hmm... we can't really do anything with this...
Our logistics people can probably get a lot out of this!
To understand this, I'm afraid you have to know something about logistics.
Radio
There's a radio in this box, Boss. Wonder if it still works. <<dynamicmessage>>
Let's hope so!
The radio has some water damage, but we can probably still use some of the parts.
The thing's a total wreck, Boss. It's useless.
We've got a veteran with us. The old guy really knows his way around one of those.
We can try to take it apart, even though we don't have an expert with us.
A deal
It's already open. Come in. Haha, Rusty, you wouldn't have thought so, huh? It's even stayed dried in here. That thing in the back, is that what you're looking for?
What's over there?
Expedition rations
Since you ask.... we could use some expedition rations.
Take the rations.
Yes, of course, no problem. Rusty always has Rations with him.
Tools
Tools sound good. We can always use them!
Take the tools.
You want Tools? My beloved Tools? Well, if that's what you've set your hearts on ... Here! Be my guest!
Activated carbon masks
Masks? We could use some activated carbon masks.
Take the masks.
You want my Masks? It's a real pity the suits in the truck weren't any good anymore. Then I already would've gotten spares. But all right ... Go ahead and take them.
The container
Well, haha ... All sorts of stuff! Masks, Tools, Rations ... Whatever your heart desires. What else could you ask for? Hm?
What can you offer?
Strange object
To be honest, Boss, we have no idea what that is. It's made all of metal, and its shape is wild, like a kind of golden snake...
What is that, Rusty?
Whoa, amazing! Is this too good to be true …? I've been looking for this for years! For ages and ages! It's a saxophone, yeah ... a real saxophone. What can I give you for it?
Valuable

Wow, this is fantastic, haha! I used to play sax ... Then I lost mine. Stuff like that hardly exists in this world anymore, no one bothers with it these days ... It's basically worthless. You know what? I'm eternally grateful to you!
We're taking it!
A good trade
No problem, Rusty. It was hardly any trouble. And we're looking forward to your first performance in Ole's bar.
It'll be great!
That's a brilliant idea! Of course I'll perform in the bar. And I owe it all to you. I'll dedicate my first piece to you. Haha, it'll be a hymn to our friendship!
An acquired taste

Dear Rusty, I don't want to say that I don't value your presence ... But now, with that saxi... With that thing I'd prefer it if you ... could move into quarters somewhat farther away. And then we'll talk about the performance some other time!
Um ... thanks?
A bit out of practice
Yeah, haha, I am a bit out of practice, you know ... But now I'm going practice every day ... On my balloon rides I have plenty of time for that!
Good luck!
Phew, what luck. With you as a musician I could've closed the bar in no time.
Homeward bound
Let's let the two of them figure it out, Boss. We should tke the opportunity and get out of here.
We've got to go.
Safe home!

Now don't be such a killjoy, Ole. And you? You want to be on your way? You've done so many great things for Rusty, but you don't want to keep him company anymore? Now, hopefully it's not on account of my saxophone, is it? Whatever ... um ... have a safe trip home!
See ya!
Pretty impressive, what all you can experience out in the middle of nowhere. We won't forget this adventure any time soon, Boss!
Another building
Here's another building we couldn't see before that was freed from the ice.
Rust? Have you already been there?
We didn't get the door open. But anyone who knows me knows that naturally I had a solution. Except, Ole ... well, he was skeptical.
The door
Rusty wanted to blow the door off with a stick of dynamite. It goes without saying that I objected. Is there any chance you'll get the door open with less collateral damage?!
Oh yeah?
Blow open
Rusty's idea wasn't bad? All this lock-picking and jimmying, how boring! Time for a little more action! <<dynamicmessage>>
Try it.
Hey, haha ...Whenever it booms and bangs, success is not far behind! It's like I said, you've got to approach it with a vengeance.
It worked, Boss, but the explosives were really ... explosive! That hit us hard. One of us even got hit in the head with the door!
Good thing we brought along some gunpowder. From now on we should always have some with us.
Unfortunately we don't have any explosives with us. We'll have to take Rusty's.
Pry open
That's a big door, Boss. I think we can try to take it off the hinges. <<dynamicmessage>>
Try it.
Oof, we just managed it. The door is off the hinges. If it hadn't worked, we's have had to blow open the door after all.
Boss, that didn't work. The door is totally warped. Maybe we'll have to go with Rusty's ida and blow it open. Or shall we keep trying?
It'll be child's play with these metal tools. We know what to do with them.
Our tools aren't really the right ones for this.
Electriciy

Stop, watch out, Rusty ... Don't move! What a pain, there's meltwater everywhere. And don't you see the cables back there? I have no idea if they work, but it's a good bet I ought to turn off the Power. I'll just dash upstairs!
Take a look.
Generator
We installed the Generator up there, remember? I'll turn off the Power now!
Let's go!
Holy smoke! You've saved our lives, Ole. Every one of us. Nipped that one in the bud, haha! Now it ought to be safe down there! But maybe it's better to remove those cables, too.
Cable complex
Well, it's not just single cables, it's a whole harness, all tangled up. It won't be so easy to unsnarl them.
Will it work?
Tie them together
They must have had a purpose. We should tie them together carefully, so that they don't come in contact with the water down here.
Tie them together.
Done! Now the cables are hanging tidily on the side.
Cut them apart
Better safe than sorry, Boss. We should just cut them apart. <<dynamicmessage>>
Cut them apart.
Done! Shouldn't be a problem anymore.
Shoot, the cables are in terrible condition. The wires will cut your hand off if you're not careful.
Our tailor can use their scissors to work through them.
We're not really sure what the safest way to do it is.
Loading dock

Fascinating. This Building here is a Recycler and Workshop all in one. Presumably Scrap was sorted here and directly processed afterwards. Amazing! Dozens of people must have once lived here! Let's wait and take a look at all the things we find down here. Take whatever you need!
Look around.
Old barrels
Here are some barrels, Boss. Shall we see what's inside? Our refiners in the settlement are always careful when they open old barrels. You never know what might be inside.
Look inside!
There's all kinds of stuff that we could really use.
Shelves

Here's some well-preserved fabric, some plastic, and coal. Those are exactly the materials we use to make our protective suits. I wonder if all of these materials here were used for the same purpose. We'll take it all with us, right?
Help yourself!
Man, Boss, that's really valuable stuff! I'm sure we can put it to good use at home.
Workbench
Boss, here's a fully equipped workbench. It's hard to believe all the tools lying around!
Pack it up.
We packed everything up. Their eyes will pop when they see this at home!
A Decontamination Post
A Decontamination Post
Hey, chief! Some of our Settlers are worried that the Radiation in the surroundings will become entrenched in our Food. They want a Decontamination Post to be built to combat this problem.
I'm not sure if it's the right idea to ignore this problem, chief.
That's disturbing news, chief! The Radiation poses a major threat to us there.
Very good! That ought to clear up the Population's worries for the time being.
A Scrap Collector
A Scrap Collector

We've already collected various sorts of Scrap from our surroundings and used it to build up our settlement. If we build a Scrap Collector, then we can use it as an additional source of Scrap, chief! Wouldn't that be somethimng?
Whatever you say, chief...
It looks as if the project dealing with the Scrap Collector didn't get completed. That's a shame. We could've put the additional Scrap to good use.
That's good news! Now we can make use of the caught Scrap, too.
The Power of the Sun
The Power of the Sun
Chief! What would you say if we use our Progress to obtain Energy from sunlight? If we build a Solar Collector, then we can use it to generate a lot of Electricity.
You're the boss! But you can still keep the idea in the back of your mind.
Sadly, that thing with the Solar Collector didn't quite work out the way it was planned, chief! I'm afraid we'll have to do without Electricity for the time being.
Wonderful news! The Solar Collector has been put into operation and can generate Power now. That's a major step ahead for the settlement.
Solid Ground
Solid Ground
In large parts our Settlers are still trudging across the settlement on unpaved routes. Maybe it would make sense to upgrade the Road network a bit. What do you think, chief?
No? Oh, well... it'll just have to work the way it is.
Road construction is unfortunately lagging a bit behind, chief. We're not completely done yet.
The Road construction is completed. That's a good start, chief!
A Campfire
A Campfire

Hey, chief! There's always a good crowd at the Campfire around our Town Center! So crowded that it can happen every now and then that not everyone's able to find a seat. It's a sure thing the Settlers would be pleased if you could make another Campfire available to them.
It was just an idea....
Sadly, the Campfire hasn't been ignited, chief! Oh well, maybe some other time.
Awesome! The Campfire picks up the Settlers' mood a bit right away, chief!
Power For Everyone
Power For Everyone
Hey, chief! Some of our Settlers are already hooked up to the Power Grid. But sadly, not all of them yet! Maybe we ought to take the step and be able to offer Electricity for all the Settlers?
Yes, you're certainly right, chief! At the moment we simply can't afford that kind of luxury yet.
Sadly, there are still Settlers with no Power connections. That dampens the mood a bit.
That's absolutely perfect, chief! Every Settler has access to Electricity. We didn't dare to believe in a kind of luxury like that.
Grant all Settlers access to Electricity: <<amount>>
A New Find
A New Find

Hey, chief! We found strange deposits in the rocks at one of our mines. It's a bit away from our normal tunnels, but we could dig a little in that direction. Maybe we'll find something interesting, right?
Whatever you say, chief! We'll continue to focus on Coal.
Looks as if we were wrong, chief! There's nothing else to find here.
Chief, we have good news! We've actually discovered a small treasure here.
Iodine

We've struck Iodine, chief! If we mine that Iodine effectively, then we can use it to combat the Radiation that does such harm to our Settlers. If you allow us to shore up this new tunnel a bit, then we can get started with the Mining right away!
Whatever you say, chief! We'll continue to focus on Coal.
It's a good day for our settlement! This Iodine can save lots of people's lives!
A Problem!
A Problem!
We have a problem, chief! Water contaminated by Radiation has leaked out of one of our Water Towers. We badly need to plug the leak!
The leak has been plugged, chief!
What Was Going On There?

Apparently our Filter System was defective and didn't let the Water flow through properly. We repaired it, but who knows how long this has already been going on. To be on the safe side we ought to have our Food decontaminated.
The Decontamination Kits didn't get finished on time. Hopefully that won't become a problem...
We've had everything decontaminated! No more problems should be able to occur anymore!
More Storage Capacity
More Storage Capacity
Hey, chief! Our settlement is steadily growing and some of us are afraid that sooner or later we'll run out of Storage Capacity. Shouldn't we build a few Warehouses?
Sooner or later we'll probably need the Storage Capacity, but for the time being we'll have to manage without it.
Additional Storage Capacity wasn't able to be provided for until now, chief! Sooner or later that could become a problem!
The new Storage Areas can be used right away. Now we have more space for stockpiles! That's very good, chief!
The Refinery
The Refinery
Our Recyclers do outstanding work, chief! Although, if we could centralize their Production even more, then maybe they'd be even more effective? A Refinery might be just the right thing for that.
Whatever you say, chief!
Unfortunately, the Refinery isn't ready for operation. So the Recyclers will just have to continue to suffice for the time being.
The Refinery is fully operational and Production can start up, chief!
Southern expedition
Hello ... This is an SOS. We're on a ship off the coast ... We don't have any supplies ... If you hear this ... If you find us somehow ... please help us!
Stop! Not one step further! What are you doing on this ship? Are you here because of the SOS?
Making contact
We picked up your emergency call. Is there someone here we could speak with? Take us to your captain...
Ask for the captain
Captain
Captain? ... Gee, well, basically there isn't anybody like that here. We're all alone on the ship and sent off the SOS ourselves.
There are no grown-ups?

No. I'm the oldest one of us here. By the way, my name is Lila. At the beginning everything worked really well on the ship, but then a whole bunch of things went wrong. We probably just had bad luck and now all that's left are us kids.
Lila
That would be awesome! If you could give us a hand with our problems, then we'll be able to navigate the ship from there for sure.
Can we help?
The raincatcher
Look at this, our Rain Collector was destroyed in a storm! Ever since then we've been short on Water and we can't drink salt water, can we?
What's wrong?
That's a leak! We wanted to patch it but don't have anything suitable. And none of us really has a clue, anyway.
A leak...
Nifty, thanks a lot! Do you think it can be repaired?
We'll take a look.
Plastic
Boss, the leak is pretty big. Maybe we should use plastic, so that it's sealed really well. <<dynamicmessage>>
Use plastic.
Oh, that's ace, it already looks very sturdy. And it'll really hold up that way? Really truly?
It's sealed, but the plastic won't withstand the pressure.
Our water carriers know about these things.
Let's hope, since none of us know about it.
Metal
Boss, the pressure in the tank will be really high when there's a lot of water. We should patch it with metal, so that it holds better. <<dynamicmessage>>
Use metal.
Oh, that's ace, it already looks very sturdy. And it'll really hold up that way? Really truly?
Boss, we just can't get it sealed. We'll have to try again.
Our master builder says that's the best idea.
But none of us knows how to build a raincatcher.
A donation
Um ... Our Water Supplies are pretty empty and I don't know when it's going to rain again. Could you give us some Water?
Sure!
Water
Let's go look... <<dynamicmessage>>
Give some away.
Yeah, really? Awesome, that sure does help us. It ought to last for a while.
Sure, yeah ... I understand! We'll just get ourselves Water from somewhere else. We'll manage, sure thing!
Sure, we can give you some. You can't drink saltwater, after all.
Listen Lila, we hardly have any water for ourselves.
Dry fields
Boss, there are some improvised fields here, right in the middle of the ship. Looks like the children planted something here. It should work, but it has to be irrigated really well.
Check it out.
Yes, we should have watered the Fields, it's true! But we just didn't have any Water left to do it! Whatever was there we needed for drinking.
Short supplies
We don't have a bit of Food left, either. If the Plants on the Fields would grow again, then we'd be able to harvest something there and eat it, right? Can you do anything about that?
We understand.
Irrigation
Chief, there's an ingenious irrigation system lying here! If we get it back into shape the little Plants ought to be able to grow again. <<dynamicmessage>>
Ok
Awesome, thanks! It's much better like this. With the Water the Plants will grow again soon for sure.
Oh ... Well, we'll figure out another way to do it, sure thing ... No problem!
Luckily we have someone along who knows their way around piping like this.
This would've called for someone with the right expertise!
Replanting
Hey, we've gathered a fair amount of grains and kernels here. We have no idea, can you just put them in the ground?
Ok!
Plants
Boss, it's not so simple. Each plant is different. <<dynamicmessage>>
Try it.
That's ace, you really do know your way around. I watched you, so next time I'll even get it done all by myself. Thanks! Do you want to take a few of the Seeds with you? We're happy to share.
It's a shame, but maybe we'll find something in the captain's books. We just have to keep a sharp eye out when we look.
Our farmer can give it a try.
It makes no sense without any expertise.
Outbreak
You know, a few days ago everything was still okay. And then everybody got sick! I think it's because we didn't have so much to eat anymore.
Take us there.
Here, come here, fast! We laid them down in the quarters back there!
Stomach ache
It all started with plain bellyaches, nothing bad, really ... Then it got worse and worse. Now Ben and Alba can't even stand up anymore.
Let me see.
Fever
Ben? Alba? That doesn't look good. The last time I took a look they were still doing better …
You've got a fever.
How bad is it? Can you do anything about it? They'll get better and be healthy again, won't they?
Alba
We haven't really had anything to eat for days. And there's no Medicine here on the ship, either. Nowhere!
Hard to say.
Nourishment
Boss, they're children! They're not even 15 years old. They need some food. Alba looks like she hasn't eaten in days. <<dynamicmessage>>
Give them some.
Ok, that should get them back on their feet. Malnourishment and a lack of vitamins isn't unusual on long sea voyages.
Boss, we don't have anything. We can't help.
Luckily we have enough food with us.
If only we had enough food with us!
Rations

Chief, the Boy urgently needs something to eat! Otherwise the body can't defend itself against viruses and germs. Should we see if we can give him Expedition Rations? That ought to build him back up a bit. <<dynamicmessage>>
Do it.
Super, that should help!
Boss, we don't even have enough of that! What a mess. We've got to do something.
Luckily we've got enough!
If only we had enough with us!
Medicine
Boss, the kids are really sick. They need medicine desperately. <<dynamicmessage>>
Give it to them.
It should be better soon with that! We were able to use the kits to clean the Clothing. We hope they weren't exposed to Radiation for too long.
Boss, we just don't have anything we can give them.
Luckily we have some with us just in case!
But we don't have any with us...
Sick boy
This one here is Ed. He's sort of familiar with Technology and stuff like that. But since a few days ago he can't even get up right anymore. Ed? How are you doing?
What did he say?
He says he'll make it – but he's just playing the hero. I mean, just look at him.
Ed
Boss, he's over there. He's really pale. All of these children have symptoms of malnourishment. They've got to be taken care of immediately.
Let's do it!
Food
Boss, the boy desperately needs something to eat. Otherwise his body won't be able to defend itself against viruses and germs. <<dynamicmessage>>
Give him something.
He ate a bit. Now he needs to rest, so that he can recuperate. It'll be ok.
Boss, we don't have any more. We can't help.
Luckily we've got enough with us.
If only we had enough with us!
Rations
Shall we see if we can give him some expedition rations?
Do it.
Super, that should help.
Boss, we don't even have enough of that. What a mess! We have to do something.
Luckily we have enough with us.
If only we had enough with us!
Medicine
Boss, he needs medicine, then it will get better quickly. We've got to strengthen his immune system until he's recuperated. <<dynamicmessage>>
Give them to him.
He took the medicine, Boss. That should help with his nausea.
Boss, we just don't have anything we can give him.
We've got some in our packs.
We don't have any with us...
Silent motors
We were headed toward the coast. But the ship has stood still since then ... Something's wrong with the engine, I think.
Take us there!
Ben would've known about stuff like that. Well, at any rate a little bit! He just loves tinkering around. But he's sick and I don't have a clue.
Silent motors
Yeah, exactly. It was loud here before, but now it's all quiet. Could you take a look at it?
Doesn't it work anymore?
Air supply
Boss, here are some controls to regulate the air supply. <<dynamicmessage>>
Set them.
There we go! The air supply should be back on line. It should work now.
No Boss, it's no easy task. We're hurting more than we're helping.
Good thing we've got the right tools with us!
We need special tools for that. We don't have them, Boss.
Cleaning
Boss, we have to clean the cylinders. Theoretically, we know what to do. But we've never done it before. <<dynamicmessage>>
Clean it.
There we are! The cylinders are shining like new! The thing should work right now.
No Boss, it's not an easy task. We're hurting more than we're helping.
No worries, we've got an expert with us!
Unfortunately we don't have an expert with us.
Adjusting
Boss, theoretically we could adjust the gears. <<dynamicmessage>>
Adjust them.
There we go! The gears are adjusted and ready to go. The thing should work right now.
No Boss, it's not an easy task. We're hurting more than we're helping.
Our expert says he knows what to do.
But we don't have any experience with it.
Start the motors.

Wow, nifty! To me that's just a pile of steel and pipes.
There's also this boiler here. We need that too, don't we? We thought all you'd have to do is burn up something inside. The main thing is something's burning!
It should work.
Wood
Boss, wood should work for fuel. <<dynamicmessage>>
Use wood.
You say we can use that to get ourselves going again? Awesome, I'll tell the others. That'll make them happy, for sure!
Wood would be a good fuel, but we don't have any with us.
That should work just as well as coal.
But we didn't bring any with us.
Coal
Boss, coal would be the best thing to heat up the boiler. <<dynamicmessage>>
Use coal.
You say we can use that to get ourselves going again? Awesome, I'll tell the others. That'll make them happy, for sure!
Of course coal would be the best, but we don't have any.
And luckily we've got some with us!
Unfortunately we don't have any with us.
Garbage
Boss, in a pinch we could burn garbage. There should be enough on the ship. <<dynamicmessage>>
Burn garbage.
Boy, does that stink. But you say the engine's running again, right? Does that mean we can get going again? Awesome, I'll tell the others. That'll make them happy, for sure!
Boss, the motor would run, but the air would be full of poisonous fumes. That would be irresponsible.
We could mix in some of our plastic.
We don't have anything to mix in. The garbage on the ship will have to do.
Farewell
I think the ship is ready to go, Boss.
Shall we go home?
It's about time for us to go.
Farewell

Those were the worst problems, I think. It's nifty how you were able to help us. But maybe it would be better if you took off again now. Sure thing you've got plenty to do at home, too! At this point we'll manage on our own.
You sure you'll be alright?
I think so, yeah. We're better equipped now. And thanks to your help we've also learned some things about the ship, too!
Going home
For sure, yeah ... A pretty wild bunch, aren't they? A few dozen kids on a ship. But what are we supposed to do? Just give up? No, we'll make it!
Are you sure?
See you next time!
It's okay, you really can go now! We still have the radio in an emergency. Amazing that it works out here, huh? Ben gave it to me. Then I basically just tried it out.
Ok! Good luck!
Hey! At any rate it was a good thing you were there. I don't know how we would've done it on our own. Whatever. All I want to say is ... Thanks, thanks a lot!
Hello, this is Lila speaking from the, um ... ship. The thing is, we have a problem here. Do you think you could drop by one more time?

Awesome, you've come at just the right time! Hold on a second! Ben, Alba, Ed? Look who's here! These are the people who rescued you. Luckily, we're healthy again now. We take much better care of ourselves and the ship now. Well, up until the little incident here ...
Incident

Out on the high seas navigating was no problem. When this island popped up on the horizon we originally wanted to sail around it. There was an endless back and forth, and nobody knew how we were supposed to get out of the way in time. By then it was already too late ...
Inspect the incident.
A big problem

We wanted to head here in the south because we thought Fruit can be farmed here and, besides that, it's nice and warm! We heard that somewhere. However, there is a problem! You see, ... now we're stuck here and can't move!
That didn't work out so well.
We haven't dared to look and see how bad the damage actually is. Not yet. Couldn't you do that for us?
Get to work!

Oh, nifty. Do you really mean that's okay with you? Basically only the navigation system has to be repaired and we have to get the ship free somehow. And the ... everything that doesn't work up front.
On it!
Navigation facility
