Boss, this mast and the antennas up there ... that must be a part of the navigation facility that Lila mentioned.
Take a look.
Yeah, exactly. Ben says there's something wrong with the Antennas. He tried this and that, but it didn't do a thing. The point is, he's no expert, either!
Antenna
Boss, to be honest, the facility looks like a ruin. Let's get to work.
Let's have a look.
Antenna
Here, these are the Antennas. The storms and the hefty collision have bent everything out of shape!
Repair it.
We need to get a closer look to better judge the situation, Boss.
Upwards
The rungs on the antenna mast are all greasy and slippery. We can't get up that way, it's way too dangerous.
Clean them.
Clean
Rather than cleaning up everything, we can just clean each rung with rags. <<dynamicmessage>>
Clean the rungs.
That worked perfectly. Everything is squeaky clean and we can finally take care of the antenna.
Without anything that at least resembles a rag, this won't work.
Luckily we brought some with us!
If only we had some with us! We're not going to sacrifice our own clothes!
Detergent
Boss, we looked in these crates. Looks like there's some detergent in one of them. With it we can surely get the rungs clean. <<dynamicmessage>>
Use the detergent.
The detergent worked like a charm, Boss.
Man, Boss, somehow it's not working. Everything's still slippery. Maybe we used too much detergent?
We've even got an expert who knows how to use it. We don't use something like this every day!
No idea how to use this, but it can't be that hard.
Repair
Boss, the antenna is about to fall apart, and it's crooked. It's a miracle it worked as long as it did. It really needs some work.
How does it look?
Position
Boss, I think we'll have to completely reposition the antenna. At least that's what these markings here indicate. <<dynamicmessage>>
Position it.
Set at “Signal” it lights up green here ... You hear it crackling again, too. But that's a good sign, isn't it?
Sadly, it's still lighting up red ... no signal is being received here!
Our expert says repositioning it is easy, if you know what to do.
But we don't really have any idea. Shall we try anyway?
Repair
Boss, we've got to tighten a few screws here. That should do just the trick to stabilize the reception. <<dynamicmessage>>
Repair it.
Ah, yeah! There are sounds coming from the control panel! Looks like it worked, that's ace!
Hmm, I don't know if it's right that way, everything here is still very quiet ...
Our technician says he can do it easily.
Without a technician it's going to be hard.
Cable
Here are some cables that look rotten. They seem to be pretty old. Looks like they got hit by lightning, and they couldn't take the sudden overload.
Take a look.
Yes, we did notice it, but we weren't sure what could be done about it. Until recently everything still worked. Can something be done to fix it?
Loose connection
In this condition, these cables are always going to cause a loose connection. We have to fix them.
Check the cables.
Replace
We don't think we should use these cables. It's probably best just to replace the whole cable harness. <<dynamicmessage>>
Replace it.
Hey, that's ace! Now that the cables are new again, this ought to stand up for quite some time at first, right?
Unfortunately we don't have the proper replacements for the missing cables. We won't solve the problem this way.
We brought a few cables with us, they should work.
Too bad we don't have any cables with us to replace them.
Replace
There are so many controls and cable bundles here, a lot of it looks like it's still useable. We could use them to replace the scorched cables in the corner. <<dynamicmessage>>
Replace them.
Hey, that's ace! That'll definitely stand up for a while. So the cables aren't a problem anymore!
Uh-oh, looks like we snipped around on the wrong cables. Suddenly there were sparks and it smelled really bad, and somebody burnt their fingers. Guess they were still live.
Good thing we've got someone who can tell us what we can take out without any danger.
We don't know exactly what we need from here. Oh well, the proof is in the pudding!
Steering
Here are the rudder and a compass. We should examine both of them carefully. It's a good bet that these important pieces got damaged in the crash.
Have a look.
You're right. I was up here when we ran aground. The impact made quite a bang. Can it be repaired?
Steering
The compass needle seems like it's frozen, and the wheel appears to be stuck. That's a shame, Boss! Looks like we'll have to go at it delicately. They're pretty much the heart of the ship!
Check both.
Compass
A compass needle that doesn't move is a tricky thing, Boss. It makes navigation impossible. The needle must have gotten banged on a corner really hard, which made it get stuck. <<dynamicmessage>>
Repair it.
Yeah! Haha, I see it! The needle's in the middle again, what luck! It's awesome that you've got so much know-how. Without you we definitely wouldn't have managed it!
It's useless. The needle won't move an inch. We hammered it, tapped it, kicked it - nothing works!
Luckily our veteran has a strong magnet. He uses it to adjust our compasses when they get dropped.
We're really in trouble, we need someone who knows what they're doing.
Wheel

Hey Boss! Like we suspected, the wheel got bent in the crash. If we don't adjust it, it'll be difficult to steer precisely. We think we'll have to take it off completely, bend it back into shape, then put it back on. <<dynamicmessage>>
Adjust it.
Thanks a lot! When the helm has been readjusted, then we can steer the ship properly again!
The wheel still doesn't seem to be right. We can't leave it like that, Boss. We'll have to try again.
Our expert it pretty sure that we can repair the wheel on site.
God only knows if we'll get it completely readjusted, Boss. We don't have an expert with us.
Navigation

The helm is up here Boss. Here's where you control how fast the ship should sail, or if the anchor should be dropped, and other things. It looks like it's in pretty bad shape. Several knobs are missing and a couple of levers are broken off.
Does it still work?

To be honest, I don't know if the panel still works, but you're welcome to take a look. We don't use a lot of these buttons at all because we don't know what they stand for. To be on the safe side I switched off the engines before the collision!
Navigation
If the children want to get the ship away from here, they're going to have to move it backwards, somehow. We should see if the whole unit is okay, or if it was damaged in the crash.
Check it.
Reverse gear
Oh boy. Looks like the lever to put the ship into reverse is missing. Guess the kids ever only went forwards. <<dynamicmessage>>
Repair it.

There's a reverse gear? Ah, yeah, now that you mention it I remember again. The grown-ups actually used to be able to move the ship backwards. Wait a sec, I'll put a note here for myself so that I don't forget it again!
Shoot! Our makeshift lever broke off on the first test. It's really hard to get it in at that spot.
Our technician always has a few spare parts in his pack, including a lever. It doesn't fit perfectly, but it's better than improvising.
Looks like we'll have to improvise and hammer something together.
Anchor

Looks like the anchor chain came loose, Boss. As long as the anchor is down, the ship sure won't be able to sail any further. There should be something on this steering unit to pull up the chain. <<dynamicmessage>>
Raise the anchor.
The anchor was lowered? We didn't even notice it! To be honest, we've never done anything with it. But it's very good that you've shown us where we can do it! Thanks a lot.
The button that we pushed must have been the wrong one. It didn't do anything. The anchor chain is still down.
Luckily our expert knows which button is the right one.
We don't know which button is for the anchor. You'd have to know more about it.
Stuck
That doesn't look good, Boss. The ship ran aground and is stuck pretty deep in the sand. Getting it free won't be easy.
Let's get to work!

I tried to get us out of the way, but it all happened so fast and all I managed to do was make sure we didn't head into the rocks. If we don't get the ship out of the sand again will we have to abandon it? Does it mean we won't be able to continue our voyage?
Stuck
We'll have to dig the ship free in a couple of places, Boss. It'll take a while, but we'll manage. When we've gotten rid of all the sand, the ship can sail again.
We'll see.
Piles of sand
There's a lot of sand blown around up here at the bow. We'll have to remove a lot of sand here. <<dynamicmessage>>
Then shovel!
Oof, we did it! The ship's free here.
It's impossible without shovels and just with our hands. It's simply too much sand.
Luckily we brought shovels with us!
Without shovels it will be a major effort. Everyone has to help!
Mountain of sand
That's a mountain of sand, Boss! But the ship is stuck. We'll have to dig. <<dynamicmessage>>
Dig.
Whoo, what an effort! But the piles of sand are gone. When we get home, I don't want to see any more sand, Boss.
Boss, it's just too much! It keeps sliding back. It's really frustrating.
At least we've got the right tools with us. Just imagine if we had to do it all without shovels.
We don't have any spades or shovels. There's nothing to do but dig with our bare hands.
Mud
This spot it critical, Boss. The sand soaked up the water and it'll be difficult to get rid of it. <<dynamicmessage>>
Get to work!
Yes! We got rid of the mud! I thought we'd never get it done. But it's finally over, luckily.
It's not working, Boss. We're just not making any progress. The wet sand is really making trouble for us.
We'll have to go at it with our shovels.
We don't have any tools with us, Boss. Should we really try it with our bare hands?
Exotic trees

Hey Boss! This doesn't have anything to do with the ship, but there are some strange, exotic trees here, like we've never seen before. And there are big globes hanging up there in the crown. You think they're fruit? How about we take some with us?
Take some.
It really is fruit! Hollow inside, but full of water. Like little water tanks! Maybe we could plant them at home. The folks at home will be amazed at something so exotic, I'll bet!
A leak

All the sand is gone! Now the ship is floating freely again. Nifty! But wait a minute, there's ... Oh, damn it ... That's not good, that looks bad. There's a hole in the ship, you see it? Can it be patched up someway or another? Are we sinking now?
How bad is it?
Lila's right, Boss. There's a big leak in the bow of the ship. Looks like the crash was worse than we thought. I guess the sand prevented it from sinking.
Repair
Now that the sand is all gone, we should hurry up. Otherwise everything will sink. We've got a couple of possibilities, but we have to decide quickly and patch the hole.
What makes sense?
Scrap
Since it's got to go fast, we could use scrap and nails to make a big sealing element to fit the hole. <<dynamicmessage>>
Use scrap.
The thing that we made fits perfectly over the hole and seals it. The ship should definitely be seaworthy.
Without parts and the necessary scrap to seal it we can't do anything about the leak.
We do have the necessary scrap and nails with us, Boss.
We don't have the necessary material. We need scrap for this kind of job.
Welding
Boss, we should make this as stable as possible. The only thing that will help is a big piece of metal that we can place over the hole and weld to the hull of the ship. <<dynamicmessage>>
Then get welding!
We're done with the welding, Boss. A shipyard couldn't have done it any better. This hole won't be a problem any more.
Boss, we don't have the materials. Without them we don't even need to try.
Luckily we brought some sheet metal with us.
We don't have anything for welding with us. We'd need a whole lot of metal.
Too much water
The hole is sealed now, but what are we going to do with all the Water inside the ship? We have to get it out again somehow, right? Can't you do something?
Help her!
Pumping

Here's an old pump. With such a big ship, it's always a possibility that water gets in. If we can get it working, I'll bet we can use it to pump out the water from the whole hull really fast. <<dynamicmessage>>
Start the pumps.

Oh, wow! You've managed to start up the Pump. That's ace! That way we can get the Water out of the ship. And if it rains heavily again sometime and some Water runs into the ship, then we don't have to haul around all those heavy buckets anymore.
Boss, turning on the pumps and getting them running is more difficult than we thought. 'Til now we've only managed a short stutter.
Our technician says if we're careful we can get the pump started. But we have to power them up slowly.
But of course only if we can even get them started. Help from a technician would be very welcome.
Bailing
We've got to get the water out, Boss. And I think that's only going to happen in the old-fashioned way. Everybody grabs a bucket and bails. <<dynamicmessage>>
Bail.

Did we do it? Oh man, we really never ever had that much Water in our ship. It always rained in every now and then, but that was always a lot less. Now it's all out of here again for the time being. Thanks so much for your help!
Te water's not going down, Boss. We're bailing as good as we can, but this is more than a little bathtub, after all.
Luckily we're all young and fit.
Some of us aren't exactly the youngest, Boss. We shouldn't press them too hard.
Re-cap

Looks like we've done all of the important tasks. These children really made a mess of things, Boss. But the navigation system is back up and running and the ship is free. Let's hope that they don't run aground again!
Good work!
I think we can be proud of ourselves today. We've accomplished a lot and got the ship back in shape. We couldn't do much more. That means it's time for us to say goodbye.
Goodbye
Thanks for bailing us out once again! It was a lot of work, and without you this little island would've been the end of the voyage.
Happy to help!
Farewell
Then let's set a course headed south! Luckily the compass works again! Off we go, sailors, southbound for paradise!
Good luck!

I'm glad that we can finally sail on again at last! Now we've really gone through everything at least once with this ship. The next time we see each other there won't be a catastrophe! That's a promise!

Hello, this is Lila here from the ship. We're on our way south now. We're doing fine, but we need your help again. We've begun a new project and we're not making any more progress. Don't you feel like visiting us again?

Hey, it's nice to see you again! And this time we really don't need to be rescued, either! Look, we found a lot of big fishing nets in the ship's belly and already used them to collect a whole bunch of flotsam. There's so much stuff floating in the sea that it will never get boring here, because you can make so many things out of it!
Greeting

Yeah, and you know what was underneath all those nets? A huge Battery! We thought if we hook up the Battery we could have Electricity here on our ship. After all, there's a big wind turbine in the back at the stern! It could provide the necessary energy.
Sounds good!
New technology

Boss, on our previous visits we never saw this technology. That would be a great idea for the ship and the children. Generally they just sail around the area, and then they wouldn't use any valuable fuel for electricity.
That's right!

That's what we thought, too! The only thing is, naturally it doesn't work yet and it's all a bit too complicated for us. We came up with the idea to radio you. After all, you've already helped us out so often! Do you know your way around things like that, too?
Good advice
What would you like to look at first? The Battery down inside the ship or the wind turbine in the back? At any rate you'll have to put your minds to both of them!
We can take a look.
Windmill

Yes, the wind turbine is back here, you see it? The next thing is you ought to take a closer look at it. Something's wrong with it. At any rate, it doesn't spin anymore. It used to be different. When a storm came it always really flew round and round!
That's what it's supposed to be?
Looks kind of willy-nilly, I know. I think those are old airplane parts. The grown-ups put it together way back when. If you get it to spin again it could provide us with Electricity.
Improvements
That's not a bad construction, Boss. If we can get it running again, it could really be a dependable electricity supply.
Let's have a look.
Rotors
Good, Boss. Lila says that the windmill used to turn. Something's probably stuck in the rotors. We'll have to clime the mast to get a better look. <<dynamicmessage>>
Climb up!
Made it! We climbed the mast, now we can finally see what's wrong.
Uh-oh, someone's injured, Boss. We thought climbing the mast would be easier than it was. Everything's really slippery.
Luckily we've got someone with us who's young and limber. Up you go!
Whoo, that's really high. Don't know if our old bones will manage it.
Junction box
Here's a junction box, Boss! Maybe something's wrong with the electronics. If we open the box, maybe we'll find out what's wrong with the system. <<dynamicmessage>>
Open it.
That's done, Boss. The box is open.
How on earth do you get this stupid box open? Couldn't they have put a handle or something on it?
Our refiner will be able to open it, that's part of his job.
If we'd had a refiner it would have been easy.
Axle
Boss, there really is something stuck on the axle for the rotors. I think it's part of the antenna that was damaged in the last storm. It's wedged in pretty tight.
Let's go!
Bent axles
That part's got to come out, Boss. The only solution is good old elbow grease. <<dynamicmessage>>
Good idea!
Hey, that looks awesome! The wind turbine is spinning again! Now it can generate Power for the whole ship.
We can't do anything without tools, Boss.
And just for that, we brought along the perfect tool - the all-purpose crowbar!
And without the right tool we can forget it.
Overload

Looks like all of the capacitors were overloaded, Boss. The windmill steadily produced electricity, but with nowhere for it to flow, it shut itself down at some point so it wouldn't break down completely.
And now?
Capacitors
We'll draw off the excess electricity from the capacitors, slow and steady, and ground the whole circuit. After that the windmill should restart on its own and start to turn. <<dynamicmessage>>
Get to it!

Um, that looks interesting, but whatever you're doing there somehow seems like magic, too. At any rate, as for really understanding it, I don't. Do you think ... if something else breaks down, can we get in touch again?
Shoot! The current's still too high. We already got the first shock, Boss.
We can use the cables we brought with us.
Without the necessary cables it could get dicey!
Battery

This is it, the Battery! At any rate, we also found some old notations that refer to this big device here by name. I also remember that there always used to be a loud hum in here. But there hasn't been a sound in here for some time now.
We'll take a look.
Could you help us with the Battery? Is there some way we can set up a big Power Grid that connects everything on the ship with each other?
Make room
The battery looks like it's in pretty bad shape, Boss. Some parts broke off when the children ran the ship aground. We'll have to see how to patch it all back together.
Could work.
Search for parts
Well, the pieces that broke off can't just have disappeared. We'll have to do a thorough search and hope we find them.
Search for the pieces.
Do you know which parts belong to the machine and which don't? I mean ... can you see that? There's a whole lot of stuff lying around down here.
Energy stores

Lila's right. There's a lot of stuff lying around that doesn't have anything to do with the machine. But we'll find the right parts. And who knows, maybe we'll find something or other that's useful for us.
Of course!
Large plug
There's a large plug on a big cable over here in the corner. Even without knowing much about it, I'd say we should plug it in somewhere, otherwise there won't be any current to the battery.
Plug it in.
Ha, it went click, I heard it, no doubt about it! Is it working already? Are we already collecting Electricity?
Shoot! The cable isn't grounded properly and was still live. Luckily our guy is just in shock.
Voltage transformer
The voltage transformer flew halfway across the room, Boss! Luckily these things are built to last. We can put it back where it belongs. <<dynamicmessage>>
Put it back.

Nifty! The part fits like a glove there. And what exactly does it do? It converts the electrical current from the wind turbine into Electricity that the Battery can store? I thought Power was Power ...
The voltage transformer isn't working, Boss. Maybe it goes somewhere else?
Our technician says it's not a problem.
Without a technician, this is all just patchwork.
Control device
Boss, the control device is damaged. A couple of relays are missing. Let's hope they're around here somewhere. If we find them, we should be able to reinstall them.
Look for them.
Ah, did something just happen there? So does that control whatchamacallit work again now? Awesome!
It's like a needle in a haystack. They're really small, the relays. We haven't had any luck yet, Boss.
Safeguard
If the sea get rough, the battery could slip out of place and get damaged. We should secure it really well so that doesn't happen.
Secure it.
Let's see what we can do, Boss. We should be able to manage it.
Anchor solidly
The battery must have been secured somehow. May we can fix the old fastenings. Or we could just build something ourselves.
Let's see.
Reconstruction
The old construction is a bit damaged, Boss, but we can still use it, more or less. We've just got to reinforce it in a few spots. <<dynamicmessage>>
Try it.
That worked great! A couple of slick moves and the old fastenings are good as new.
It's no use, Boss. We need more plastic to do anything with it.
We should shore up the critical spots with plastic from our stores. It's stable, but at the same time elastic enough to absorb even strong shocks.
Plastic would work best, Boss. The old fastenings can't be repaired without it.
New construction
It would be safest to build something new, since we don't know exactly how the old system functioned. So it's better to use the parts to build something that we know will work. <<dynamicmessage>>
Start.
There! That's a piece of engineering art! They should work that meticulously at home in the settlement!
Pfft ... It's no use just throwing something together without any instructions. We'll have to start over.
Our master builder made a quick sketch.
It'll be a challenge without a master builder.
Activation
I think we're ready, Boss. The broken pieces are back on the battery and it's fastened down.
Great, keep going.
Yeah, that's ace! Thanks a lot already for all the trouble you took. It all looks tip-top to me. I am kind of impatient, so can we get that big thing started now?
Electricity connection
I know, maybe I'm a little bit impetuous here, but it would simply be so fine if it did the trick now!
Not so fast!
Turning it on
Everything's ready, Boss! We can turn the battery on, just waiting for your command. Can we press the button?
Press it.
The battery works, Boss! Looks like there's no more problems with it. That sound it's making - you could say it's humming.
Supply
The battery is secured and the supply is up and running. The circuit seems to be absolutely stable. Looks like this system will run on its own for a while, without any maintenance.
Good job!
I think we can start connecting up customers. We've saw connections on the residential containers and on the water supply, Boss. And we can hook up the bridge, too.
Electricity supply
Aaaah, that's fabulous! Yes, you realized what it was really well. The others in their containers will be happy. Non-stop lighting and clean Water again, at last!
Get going!
Water filters
Here's the electricity connection at the water tank. Lila was just talking about clean water, I'll bet this connection is for a filter system. We should also protect the connection from getting wet.
Start the filter.
Boss, we reconnected the cables, and soldered them too. That way no water can get in. It should hold up for a while.
Irrigation system
The irrigation system in the fields has an electric pump. Up to now the kids watered everything by hand and the system is kind of old, but it should still work.
Hook it up.
The irrigation system is hooked up, Boss. The first test run was successful, too. That worked out great!
Bridge
You want to hook up the bridge, too? And that means you have to get into the power distribution room? But it's locked! Um, are you sure you have to get in there?
The bridge needs electricity.
True, yes, that does make sense! The room is locked up, you know? And the key ... we'd have to go get it first. You see ... that presents a problem. The ... um ... old captain had it.
The key
Yeah, the old captain. We locked him in. We're sorry we didn't already tell you about him before.
The captain?
The captain
You know, he just went bananas ... before you were here the first time ... He started shooting at the others ... And now he's sitting in the back of the ship in a cell!
Excuse me?
Yes. There's an old container back there. The grown-ups converted it into a cell. But none of them are still alive anymore now. So we stuck the captain in there.
The cell
Okay ... Then just follow me. But be careful! He's completely wacko.
Take us there. Immediately!
A cell
Where did he go? He was still in here before! Oh, no! Did he break out?
There's no one here.

Does that mean he's somewhere on the ship? What should we do now? We've got to warn everybody and you've got to watch out for yourselves, too! There was already that time when he just started firing away.
The keys
He has to be here somewhere on the ship. God only knows what he's planning. At any rate, he has the key to the power distribution room!
Let's look for him!
Below deck
He must have gone below deck or else we would've spied him already! Quick! We've got to get down there before he gets his hands on all the Weapons!
What kind of weapons?

Yeesss! There's a room with a whole bunch of old Weapons down below on the ship. Pistols and rifles and stuff like that. And the captain certainly knows that it's all down there! After all, at one point it was his ship.
Haste
Where is this room, Lila? We have to get there before he starts shooting!
Show us the room.
Armory
Yeah This way! Down the stairs back there and then left at the end of the passageway there! That's where the room with all the old Weapons is.
Ok.
You stay here and wait until we come back. It's much too dangerous for you. Tell the others to hide.
The captain
Boss! He really has barricaded himself in. We've got to do something! If he really is crazy, and hasn't eaten for days, he might blow the ship up by accident!
Go in.
Surprise attack
I don't think he's noticed us, Boss. If we storm the room, maybe we can surprise him and knock him out.
Do it.
The gun went off, Boss. The poor guy's gone. The weapons are all pretty old and patched up. His pistol backfired. We can't do any more for him, I'm afraid.
He started shooting, Boss! He hit one of us before his weapon backfired. That killed the dirty dog. What did he expect? The weapons here are pretty old. Not surprising that they misfire!
Nail it down
As long as he's in the room and we're at the door, he won't get out. If we trap him in there, maybe he'll give up. <<dynamicmessage>>
Try it.
The gun went off, Boss. The poor guy's gone. The weapons are all pretty old. His pistol backfired. We can't do any more for him, I'm afraid.
He started shooting, Boss! He hit one of us before his weapon backfired. That killed the dirty dog. What did he expect? The weapons here are pretty old. Not surprising that they misfire!
We've got enough weapons and ammo with us to underpin our standpoint.
Unfortunately we don't have any weapons with us. We'll have to bluff.
It's over.

That guy is completely wacko! Originally there were more people on this ship ... Us and five others, older ones. They knew about how the ship functions, too. At some point there were shots at night ... He shot them ... all of them! For whatever reason ...
Maybe it's better this way.
Totally crazy

We overpowered him ... and locked him in the cell ... We brought him Food and stuff, but all he did was hammer against the door and tell us over and over again that he'll wring our necks. Every night you heard him ... Then our supplies ran out ...
That's awful!

Damn it, what were we supposed to do? We didn't have anything for ourselves, otherwise we would've starved to death ... We had to leave him back there, he would've done away with all of us ... I just ask myself what we ought to do now – what do we do with him, now that he's dead?
Let's go home.
Don't worry, Lila. You don't have to worry about him any more. We'll take him with us and ... make sure he's buried.
We'll take care of it.
Goodbye
Well, that was a wild ride! After all this excitement, I think it's time for us to head home.
I think so too.
I can't tell you how much you've helped us ... Yeah, we've already gotten a lot closer to the south. We'll make it! For sure!
Residential container
There are some lamps in the residential containers. So they were connected to the electricity supply once. We should hook them up again so the kids don't have to sit in the dark at night.
Good idea!
Fantastic! Now the children can turn on the lights whenever they want.
Western expedition

... I repeat: If anyone can hear us, we've gotten stuck en route and have some problems. We've run out of Water! Any kind of help would be welcome here. If you can hear us out there we're going to radio through our coordinates now! Water, we need Water!
Thank god, somebody tracked our radio message! We tried so often we got to the point where we didn't believe that anyone was going to come anymore!
Train
Jess! Come here, there are people here who might be able to help us! Our radio message actually reached someone. By the way, I'm Ella and I drive the train. Pleased to meet you.
How can we help?
Travellers

At last somebody's heard us! I'm Jess. As a botanist I take care of the Plants here! The best thing would be for Ella to show you the rest of the train because I have a lot to do at the moment so that my little Seedlings don't wither away!
What is this?

Yes, let me briefly explain the situation: We remodeled this train and turned it into our rolling home. Survival simply wasn't possible anymore where we come from. Everything was contaminated with Radiation and dried up. Now we're en route to a better future, except that unfortunately we're stuck here because our Water Supply is running out and we can't get any farther like this.
Problems

We were forced to decide whether we hold on to the remaining Water for drinking or use it to run the locomotive boiler. Naturally we rationed the Water to our people, but now the tank's almost empty and then we won't have a drop left! There's nothing except dust and sand around here, it's exasperating! Do you have an idea?
How can we help?
Opening
Boss, we could give these people some of our water if we could only get this tanker open. It's completely rusted ... wait a sec, here's an opening! <<dynamicmessage>>
Open it.
It's open, Boss. With a bit of patience and a deft touch, we got the nozzle open. We used the opportunity and cleaned it, too.
Boss, without some expert knowledge we'll just break it, and the folks here will lose what little water they still have.
The expert says he's seen this before. Apparently it's a filler pipe, specifically for re-filling.
It's probably for re-filling, but no idea how to open it.
Lid

Boss, we're having trouble opeing the water tank. The lid is completely rusted. If we want to fill it with water, we've got to get it open somehow. In other words, we've got to get the lid off. <<dynamicmessage>>
Remove the lid.
The water tank's open, Boss. We got the lid off with some elbow grease and a bit of cleverness.
It's not easy, Boss. We can't get the cover off. The thing's still stuck.
We'll get out the crowbar and use the pliers. We'll get the thing open!
Could take a while, Boss. It'll be difficult without a crowbar.
The water tank

Oh, god! I'd really hoped there'd be at least a little bit left in the tank, but the status quo is truly a gaping void. Damn it! We'll never get the train away from here like this. Please help us! You do have Water with you, don't you?
Look inside.
Filling the tank
<<dynamicmessage>>
Fill the tank.

Thanks a lot for your help! That amount ought to be enough for the time being! Hopefully we'll find a Lake or something like it soon! But with this we'll be able to start up the engine again and certainly make it to the next source of Water.
Boss, staring at the tank won't fill it up. We just don't have anything with us. We should fly back and get something. We can't leave these people in the lurch!
We brought as much water with us as our balloon could carry. That should last you a while.
Shoot, Boss! We must have missed that in Ella's radio message. Unfortunately we didn't bring any water with us. We're really sorry.
A lot to do

It's a lucky thing you responded to our radio signal and helped us. I already thought we were going to die of thirst here ... But we've survived it now! This train is nothing to sneeze at, isn't it? Go take a look around! Maybe you can help out some more here and there.
No problem!
Plant wagon

What luck that we have Water again now! That's called a rescue in direst need, but just look at them, my little beauties. The last few days I had to use my own Water ration to get them through it. Plants are living things, too!
Can we help?

This Greenhouse on wheels is simply fantastic, you know! Whenever I find a Plant that's survived out here I plant it right away. But ever since our Water's been in short supply I've sadly had to let some of the Plants die. Is there any chance you could help me pot the last Seedlings I was still able to rescue and perk them up?
A greenhouse

Really? Great! What would we be without Plants, hm? The heat tormented my little ones here the same as it did to us human beings. Except that they can't be heard when they call for help. To get these little rascals fit again we'll have to take care of the soil. It's all dried out and low on nutrients.
Sure!
Loosen the soil
Boss, the planters are full of old roots and the soil is really hard. I guess we need to get rid of the old plants and prepare the soil. <<dynamicmessage>>
Get going!
That looks very good! The soil is much looser and you've removed the withered specimens. We can work with that!
No no no, not like that! Does a person always have to do it themself to get anything done? I mean, thanks for wanting to help me, but please pay a bit more attention. You're spilling everything!
Our expert can show us how to do it right.
Unfortuntely none of us know anything about plants, but we'll just pretend we know what we're doing.
Fertilizing

Boss, the soil is dry and depleted. There are probably hardly any nutrients left. We could mix in some of our expedition rations. They're specifically put together to have a lot of nutrients and minerals. <<dynamicmessage>>
Try it.
That looks very good! That ought to strengthen the Plants and speed up their Growth. Any Plant is going to feel fit as a fiddle in there.
Boss, we just don't have enough provisions with us that we could use as fertilizer.
Our provisions should be enough for now.
Unfortunately we don't have enough provisions with us.
New seeds

Very good, the boxes are already prepared, for a start. Unfortunately, all of my sunflowers died. They simply didn't survive the lack of Water ... On the other hand, this way we have space for something new! I want to hear your opinion! What do you think I should plant instead?
Now what?
Potatoes
What is we planted potatoes instead? They're nutritious and don't need much water. And there are so many ways to prepare them, and they keep for a long time.
Use potatoes

Oh yeah, that's true. Potatoes really are quite well suited for that purpose. I already planted some too, but from a botanical point of view they're always so boring. Oh well, you're right. Survival takes precedence over professional prestige!
Sugar beets
These are sugar beet seedlings, aren't they Jess? They provide a lot of energy and are pretty low-maintenance. Maybe it would be best to plant sugar beets in your wagon.
Suggest it.
You're absolutely right! So I hit a bullseye with my hunch that you have a green thumb! To be honest ... The others here on the train don't have a clue when it comes to Plants!
Plant wagon
Now, could you also take a look at my irrigation system here? I built it to distribute our Water to the Plants more effectively. Well, what do you think? Can we put it into operation?
That's a shame.
Hoses
Boss, here's a bunch of hoses that lead to the planters. <<dynamicmessage>>
Try it.

Simple Technology, less Water consumption: That's the way it should be! Now that you've freed the hoses from deposits the Water will be properly distributed again! Top-notch! Here, take these sunflower seeds as a thanks for your help. The flowers have dried up anyway, but new Plants can be grown from the Seeds. Maybe they'll grow better where you are. But take good care of them for me, okay?
A whole lot of Water is coming out of here at one spot now and only part of the Plant tubs are being watered. I think we've broken something here, chief!

According to the Specialist, it's a drip irrigation system. That's a nifty term! The holes in the hoses are really tiny so that the Water is only released droplet for droplet! We ought to blow into the openings and free them to remove any deposits.
We're not sure what that's supposed to accomplish here. Apparently the hoses don't have any recognizable openings. How's Water supposed to get out of there? Should we cut the hose open?
Irrigation System

Chief, the connector for the irrigation system is completely bent. There's no way Water can flow down like that. The valve has to go and the connector has to be reset. When all that is straight again the Water should be able to flow again. <<dynamicmessage>>
Then get going.

Fabulous! The Water's running! That's the way it should be! Now I can always water my little ones sufficiently. It's a shame that there's no room now for my sunflowers at the moment. What would you say if you just took them with you and tended them? And if someone asks you where you got the lovely Flowers from, then you can tell the story about me and my darlings.
Man, chief, it's harder than we thought. We've got to take a step back again and think for a second about how we ought to do this.
With our Tools these work steps aren't any problem at all, chief!
At best, all we'd need now are the right Tools. Unfortunately, we don't have them with us.
Materials Car
This is our materials car. We toss everything in here that we collect on the edge of the tracks. Some of the pieces lying in here were probably part of the train once, too.
Interesting!

Time after time we're able to use something from it for repairs. Admittedly, we don't really have any actual use for a lot of it and more or less just take it for a ride. I'm afraid that at some point an inventory would be called for.
Remnants
What do you say about taking a look to see if there's something in it you could use? As thanks, so to speak, in return for you helping us with our problem with the Water.
Then show what you've got!
Sheet Metal
Chief, there's a load of Sheet Metal here. We can put it to good use at our settlement. Our Refiners confirm that in any case the parts are very high quality!
Take it!
What we'll do is, we'll make a pile out of the Sheet Metal, chief! Then we can take the pieces with us later.
Plastic
There's a whole bunch of Plastic buckets and bottles lying here in between all the Scrap. We can take them home with us, easy as pie.
Take them along!
We simply stacked the buckets inside each other. That way we can transport lots of them without wasting too much space in our Balloon.
Cables
Cables, chief! Cables galore! And each plug is different. It's a sure thing this would make the Electronics fanatics at home happy.
Take them!

I really ask myself what people used to need so many different plugs for, chief! Instead of them simply just standardizing all the connections ... Oh well, when you live where everything's in abundance you can probably allow yourself stuff like that. At any rate we'll pack it all up.
Kitchen Galley Car

Here is where we always all get together to prepare our meals. Although it's not as ritzy as it must have been way back when anymore, it does a good job of serving its purpose. Now that we have Water again we can finally cook up something decent, too!
What's up?
Aha, you ask what's on the menu? Good question. We ought to talk about that. At any rate I've put on some broth!
Mealtime
The way I pictured it, this here is going to be a tasty stew. Although, hm, it still tastes kind of bland. What do you think? What else should we add?
What have you got there?
Grilled Meat

Chief, there's a swivel grill standing here and the smell of grilled Meat is delightful. Somebody stocked the grill with gusto. It really would suggest itself to cut a little of it up and add it to the Stew, wouldn't it?  <<dynamicmessage>>
Toss it in!
Good, at any rate that ought to be enough to fill up our troop here. I don't know who put the Meat on the grill for themselves, but now it's in our pot for the good of the community!
Oh, I don't know. Take a closer look at the pieces again! Some of them are completely charred. We can't put them in in that condition or else someone will end up with an upset stomach afterwards!
Our cook will quickly cut away the charred spots. Apparently a few of the steaks had been left on one side for too long.
But that looks great! On the other hand, none of us are gourmets.
Potatoes
The way it looks, this troop here still had lots and lots of Potatoes along, chief! They're basically always good in a soup. Although, a few of them don't look too fresh anymore. <<dynamicmessage>>
Sort out the Potatoes!
I must say, that smells really good already! No two ways about it, Jess's potatoes are simply first-rate! I can hardly wait for the meal to get started.
Are you really sure about that? What if there are still rotten potatoes among them and then everyone here gets sick? Should we really risk it?
Our Farmer will take a quick look at them and sort out the rotten Potatoes.
We can take a look at that. Even though we don't know much about it.
Serve

The stew really turned out to be wonderful. It's a sure thing it will give us strength for our journey. Thank you for helping us with the preparations. Is there any chance that you'd like to hand out the Food to the crew now?
Very good!
Crew
Top-notch, chief! It's a sure thing the whole community here is going to be happy about this feast for the palate! We'll just place the big pot there for them, okay?
Exactly!

Thanks a lot for bringing it by! As a result of the scarce Water Supplies we've had to severely cut back on the Food too so that we don't dehydrate any further. Naturally, now everyone's positively famished.
Jess
We ought to bring Jess a plate of Stew too, chief! Sure thing she's in her plant car.
Go to Jess!
Oh? The Food's ready! Say, that's nice of you to bring something by for me. But watch out that you don't spill anything and scald my sweeties.
Farewell

Good, chief. I think we've done what we could here. The most important thing was surely the Water Supply. With the new supply, Ella, Jess and the others here will hopefully make it and escape the Drought.
Homebound?
There's nothing else to do here now. It's time we packed our things and shipped out again.
We've Got To Get Going!

What a shame, you were hardly here at all. Thanks for your help, truly, thank you so much. It saved us!
I think we'll be setting off on our way again soon, too. I wish you a safe trip home.
We've got to get going!
Goodbye
You're heading off again? Be careful with the Seeds I've given you and take good care of them so that they grow nicely, too! Maybe we'll see each other again. Till then!
It's as good as done!
Chief, we ought to fly on, the train has already started moving.
Hey, listen: I've had a very queasy feeling for several days now. As if someone was watching us ... Any chance you could drop by and check that from the air? It's dangerous out here!
Do you hear me? We're being attacked! Run for cover! Shots are being fired everywhere! They want to steal our train!
Shootout
We're back here! At the Water car! Those pigs aren't risking to shoot at it because they need the Water! Can you manage to get to us?
Where are you!
Zigzag
It's not that far, chief! We'll twist and turn a few times and race as fast as we can to the water car.
Get moving!
Luckily you made it to us! I'm glad that nothing hit you.
Chief, we made it, but one of us got hit by a ricochet. At any rate we've already taken cover!
n/a
n/a
Cover
Chief, the rocks from the cliff are high enough. If we press ourselves against the face we'll have good cover and the attackers can't get away from us!
Hide yourselves.
Luckily you made it to us! I'm glad that nothing hit you.
Damn, it's pretty darn steep here. Some of us slid down and we've gotten grazed by shots!
n/a
n/a
Siege

We'd made a stop here to refill our Water Supplies when they surprised us! They just popped up on the edge of the tracks and opened fire on us! We're pinned down here and can't get through to the front to start up the train.
What's the shooting all about?
Pinned Down
Do you think you can get the train started again if we help you work your way to the front?
What do you think, Ella?
I think so. But that's not our only problem. Jess was hit and a few of our people are still trapped in the other cars!
Do Something

We've got to get away from here as fast as possible! But first we ought to take care of the ones who were wounded, then we can see what comes next! Could you please take a look at Jess, too? I've got my hands full here fighting off the attackers!
Where do we start?
The Wounded
It looks as if two from the group didn't make it behind the Water tank, chief. We absolutely have to get them out of the line of fire so that they can be patched up!
Help them!
It'd be better if we hurried up, chief! Not that the attackers manage to get any closer!
The Wounded
Okay, we've gotten her over here. It doesn't look good. I hope she's still breathing! Now get moving! Fast!
Get going!
Wounded Man
Hello? Do you hear me? Damn. Chief, the guy is unconscious and has a bullet wound on his leg. <<dynamicmessage>>
Patch him up!
Very good, at any rate the wound has been properly bandaged and he's breathing regularly, too. He'll make it like that, for sure!
Gee, the blood's already seeping through the bandage. Is he going to make it? Well, it'll just have to be enough for the time being!
Our medic says we have to make a tourniquet and put him in a stable position on his side!
Without medics, all we can do is guess, hm. In any case we ought to bandage it!
Jess
Chief, it's Jess! Her breathing is very shalllow. Oh, man, this doesn't look good. If we don't tend to her right away she might not make it. <<dynamicmessage>>
Help Jess!
Oh god, Jess! She's still alive! Thank you for saving her. I wouldn't know what to do without her.
It doesn't look good, chief! We're losing her! We've got to think of something! Fast!
Luckily we've got a medic with us. We'll give Jess our undivided attention.
Even without medical Training we've got to do our best to help her!
Moving Forward
All set! Now that the wounded ones have been seen to we can fight our way ahead to the locomotive! Then I can get it started and we can get out of here.
All right, get going!
It'll be best for us to run along the train outside. We can only hope that the locomotive hasn't already been damaged too severely!
Greenhouse
Get going, towards the front, up to the Greenhouse! And keep those heads down!
Let's hurry up!
Run
Chief, the car is made almost completely out of glass and doesn't offer us hardly any protection! We have to race by here as fast as possible if we don't want to be shot full of holes.
Run, get going!
Whew, just made it that time.
We made it through all right, but some of us were injured by the shards of glass flying around.
n/a
n/a
Creep
Luckily not everything's made of glass. The lower part of the car is made of sturdy Metal again! If we crouch down and stay careful we can just creep along here. <<dynamicmessage>>
Duck down!
That's the way, very good! We've made it to the other end of the car!
Hold it, not like that, we'll all get killed that way! We've got to crouch down lower or else they'll still manage to hit us!
And besides, we also have a few Metal plates with us that we can use as supplementary shields!
If we had some pieces of Sheet Metal with us, even if only a few, then we'd be able to additionally protect ourselves.
Kitchen Galley Car
Good, the next thing is we have to get past the kitchen galley car! What? We're under fire here! There, on the corner, watch out!
Then head on carefully!
Shoot Down
The guy's standing in our way, chief! I'm afraid we have to eliminate him with a targeted shot. <<dynamicmessage>>
Shoot him!
That's the end of him. He's not going to shoot at anyone else, chief. Now we can move on.
One single bullet would already do the trick, chief. But we don't even have that!
The weapon is loaded and we're ready to shoot!
The shot wouldn't be a problem for us, but we don't have any Ammunition, chief!
Surprise Attack

A few of us sneak our way in across the front part of the car and surprise him from the side! But we have to duck down well so that we don't become a target for the other attackers. <<dynamicmessage>>
Do it!
Just as planned, we were able to surprise him, chief! He lost his balance and fell off the car. He apparently hit his head on something when he landed. At any rate he's not even twitching anymore.
Aaahh, of all the luck! Our cover's been blown! We just managed to make it, but we're full of glass splinters. Hopefully the attacker didn't get wind of what happened!
Our Hunter knows how to sneak up undetected!
With our Hunter we'd know how we'd be able to advance there undetected!
Food Car
Very good, apparently he hasn't detected us yet, chief! Which door should we use for the surprise attack?
Keep going!
Back Door
We'll try using the back door. We can be certain that we'll surprise him there! But we've got to be quick so that we don't become a target for the other attackers! <<dynamicmessage>>
A good plan!
We gave him a solid knock on the head, and in the process he fell over the railing. The way he's lying there he probably broke his neck.
Dang it, we were too slow! We came under fire and got hit. But luckily we were still able to knock the attacker over the railing. Now we've got to take care of our wounds first.
We're young and fit as a fiddle, we'll make it!
The thing is, do we have the necessary reflexes?
Front Door

He certainly won't reckon with us suddenly popping up directly in front of him, chief! If we force the door open, we might even knock the Rifle out of his hands. It'd be worth a try. On the other hand, the door does stick a bit. <<dynamicmessage>>
Attack!
Just as planned, we were able to surprise him, chief! He lost his balance and fell off the car. He apparently hit his head on something when he landed. At any rate he's not even twitching anymore.
We were able to overpower him, chief, but he was still able to smack one of us in the face with his rifle barrel. The wound's bleeding heavily, but we can keep going.
Luckily we always have a crowbar along for a case like this.
Which means that without Tools it's doubtful whether we'll be able to open it, even with plenty of momentum.
One More Car
Oh my goodness! The door was blasted open here and the car was set on fire! We've got to do something or else the bridge will catch fire, too!
Move forward!
Extinguish
The best option will be to put out the flames. The only way we'll get that done is if we manage to close off this door again! <<dynamicmessage>>
Close the door!
Ha, that's done! The door is closed and with all the smoke the fire will be smothered real quick!
Ouch, we did a good job of scorching our paws, chief! We won't get the door shut this way, it's just too hot!
With our sturdy Tools we'll get the job done!
Without Tools this will turn out to be a feat of extreme brute force!
Put Out The Fire
We've got to put out the fire right away, chief! If the bridge catches fire it's going to collapse and the whole train will crash down! <<dynamicmessage>>
Put out the fire!
The fire's been put out! Luckily the bridge didn't get damaged.
We don't have any Water, chief! We can't put out the fire like this.
Luckily we took Water along with us.
The thing is, we don't have any Water with us.
One More Car
Do you hear that? I think someone here is calling for help! But the cries sound so muted ... It's true, they're coming from the caravan car up front there! Time's a wasting!
Moving on!
Door
We've got to quickly force the door open. It's completely dark inside, we don't really see anything for certain! But judging by the screams we really ought to hurry, chief! <<dynamicmessage>>
Force it open!

We're inside, chief! There's an elderly woman here. She was probably asleep when the train was attacked, and one of the clothes racks fell on top of her. She got wedged in. But by joining forces we were able to free her.
The junk got jammed tight, chief! We can't budge it an inch.
With our universally popular crowbar we'll get it open!
It's hard to find anything to get hold of. We'd need Tools!
Window
Someone's inside there, chief! Major chaos reigns in the whole compartment. We can climb in through this window. <<dynamicmessage>>
Climb in!

We're inside, chief! There's an elderly woman here. She was probably asleep when the train was attacked, and one of the clothes racks fell on top of her. She got wedged in. But by joining forces we were able to free her.
There's too much stuff standing in front of the window on the inside, chief! We can't get through like this.
Luckily we're still in good enough shape for this.
Although, at our age this might become harder than it looks.
Connection
God, damn it! Those bastards uncoupled the train! Could you take care of that for me? Meanwhile I'll see to it that I get the locomotive running again. That way we'll lose less time!
Keep going!
Uncoupled

Yes, chief! It's like Ella said. The cars here aren't linked together anymore. Someone actually must have deliberately uncoupled them! Moreover, what's worse is that the original parts are all missing!
If that doesn't beat all!
This is definitely not in our favor. We can't lose any time and ought to find a solution as fast as possible to get the cars hooked up to each other again!
Reconnect
The way we see it, we have two options here! Either we search for the original part or we replace it with something we make ourselves now in a hurry!
Look for a solution!
Improvise
We can piece together a new improvised connection of our own. If we do it right, it ought to stay put for at least a few kilometers. <<dynamicmessage>>
Get going!
Our patchwork is strong enough! It's holding up! The connection between the cars has been restored! Although, once we're in a safe place it has to be properly repaired again.
Damn it, no, it's not staying put that way. Either we've got another brilliant idea here or we have to find an alternative!
Luckily we have Experts along who'll be able to patch together something durable here.
Unfortunately we're missing the Experts who know how to do this.
Old Coupler

I do believe we've found the old coupler, chief! The way things look, those bastards simply threw it down off the bridge. We can climb down this Ladder and pull the coupler out of the Scrap down there. <<dynamicmessage>>
Climb down!
We've found the coupler, chief! It fits perfectly. The train can get going now.
We haven't been able to find the coupler yet, chief!
Our Scrap Collector says he fished out the coupler down there in no time at all.
Naturally we could really use a Scrap Collector at the moment. That's all they do, the whole day long.
Departure
You've coupled up the train again? Very good! The engine's ready to go again, too! Let the others know that we're starting now. Were not leaving anyone behind!
We'll do it!
Shout Out
Hey , people! The train is ready for action again. See to it that you get in the cars! Come on! Hurry up!
Don't lose any time!
It looks good, chief! Everything here is setting itself in motion, but we ought to head for our Balloon now as fast as possible!
Retreat
We're getting the train moving! See to it that you get your Balloon in the air before they riddle it with holes!
Cast off!
Takeoff
Chief, we've managed to make it back to our Balloon again and are preparing everything for our takeoff! Let's get out of here! Fast!
What are you waiting for?
Thanks, thanks so much! Once again you've helped us out of a tight situation! We'll radio you as soon as we're safe.
Hey, friends! We've moved on and luckily there have been no more incidents. The danger's been averted, but the attack left various damage behind. Could we ask for your help one more time?

Welcome! It's really nice to see you again! That last encounter was ... Well, we're better off forgetting it. It was only thanks to you that we survived the ambush. By the way, Jess and the others are doing better, too!
Welcome

Sadly, our train didn't get off lightly during the attack. Above all the locomotive has us worried because the boiler was damaged. To be better prepared against any more ambushes we've decided to reinforce the whole train. Do you think you could help us out again?
Let's get to work!
The Locomotive
Yeah, the engine is our problem child. A big hole was torn in the boiler and now it doesn't run smoothly anymore. Which of course means that our Water consumption has significantly increased, too.
How can we help?
To be honest, we have no idea how we're supposed to repair the pressure chamber. We've already tried a few things, but our success never lasted too long!
Repair
Like I said, none of the patches stood up for long. We've just managed to make it up to here.
We'll take a look inside!
Sheet Metal
Chief, the situation is actually pretty clear. Here's a large hole that we have to cover with Sheet Metal and weld on. <<dynamicmessage>>
Give it a try!
It'll stand up that way? Really? Yeah, I guess so, it looks sturdier than the things we tried! Fantastic, one less problem!
Not a chance, chief. That's not going to stay together for long without the necessary know-how.
Luckily we have a welding genius along. After all, precision craftsmanship is called for here!
That won't get anywhere without Experts!
Scrap
Chief, we can comb through the Scrap for Spare Parts up there on the car behind the locomotive. <<dynamicmessage>>
We'll do it!
Wow! You've really got the know-how for constructing things like that! It almost looks better than before. With that the boiler should be able to withstand the pressure.
Unfortunately, we didn't find anything suitable, and this way it's not going to hold tight, chief!
It's a sure thing our Refiner will pick out the right parts.
We don't know much about this, but maybe we'll find something that might possibly fit.
Drivetrain

Okay, the engine's back in shape again! We had extremely high fuel consumption because the boiler firebox was damaged. As you see, our Coal tender is completely empty. So we absolutely need new fuel to get moving again.
Done!
Coal
As Ella already said, Coal is the best fuel for the engine, chief. After all, that's precisely what is was designed for way back when. <<dynamicmessage>>
Use Coal!

Great! Good thing you've brought Coal with you. Naturally things function distinctly better with it than with the palm wood we always use instead. Maybe we'll chug into an old train station again sometime soon and find a supply of real Coal again.
No matter how badly we want it – we still don't have any Coal with us!
We additionally brought along Coal precisely for this kind of situation. It's a lucky thing we're always prepared this well.
Sadly, we don't have enough with us.
Wood
All set, chief, we can fill the Coal car just as well with pieces of Wood. Although it won't last as long as Coal, it still ought to be a decent fuel. <<dynamicmessage>>
Let's give it a try!
It's burning! Hard to believe! We'd already tried using freshly cut palm wood, but it was probably just too wet. At any rate, all it did was smoke.
Can't do a thing there without firewood, chief.
We brought along a big supply!
Sadly, we don't have any Wood with us.
Greenhouse
Hey! Oh, how nice that you're here again. Come on over!
How are you?
My bullet wound has taken its toll on me lately, but now I'm back on my feet again. After all, someone has to take care of all the Plants.
Very nice!
I wanted to thank you. Without you  ... Well, without you we wouldn't be here. That attack hit us as if it came from nowhere.
Nice to hear!
Well-being
How are you doing? Are you sure you should go back to work already? Wouldn't it be better if you still took it easy a little while longer?
Exactly!
What am I saying! I'm doing well enough! What's more important is that my darlings are looked after. The others can't even hold a watering can the right way around.
Plants
How are your Plants doing? How well did they survive the attack?
Good question!

How nice of you to ask about them! Yes, my little Plants also took quite a beating, but unlike us human beings they regenerate much faster, too! A few days after the attack and they were back to blossoming and thriving again!
Sunflowers

But that's enough about me! How are the sunflowers doing, the ones I entrusted you with? I hope they bloom where you are in your settlement. As for me, they always filled my heart when they greeted me after getting up in the morning.
That sounds good.
Sunflowers?
Oh, yeah. Hm? What are you talking about, Jess? Aaaah, the sunflower seeds ... To be honest, I do believe we polished them off by accident on the way back.
How unfortunate!

Really? I must say that truly makes me a bit sad now. After all, you were such diligent helpers ... Do I still want to give you my gift at all anymore? All right, I will, I mean, you did save my life, too!
Naturally

Come on, of course we planted them, Jess! And you're right, they really do bloom very prettily! They've even supplied new seeds already and we were already able to more than double the sunflower population at our settlement.
Exactly!

That makes me glad, that really makes me happy! You see, when the Plants are doing fine, then I already feel much better right away, too!  Wait, I've got another small token of appreciation here for you!
New Seeds

It's a Plant ... A special one. I recently found it in an old riverbed! I didn't think it would survive ... But now it even bears long, crooked fruit! However, unfortunately my car is going to be too low for it soon.
What else can it be?
A Plant
We'll tend to the Plant with the utmost care, Jess! We promise you, we will.
For sure!
I'm sure it will survive where you are! You've shown me that all of you have a green thumb. And now I have to tend to my own Plants. Once again, thanks a lot for your help!
Locked Car

This car was hit the hardest. The fire that arose due to the attack pretty much ravaged it and made a lot of things useless. If you hadn't gotten the fire under control, the damage done probably would've been even greater.
Glad to do it!
We were glad to help! If we hadn't done anything, not only the car would've been torched but probably the whole bridge as well. Is there any other way we can help you here somehow?
More Help
No, no, you don't have to worry. There's enough other work. Please leave the boxes where they are. I'll take care of that.
Can we help?
Help Out Anyway
The boxes look pretty heavy, chief! Jess is still hurt and we can't take responsibility for the fact that she's overexerting herself here to that degree.
Then help her!
No, everything's fine. Don't worry, we'll do it. There's really nothing for you to see here.
Take A Look
Something doesn't seem to be right with those boxes, chief! As secretive as Jess has been acting here, there's something going on. We could risk a look in the boxes.
What's inside?
Hey! Don't look in the box! It's none of your business!
What's in the boxes?
Jess, tell them! After all, they risked their lives for us and all this stuff here! They've earned a little more faith in them, if you ask me.
What's the big deal?
Boxes

It's none of their ... Hmph, you're right. What's in the boxes is Medicine ... loads of it! 
The thing is, where we come from, where this train comes from ... there are, let's say, inconsistencies in how medication is allocated. And that, hmm ... we didn't play along with that any longer. Although some of it was burned up in the fire, we were still able to rescue a few boxes.
Did you steal them?

After the previous leader of our settlement died, the new self-appointed ruler named Grey grabbed all the pills for himself and locked them away. When we got sick at some point the bastard didn't give us a pack, not one single pack! We had every right to take them back in our hands.
More Help

Yes, he's been following us for quite some time now! I think Grey will have to give up the chase at some point. But till then ... Well, until then we'll just keep on heading farther and farther away from here.
If you'd like to have anything, just go ahead and take it. It's much too much for us all by ourselves, anyway.
That's why you were attacked!
Pills
There are loads of boxes, full of Medicine. Take some, go right ahead. There's not that much of it anymore after the fire, but it should still be enough for us, and for you! <<dynamicmessage>>
Thanks!
Awesome, chief, it's a sure thing we can put this Medicine to good use at home. There are some Iodine tablets against high-level Radiation in there. But we'll leave some left over for them, too!
I don't think we can use any of that, chief. Except for this Iodine salt here, we don't know what the rest is good for.
You probably know what to do with some of the medications better than we do!
Or isn't there a thing you can do with them?
Hospital Utensils

We not only took Medicine along with us, we took other gear, too. Syringes, rubber gloves, and so on. Is there any chance you could make use of some of it? Of course it has to be properly sorted out, a lot is charred or singed. <<dynamicmessage>>
Let 's have a look!
Chief, there's lots of useful stuff in there! We'll take along a bit of everything.
Unfortunately, we're not able to recognize what's useful among it. All we've taken with us now are a few parts of it.
You've got people along who can do something with it!
Or do you see it as just more trash?
Medical Equipment

These are some kinds of equipment that Grey made off with from an old hospital. But we don't have any continuous Power Supply here and aren't able to put any of it into operation, even if we wanted to! <<dynamicmessage>>
We'll take it with us!
Great, chief! That's a whole lot of Electronics. Sure thing we can process them further back home at the settlement!
Nothing usable among it, chief! Just a little Scrap. Oh well, ... we'll still pack it up.
But it's a sure thing you can put Electronics stuff to good use.
But ... you don't know a thing about Electronics either, do you?
The Next Attack

The last attack took us by surprise, all right. We don't want to be caught off guard again. We thought about possibly doing a thorough job of armor-plating the train. At any rate we still have plenty of Scrap in our materials car.
Sounds good!
Any chance you'd want to help us reinforce the train? It's a sure thing you know your way around things like that distinctly better than we do.
Reinforced Armor Plating

What do you think? What should we use to build the reinforcement? Either out of Scrap, in that case we still have some of our own, or we'll build it out of sturdy Metal. Unfortunately, we don't have any of that in our car. Any chance you've got some with you?
We'll take a look!
Remnants
What's with these old pieces of Sheet Metal here, chief? We can certainly use them for this construction. <<dynamicmessage>>
Take them!
Well, I'm convinced, chief! These parts here are going to make a lot of places on the train significantly more resistant against attacks.
No, chief, none of that is going to stay put. We've got to start from scratch all over again. Otherwise this plating will end up falling off the train onto these bumpy tracks!
If we fill out the rest with a few parts from our own Balloon, that ought to turn into sturdy armor for the train! That's what our Scrap Collector says!
All things considered, that ought to suffice. Sure it would be better if we had some more Scrap of our own with us, but this here is just going to have to be enough.
Metal
Chief, it's a sure thing Metal would be the best choice! <<dynamicmessage>>
Take Metal!
Well, I'm convinced, chief: With this Metal sheeting the train is going to be nearly indestructible.
Chief, but if we don't have any. We can't conjure it up out of thin air!
And we've brought along the right Metal for the job in our Balloon.
Sadly, we don't have any with us. So that means back to remnant recycling, after all, huh?
Attach
That's looking wonderful already! And we've already given some thought to which places are probably the best to protect. Where do we want to start?
Where does it go?
Kitchen Galley Car
Grey's people did a good job of shooting up the canteen. A lot is made of Glass and we thought it would be really good to make a few adjustments.
Sounds reasonable.
Maybe we'll armor-plate it so that next time we'll be able to shoot right back, too? What do you think?
Reinforced Armor Plating
Okay, look over here, that's where the reinforcements have to be mounted. At best, that ought to be done by a pro. Do you have anybody along who has a grip on that?
Good idea!
Arrow Slits
We can try to do it the way Ella suggested and build in arrow slits, too! <<dynamicmessage>>
Do it like that!
That looks fantastic! This way we'll be well protected during the next attack, and at the same time we can defend ourselves from this car.
Chief, none of us has the know-how and this here is not so easy, after all, not with this special design.
Our Technician says the odds are very good that he can put it into practice.
But unfortunately we don't have a Specialist with us.
An Alternative

Chief, although Ella's suggestion is rock-solid, we think that the armor plating at this spot could be even more effective here. And what's more, the plating's easier to attach here and can be repaired again faster.
Then do it that way!
That looks fantastic! This way we'll be well protected during the next attack, and at the same time we can defend ourselves from this car.
Hm ... This seems to be harder than we thought, after all. Maybe we'll start again from scratch.
n/a
n/a
Caravan Car
That's one of the caravan cars, chief. The people sleep there. By all means that ought to be well protected.
Then get started!
If the situation gets tight the next time they'll be able to hole up in this car. We've got two spots here where an armor plating would suggest itself. Which of them should we take, chief?
Reinforced Armor Plating
That's a good idea! It'd be best if you took the armor plating and attached it properly to the car. That way the whole thing will be much more resistant, I'm sure of it!
Show me!
Doors

We ought to armor-plate the doors the most, chief! Here's where the people are most probably going to hide in the event of an attack. It would be disastrous if someone can just force their way in here.
Reinforce the doors!
Well, isn't that something?! No one's going to take us by surprise in here! Thanks for your help! Now we can get a little better night's sleep.
Damn, this plating is heavy! It's turned out to be more effort than we expected. So let's start all over again, okay?
n/a
n/a
Windows
The last time the attackers shot out nearly all the windows. They absolutely have to be secured in order to shield the people inside.
Secure the windows!
Well, isn't that something?! No one's going to take us by surprise in here! Thanks for your help! Now we can get a little better night's sleep.
Weak Points
This car here has several weak points, chief! It looks as if the plates we produced for the armor plating were a bit too large for this car. We ought to cut them a bit more to size.
Really?
Yes, unfortunately that's going to be necessary. But hopefully these modifications won't have to be too major, will they?
Reinforced Armor Plating
Good, this plating has to fit really tight. Could you take over doing the adjustments?
It'll fit all right!
Cut To Size
We're cutting all the plating properly to size, chief! But it's going to take its toll on energy to do it. <<dynamicmessage>>
Go right ahead!
Sits tight and fits right with room to spare, chief! This part suits the train to a T.
Chief, we don't stand a chance here without Tools! We can't summon up the necessary power to do it.
Luckily we have the right kinds of Tools with us.
Without the right kinds of Tools I'm afraid this adventure won't last long.
Adjust
I think that one way or another we have to adjust the plating again anyway, chief. We'll take some Scrap from the materials car again and try it out with that. <<dynamicmessage>>
Adjust them!
Sits tight and fits right with room to spare, chief! This part suits the train to a T. You do see that it was improvised, but who's going to be bothered by that?
No, improvising won't achieve a thing here, chief. The plating will end up landing on our heads. We've got to do it again.
We'll mix in some from our own supply, too. Then it'll hold tight for sure.
It would be even easier if we had some more of our own along. But when it comes to Scrap, we brought absolutely nothing with us.
Farewell

The train is completely reinforced, chief! Our work here is nothing to sneeze at! Not by a long shot! And as a result, I think that Jess, Ella and their crew are well protected against further attacks. We can't do more than that, really.
Let's fly home!
So the time has come for us to say farewell to our hosts.
Do that!

Really? You want to go already? Oh, that's a shame. All I can do is emphasize once again how much you've helped us and how grateful we are to you for that! Without you we would've either died of thirst, been shot to death, or left stuck here. At any rate, in our eyes you're big heroes!
Time to head home!
Homeward Bound

The train is even better protected than we had hoped for. You really worked with a vengeance! I hope we'll see each other again very soon! Take care of my darlings, goodbye, and have a safe trip home!
Glad to do it!
No matter where we end up we'll tell folks about you! Take care and have lots more success on your journeys!
Distant Places
An introduction to the new content from "Distant Places". Get acquainted with the new Balloon Station and its functions, and find out how you can send your Settlers on far-off Expeditions.
Welcome back. I hope it's okay that I'm filling in for Arthur today. I'll do my best, I promise!

This time it's about remote Expeditions that will lead you to distant places. To make them possible, first you have to do research on a Balloon Station. Your Settlers have to know what they're supposed to build before setting off on a treasure hunt!
Very good! I've already brought along the plans for the Balloon Station for you so that we can get started right away.
Distant Places

To begin with, it would be best for you to construct the Balloon Station. To equip your new Expeditions you should also assign additional Scouts. Scouts can work at both a Balloon Station and an Expedition Station.
We're all set! The Balloon Station has been put up and your Scouts are ready to equip a new Expedition.
Distant Places

Now the time has finally come to send off an Expedition. You can do this directly at your new Balloon Station. You already ought to be familiar with the process due to your Expedition Station. Prepare the Expedition and send it off!

Just like you're already accustomed to from your Expedition Station, now your Scouts are going to equip your Researchers. Once all the Equipment has been brought and all the participants have assembled, the Expedition will set off on its way.
Distant Places
When the Expedition has arrived at its targeted destination they're going to report in to you. When that has happened you can get in touch with them in order to instruct them.
The Expedition has been completed and will now return to the Balloon Station together with its Balloon.
Distant Places
During your future Expeditions you should always keep your eyes open. You might find new Seeds on them, all kinds of Resources, and possibly one or another type of Technology, too.

With that, once again I'd like to say goodbye to you. Even though we didn't encounter anyone this time, I'm certain that you'll get to know interesting people and experience thrilling stories on your Expeditions to distant places.
Distant Places
I wish you lots of success on your future adventures.

Normally you'd be able to start an Expedition from here heading in this direction on the compass. But in this Tutorial I only want to travel to one place with you. I've discovered a strange house some distance away. You can begin the Expedition to this house starting from any direction on the compass.
Your Expedition has arrived. It looks as if this house is still being lived in. Maybe your Settlers should take a look around in the vicinity of their landing point.
Large Gate
Someone made a pretty big effort here to safeguard their house. This gate here prevents us from being able to advance any further ...
Take a look around!
Doorbell
The gate appears to be locked. But there is a kind of doorbell. Maybe someone's home! Should we ring it?
Give it a ring!
Hm ... Nobody answers! It seems like no one's there. We'd better not break in, chief. We don't want to aggravate anyone else.
Boxes And Barrels

There are a few boxes and barrels lying around. Looks like the owners didn't want to have what was in them anymore ... I think your Researchers don't have to worry about taking a look at what they find there.
What else is there?
Boxes
There seems to be all kinds of Scrap in these boxes. Maybe we'll find something usable.
Open them!
It's only Scrap, but it's a sure thing we can process it further at home, chief! We'll take it with us.
Apparently there's nothing to get here, chief!
n/a
n/a
Barrels
The barrels are full of old Plastic and Electronics parts. Sure thing that one or another of the parts can still be used!
Look inside!
Our educated guess was right on the money. We'll take the usable parts with us.
Apparently there's nothing to get here, chief!
n/a
n/a
Open the Expedition window via your Balloon Station
Put together an Expedition to a distant place.
Lead an Expedition to a distant place.
Distant Places
Distant Places
Trophies

Once a Balloon Station has been built, some of the Settlers can visit distant places in the course of an Expedition. Which Settlers take part on an Expedition must be specified in advance. Specific advantages and the provisioning with sufficient Rations ought to be taken into account during the preparations.
