Global Expeditions proceed in a way similar to <link="14"><style="DefaultLink">conventional Expeditions</style></link>. Unlike <link="14"><style="DefaultLink">conventional Expeditions</style></link>, however, a Scout does not have to be sent out first.

The Balloon Station <link="3"><style="DefaultLink">employs</style></link> Scouts. They are in charge of equipping global Expeditions. Global Expeditions are planned and sent out at the Balloon Station.
Trophies are collected on global Expeditions. A Trophy can be placed in order to gain an advantage for the entire settlement. This advantage depends on the respective type of Trophy.
Settlers consume 25% less Food
Storage Capacity of Batteries is doubled. Wind Turbines and Solar Power Plants produce 50% more Electricity.
Durability of Buildings is increased by 50%.
Traders offer more favorable terms during Barter Trade Deals. Storage Capacity of all Warehouses is doubled.

This Trophy reminds us of our adventure with Lem the Tinkerer. We built an astounding noodle machine together with him. We learned a great deal about preparing Food and perfected our kitchen utensils.

This Trophy reminds us of our adventure with Lila and her crew. We helped the kids whip their ship back into shape and optimized their Wind Turbine. We learned to act more prudently with our own Electricity and optimized how the Power is distributed.

This Trophy reminds us of our adventure with Ella, Jess and their armor-plated train. We helped them defend themselves against an attack and reinforced their train. What we took with us was the Knowledge how we can improve our own defenses.

This Trophy reminds us of our adventure with Ole, Rusty Rolph and T. Bara, and of the bar in the midst of ice. We helped to thaw out the old tower and make it usable again. Word of our readiness to help has gotten around among the Traders and they offer us particularly favorable terms. They also revealed a few tricks to us about how we can make better use of our Storerooms.
Yes? ... Ma, is that you? Ohh! Excuse me, I'm all yours now. How nice that you're getting in touch! I have a few materials I could use for my next project!
Hello!? Oh ... It's you. How are you doing? Everything's fantastic on our side. We fished tons of stuff out of the ocean.

Well, isn't that something! Nice to hear from you again! Everything's running like clockwork with us! We can gather up most of what we need or make it ourselves. Although, there may well be one thing or another that gets a bit scarce every now and then.
Take pleasure in the fact that you've reached Ole Sørensen! Your culinary journey will come to an extremely gratifying end! We offer the finest delicacies and delectables.
No ... Yes! Yes, it might work like that … hm … Hah, it's you! Just what the doctor ordered ... I'm going to need a few parts from you again!
Hello? It's Lila here! Aaah, hello! Good thing you're getting in touch! We found a whole bunch of new stuff on our voyage.
The connection seems to be stable! Please excuse me if it gets a bit loud sometimes! The old locomotive's running full blast at the moment! By the way, I have something that might interest you!
Ole Sørensen on the other end of the line! We offer everything your palate could ever dream of! And from time to time we even delight you with a special offer!
Ah! Yes, yes, yes! That's wonderful! My wavelength amplifier seems to work! Since I just happen to have you here at the moment ... I have a small proposal. I'm going to need a few parts ...
Oh, it's you again. Nifty, we can understand you just fine on our side! Is there any chance you want a few of the things we fished out of the ocean?
Oh, no way! Nice to hear from you! We were just talking about how we could use a buyer for our last catch …
Ole Sørensen is pleased to hear from his good friends! Let's see what special offers we have for you today!
I'm sure I also have several things that are going to interest you!
There's a lot of it we can't make any use of. But I thought maybe you can put it to good use, okay?
What would you say if we compare our Inventories a bit and see if we want to trade anything?
For our friends, naturally at the best possible terms!
Thanks for your help! I think I can keep making progress this way! Or can't I? No … I can! Yes, yes, that works! Do get in touch again!
Wow! It's awesome that we can mutually help each other so well. We're going to keep on trawling the sea. Maybe we can trade again sometime!
You see, that worked out just fine, after all! In any case, we ought to keep up this partnership!
And once again Ole Sørensen has successfully closed a deal! And, as always, everyone involved is extremely satisfied.
What? You're not interested? Well, all right, then maybe next time? Should I ...? No? You'll get in touch with me ... Okay?
Oh ... That's a shame ... I thought you might have been able to use something from it. But then we'll just toss it overboard again. Maybe there'll be something along in the next catch!
No interest? Oh well, apparently that's how it is sometimes. If you change your minds, just get in touch again, okay? For the time being we're moving on!
It's a crying shame that this time there are no takers for Ole Sørensen's goods. But it goes without saying that Ole Sørensen is staying in business and always available, anytime at all!
I've got a ton of old electrical parts lying around here that I'm not using for any project at the moment. You're welcome to rummage through it there and see if you like anything.

We've fished quite a bit of Plastic out of the ocean. You've always collected stuff like that, right? Is there any chance we can trade it for Water and Food? In the long run, just Fish all the time gets kind of boring ...
We found a few more boxes of Iodine tablets! We can't really do anything with them. Any chance you'd want to have some of them? We're more than willing to trade!

As today's special offer we have ... the finest of Mushrooms. Cultivated and mined on-site with our own hands, scrumptious delicacies like these won't be found anywhere else in this world! And the most delectable part ... is the unbeatable price!

A great deal of Metal was left over in the course of my last project. Meanwhile it's all just lying around here. I could make much better use of cooking ingredients. You've always got so many of them, don't you? Let's trade!

We caught a big catch of Fish and dragged some kind of stuff out of the Water while we were at it ... probably something electrical. We don't know what we should do with it. On the other hand, what we could use would be Cloth for new Clothes.

Wie still have some of the Medicine left here. You could have some more of it. And, well ... the thing is, the train's already gotten sort of scraped and scratched up, too. A few high-quality Tools would be a real help.

As today's special offer we have... freshly thawed Water! Water from a better era when the world was still clean! It's a sure thing that no one can offer you a better drop than what you'll get from Ole Sørensen!
I've designed a new machine that's able to strengthen and enhance simple Tools! If you give me your junk-quality Tools I'll switch on my machine, just for you!

We came across a pretty old wreck. There were big boxes of Protective Suits on it, but all that stuff doesn't really fit us. And what we'd need soon is new fuel. Feel like trading before we burn the suits?
We came across an old train station and were able to salvage loads of Spare Parts, Scrap and Metal. It's far more than we can take with us. If you send us a little fuel we'll let you have some of it.
As today's special offer we have ... fresh Cake. It goes without saying that it's homemade and kept perfectly chilled. You could be among the first to treat yourselves to such a piece of pure luxury!

At the moment I'm in the process of completing a wonderful new invention. It will swallow all kinds of Scrap, heat it, and then press it together. That way I can press all the Scrap into Metal. But it's not really fully operational yet. I still need lots and lots of testing material. Can't you bring some by? And in return you'll promptly take all the Metal I have here with you. I won't need it anymore in the future.

Although, there is one thing. It hasn't rained anymore for several days now and I'm slowly getting a little nervous. What if it stays that way for quite a while? Just to be on the safe side, couldn't you send us some Water? It's a sure thing we'll manage the way it is, but better safe than sorry! We could offer you our last catch as a trade. There are lots of complicated parts in it that we don't really understand. But it's a sure thing that at the settlement you'll know what can be done with it.

We recently had to change back to palm wood again because our Coal is running out. We've gathered up all sorts of Scrap here that we'll have to discard soon to keep our weight down. If you send us Coal, then we'll gladly exchange it for our Scrap. A win-win for both sides. What do you think?

Good thing we've reached you. The thing is, an extremely unpleasant occurrence awaits Ole Sørensen's bar if it doesn't get help soon. It's getting colder and colder, and the ice is beginning to reclaim the tower all for itself. We'd turn up the boiler, but our Coal supplies are running very low. What would you say to sending us a little Coal? In return we'll give you all the melted ice. After all, it's a sure thing you can put fresh, clean Water to good use.

At the moment things are pretty chaotic here. One of my machines … it always runs hot. Which basically isn't a problem at all, either. But I had to install Plastic parts back then and they're starting to melt now. I really ought to replace them with Metal parts. By any chance, don't you have some left over? In return I'll promptly give you the old Plastic parts to take with you. It's a sure thing you can install them well somewhere ... or whatever else you'd do with things like that.

We eat nothing but Fish all the time and we're sick and tired of it. Can't you send us something else to eat? We want some variety for a change. Any chance we can give you Fish to take along in return? It's really good, it's just that lately we simply had too much of it.

On our journey we came across a plain where lots of Wild Animals live. We plan to increase our supplies of Meat a bit. Can't you give us some Wood? Then we can smoke the Meat and cure it. We'd use Coal, but we need it to run the locomotive. If you don't eat any Meat, then we'll only hunt for as much as we need for ourselves.

Listen! Ole Sørensen is currently playing the host to one of his good colleagues. My trusted friend is a Specialist for the best functional garments. His supplier is having logistics difficulties and now my good friend has a lack of Raw Materials. I thought that maybe you could help him. If you could stock him, he's assured me that in return he'll offer you his best merchandise.

I have a plan! A previously unseen new Technology. Haha! When it's ready it's going to change the world. But I'm not going to reveal to you what it is yet. Sketches have to be drawn and a prototype created first. By any chance, don't you have some old electrical Scrap? The thing is, I need it for my plan. If it's successful, you'll receive the sketches for the Technology from me in return, okay?

We're running out of Coal. We have to fill up the bunker again. Do you have some left over for us? We're sailing across the sea in the south and busily collecting everything that gets caught in our nets. Any chance you'd want to have some of it? It really is a lot.

We're already running out of Water again. This time we want to take care of that before it's a problem. The supplies have to be replenished and our consumption reduced. Could you bring by some Water for us? In return we'd entrust you with some of our Livestock that we take along with us. I'm afraid that at the moment they're simply using up too much Water.

At the moment, however, Ole Sørensen's Storerooms are unfortunately a little emptied out. I'm afraid that news of our bar hasn't spread too far yet. We have lots of time and little to do. What would you say to this: If you send fresh Food Items to Ole Sørensen, then we can put them up as preserves and process them further. The oven's on, anyway. Maybe we'll even make jam again! And then we'll send the processed Food back to you.

You're lucky you still caught me. I was just about to set off on a new Expedition. But it's a good thing I've got you here! I've discovered a new promising source for all sorts of good junk. The stupid thing is, the whole area is very highly contaminated with Radiation. Could you help me improve my protective measures? Then I could see what kinds of wonderful parts can be found there. In exchange I can already give you something from my collection of electrical parts. They're worth something!

Just about the only thing we've been fishing out of the ocean for quite some time now is driftwood. Do you want to have some? Any chance you could pick it up? And is there any chance you could bring along a few Spare Parts for the Battery and the Wind Turbine? I think they're in need of maintenance again. We could really use your help.

Everything I find on my travels is blossoming and thriving in my railroad car. Although, I'm afraid that slowly but surely I have specimens of all the species that exist in this area here. Any chance that you have something else I can plant? If anything new and exciting is among them, then we can see if I might have something for you as well.

Ole Sørensen has just received a fresh and very special delivery. It deals with a number of old manuals, guides and other types of ancient Knowledge. We would be extremely pleased if this Knowledge were able to find a new home at our good friends' settlement. Is there any chance that you could send Ole Sørensen a few Spare Parts for the Power Generator you installed? It keeps breaking down every now and then, and Rusty had to repair it for us once. But as for the Spare Parts, Ole Sørensen has to organize them himself.

So? How's the equipment working that I gave you to take along? Personally, I'd like to experiment a bit with new dishes and machines. Maybe what this world needs is an automatic pancake flipper. Or better yet, a fully automated version right from the start? Hm ... Questions upon questions, as you see. I already have the ideas, but what's lacking is not always having all the ingredients right there. Couldn't you bring by a package for me? Then I'll equally share what I've learned with you.

We're sailing farther and farther to the south. We're eating and drinking well, and everyone's healthy. Some of the younger ones are quickly growing out of their clothes. Any chance you could send us new Cloth so that we can make our own clothes? The Cloth we fish out of the ocean is sadly not usable anymore. When you come you can take something else we collected with you right away. It's some kind of strange old piece of equipment. We don't know what purpose it serves. But if you take it apart it's a sure thing you'll be able to learn some more.

Although Jess's Fruit really is delicious, my crew has slowly had enough of it. What we need is a change of pace. Any chance that you've got some Vegetables for us? Then we could design our Stew a bit fancier again. I've got it! In return you can have something from our Medicine supply. We still have plenty left, and we don't use up that much of it ourselves.

Our Greenhouse has wonderful Crops. The heating power of the oven performs the miracle that we're able to harvest fresh Fruit and Vegetables in this icy environment! However, Ole Sørensen's Greenhouse does have one problem. The large temperature fluctuations let the cables and hoses get porous. If you could send us a little replacement material, then Ole Sørensen will gladly hand over some of his Crop yields to you. And who knows …? Maybe even one or another delicacy is among them that you've never heard of before.
We were able to make out a small island off the coast. It seems to be inhabited and a lot of strange equipment is standing around.

We were able to make out a small island off the coast and encountered Lem there. He's a kind of inventor and had a whole range of peculiar machinery at his place. After we helped him to get some of those machines operating again, he asked us if we could help him with procuring several special types of Equipment in order to forge ahead with his latest secret project, and gave us the coordinates for an abandoned settlement.
Lem had the coordinates for the settlement sent to us. Now it's time to help him with procuring the things he needs.

Guided by Lem, we explored the abandoned settlement and were able to salvage the objects he needed. It emerged that the place apparently dealt with Lem's old home town. He was in radio contact with us and was able to navigate us through the Ruins from memory.
We've collected all the parts for the machine. Now all we have to do is to assemble them and get them running.
With the parts from his old home town we were able to get Lem's machine done and going. It deals with a Noodle Master 3000 that Lem wants to use to reenact his mother's recipe for noodles.
Ole Sørensen radioed us and wants us to help him with a "project".

Ole Sørensen made radio contact with us so that we would help him with a "project". It deals with an old, completely snowed-in tower that Ole wanted to get back in shape so that he can open up a bar in it. Once we had tidied things up a bit we found an oven that we were able to get going again. As we were about to set off Ole asked us if we couldn't bring a little fuel with us next time.
Ole has apparently already set himself up right at home in his new bar. The last time we were there he had asked us to bring along more fuel. It might even be that the first customers have arrived.

The oven had already done a hefty share of work when we paid Ole another visit. A whole section of the ice that encased the tower had thawed to reveal new compartments and rooms. Once we had repaired and cleaned the heating pipes that surround the tower, now the oven was able to unfold its power to the fullest. Ole had even had his first customers already. Although, old T. Bara was the only one who could put up with all the fumes and smoke.
Meanwhile it could be that more parts of the tower have thawed out and are free from ice. It's a sure thing that we'll be able to find interesting things again in the course of another visit.

On our third visit to Ole's bar the tower displayed itself in all its glory. It was already completely thawed out, a good share of the surrounding area had been freed from ice as well, and quite a number of old treasures were revealed as a result. It's a sure thing that Rusty Rolph was particularly pleased by this. He was also currently paying a visit when we arrived and we were able to help him salvage an old saxophone. It seems as if he might have a soft spot for old musical instruments ...
We picked up a radio message from Ella Sawchyn and arranged a rendezvous. What this was precisely going to be all about she kept to herself and didn't tell us.

We picked up a radio message from Ella Sawchyn and arranged a rendezvous. She and her crew are riding on old tracks in a train that they've gotten back into shape. Their Water Supplies were running out and we were able to be of assistance in repairing one thing or another.
Once we had helped Ella and Jess they traveled on with their train. However, for some reason Jess had had misgivings about their safety. Maybe we ought to take a look and see what's going on.

Luckily we got there just in time. As we approached the agreed place to meet we could already hear the first shots. The train was being attacked by a group of Raiders. The Raiders had been able to uncouple the rear section of the train and pin down the crew. Jess was hit but we were able to help her. We worked our way forward through the train and ultimately managed to reconnect the train so that the crew could make their escape.
The train and crew survived the attack. Now that they're safe we're supposed to meet again. It's a sure thing they could really use some more help.

Once the train was out of harm's way the crew was able to catch their breath for a moment. Nevertheless, major damage had been done to the train and we had to give a hand again. In addition to the repair work we forged armor plating to protect the train better against future attacks. Ella and Jess told us that the reason why they were attacked probably must have been part of their cargo. They had loaded a large quantity of medical Equipment that the Raiders would've only too gladly gotten their hands on.
We picked up a radio message in which someone's requesting support. Apparently they're located on a ship and they've run out of supplies.

We've come across a ship that's drifting around aimlessly on the high seas. The ship's propulsion unit had broken down and, as it turned out, the crew consisted of a group of adolescents who were pretty poorly supplied. We helped them get the engines running again and gave them Food and Water so that they could sail on.
Lila and her crew apparently have another problem with their ship. It's a sure thing we can help!

A desperate radio message from Lila reached us. Her navigation broke down and the ship ran aground on a sandbank. We came to their aid and were able to dig the ship free and make it seaworthy again. We were also able to get the navigation functioning again.
The ship is sailing again, we've repaired the navigation, and there's enough to eat and drink. This time Lila radioed us so that we can give them a hand with a a new project.

Lila radioed us one more time. This time they didn't have any problems, but they did want to ask for our support on a project. They planned to improve the ship's Power Supply and use a damaged machine located in the ship's hull for that purpose. Once we had put the installation into operation we were forced to realize that our work had been sabotaged. The old captain had apparently gone berserk and the adolescents managed to put him in confinement. He was nonetheless able to escape. Once we were able to alleviate the situation we decided to take him along with us and send Lila on her way.
... Thanks for helping me! The Noodle Master 3000 works precisely as planned. Your assistance was truly welcome!

Remember the guide full of useful equipment! A little efficiency when processing Food certainly won't harm you. You'll save a respectable amount of Food and Water as a result. Practical, isn't it? Then take care, you'll be hearing from me!
You really were a big help to us! I don't know if we would have done it without you.

The idea occurred to us to pass along the blueprints for the Power system to you on your way. We already have one now and I don't think we're going to build another one at some point ... And if we do, then ... then we'll just ask you for help again, right?
Thanks again for rescuing us! Without you we'd be in one heck of a fix right now!
The reinforcements on our train might be useful for your Buildings too, wouldn't they? We'll send over the construction manuals to you! It's the least we can do!

With your help Ole Sørensen is now able to offer a wonderful new outpost for transactions. Naturally people can also drop by whenever they want to simply leave their cares behind them. Though no one should ever say we don't properly reward our business partners! We've spoken with all the other Traders and told them what you've done for us. Ole Sørensen is convinced that they are going to offer you the best possible terms in the future.

What's more, we have also provided you with our Guide to Optimizing Storage Space! When you use Ole Sørensen's secrets, they'll let you make better use of your storage area in no time at all! And all that without major alterations!

Listen, I've developed an extraordinary method. I was able to enhance the Metal that's frequently left over with my machines quite substantially in my modified oven. I've never experienced that before, that my idea works so well. If you bring me your Metal and some Fuel, then I'll make you your very own portion of miracle Metal.

On our voyage we discovered an old port on an island. Don't worry, this time we didn't get stuck! However, we did collect a whole lot of valuable and useful stuff. One thing we're not able to use are large gray Stones for building Houses. Ben thought your settlement can sure put this Concrete to good use. Do you want to pick it up? And while you're at it, then maybe you'll bring along a few things that we can use here for us, okay?

We've found something: a fenced-in area in the midst of wasteland. There was an awful lot of unused material. Apparently we were the first to examine it. Among other things there was lots and lots of Glass there, too. Although Jess used it to repair her car, naturally we're not able to use all of it. It was a really big quantity. Any chance you're interested? Let's say ... in exchange for some Spare Parts?!

Now, Ole Sørensen did promise you that he'll give you preference with his special offers. One of our partners got his hands on a large cargo of fresh cake and is searching high and low for hungry buyers! Lo and behold, Ole Sørensen's good friends promptly crossed his mind! Are you interested? Ole Sørensen has secured you the exclusive right of first refusal! ... mhm, if you could maybe bring something along in return?! For instance, I need some fresh Food Items ...

The old mixer, remember? No? Doesn't matter! Hard to believe, it works now, it does! I cooked Ma's Stew. It didn't turn out so well, not like Ma's ... but it fills you up, yes sir! Go ahead, help yourself ... and is there any chance you could help me out with a few things? I've got a list here ...

And could you maybe help us out? Our nets are getting more and more holes in them and we don't have a repair kit. We also have something we can trade! We're making sure that we always feed ourselves well now and stuff like that ... we've started to make Soap too so that we get all the Salt off our skin. We can gladly trade some of the Soap.

Now Jess has started to cultivate other Plants besides all of her Vegetables and Fruit. One of them is going down particularly well with my crew. They smoke it sometimes to relax ... and are especially glad to when they've done all their work. There's quite a lot of it and I'd be happy if we could get rid of some. Let's say, in exchange for some Equipment?

Are you also tired sometimes but still have to work all night? Well, Ole Sørensen has a miracle cure for you! Coffee, freshly roasted! Just one sip and you're already wide awake and raring to go. Just drop by and we'll drink a little cupful. Oh yeah, and if you're coming anyway then please bring along a few materials for the bar. Otherwise, soon it's going to be hard to carry the Coffee out into the world out there.

I fished out Ma's recipe for Beer and took an oil Barrel as brewing kettle. I see you're interested! Yes, you clearly are! It truly is a special beverage – it tastes ... peculiar, but it'll all work out. Yes, it surely will. I'm still working on the recipe ... would you help me improve the kettle? I already have an idea  ...

That Turbine really is a beauty, chief! It's a sure thing there's still something to be learned from it for our settlement. Since we've already done a fair job of tinkering with it, we know our way around the mechanisms pretty well. We'll just make a few quick sketches.

Chief, it's a sure thing this Battery would make an excellent energy storage device. We'll prepare a few technical drawings and take them with us to our settlement. Maybe a replica of something like this can be built at home.
We've conjured up something really tasty here, chief! It might also go down really well with the folks at our settlement. We'll make a quick note of all the ingredients.
Jumpin' jehoshaphat, that really packed a wallop! We'll have to keep Rusty's blend of explosives in mind for our settlement! It might help us dig deeper tunnels for our Mines.
Roger that!
OK!
Got it!
Echoes from the Past

Our scouts have made a remarkable discovery: a fragmentary blueprint found in a dilapidated Endzone! It seems to be for a vehicle known as the Pathfinder. It could serve as a symbol of progress and a source of inspiration for our community. We might have to disassemble our own bus to put it together, though, and spend some time rebuilding our town center. What do you say, chief?

Our explorers have made a remarkable discovery while sifting through the supplies they scavenged from the last Endzone: part of a blueprint for a vehicle known as the Pathfinder. It could serve as a symbol of progress and a source of inspiration for our community. We might have to disassemble our own bus to put it together, though, and spend some time rebuilding our town center. What do you say, chief?
Understood, chief. Restoring the Pathfinder might not align with our current priorities. Let’s focus our efforts on other pressing matters and ensure the well-being of our settlement.
Certainly, chief! We’ll get the resources we need together and pass on the blueprint for the Pathfinder’s restoration.
Despite our efforts, we couldn’t gather the resources and expertise needed to reconstruct the Pathfinder from the blueprint fragments our scouts discovered. What a missed opportunity!

Great news, chief! We’ve gathered the resources and expertise required to reconstruct the Pathfinder from the other Endzone’s blueprint fragments. Together, we’ll unlock the secrets of this legendary vehicle.
Mechanical Mastery

Now that we have the necessary parts for the Pathfinder, it’s time to call upon our most skilled researchers to help with the restoration. We need their expertise to ensure the vehicle ends up functional and reliable.
Despite our efforts, we were unable to secure the assistance of skilled researchers to restore the Pathfinder. Looks like our plea didn’t resonate with them.

Congratulations, chief! Our skilled researchers agreed to contribute their expertise and build a replica of the Pathfinder. Let’s hope that their mechanical mastery helps us reach our goal. Together, we’ll bring this dusty old blueprint to life!
Rust in Peace

Chief, it’s time to put our plans into action and put our researchers’ calculations to the test. If they’ve done their job right, our interpretation of the Pathfinder should be up and running in no time. Let’s not waste a moment and get to work! I’m eager to hear the resurrected Pathfinder humming and buzzing once again.

Well, chief, it looks like there was a miscommunication. The researchers seem to have developed a non-functional version of the Pathfinder. Still, the replica is an impressive structure, symbolizing our community’s resilience. While it may not move, it serves as a constant reminder of our resourcefulness.
Pathfinder Replica
A non-functional replica of the mighty Pathfinder, a vehicle once used to traverse swampy and treacherous terrain.
